Staff are very attentive and skillful, our bookings were done via the hotel and it gave us good discounts. Simply unbeatable experience, relaxing music and aromatic essential oils let you feel fully rested....they deserve a good tip as well. thank you.

Very professional service. I had the Himalayan salt stone treatment and the total foot treatment as a couple and the service was very professional and therapeutic and we felt very relaxed afterwards. We took advantage of the discount available on the day so the price for me was really reasonable when comparing to what I would pay in London. The two therapists were lovely and sorry that I couldn't remember your names. I had the treatments on the 24th Nov.

Time out of travelling. Staff were brilliant, facilities were great. Was a very relaxing hour in which I availed of the Swedish massage and got a great discount on it too.it was cold and raining the day I visited. There are cheaper places for massages in Ha Noi but at La Siesta they gave us a questionnaire to fill out, I informed them I had an injury to my leg and the therapist took great care of this. Would highly recommend!
Couldn't be better. The staff were terrific and the massages were amazing, I can't wait to go back. Very well priced and great staff.

Great choice. We went for a swedish massage before taking our long flight home. It was 1h massage with a 40% discount since we did it from 9:00 to 12:00. The experience was great and so relaxing. All the staff was thoughtful and nice and the atmosphere was so calm. For sure it is a great choice before a long trip! I would recommend this place, no doubt.

"Hot Stone Massage". My husband and I came here for a hot stone massage after our flight from Melbourne. It was the perfect way to unwind sore muscles. The style of massage was perfect and the staff were very attentive at all times. Thank you La Siesta Spa!

Lovely massage. We went for a hot stone massage. The staff were extremely friendly and efficient, having accommodated us at very short notice. The spa is beautifully decorated, clean and comfortable. The massage was very relaxing and professionally done.

Nika & Rose. It's my first time in the spa experience , when i'm entered the reception room and greeted Ms. Nika with friendly I began to feel comfortable, to the slowVietnamese music in the background began to miss Rose in massage began to feel that I stay away from the world and I travel away in the world of dreams , it's an adventure worth the experience , all thanks and appreciation ( Nika and Rose)

Perfect before our overnight flight home. We visited La Siesta Spa before an overnight flight home and had a wonderful massage and scrub, leaving us truly relaxed. Also after a busy day in Hanoi, access to a fantastic shower and hairdryer was much appreciated before getting on the plane!
Excellent Choice. The personnel at the spa was very professional.The treatment I choose was spot on. I can surely advice this spa.

Bliss!. I have made several visits to La Siesta Spa while staying at La Siesta Hotel & Spa. Wonderfully relaxing treatments! Amazing staff...very professional, respectful and friendly. I particularly loved the collagen facial. 😊

Superb massage. My wife and I enjoyed simultaneous full body massages wth herbal treatments The rooms were beautifully appointed The masseuses were delightful and highly expert. My masseuse, Rose, treated an area of Lymphodema along my jaw, reducing the swelling etc. I won't go into detail except to say she was brilliant, and understood immediately how to treat the problem. I am going back for a follow up.

LA siesta spz. A totally enjoyable and relaxing treatment, my whole body felt re-juvenated. We were fortunate to be staying at the hotel do no distance to travel. Having been travelling or two weeks it made a nice change to be pampered and the prices were excellent.

Nice and relaxing. as part of the booking package there was a 45 minute spa treatment, I chose the facial and it was great, the beautician was light with the massaging and my skin felt wonderful afterwards. It came with a head and neck massage which was a bonus., They serve a small tea before and after Really nice treat

The extra effort shows. We first turned up without a reservation to find they were full. They gave us their email and asked us to send us a time we could return. They responded quickly and even offered us their 40% off early hour discount. Our only free day was when we flew out...they agreed to come in early so we wouldn't be late for our flight and still offered us the discount (even though we were out of hours). The spa itself was everything you could ask for. It's a beautiful environment...they offer you tea and cold towels upon arrival and departure and the himalayan salt massage was bliss. Highly recommended.

Wonderful treatments and fantastic prices. My husband and I had two massages and a facial during our time in Hanoi. All of them we booked at La Siesta Spa. We were staying at the Hanoi Elegance Diamond Hotel and the spa is located in the hotel. We were able to book last minute for all of our treatments and they had a fabulous special for morning treatments where you got 40% off the regular fee (9-12). Our massages were couple massages and we both enjoyed them immensely. The spa makes a great effort to inquire beforehand what problem areas you have or what your expectations are for the treatment. The facilities were also very clean and calming. All of the staff who waited on us were extremely friendly.

Lovely massage and excellent service. We went in the morning and tried to book in for the morning special - unfortunately they were fully booked, but they honoured the morning discount for that afternoon for us.Couldn't fault the service or treatment

Wonderful massage.. We had three massages at la siesta spa within a five day timeframe, that's how much we enjoyed not only the massage but the most wonderful service that we have received whilst in hanoi. If you need to pamper yourself or your loved one's, do yourself a favor and book a treatment.You will feel totally pampered. Thank you la siesta spa, we look forward to seeing you again one day.

Very sweet and sincere service. I travel to Vietnam fairly regularly for business and always try a different spa. I saw good reviews for La Siesta, so a friend and I went in the morning to try it out. To our delight, they had a special for morning bookings- even though they couldn't take us at the time of our walk-in, they asked us to return in about an hour- and still honored the special price. I had a 90 minute swedish massage, the coffee/orange scrub, and a facial- I think the total pre-tip was around $67 USD. The young woman who worked the desk area was so sweet and friendly- she made sure we felt comfortable- and, after we filled out a short pre-massage questionnaire, she read over it and confirmed what we had written to make sure she understood and could explain to the masseuses. (She also apologized for the little English they knew- but I thought they did just fine!) My masseuse checked with me several times to make sure the temperature, music, pressure, etc were ok. I thought it was just perfect! They offered us tea and sugared lotus seeds- and when we asked where we could buy some more lotus seeds, they packaged some for us in a little gift bag... Afterwards, the woman at the desk asked us how everything was- and genuinely urged us to be honest. Overall- it was wonderful. I rarely return to the same spa more than once- just because I like to try new spots- but I would definitely return here.

One of the best massage I've ever had . Had the 90 minutes Himalayan salt stones massage. It was completely amazing.Probably one the most expensive place to get a massage in Hanoi, but well worth it. (55 USD).The installation is great. Better than most spa in Vietnam. They respect every costumer's privacy.Professional massage therapistI'm actually going back there for other treatments before I leave Vietnam

Excellent service. As part of our package, we booked a Swedish Massage, absolutely fantastic, so relaxing, best massage I had in Hanoi. I booked another for a foot/leg massage with a orange and coffee scub, which was so nice I wish it had gone on for another hour! Well done to the lovely, gracious and competent staff at the spa!!

great authentic massage experience. i stayed at the hotel with my wife for 2 nights...its an excellent boutique hotel, and i would highly recommend it.
We both had massages and foot treatments..it was excellent,with great service and super friendly staff.

6 treatments all excellent. My family and I stayed at the La Siesta Hotel for 3 nights. On arrival we all booked in for a massage - hot stone, relaxation etc. the facilities were good and the staff excellent. Later in the week after returning from a very bumpy ride I booked in for a second massage to sort out a bad back. Although my Vietnamese is not existent I was able to convey something akin to sciatica and the masseuse focused on my spine, lower back and leg. She did a really good job. My daughter had a facial involving yoghurt which she thoroughly enjoyed. During August the treatments were also heavily discounted. 60 minute treatments for £15 is a complete bargain when the facilities are good, the lotions and potions are good quality and the staff are pleasant and obviously skilled and well trained.

Relaxation heaven! . The place to visit for a relaxing start or end to your day. I went in for a Herbal Body Massage and Sauna, it was nothing short of amazing. Everything from the greeting, complimentary tea, ambience and service was exceptional. Calling to make a reservation is recommended due to the high demand. Also, be mindful that they have two venues - one with the Sauna and the other with the Herbal Bath. We visited the main spa, which unfortunately only had the Sauna. Other than that La Siesta Spa has definitely lived up to my expecations as the best place for a relaxing massage.

The place to relax. The spa is located in the Hanoi Elegence Diamond Hotel where I was staying. I had two treatments here, the Relaxation 90 min massage and a hot stone foot massage for 60 mins. Both treatments were excellent with the therapist checking if the pressure applied was ok. I left floating after the foot massage. I prebooked but think you can also just turn up and see if they have appointments available. They also had a happy hour with 40% off which made it even better value. Highly recommended.

Great Massage and Service. La Siesta provided an excellent massage experience and the staff was very friendly. Would definitely recommend for anyone traveling in Hanoi, and look forward to going again during my next trip.
Luxurious Massage. Excellent service, luxurious massage, beautiful spa and ambience.You must try the collagen facial also, very relaxing.
Excellent Service. Absolutely wonderful. Thoroughly enjoyed my hot stone massage and was impressed with the care my masseuse took with my ankle, which was recovering from a sprain.

PERFECT EXPERIENCE!. La Siesta Spa is an oasis of relaxation and well-being in the midst of the frenetic activity of the city of Hanoi.Enjoy any of the therapies offered is an activity that body and mind will thank, money well spent on health.Excellence in service is the goal, they take care for the smallest detail, their main concern is customer satisfaction. The time seems to stop and even one comes to feel rejuvenated.In places like this that one realizes the importance of having the best possible team. Workers are the key to success, the owner must never forget this.The treatment received upon my arrival by the receptionist was excellent. All my tensions disappeared for several days thanks to the therapist. And especially the work of the manager of the spa, miss Kim, deserves the best rewards. Always attentive to my needs, she coordinated team to perfection, showing themselves very friendly and educated. I could not have imagined a better service.Thank you so much!If I had to rate the experience the note would be 10 points out of 10.Siesta Spa is a place that I recommend to everyone without a doubt.
Awesome service and amazing massage. Lien was an incredibly gracious host and the masseurs were equally matched in their service. A very comfortable environment which I can't recommend highly enough.

Perfect experience. My friend and I booked this massage through the Emerald Elegance Hotel and the booking was made very easily at a short notice. The spa receptionist Lien was very professional and very friendly. They sit you through the various treatment options with a nice cup of tea. The massage was carried out very professionally and the masseuses were very polite and friendly. The price was so reasonable and the whole experience so comfortable and relaxing. Very highly recommended by me!

Lovely afternoon. My husband and I enjoyed a lovely relaxing afternoon. He had a 90 min massage and I had the package with a body scrub, massage and facial. My therapist was very skilled and worked hard to help relieve the pain in my arm. Body scrub was good- hopefully got rid of the dead skin. The facial was just ok, it is really a clean and massage, no steam or extraction.
Relaxing, perfect after a day out!. I thoroughly enjoyed the service, the masseuse really take your needs into consideration! Quite worth the money spent!

Great way to re-energize. Went about 8:30am to the hotel to check out the spa with my wife. This is one of the few spa places in the Old Quarter that has a couples room. Had a two hour massage which was excellent, as good as I get in Shanghai. The place is your typical high-end spa, with good ambience, and very clean. I like strong deep tissue massages and this fit the bill. By the end, I was totally relaxed, and ready to tackle the hustle and bustle of Hanoi again. Prices were a little more than the typical small shops, but the small difference was worth the ambience and overall experience (but less than what you pay at the western-oriented hotels). I'm already planning to go back on our next trip in January.

Relaxing pre-flight massage.. Before heading to the airport I got a 90-minute massage at the La Siesta Hotel Spa. They offered a huge discount for getting early morning massages which worked out great for me. My therapist was good but she kept asking me to relax. I'm all skin, bones and muscles so while my body might have felt tense it was relaxed. Aside from that the massage was pleasant and made me nice and relaxed for my flight to Thailand.

Happy Hour!. The spa services were offered to us upon check-in in La Siesta and we immediately booked the Relaxation package during Happy Hour. Nice welcome from the reception and our therapists, massage is great, and attention to detail is superb (i.e. interiors, room temperature, music, customer information).
Great Massage. Clean, beautiful, tranquil spa. Professional, friendly staff. Great 60 minute whole body massage. I especially loved the hot, moist towels.

back again to see staff. Great to return to Hanoi and be accomodated in elegance group again. Janine is afavourite but we loved all staff. Everybody in tbe meals area were great. Thank you. Always greeted very well and treated well. See you all again soon. Geoff, fitzy and family

Amazing service. I really do recommend this Spa. Best in Hanoi apparently, and not too expensive either. You can get 40% off if you book for before noon, which is pretty great. Not to mention the service there is amazing. The staff are really lovely and friendly. Would definitely go again and recommend everyone else to go here too!

Worthwhile. We used the spa on two different occasions and was very pleased with our service. We took advantage of the discounted rates before midday. 40% off in July 2015 Made it very attractive indeed. Friendly staff.

Amazing head massage, facials and body massages. We only had a brief time in Hanoi so didn't want to take any chances - La siesta was the top choice.The head massage was amazing. The therapist had great technique and knew exactly what she was doing, and the pressure was just right. The facial was also very good - costing 600,000 VND and I believe they use pretty good products. The massage on the face was also very well planned out and the pressure just right. Technique was great. Some points of improvement: the foot lounge only had one song - need to add more songs to increase variety. My foot massage therapist left halfway for the restroom - a top spa should have policies for this. The towels were a bit damp and didn't feel fresh. I might have seen the ones we used being reused but I'm not 100% sure. The face rest was too hard and uncomfortable. Add a face rest padding to remedy this. These are changes that can be easily made and will make the spa a truly first class one. Right now it's still a tad shy from that title.Although, I find its services and ambience to be much more preferable than the ones on the streets. The receptionist are and professional and friendly - Rosie being the most remarkable. Special promotion where 90 mins treatment will give you a 45 min extra treatment for free. Only if you book before 12noon. For around 1 million VND you can get around 2 hours of full body treatment. One way free taxi ride from your hotel. I think the foot massage is just ok - not as good as their face and body massages. skipable and a bit pricey. The hot stone massages and facials are great so maybe go for those. The hotel itself is gorgeous.

Double check that they are not using training staff for your massage. Unfortunately the staff weren't honest about the fact that they were using training staff for our massages - we had a massage the day before which was great but when we went back the next day for another treatment we were sadly disappointed and left with a bit of a sour taste in our mouths at the non-disclosure of the fact that they were training staff - it was only when we complained that this fact was made know.

Great spa and nice environment. The spa is part of a three star hotel. Went there two days in a row. Very reasonably priced. My masseuse had good skills and applied enough pressure whereas my wife complained hers was a tas too soft. We had a couple's room to ourselves and it had good ambience (which i doubt some.of the cheaper ones on the streets have). Gave us 20% discount on our first visit and 30% the next. Worth a visit or two!

Great massage, pretty rooms & attentive staff. My husband and I chose this day spa for our one massage in Hanoi and we were both very happy with the experience. I have regular massages back home and I do like to indulge in different massages when holidaying in different countries. I was impressed with this day spa. It is located on the 2nd floor of the La Siesta Hanoi Hotel and is a very pretty, tranquil setting with a professional but aesthetically pleasing ambience. The reception staff were delightful and the massage therapist was experienced & very attentive to our expectations. We were offered a discount as we were guests of the hotel. Highly recommend the relaxation massage. It was therapeutic after cycling and walking hundreds of kilometers over 3 weeks & relaxing at the same time. The therapists were very careful and asked several times whether their pressure was satisfactory. It was neither too firm nor too gentle. It was perfect.

Good place to go relax and rejuvenate... noise interrupted my experience. I found La Siesta spa very easy to find and the staff very pleasant upon arrival. I had a session there and it was good but one issue when I was there it was very noisy and works was going on just outside the room I was having my massage but I believe I was unlucky since my friends had no such issue. Wish they'd leave works done when treatment rooms aren't being used.

Superb. It was around 38 degrees and incredibly humid in Hanoi. We had a whole afternoon to fill before travelling that night. We thought a spa treatment would be a relaxing (and cool) way to spend some time and visited La Siesta after finding it on Trip Advisor. It was a life saver. We spent two hours here for a herbal relaxing massage and while the treatment itself was fantastic, the service at this hotel was exquisite. We had wandered in, and they were happy to send us straight up, organised out treatment while we sipped tea in the beautiful lounge. An afternoon very well spent and we will be heading there first when we return to Hanoi. I think we will probably even stay in the hotel to make the most of it!

Wonderful experience. I choose 1 Hour and 30 minuts Massage , wich includes The Hot Stones. The lady who did my Massage was a real good Professional, knows her Job. I should say I am a Spa Hunter,always trying to find the best. I left The place so fine...Every body who likes massage should try this Spa.
Great Spa. Awesome hot stone massage - the staff were very friendly and the facilities are excellent. A great retreat from the heat and noise. Left feeling relaxed and refreshed.

Rejuvenate!. After hot tiring day,no better way to rejuvenate than having a massage of legs and feet.If you are looking for a spa,equal to any in the West,you can't go past La Siesta Spa.Second visit,for facial,included a discount. One happy customer!

Excellent treatment, shoulders, back, head and hands. Excellent treatment therapist very attentive and made sure everything was to my liking from the ambience in the room to the pressure being applied.Highly recommend.

Really lovely spa experience. I visited La Siesta Spa in March 2015. The whole experience was fantastic - from the lady who met me when I arrived and offered me tea, through to the beautiful rooms of the spa itself. The service was top notch and the treatment itself was well performed and incredibly relaxing. I had the Himalayan Salt Stone Treatment and Collagen Royal Facial Treatment, and absolutely floated home afterwards! Would highly recommend visiting here.
Good experience. It's a nice spa after walking & shopping in Hanoi. Staff are nice & helpful. Good environment and lovation. Reasonably priced.

sensational spa. This lovely small day spa with the Hanoi Elegance Hotel is a gem! The service was flawless, they were incredibly accommodating and the treatment was fantastic. I had a 3.5hr package; massage, scrub and wrap followed by a shower and flower bath. It was perfect after a month of backpacking!

Massage at the Spa. I had the best massage experience at this hotel, the warm bag of herbs used was the best feeling, it was so relaxing, the service and friendliness from the girls were amazing, they made me feel like we'd been friends for years. Thank you and all don't miss out on this one.

Would fly back from Brisbane just to experience it again. Best 45 minute back and neck massage I've ever had.The room was very comfortable and my wife and I were massaged at the same time. Provided with tea and cool towel upon arrival and on departure.The ambiance, temperature and music were at the right levels and i certainly felt like a new man afterwards.It's a to do whilst in Hanoi.
Lovely.. Fabulous experience. Expert staff. Ambience great. Very relaxing and invigorating. Highly recommended if you're staying at the hotel.

Bliss. I treated myself to 2 types of massages at both La Siesta spas as La Siesta Hotel and Elegance Diamond. First time a sauna and salt stone massage at La Siesta Hotel and this week an aromatherapy massage at Diamond hotel. Both were amazing. I fell asleep for the first one - may have been even more relaxation from having a sauna first and 2nd one lost complete track of time and was very dozy. Both therapists were brilliant and gave very very smooth massages with just the right pressure. I like hard massages but not too hard and they were both perfect. Room temperature perfect too. Both therapists had really excellent skills and techniques. And what is so lovely about both these spas is that there is nothing clinical about them. You know you go into some treatment rooms and it looks like you have stepped into a room full of technology with this machine for this and that machine for that etc. at La Siesta spas you get a lovely Zen like environment, subtly decorated, lovely aromas and peace and quiet.Definitely, you must fit a treatment or 2 in if you are in Hanoi!

A relaxing Spa day. I had 2 treatments here while staying at the hotel. The prices here are excellent and the service is really nice. They offer 25% off for treatments over 2 hours and 30% off your second treatment.There were a few issues though. They lost my initial reservation and I had to come back later. Then, I had to pay for a service that my mother in law offered me 3 hours after I had received treatments. (She must have used the serivce herself without telling me.) In the spas defense it was a little confusing.If you are a guest of the hotel or not, I would really recommend visiting this spa!!

Lovely place to relax both your muscles and your mind.. We (my husband and I) arrived in Hanoi very early in the morning after an all night train trip from Sapa. We had booked La Siesta hotel's early check-in Spa and Breakfast package and we were graciously welcomed at 5:30 am. The hotel is relatively small (and absolutely wonderful) so the spa area is not large. We were a group of 4 and we all took showers, changed, went down for breakfast, and then returned for massages. Our friends both had head and shoulder massages and reported that they were wonderful. My husband and I both upgraded our package so that we could have full body massages and they were very good. The facilities are super clean and each of us had a lovely, well-trained, and effective masseuse. We wanted to come back again but we just had too much to see and do in Hanoi.

Massage and facial. I can honestly say that the massage I had at the La Siesta Spa was one of the best I had ever had. I had just spent the two previous days on sleeper trains and the day before walking in Sapa. My legs ached considerably and then I had a firm massage, which went up and down the spine - perfect treat after a day's trekking. The facial was lovely too.
hot stone massage. an excellent hot stone massage . quiet, calming, good technique. they even reimbursed me for the taxi.

Quality & perfection for relaxation. My husband and I went for a sauna and a relaxing 1 hour Swedish massage. It was the most relaxed I have felt in a long time. There is nothing to complain about here! Great experience.We live in HK and have travelled SE Asia for quite a few years so massages are not a new experience. The quality of service was second to none. The host was communicative and pleasant and the masseuses communicated enough to ensure that you get the experience you pay for. Soft music, beautiful atmosphere, knowledgeable staff and complete relaxation with just the right amount of pressure. It's worth the price and I went back on the last day, it was just that memorable.

Amazing Massages. My wife and I stayed at The Elegance Diamond from Feb 11 to 17, 2015. We went to La Siesta spa on our second day and we were so impressed that we returned twice more. We first tried the 90 minute Sweedish massage, the following day we tried the 90 minute Himalayan Salt Stone Treatment and finally we went all out and did the 4 hour Blissful La Siesta day. The employees were incredibly kind, the services were amazing and my wife and I both walked away feeling each service was well worth every penny. The prices are incredibly inexpensive compared to North America and folks need to remember they did not wander down an alley to get a five dollar massage, if that is what people are looking for this is not the place. Please tip the ladies they are very hard working.

Recommended, Good price in Vietnam!. I got a foot massage with my mom, and the first impression of this place was very clean and neat. However, as I wanted the strong pressure one, the pressure my masseuse provided me was not as strong as I thought it would be. All in all, including all the atmostphere and service, I think I made a good choice and will come back later.

Amazing Massage. Had a Himalayan salt massage, 60 mins, AMAZING!The staff were so lovely, really fantastically relaxing massage, beautiful spa area, like a little oasis of peace in Hanoi. Also very good value for money. Would def go again (and probably will!)

One of the best spa experience I had had. I was staying at la siesta hotel and was provided complementary taxi to this spa, located in other hotel. The welcoming, treatments and quality of products was very good. It is nice thing to do before heading 24 hours of travel back home :)My therapist was a young yet professional girl who made me feel special: congratulations for such skilled people working there.
Very professional. I enjoyed my time at the siesta spa. Very professional, clean and abordable. The employees are warming.

Relaxing. The moment you walk in you are treated like a VIP , with very friendly staff and very helpful in working out which type of treatment would suit me. I had the hot shone massage . Fantastic choice very relaxing felt great when I walked out after my Jasmine tea and fruit . Highly recommend .

Pure bliss.. This is truly a gem! I have been backpacking for 3 months and decided to treat myself to a facial and back massage this place is very daily priced with luxory massages! One of the best in Asia so far!

Very relaxed. I enjoyed having a very relaxing facial with my sister. We both didn't want it to end and my sister came back in the afternoon for a foot massage! We recommend that you visit La Siesta in the morning rather than the afternoon as it gets quite busy. Some of the services were more expensive than some other massage places in Hanoi however, they were still comparatively cheap to what you would pay in Australia.

Pure luxury. I had the 4 hour treatment involving steam room, massage, facial and foot treatment! It was a wonderful way to recover from 2 weeks on the road, and prepare for my long flight home to NZ.

Best massage and spa experience in Vietnam. Recently visited Vietnam with friends, visited La Siesta Spa based on reviews from Trip Advisor and was not disappointed. Relaxing experience from arrival to departure. Go early so you have time to enjoy the tea and soak up the atmosphere. I had the old quarter treatment which was bliss, the masseuse was excellent. We had visited a number of other massage places and was just about to give up on a Good massage in Vietnam, glad I checked out trip advisor to find this place and def happy to also recommend. It is def more expensive but worth it.

A Must!!. I was staying at the Hanoi Elegance Diamond Hotel and so this spa was very handy for the pampering I was after. I had 3 different treatments - Old Town Package; Backache (back massage with hot stones) and a renewal facial; Earth package. All were fantastic. The Old Town was a nice after two flights (11hrs, 3 hrs) and I loved and really recommend the hot stones - pure heaven! The facial was awesome and my face felt so much better after all the sweating from the humid Hanoi air. The backache was good but in retrospect I should have gone for an Old Town package and got a full body (I didn't have enough time - did this on the day I was checking out and leaving Hanoi). The Earth package left my skin feeling amazing and was my favourite. If you have the time (close to 3 hrs) this is great! The staff were lovely each visit, friendly and professional. The facilities were very clean. I can't fault it. Price wise, I thought it definately value for money. Would highly recommend this and I would definately go back for more!!

Serenity. I was greeted in the small waiting room to beautiful green tea and gorgeous little crystallised lotus seeds which I have fallen in love with and probably will never get in Australia. I had a foot massage and a facial, both of which were great. Both the lady in reception and my masseuse were attentive and professional. Thanks la Siesta spa for a relaxing and calming afternoon.

Amazing!. I visited this spa on my last day in Hanoi, 8/1. The experience was so relaxing. The price might be considered expensive since everything in Hanoi is so inexpensive but it's worth it. I couldn't get this for the same price where I'm from. 2 1/2 hrs of pure bliss!

Brilliant spa experience. Got recommendation via Lonely Planet. Was excellent choice. Not cheapest by a long shot but still very reasonable by Australian standards. Well presented, clean, expert - throughly recommend to all travellrs who dont mind paying for great product - life is too short not to.
Great value, clean, professional. Very clean, porfessional and relaxing. The price is competitive . Like the hotel itself it's was a great value. I enjoyed staying at Hanoi Elegance.

very good spa and massage. i have been to many spa and massage places in Asia and I must say this is one of the better ones I have been. First of all, the service is great, and the people are not pushy with regards to the packages you want. Therapist are very attentive and professional. Most importantly, the massage strokes are well done and you can sense that these therapists are properly trained in doing massages. Ambience of the place is great, quiet. and I totally feel relaxed during the session. Price is a higher than other street massage shops but quality is definitely higher. I think it was money well spent.

Superb, friendly realistic priced Spa. I recently stayed at the Diamond Elegance Boutique Hotel in Hanoi and this spa is part of the complex. I regularly booked in for a full body massage and foot massages and they were just sensational. The prices are extremely cheap compared to Perth, WA prices, and the services are great. Lovely compliment at the end of your treatment of ginger tea and fresh fruit. Would recommend most highly for anyone visiting Hanoi.
Lovely spa with professional staff. Very relaxing ambience. The staff were excellent and the treatments were amazing. Very pleased we went there!

lovely. Consistent with the hotel it's in, the staff at this elegant spa are really friendly and helpful. I had the herbal massage they recomended, it was great - you know a massuse is great when they know when to push you and when to ease off without constantly needing to be told.They gave me a discount to celebrate Tet, I paid about $50 for 90mins (I think - by this time I'd concluded that everything in Vietnam is cheap and stopped doing any more than very rough conversions), a bit less than 1/2 of what I'd pay back home, which seems fair (things in Vietnam generally cost 1/4 to 1/2 of what they'd cost back home).

Relaxing break from the city bustle. The spa is located in the hotel and accepts all customers. The experience was very relaxing and professionally done. The spa has a variety of treatments and is well worthwhile

Thank you Lonely Planet!. My girlfriend and I decided to try this amazing place after reading Lonely Planet recommended it highly. From our initial enquiry phone call the staff couldn't have been more friendly, helpful and co-operative - all the while maintaining a gentle graciousness which was most appreciated. Arriving at this gorgeous place is like stepping into an oasis of calm, minimalist elegance, and yes it does have a zen like feel to it, We both had a herbal therapy massage using natural herbs which you could smell them mixing up prior to the treatment. The massage was excellent (and I have trained as a masseur so I'm picky!) The price was very reasonable and you get a 20% discount for future visits. Do yourself a favour and check this place out, you won't be sorry, we left blissed out and very contented. I will definitely return if I'm ever in Hanoi again.

So glad I went here. Excellent spa experience. It was very clean, the staff were very attentive and recommended the right things for you. Opted for a herbal massage and a relaxing facial. Couldn't feel more relaxed. This place is 5 stars.
Superb. Best body massage and facial I've ever had. Staff could not do enough to make my experience any better than it was.Included was a Pho soup at the end.

This How a Spa Should Be. Booked an appointment at this spa during a recent stay at the hotel. The space is absolutely gorgeous. It has a clean, elegant, zen-like feel. It was easy to make an appointment and easy to interact with the person with whom you make the appointment. The Spa is located on the second floor of the hotel which makes it easy to access. You sit and immediately you are offered a warm tea to set the mood right. The service is simply amazing. I had a body scrub, massage, and facial and was truly impressed. The therapist was responsive to the type of services that I was looking for. The temperature in the rooms was to my liking. The tables were very comfortable and the oil and other products were clearly top of the line. I absolutely love the wooden bath tub and the shower. I have been to several spas throughout South East Asia and I frequently get Spa services (3 or so massages a month in the U.S. and 3 or so each day whenever I am in South Asia). This Spa easily ranks a the top of my list of Spa. I would place it in my top 5 in the region. I plan to stay at the hotel and use this Spa when in Hanoi in the future.

Absolutley fantastic. My sister and I were here for 2.5 hours having different treatments including a facial, body scrub, massage, flower bath. It was the most relaxing time and it was so professional.The staff were truly delightful. After our delighful treatments we then had the choice of Pho with chicken or beef.I went home with some jasmine Tea due to my choice of treatments.I cannot recommend this enough. I would certainly revisit here on my return to Hanoi.Extremely well priced for the standard.

total relaxation. My friend and I had two very amazing treatments each at the spa. We had them in the same room which made it more fun. Would recommend the body scrubs and the body relaxation massages. Highly trained therapists and very lovely ambience and nice touches throughout the treatment.

Great little spa. This spa is lovely! My friend and I went here for a body scrub and facial. The atmosphere was relaxing, the staff was friendly and professional, and all the products used in the treatments were first rate. The prices are very fair and booking is easy. Highly recommend!!
Superb spa. Lovely way to put up the feet and enjoy the tranquillity of a first class spa. Little more expensive than the street ones.. But so much better
Blissful. Just came back from a massage and facial. Beautiful experience! Highly recommended. Quiet, peaceful, calm atmosphere. Facial massage was particularly special.

A must in Hanoi!. Just bliss!! I had a 1 hr hot stone massage at La Siesta and it was the perfect way to finish a day of touring this hectic city. Prices are very reasonable considering the experience of the staff and the facilities of the spa. My treatment included tea and fruit post massage AND a taxi back to my hotel - exceptional service!

Great experience. This is the second time I came to la Siesta Spa, and relly I'll be back each time I'll be in Hanoi if I have enough time. It is caaaaaalm, clean, extremely professional and even a 2 hours treatment is too short. It is highly recommended. Make a reservation by phone if you want to make sure to have a slot available for you.
Terrific Spa!. My daughter and I loved our facial at La Siesta Spa. They did a wonderful job. It was very relaxing and afterwards, we enjoyed the tea and fruit.

Professional and relaxing. The La Siesta Spa offers a great range of spa treatments at very good prices. I went for two hot stone imperial jade massages during my time in Hanoi and enjoyed both! The spa is located on the second floor of the building and you do not need to be a member of the hotel to go along. Afterwards treat yourself to a meal on the 12th floor, the views are amazing and so is the food.

Total relaxation - wonderful service.. I had the Deep Ocean spa treatment late afternoon after a busy 1st day in Hanoi. It was blissful and totally relaxing and just what I needed. After about 2 hours of various treatments I was even given a beautifully prepared pho soup and a gift which was a wonderful ending to a perfect day. The spa rooms I was in were clean and quiet, and the massage therapist was lovely. The price was fantastic compared with what I would have paid at home for a similar spa package.

Nice spa shame about ambient noise. We enjoyed our Old Hanoi 1.75 hour package. The therapists try very hard and gave a good massage which involved climbing on our backs!Really good service and relaxing treatment but sadly this was interspersed with noise from below and coming up from stairs as guests checked into the hotel one floor below which disturbed the karma somewhat!With some extra soundproofing it would be a far more pleasant experience or maybe they could put an additional door into the treatment rooms and reception area to give more distance and block out hotel noiseOne thing I did not like was paying up front that kind of seemed at odds with the establishment Overall though I would recommend. Treatment price was US 55 for just under two hours about a third if what we would pay at home

High currency exchange rate!. Was looking for a decent place for massage after a week of work. Search online and finally decided to go with this recommended place. Asked for 90mins herbal incense therapy, the receptionist told me it is USD 53.55 after 15% discount.However, during payment I realized she charged in and the amount was VND 1,270,000 which is equivalent to about USD 64.00. The only explanation is they set their exchange rate at VND 21,000 per USD. And honestly, I wouldn't mind paying as the session was good and the masseuse was helpful and friendly but the principle is wrong!

Construction in our ears!. Unfortunately, we have to rate our experience very low due to the fact that there was heavy construction going on directly next door to our room. They claimed it was outside of the spa and no, this is not their fault, but they should have warned us. For 45 min of our one-hour facial we had to listen to drilling and hammering and scraping. NOT relaxing. I would have passed on the treatment had I known construction was going on. It was not cheap. The ladies did a fine job, but if you were going in the next few days/weeks – I would ask about the construction before booking.

Great Spa Experience. We had a great spa on our last day in Hanoi. Having visited several spas during our three weeks in Vietnam, La Siesta was by far the best. They even supplied us with Pho after the spa. The masseuse was sensitive, helpful and there was no "special" offers.

Amazing spa package at a great price. One of the best spa package experience I've had. I don't remember what the package was called, but it was their complete package that included a body scrub, body treatment, relaxing body soak, massage, and facial. Package also included tea before and during the package (in between treatments as a break), and a "light" snack of a bowl of chicken or beef pho at the end. The estheticians were friendly and did their job well. Note that the spa offers a discount for first time visitors. I also got an additional discount since I was there with two other people and we all got the same package. This made for a really affordable package!Located in the Hanoi Elegance Diamod Hotel, a treatment at this spa was a great way to end my trip to Hanoi.

visit to La Siesta Spa. My daughter and I had been backpacking for the last 5 weeks and our time together was coming to an end and we wanted to go to a spa for our last night together. My daughter found La Siesta Spa on line and we decided to go there. We did not have an appointment but they were very accomodating and our spa began. The spa we chose was the ladies package. We were there for over 3 hours. What an amazing spa. I highly recommend this spa to everyone looking for that special place to go. The atmosphere they created there was so relaxing and peaceful that it just melted the stress away. The masseurs were very professional and qualified and gave the most wonderful massage. Their care and attention to detail was very much appreciated The cost I thought was very reasonable as at home in Canada would have cost hundreds of dollars. Highly recommend the La Siesta Spa to anyone wanting to have an incredible spa experience.

Ahhhhh......very relaxing. My husband and I were having lunch at the hotel restaurant, and as we were leaving, saw the Spa and decided to have a look. Boy are we glad we did. This was the best massage experience I ever had. The ambiance was very soothing and the staff was very professional and accommodating. They communicate very well in English and Taylor the experience as you like it. They do have an extensive menu of services to offer.

Fabulous spa!. We went to La Siesta Spa after travelling for 2 weeks through Vietnam as a treat for our last day. It was a fabulous way to end our holiday. Wonderful friendly staff with the best massage I have ever had.Highly recommend that you treat yourself at La Siesta Spa.Also, if you have time, visit the resturant on the 12th floor for amazing views and delicious food.

An oasis in a busy city. Step out of the chaos of Hanoi into La Siesta Spa and lose yourself for a couple of hours. What a wonderful relaxing experience in pleasant, clean surroundings. I enjoyed the Deep Ocean package (foot bath, body scrub, flower bath, massage and aloe body treatment). Every visitor to Hanoi should treat themselves here after battling it out on the streets!

The best massage I have had - ever. My husband organised an appointment for me at La Siesta for my birthday.He selected a three hour package which was amazing. It included a body scrub, body massage and facial. It was fantastic value for money, whilst you might pay a little more than most places in Vietnam you are getting a masseur that is really well trainined and is in tune with what you want.The service was great which really added to the overall experience. The spa was modern and clean which made it very comfortable. With the music being played and insence burning it doesn't take long to feel completely relaxed. I would strongly recommend this place as there is nothing I could fault.

Good massage and reasonable price. I'm very particular about massage and found most places lacking regardless of prices. I had the energy balance body massage at La Siesta Spa and was very pleased with it. The masseur was skilled and professional. The treatment room has a bathroom which is convenient as I was able to take a shower before our evening flight. If you are in the Old Quarter, this spa is highly recommended.

Best Massage I've Had. I have had massages throughout Southeast Asia and I can say without reservation that this is the best I've had. You get more than your money's worth. They do not rush (it's supposed to be relaxing... why would they hurry) and the therapists are obviously extremely well trained to recognize how to spend time on an area that needs work. Superb job. In comparison to Bali and Thailand, they are a bit more expensive but I would say definitely worth it. If you are not staying at the Hanoi Elegance Diamond (where the spa is), definitely consider booking a room for the night so you can retire to your room after your massage (ask for a room on floor 8, 9, or 10 for quietness).

Worth it!. This is the spa to go to to relax those tired legs and body. We each booked the 3.5 hr spa package (ladies and men package) when we returned from our Sapa trek, and I was impressed with the quality of massage. Great and sincere service as well, and they are happy to customize/switch out items in the spa package that I wasn't keen on, e.g. Facial. They didn't advertise it, but a 15% discount were given to us as first-time customers, and a 25% discount would be given for repeat customers, at the time of our visit. Overall, a wonderful clean place for spa and massage - highly recommended.

Surprise ending!. It was easy to call and book for an appointment on the same day. Initially just wanted a 1 hr facial but when I got there they offered 15% off any treatment for first time customers so I chose the 3.5 hr spa package. I think the body scrub and massage was totally worth it, but the facial was only mediocre. Overall, great experience and I would back. Plus, at the end they served me a bowl of pho and gave a little tea leaves jar as a gift!

Little choice but charming. The spa is located within the Elegance Diamond hotel, although it doesn't belong to the hotel. It's not quite a spa, as it basically offers a choice of different of massages and treatments.It's quite expensive but the massages are great, all within a very relaxing atmosphere. The staff greets you with a nice tea and hot towels and offers some fruit after your relaxing massage.A good place overall, a bit expensive but with a good choice of treatments.

Best spa experience. I can not rate the La Siesta Spa highly enough. I returned to this spa on 3 occasions while staying in Hanoi and each time was relaxing and invigorating. All the staff were lovely.Definitely worth checking out if staying in Hanoi

Reborn. A really good massage. The girl knew what she was doing. Very professional. They immediately offered a discount of 15%, and a discount of 25% for the second visit. Fruit and tea afterwards, and no rush to get you out.

Fantastic. After a long day walking around the old quarter, we stumbled across The hotel Elegance were we had dinner. After we booked in to the spa and had a hour foot rejuvenation. Absolutely fantastic, the atmosphere, the girls and the service were second to none.
Fantastic service, so relaxing. Booked in to La Siesta Spa for a hot stone massage and facial. The total experience was wonderful. If you want a great massage, ask for Yen, she is terrific.

A siesta... Indeed. La Siesta was the perfect place to go to the day after you arrive in Vietnam. Being on the plane for 24hrs can leave your body feeling weary and weak which can really disrupt your plans. I booked a 90 min herbal massage at 11.30 am before my day started. Must admit after that, I felt revived for the whole trip. The spa is decently priced for the level of service that was given. It is clean and relaxing and they also give great discounts to new clients. Request to be treated by Dao. She was very good.

Relax at the Hanoi Elegance Group. I spent 18 days in Vietnam travelling from North in Ha Noi to Sai Gon. The bet experience we had was with the Hanoi Elegance Group- Sapphire and Diamond in Ha Noi. Mr Phoung , the Manager, at Elegance Sapphire was a wonderful, courteous, honourable and diligent Manager who did anticipated evry need we had.The Spa at the Elegance Diamond was a truly professional service..better than the hotel we stayed in Hue and Hoi An.If I ever return to Ha Noi I will ALWAYS stay at Elegance group...service with hundreds of smiles and a laptop in every room...why try anywhere else??

Relaxing. With the busyness outside it was nice to enter the Spa which felt tranquil and welcoming. The rooms were tidy and clean and the one hour massage was relaxing. I also had a one hour facial which was lovely; so much so I fell asleep. The cost was on the high side for Vietnam - but worth it, we both walked out so much more relaxed and refreshed than when we walked in. The other nice part was after the massage they don't hurry you out the door but give you a cup of herbal tea some fruit and time to settle before heading back into the chaos of Hanoi.
Place to relax. had two different types of massage there, one better than the other.I found them a bit pushy wanting us to upgrade and spend more money. Would not listen.!

Had better, had worse. Good 1hr massage. Clean, polite, efficient and effective. Nothing more, nothing less. On the high side regards cost. With 10% "tax" and 5% service, not a whole lot of change from $US 100 for 2 for an hour. Surprisingly quiet from the madness below from the old quarter. Hot rocks were a bit too hot! Occasional but distant giggling was a bit off putting.

Clean, friendly. We were staying in the hotel so it was really convenient. And it was clean and quiet. Really quite pricey for Hanoi, but we didn't mind as it's still cheap and it was so convenient. And lovely. We really enjoyed all the treatments we had there.

Great experience. We did the couple experience including body scrub, facial and massage. Took more than 3 hours but only cost about 115 US Dollars. would have cost over 300 in US. THEY ALSO SERVED US LUNCH AT THE END. IT WAS GREAT

So soothing I did indeed have a siesta!. Previous reviews have been acted on. The reception room was very clean and staff welcoming. Treatments offered were well explained and assistance given to select the best treatment for my needs. Treatment room was clean, private (two tables) and discreetly appointed. Ms Tam, a highly experienced masseuse, provided an outstanding treatment in the 2.5hrs I spent there. A gift on departure was a delightful surprise. Return taxi fares were included as I was staying in one Elegance Hotel (Essence) and La Siesta is located in another. (Essence Diamond). Blissful!
Could do better. they took so much time so we lost 15mn talking blablabla...before to have a good massageif you are rush pease dont go there...the therapistes are ok but nothing special

Totally excellent.. After my travel to Sa Pa, I went back to Hanoi Elegance Diamond Hotel, and had "ZEN Moment" (around 3 hours) at Le Siesta Spa on the 2nd floor. First, I got welcome flower tea, water, and foot bath. Then, had "Honey Body Scrub with Himalaya Salt", "Vietnamese Rice Lightening Body Treatment", "Traditional Herbal Bath", "Herbal Therapy", and "Anti Stress Facial".During treatments above, the staff was friendly and always asked me my preference. Especially, I liked bath very much! It was so romantic to take a bath with many pink lotus petals...!! Lastly, tropical drink and spa cuisine were served. It was Vietnamese Pho noodle (You can choose chicken or beef). If you are not willing to have Pho noodle, spring rolls are also available. Spa gift was a charming herb tea leaves in glass bottle. By the way, I strongly recommend you to go Le Siesta Spa as a guest at Hanoi Elegance Diamond Hotel. I got 15% discount for the first time. The rate went up to 25% at the second time.

totally relaxed. After a long day of shopping we needed to relax and relax we did...........upon entering La Siesta Spa we were greeted by a lovely smile, tea and lotus seeds. We were also made aware of all the option we could have. The staff was fantastic, the massage exceptional that I almost fell asleep - it was that good!!!! Very highly recommended that I will be booking my parents to stay in Hanoi Elegance Diamond and partake on La Siesta's full body massage next February!!!!!

good massage. I had a massage before my late flight which was good to relax. the package was the deep ocean and included bath, body scrub and massage. the place is very nice and clean and the staff is very nice and skilled. prices are not the cheapest in Hanoi but it is worth. they offer you a light meal and a gift (tea) at the end of the massage.

Average and over priced. Based on the website and higher price I was expecting a more upscale spa. The staff were friendly and the massage was average. There are actually not many nice spas in Hanoi to choose from except the hotel spas.

Good massage. The welcoming at the spa was great, they gave us slippers and tea to relax. The staff was really caring and nice, but the only problem was that they did not really speak english and we could not interact well with them. Our massages were good. The place was not luxurious, but that was not important for us since it was very clean. Great value for your money.

Loved Siesta Spa.. I also enjoyed the pacakge which included hot tea and lotus seeds to start, a body scrub, flower bath, massage and facial. The treatment was professional and very relaxing. Ended with more tea, noodle soup and fruit. Then a gift and money for taxi!! Not cheap by Vietnamese standards but well worth it.

Best Spa Experience. We booked the 3 hour package of body scrub, body wrap, herbal bath, body massage, relaxing facial ending with meal, small gift and taxi back to our hotel.Masseurs Tam and Yen were very professional, our hostess Hien was delightful the ambience and cleanliness perfect we would thoroughly recommend this very relaxing spa

Great place!. Great spa packages. I booked the "Ladies Package" which included hot tea to start, a body scrub, flower bath, massage and facial. They also give you Pho soup before you go. Very nice staff and a great experience!!
Great SPA experience. One of the best massages I ever had! Not cheap, but definitely worth it. From room temperature to the volume of the music everything was perfectly arranged. Highly recommended.

Fantastic Spa packages. While staying at Essence Hotel Hanoi my partner and I visited La Siesta Spa. We originally booked a hot stone massage but after having a look through the brochure, we decided to spoil ourselves and try a package . I cant remember the name but it included a Body wrap, flower bath, facial, one hour hot stone massage, meal and spa gift. Fantastic value at just over USD$100 per person. The staff were wonderful. very friendly and the therapists were excellent... always checking if the pressure was ok. We had just come from having many massages in Bangkok and although this was more expensive than the little spas you get on the street side - it was something we could not compare! La Siesta was wonderful and worth every dollar. Our meal of Pho and fresh fruits at the end of our treatment was perfect - just what we felt like after nearly three hours of indulgence. A taxi back to our hotel was also included and some money for this was given to us in an envelope. Very nice touch as we didnt feel like walking after all that relaxing :)Thank you very much to La Siesta for making our holiday a memorable one.

Good massage. The hotel recommended me this place. A pick up was organised and the place is clean, looks nice and staff is very friendly. They helped me to choose a package which finally was a foot bath, scrub, flower bath and massage. The therapist checked on me several times for temperature in the room, pressure level of massage and the massage was as relaxing as I hoped it to be. The Spa is located in a hotel and there was a lot of noise around; it looks like all doors and windows are open; it did not bother me as I can easily switch off. Another thing to keep in mind is the minimum of privacy: you will undress yourself with therapist in front of you, after the scrub the therapist will be in shower with you to clean you and you have to get out of the bath with therapist in front of you; you also better tell them in advance if you do not like them to touch your breasts. I felt very relaxed after this treatment and that was exactly what I needed, so would recommend it and do it again if I would return to Hanoi.
Very Proffesional. Very calming and relaxing. Not a bad price - $53 for 90 min massage. Then offered a 25% discount for next massage.

nice change of scenery. Tried the spa because it was in the hotel where we were staying which was really convenient. The thought of having to search for a decent massage in Hanoi was just too much of a hassle. The spa is very nicely designed and offers a relaxing environment. True the price is higher than what you'll find out in the streets but it's much less than an international hotel so I was ok with that. My friends enjoyed our blissful 2 hr treatment which was just enough to help us recover from our hiking trip in the northern highlands.

Over-priced and Under Massaged. I really really wanted to like this place. I stayed at one of the sister hotels, and received the small discount they offer (although they did of course try to up-sell me when I arrived). I was late for my appointment, for which I apologized and they were still able to accommodate me, which I appreciated. I also appreciated the included taxi back to my hotel... except the part where they forgot to pay the taxi, and then I was left at my hotel, trying to explain that it was supposed to be included (the front desk people at my hotel sorted it out, but it was awkward, and I wanted to be sure that the driver got paid).However. I had high expectations, having heard so much about the cheap, fabulous massages in Asia, and this was neither cheap nor fabulous. My spa technician (I will not say masseuse) spoke enough English to inquire as to my problem areas, and then actively avoided them. The pressure was hard enough, however, involved mostly pressing hard on bone, and avoiding muscle. At home, I regularly see a registered massage therapist, who is excellent, and I realize this wasn't going to be that good, but I just did not enjoy the treatment at all. A lengthy portion near the end involved wiping ones arms and legs down with warm wet towels. After 5 minutes of this, I had had enough, but I did not want to be rude, since the girl was obviously trying hard, and presumably doing what she was trained to do. I tried to imply that enough was enough, and go back to the massaging, and asked what kind of technique this was, as I had never encountered this much non-massaging in a massage. The answer was "Vietnamese massage" and another 5 - 10 minutes of toweling continued. I do not know whether or not wiping one with towels for a large part of the massage hour is indeed "Vietnamese massage" but it was certainly not what I wanted, and it was enough to put me off trying any further massages or spas in Vietnam. Given the response to the below review, I assume the spa folks are reading these, so let me say that your staff does not appear to be re-trained yet, and if wiping with towels is going to take up a sizable portion of the massage time, I suggest you mention that in your brochure, as Westerners such as me, who want a deep tissue massage do not expect it. I also had a facial, the best thing about which I can say is that it did not irritate my eyes at all, unlike most facials I have had at spas in North America. This was presumably because it was not really a "facial" that you would expect from a European or North American spa. For example, I asked if extractions were to be done, and they did not know the word.Noise levels: As previous reviewers pointed out, the walls are thin. I seemed to be the only customer there, but a staff room or something appears to be nearby - during my treatment, I could hear loud talking and laughter coming in through the door, which is not what a western tourist finds "relaxing" in a spa environment.Finally, while the place was very clean, I was not happy to find myself lying on a towel that did not cover the plastic bed beneath me. My arms and legs hung over the towel and felt disgusting laying on the plastic covering (that presumably others had sweated on before me.) Same with only being covered with a small towel instead of a sheet. I personally also felt extremely uncomfortable with the technician, who insisted on hanging all my clothes up for me including underwear (despite me asking her not to), having this small towel and the technician staring at me as I attempted to role over conservatively, and then had to twice ask her to leave the room while I got re-dressed. Different people have different comfort levels. I tried to express mine, and they were ignored or not understood. I think this place has potential - nice setting, nice furnishings, but in my opinion, the price is not justified.

Overpriced for the quality of massage. $18 for 35 min of massage is not a bad price if you come out feeling really relaxed. It started out well, with a flower footbath and hot towels over the back and herbal tea. Lovely, clean layout with relaxing music. However the massage itself was not that good. The therapist asked how strong I like it and I said medium. It wasn't relaxing enough for my strained neck and back, and this was supposed to be the backache massage. Let me just say here that I expect a professional therapist to get the pressure right without asking a few times, and to find the painful spots and relax them without being told where they are. Well, this wasn't the case here. They offer a 20% off if you go back but I'd rather ask my boyfriend to give me a massage, and he is not a pro. So it was a nice pampering experience, welcome in the hustle and bustle of Hanoi, but not really deeply relaxing and relieving.

They forgot our booking!. I made bookings since August 2011 for January 2012. Followed up prior to travel and it was confirmed. On the actual day itself, we went to the spa only to be told that they are closed for a week for the Tet Holiday. They could have told us since they have all our contact details!

The best of Hanoi still lags in the South East Asian league. Hanoi is still not the place you go for a Spa holiday, but after a few days trekking the Sapa highlands a rub down is more of a need then a luxury. I chose la Siesta by default having stayed at the Essence Hotel which is a member of the eleganc hotel chain. The 10% discount plus the excellent level of service by the hotel made the decision making much easier. A second visit would entitle you to a 20% discount I was told.The reception was basic with mattresses serving as seats. It took some getting use to. It was an open reception thus not giving the privacy nor the intimacy you would expect in a boutique setting. The lady at the reception was however very welcoming and added warmth to the experience.The therapy room was luxurious and very well set up. The temperature, the music and the hygienic zen atmosphere was very pleasing and relaxing. I opted for the oil massage in view of the strained muscles of a veteran of Sapa. She spoke reasonable English, fairly well trained as a therapist belying her young age. Against my fairly senior Thai therapist in Kuala Lumpur who is currently my standard bearer she scored a credible 6. Technically she has a lot more to learn. The total 90 minute experience cost me usd 50. I wish it was a 2 HR session. I would rate the overall experience as a strong average.

A beautiful treat. I recently booked the very comprehensive Pearl Asia package (mud wrap, facial, full body massage, flower bath,meal and gift) at La Siesta Spa and it was a delightful experience. Expert therapist in a very clean and relaxing atmosphere. A bit pricey (US$100 for the package) but it was well worth it as I'd rather spend a bit more and be happy with the outcome!
just okay. Was just okay for what the reviews say. Enjoyed it but got better massages from smaller places. Maybe my girl was new.

Amazing spa with lots to offer!. My husband and I are spa junkies, and after a long day of walking around Hanoi, we stopped to treat ourselves to the Hanoi Old Town package. The hot stone massage was amazing, followed by a relaxing facial, all for about $50. We were staying at one of the Hanoi Elegance hotels, so we got an additional 10% discount. There is a variety of treatments and price points to choose from, giving you plenty of options. The spa is spotless with a relaxing/sitting area where they serve tea before and after the treatments. Both of our massage therapists were great - checking on the pressure and adjusting according to our comfort level. Overall, an exceptional spa experience. Will definitely return!

A bit pricey but worth it. I had a massage, coffee scrub, and facial. The treatments were great and the staff, much like the hotel staff were great. I even had a slight cough during my massage. The lady when to get me ginger tea and told me if my cough continued to come down anytime during my stay and get some more tea. It was like having your mother take care of you. Something I have never experienced at any other spa or hotel

Expensive and short-changed. Although we knew that the prices here were much more expensive than other places, we decided to give it a try thinking that we would get tip-top services here. On arrival, the reception was less than impressive, we were led to a big room with with many thin mattress on the floor and no proper reception counter. The introduction to the spa treatment was done with us sitting on the floor mattresses and the receptionist was not able to recommend any specific treatment. Nonetheless, we bought the extended "Herbal Therapy" massage packages. The treatment room looked old and the massage tables did not look particularly clean. After 90min of treatment, we felt really short-changed as the massage skills of the therapists were amateurish at best -- lacking in strengths and techniques, and the therapists spent a lot of time wiping our limbs with hot towels and then rinsing the towels. The therapists also seemed to be taking a long time preparing the herbal packages while we were made to wait on the massage tables. Overall, we did not feel that there were 90min of massages that we paid for!

True Bliss!!. I went for a package called Old Hanoi Package. It was glorious. My therapist Dao was excellent and so professional. She made me feel very comfortable and gave just the right amount of pressure. I didn't want it to end! My package included a full body massage, then a hot stone massage with Jade stones and finally a lovely facial. All for the low price of $50.00 US. I left there wanting to book another appointment but sadly I was leaving the next day.The staff at the hotel and in the spa were also very professional and friendly. They really made me feel welcome and taken care of. Thank you to Dao and the rest of the staff at La Siesta! One in a million!

Really good Spa. I get the "Traditional Vietnamese Package" (2h50min / 128 $) and everything was really good. Before it started they told me that a honey&coffee scrub is better for a men skin. so i changed (normally the package comes with the Dragon Fruit body scrub. Fantastic! Some 'little' negative: Sometimes you hear the floor but not too loud.

Great opportunity to relax from bustling city. Visited this place recently and were fully satisfied with what we got. We booked in advance Indochina package for 2 by phone and were able to negotiate additional discount, so you can also give it a try )Atmosphere is very relaxing, reception staff is very welcoming, we really enjoyed it. Our course lasted 120 minutes and it was wonderful. The only things we recommended to management afterwards in a review that they give to every guest were adding music to wooden bath room and make better isolation from corridor sounds. In the middle it seems like a large group appeared somewhere nearby and they laughed and chatted too loud - our therapeutists had to come out and tell them to calm down. Frankly speaking, it didn't ruined the mood and everything else was ok, including middle tea brake and light snacks (were included into our package) in the ending. Recommend to all of you, 100% satisfaction guaranteed! To enhance the contrasting effect, you can first roam around old quarter for half day (to get maximum loudness effect) and afterwards to go to hotel room to rest OR go to some calm cafe and indulge yourself with couple of cakes and vietnamese coffee. We went to Highlands and continued our evening in Fanny's. You will find separate reviews for both soon.

So relaxing!. I went to Hanoi in October 2010. In total I visited this spa 4 times, and would happily recommend it! It's located on the 2nd and 3rd floors of the Hanoi Elegance Diamond hotel.On all 4 occasions, the service was excellent. You're welcomed with a cool scented flannel and a cup of tea. They'll give you the menu to look over. When you tell them what you want (unless you order one of the big packages, in which case I'd recommend booking in advance) the girl WILL try to sell you either a bigger package or a longer massage. However, it is a soft sell, not at all pushy, so I didn't mind, the girls are just doing their job. On 2 occasions I did 'upgrade' as the recommendation did fit well with what I wanted, but the other 2 times I stuck with my original choice. If you don't want to 'upgrade' (you only want a foot massage for example) the easiest way is to tell them you don't have time for anything more. That way you avoid being rude, and the girl has done her job by asking you, so won't get in trouble with her boss!Once you've made your choice they'll give you an invoice to check and sign. You can pay by cash or credit card (though I believe paying by card carries an extra charge as with most places in Vietnam) Prices are in US$ but they'll accept payment in VND if you'd prefer. You can pay before or after the treatment.During all 4 treatments the therapist was very professional, and careful to check I was comfortable, that the temperature was OK, and that the strength of the massage was OK. If at any point you become uncomfortable (you start to feel cold for example) just tell her and she'll change it for you, no problem. They all spoke reasonable English.On the first day I just had the "back ache" 35 minute massage. I would have liked a longer one if I'd had the time, but I was going out for dinner. The massage was perfect to ease the aches of the flight!The second time I had the Herbal Therapy, which is a full body massage. They then use a bag of warm herbs, which they press onto the key muscles along your back and legs.The third time I had the coffee & honey body scrub which I really enjoyed. The session is listed as 50 minutes. The scrub itself lasts about 30 minutes. You're then 'wrapped' for about 5-10 minutes, while the therapist gives you a little head massage and prepares your bath. You then go into the bathroom where you wash the scrub off, and then relax in a wooden bath tub, with flowers, herbs and lime - it smelt lovely! And my skin felt great afterwards.The final time I had the Herbal Incense treatment, which is quite similar to the Herbal Therapy. You have a full body massage with oil. They then light an incense stick which they hold over parts of your body making them warm, helping the muscles to relax. I went for 90 minutes that time, and was sooooo relaxed afterwards!I enjoyed all 4 visits. The prices are so much cheaper than back home, so it felt great to be able to treat myself while on vacation! Each time made a very welcome break from the noise and craziness of Hanoi! The quality of the treatments and service is excellent. My only minor complaint is that for the Herbal Therapy and Herbal Incense I would have liked more of the heat treatment. But the massages themselves were still great.There are a great many spas and massage places in Hanoi, of varying price and quality. Personally, I would stay clear of the cheap places. Some of them have very poor reputations, and you just can't be sure what you're actually going to get! I feel it's worth paying a bit more (but still much less than home!) to be sure of good service. Of the few more upmarket places, I would guess La Siesta Spa is of similar quality (and price!) to the others. So which one you choose may simply depend on location and convenience for you. But, I can say with confidence that you'll have a good experience here.I was a guest at the Hanoi Elegance Ruby hotel (an excellent hotel) and so got a 20% discount, which meant that I really did get very good value for money!

Relaxing Oasis in the Middle of the Old Quarter of Hanoi. We made reservations for our family to visit the spa prior to our arrival in Hanoi. We were traveling with a party of 5 and the spa made accomodations for our entire group to start our treatments at the same time. The spa has a large menu of services. We went with massages and facials for the most part. We did everything from the hot jade massage to the indochine silver massage. The therapists were professional and everyone in our group finished their treatments relaxed.The spa is located on the second floor of the Hanoi Elegance 5 and the facilities are brand new. The reception area is a very zen type room with minimalistic furniture. The atmosphere is very peaceful and relaxing. The treatment rooms are brand new as well with great climate control (just the right amount of air conditioning for those of us who need it to be cool). The music was very relaxing.The spa was the first thing we did when we arrived in Vietnam, and the last thing we did before we left to come home. I would recommend this spa to anyone who is looking for a first class spa. The manager of the spa was great and he worked very hard to make sure we had a good experience. The spa was a great part of our trip.

Incense massage. The spa is very nice service is good. But the staff who handled me was not strong when it came to the massage although I told her I want it stronger. The incense massage was suppose to be their signature massage. There was nothing much to it. Just place a incense stick over the back and that was it. For the price that we paid that was already discounted, it was not worth it at all.

Amazing little hideaway for serenity and luxury. La Siesta Spa was so good my husband and I had to return a second time even after we'd checked out of Hotel Elegance 5. The welcome space is small, serene, intimate, complete with beautiful fresh vases of lotus, welcome drinks, wet hand towels and smiles. We both had the 'incense' treatment which was beyond sublime (full body massage, followed by an exotic heat treatment using incense cones on our backs). This spa is such a lovely, calm respite from the crazy beeps and bumps of Hanoi. I'd highly recommend it for Elegance guests and for those who just need some respite from the frenzy. Stunning little gem.

AMAZING!!. I was in Hanoi in June 2010.I had an incredible experience at the spa at hotel Elegance 5. I believe I had the "Ancient Hanoi" package, nearly two hours of body massage, stones and facial. The environment is very relaxing, the service is great. The maseusse that worked on me (Dao) has incredible technique, and amazing hands. I felt in heaven after the session. And the price was very good. What else can I say?I highly recommended it.Rodrigo

Very impressed. The staff at SF Spa were professional and friendly. This was easily the best massage I had in Vietnam and it was great value. When I entered, I was provided with tea, a cold towel, slippers and a form to complete about your massage preferences. The massage was in a private room. I was provided with a safe and key for storing my belongings inside the room and given a foot bath. I had a sports massage and it was excellent.

Relaxing time, lovely treatment. Great atmosphere, clean and tidy environment. Range of packages. Visited twice in three days. Pre booking advised and good level of health awareness (survey filled in pre massage where you can let them know of any and pre existing conditions). Very chilled and very good.

Worth it.. Very official and professional when you enter. Your greated with a cold cloth and a nice tea and it smells amazing with aromatherapy scents. My partner and were put into the same room. He can be a bit precious about new things and was horrified when he was asked to strip off and put on paper underwear. He soon got over it when the Vietnamese massage we got was really good and relaxing. Well worth it and make sure you book. They get very busy.
