Hits and Misses. very impressed once we entered. ambience was good, the whole place looks clean and smells great. massage however was very average with me and my husband feeling at times that the masseuses were just rubbing our limbs and going through the motion. an hour flew by and we paid and left feeling the same as before we entered. not refreshed nor relaxed nor anything. rather disappointing if you ask me. I'll skip this and go for the others.

Great massage. Recently opened, relatively small, very pleasant spa. Warm welcome, choose your treatment from a broad selection. No pressure to spend more than you planned. Mine was an Indian back and shoulder massage 30mins. Exactly what I got, and it relieved my back ache for a week. I will go back

Very average.. My husband and I booked for a 90 mins traditional Vietnamese massage. Entrance was really good, clean and fancy and smells awesome. W got the couple room so 2 ladies were assigned to assist us. It looks so promising and also SF spa was high recommended in Hanoi, i guess the high expectations are what disappoints us. The massage were very very average. The 2 ladies were more interested in speaking to each other in their own language than to pay more attention to us. Sure we got a full 90 mins (they were showing us the clock before and after) but in between the session, they were walking in and out of the room several times and each time they reach for the oil or to walk to the other side of the bed it felt like a slow motion scene. The techniques were so-so, the session ended without much to be impressed. There were so many spa outlets in Hanoi but we paid more and came to SF spa because of the recommendations, but overall it was.. meh. I am certain you can find a cheaper and better spa out there.

Vietnamese massage is a must. We tried this place because our hotel spa was fully booked and we are so glad we did.Clean rooms with great ambiance and the therapists were great. Try to Vietnam massage, it's a mix of Thai (good pressure and focus on stretching) and oil. Our therapists name was Phuong, ask for her!

Nice warm stone massage but very disappointed with lack of privacy. I went lakeview branch which is near to hoan kiem lake and thang long theater.Facility itself was well maintained, clean and massage was nice.But if u r sensitive, particular with privacy and service then this is not the one you are looking for. I got the body scrub and full body massage. I totally understand other ppl could see my back or shoulder during massage because it's not private room. but they even didn't use curtain during body scrub which other ppl can see my whole upper body and even there's curtain, it's no use at all too, too thin so can be seen through everything. Even worse, I could hear a few times other ppl's surprised voice during my service. Luckily they covered my eyes :(Very disappointed and never expected this kind of thing which doesn't meet their reputation. Even street massage shop doesn't do service in this way.Their price range is also not really cheap compared to other competitors, much better to go hotel spa&massage shop honestly.I like their hot stone massage but I won't come back anymore.
No pattern . Went there three times first time was great, second average and third was pretty bad...same happened to my husband who was having massage all these three times as well. Shame...

Relax and unwind. I visited here today with my boyfriend and we decided to treat ourselves to the Travel package. It was worth every dollar spent. Hands down the best massage I've ever had. The staff were very professional and we were able to get a room having side-by-side treatments. It was great to come here after a few days of a lot of walking and sore muscles. Not anymore though. Both of us very happy and relaxed now.

Top 2 of All Time. I got the sports massage thrown into my package which also included a facial, foot massage and milk bath. I was in heaven for 3 hours. My wife got the massage and facial. I had Yen Nguyen as my masseuse and explained the areas I wanted extra attention (neck,back and shoulders) typical areas but I get huge knots around my neck and shoulders to the point of causing nausea. I asked for a pressure of 7 to 10, 5 is normal. Within the first 5 to 10 minutes I knew I made the right decision. Yen, worked those knots while my wife was laughing due to the sounds/ grunts of pain/pleasure and tension relief I was receiving. Needless to say, I was happy. My wife said hers was ok.

Amazing!!!!!!!. Hands down one of the best massages we have ever had! We had the aromatherapy massage for 90mins and we both came away feeling so relaxed we were almost a hazard to the traffic on our walk home! We will definitely be coming back and would recommend to anyone visiting Hanoi. The rooms in the spa are beautiful and the staff are very friendly also.

Utterly relaxing . My boyfriend and I both visited SF Spa and each got the 60 minute sports massage. My boyfriend was quite nervous as he had never had a massage before or been to a spa but we were in agreement that we would go back. The massage was amazing and relaxing and price was around 499,000 dong which is approximately $30 AUD so very cheap.

The best massage!. It was really nice from the beginning. People were really nice and my masseuse Ahn was awesome! Thanks to you again. I got a Vietnam Traditional Massage for 60 mins. I highly recommend this to any person whose body is bogged down from long traveling.

Professional massage service in Old Town. A wonderful experience - superb pre service where you have tea and fill out a form with your preferences. The strength of the massage was perfect, as I do not like it to be too strong. They help make recommendations on type of massage and aromas. We were a couple and they accommodates us in a single room, where we had a private steam bath followed by individual treatments. Good prices too - would definitely revisit.

Becarefull. Be carefull cheating , selling voucher you canot uce , spending 800,000 always bisy Promisses to pay taxi one way Then come to the place then they sy they are fullybooked ; we check online its was not fullybooked any place , refuce to pay taxi and take voucher

Maiden Viatnamese Spa experience. There are 3 branches in Hanoi, where two branches offer a slightly different menu than the other. We went to one of the two main branches, which is in Hanoi Corner. Walking there would be slightly confusing as you have to walk further until you see the shop. The alley is quite dark at night and you might wonder if you're at the right place.The spa has a great ambience. We were greeted with good hospitality and fluent English-speaking personnel. The serving of iced tea would be a peculiar one as usually massage parlours serve warm drinks. We were given forms to fill-up prior to the massage.We could write areas to focus on, and areas to avoid in the massage, as well as inform them regarding any illness/injuries that we have.Massage room was a floor above; a couple room was given, side-by-side. Room temperature was just nice, ambience was decent. Our feet was soaked in warm water containing ginger and lime.The massage lasted one hour. Major differences in a Vietnamese massage as compared to the rest were:1. Massage commenced in supine position first, and then prone.2. Massage started from scalp/face and downwards3. A warm pack was placed twice during the massage, once at the nape of neck, and another at lower back.We took a one-hour session, so the feeling was not "thorough" enough. Overall it was not the best massage but a good experience having Vietnamese style therapy for once.

Professional Massages!. My girlfriend and I went to the SF spa during our stay of three days in Hanoi. After a nice welcome tea we had to fill in a form to give some information and you could fill in focus point and areas to avoid. Everything is very clean and the staff was very nice. The massages were the best we've had in Vietnam and very professional. On the second day in Hanoi we came back for a 60 min body massage. Highly recommended if you want to relax after a busy day!

Lovely. SF Spa was relaxing, calm and clean. As most spa's here is a communal room but there are curtains between tables and you forget there are other people in the room. The treatments i had were back, neck shoulder massage, body scrub and facial. The massage pressure was great and she really found some stress points that were bothering me and my skin felt amazing after the scrub and facial. Great place to get pampered while working abroad.

Not expect to come again. Came with friends and we shared the room which is not expected, no blinds or curtain between us made us not comfortable. My friend had a stone massage and I could hear the noise from the stones, the masseuse dropped the stones, both masseuse and masseur chat during the massage even though they speak softly, I couldn't relax at all. My friend finished early and the noise from his shower and door open and close....which is not a good experience.Also, have to wear instant underpants bother me a bit though I understand it's hygiene issue.By the way, They have one male masseur only, make sure make booking early if you request male masseur.

Perfect way to end a holiday!. On my last day in Hanoi, after three weeks of backpacking from south to north Vietnam, I decided to have a half day Spa at SF, the bigger one in city centre. Stayed at Nova Hotel, they recommended few spas but I got good feeling about this one so I called and booked. My first impression of the place was : fantastic. Reception was friendly. I even pushed my luck by coming half an hour before appointment time, and she received me straight away and arranged for everything. I was asked to wait, got nice tea and cold small towel served, and a form to fill in. A couple of minutes later, my therapist came to me and we went to the room. I love the decoration of the place and the ambience they provided. I choose to have one hour foot massage, one hour body Vietnam traditional massage and Mandi Susu (Milk Bath) at the end. I enjoyed the foot massage but enjoyed the body massage more. She was very careful, very polite, very caring and a very good therapist. I mean I am an Indonesian who is used to have massages and visit spas, so based on my experiences I know and I can feel what works for me and whats not. I probably was lucky, as I was the only customer in the room that day. Mandi Susu (Milk Bath) at the end was very relaxing after a very good massage. I felt seriously relaxed and good. Check out was smooth and no fuss. Added the tip to the bill and paid by credit card was no problem at all since I was lack of Dongs. It was a perfect end for a perfect holiday! Thanks SF! Warm regards from Germany!

Nothing for style massage. We choosed Thai massage from hight remcomment on tripadvisor. After finish we have some comments as follows: price too expensive, not enough force for thai masage , uncomfortable oil smell.

Excellent foot massage.. Booked an appointment the previous night before and very easy to locate. The decoration is very unique. Staff was very warm and friendly. I had a foot massage of 75 minutes. It's a little bit more expensive then most places but well worth it. I even fell asleep a bit during it.
Fantastic massage. Great massage, lovely atmosphere. Therapist was fantastic and I walked out feeling better than I have in months. Easy to locate and easy to book.

It really feels like a spa with cheap prices. They are professional and treat tou like a vip. Everthing is available from robes to showers to music. The best thing is the nice smell and cleanliness. It really gives a sense of relaxation. Its right in the middle of the old quarter.

Incredible massage . My partner and I visited Sf today for a massage each. The price was a little higher than what we've paid at other places in Vietnam but man it was worth it. My partner likes an incredibly hard massage, so went with the Thai massage for 75 mins. He absolutely loved it and is still keeps mentioning tonight how great it was! I was unsure about which massage to get, but the receptionist was fantastic and described (in quite a lot of detail) the various massage styles and suggested I get the Vietnamese as I like a medium strength massage. It was absolutely brilliant. The place was immaculately clean, the vibe was very peaceful, and we were greeted with tea (which always wins me over). Highly recommend!

BLISSFUL MASSAGE. My boyfriend and I had wonderful traditional vietnamese massages here. It was so relaxing. We were offered tea before and after. A lovely little respite from the bustling city outside!

Great spa. We have been here 3 times in our stay , the staff were polite and friendly, the place was good and clean,i had two vietnamese massage and the first one was ok but the second one was great because of the messagers..and i told her to message my legs more as I had pain in my legs because of walking alot those days,so she spent more time on my legs and feet.unfortunately I don't remember her name but if you're planning to go there ask for their best massagers..and make sure to ask them to spend more time in the areas that you want to get more message like legs or back or...Totally it was great!go there and relax
Now that was a massage!!. Easy to locate, inexpensive, charming, friendly staff members, SF Spa is perfect for a quick massage or a full day spa treatment.

Best massage in Vietnam . This was the best massage I've had in Vietnam. Very friendly and communicative staff, relaxed environment very attentive to the customers and the masseuse had great technique

Outstanding massage for men!. I regularly have massages and prefer strong, firm pressure so selected a Sports massage. Just outstanding! She walked my back with just the right level of pressure. You pay top dong but it is so worth it at this Spa. Went there twice. Totally professional operation where I did not feel embarrassed to be. I seriously loved it !

Best massage ever!. My 3 girlfriends and I went to SF Spa in the Old Quarter on the recommendation of our hotel concierge and our walking tour guide - he said it was his wife's favorite spa. Well they did not disappoint. We each had the same massages - 45 minute back, shoulders, neck massage and a 1 hour foot massage. We were all in the same room with curtains pulled between for our back massages. Not a big deal as we weren't doing a full body massage. This was by far the best back massage i have ever had and my friends agreed. She worked out so many knots I had in my back and neck with a perfect amount of pressure. Next we moved downstairs to another room where we all were seated in big lazy boys and given tea while we had a 1 hour foot massage. Again.... absolutely wonderful. The only negative i could possibly say is that the location is in the old quarter and there was quite a bit of noise coming from the school next door during our back massage and the street during our foot massage. Honestly this didn't bother me with the amazing massage I was getting (bring earplugs or headphones if you desire). The price was unbelievable at about $26. Absolutely worth calling and making an appointment while you are visiting Hanoi. Very easy to get to and the spa itself was very nicely done (wood and stones - very serene) and very clean. Highly recommend!

Nice ambiance. I tried to book online but never received any response to my website inquiry/booking. However, once I arrived in Hanoi I just called them and booked for the same day. I walked but they offer a complementary taxi pick up from the hotel. The waiting area is nice and relaxing. The room I was in was clean and set the right mood for a spa session, with fresh flowers and lovely smells (it was a couples room but I was there alone). I visited both SF spa and Mido spa and found the atmosphere at SF spa much more relaxing and "spa-like". I had a massage, dead sea salt scrub and mud wrap. My therapist had limited English but was nice and professional and I enjoyed all three.After these I had a bikini wax. While I would happily recommend the massage, scrub and mud wrap, I would not recommend the wax. The wax they use seemed to be of not good quality, it was too hot and therefore painful and also did not do a very thorough job.To sum up, a very nice place for spa services but would not recommend getting a wax there.

Best spa and massage in Hanoi!. I've been to a few spas in Hanoi within varying price brackets and decided that I would venture into SF Spa, 30 Cua Dong after reading great reviews online. I booked the SF Spa Signature package but being an high level athlete the type of massage I required was stronger than a traditional Vietnamese massage. I asked if I could swap the massage component to a Thai Massage and the spa quickly obliged.I am a British born Vietnamese and I have a lot of family in Hanoi and they were trying to discourage me from using an "expensive" spa citing that this spa would be just like the cheaper alternatives. Boy were they wrong!!The venue was very clean, ambient, temperature and lighting just right, staff super friendly and professional and spoke English very well. The pre-massage steam was fantastic and the actual Thai massage; honestly was one of the best I have had and I'm a regular spa visitor in London. If you want a massage book with Thao. She is strong, polite, very professional and can have a laugh too when she presented me with the disposable panties. "Sexy hey?" Thao is very attentive, always making sure and checking to see if the pressure of the massage strokes were ok, but without ruining the relaxation element of the massage. I'm not sure if tipping is necessary but I tipped Thao 200,000 VNĐ. Honestly she deserves more so get your wallets out and tip away. A massage package in London of this calibre would cost over £180.00. This was all for about £30.00. Great value and the best in Hanoi for sure. I would bet against anyone that can find a better spa than this in Hanoi. 5**.
Best massage in old quarter. May be more expensive than the other 'backyard' places but worth every cent, very relaxing and almost no road sounds, highly recommend, just brilliant!!!

Enjoyable Vietnamese Massage. Needed to kill time and so looked up trip advisor s for a nearby spa. Was pleasantly impressed with the therapy. Even though it does not offer the cheapest treatment, it is sure worth every penny with its friendly, clean room and towels. Downside, I climbed up stairs to get to treatment room. Do check it out when you are in Hanoi. Hope you will have a great experience too.

An oasis in Hanoi. Our hotel recommended we use this spa and we weren't disappointed. We had a Tradional Vietnamese Spa and a facial. It is more expensive than a lot of the spas in Hanoi but the ambience is soothing and the staff are lovely. It's very clean and well worth a visit.

A wonderful place to relax and be pampered. On the top floor of a lovely boutique hotel in the heart of the old city, this spa offers total respite from the hustle and bustle outside. The masseurs are highly skilled and your treatment is exactly what you ask for. Highly recommended

Great Spa Experience!. I loved SF Spa. I went there several times while I was in Hanoi. SF Spa provided a high end spa experience for a moderate price. It was located an easy walk from my hotel, the Essence. Yienb gave me a traditional Vietnamese massage. She was so amazing that I went back the next day for a massage from her too. I have no idea how she was able to balance on my back but no matter- it was great! I also tried the steam bath and a mini facial. The massage was the highlight of my experience there.
So bad. Worst massage I've had in Asia so far. In not sure if other therapists are better but mine was not good. Go somewhere else.

Massaged to the soundtrack of a woman getting waxed. When I first walked into SF Spa, I was impressed by the service I immediately received and the ambiance of the spa. I selected what services I wanted (75 min sports massage and Brazilian wax) and was given tea while I waited on the masseuse. Prior to walking up to the massage room, the receptionist asked me if it was okay if a woman received waxing services in the same room as me while I got massaged. She asked the woman getting waxed the same thing. We both were extremely hesitant and told her that we would prefer not to be in the same room. I assumed they would figure out an alternative so we didn't have to be in the same room. Little did I know... I was then escorted to the massage room (a couples massage room with 2 tables and no privacy screen), changed, put my belongings in a locker that was provided and laid down on the massage table. The actual quality of my sports massage was excellent - the pressure was great and the masseuse focused on my problem areas. However, 10 minutes into the massage, the receptionist interrupts the massage and asks again if the woman can get waxed in the same room as me. I'm annoyed, but know this is Vietnam and things don't work here like they do in the states, so I say "okay". The woman starts to get waxed on the table 2 feet away from me and the whole time I'm getting massaged, I hear hair being ripped off of this woman's body. There wasn't even any music to cover up the noises. The massage was NOT a relaxing experience for me. After my massage was done, I was told to continue to stay on the massage table until the woman in the room was done with her wax so I could have mine. I waited a good 15-20 minutes until I became fed up and left. The woman getting the wax said it was one of the worst waxes she's ever had (I think she got her legs waxed and a brazilian) and that I shouldn't stay. So I didn't.When I walked down to pay, the receptionist knew I was annoyed and gave me 10% off. She apologized profusely, but I mean...come on. No one wants to get a "relaxing massage" with the soundtrack of a woman next to them getting waxed. Not to mention, if I was more prude, I'd be very uncomfortable with a stranger seeing me naked on the massage table and seeing a semi-naked woman next to me.

Best massage in Vietnam . I spent half a day getting the 'travel' spa treatment. It was four hours from start to finish of pure heaven. Great facilities and staff, very professional and the ultimate way to relax. I was even given lunch. All this for less than $100 US.

Overall good but a few issues . My husband and I booked to have the winter warmer package on our last day in Hanoi. This involved a jacuzzi, ginger scrub, a ginger oil massage, a foot wrap and a soak in a traditional wooden bath. When we got to the jacuzzi it was almost scalding hot and they seemed a little confused why I wouldn't get in and just sat awkwardly on the side! They were testing the water temperature with their hands and saying it was ok, which it clearly wasn't. They attempted to cool it down but there wasn't long enough to get it cool enough unfortunately. I usually like a hot bath but this was painful and the skin on my legs was turning red! Things improved during the ginger scrub and the massage, we enjoyed both of these. The only comments I have on those was that there was no music, meaning we had to listen to the traffic outside which was a little odd. Very unusual not to have music. We also had to listen to the therapists chatting away in the next room while we were left to relax. The music would drown this out somewhat. The foot wrap was nice enough. As the previous reviewer noted, the bath wasn't in a traditional wooden bath as the brochure and receptionist had said it was, it was basically another jacuzzi bath (although granted not as hot) so that was a shame. Overall when compared with UK prices this was worth the money and a nice experience, but one that could be easily improved.

Excellent Services in a Soothing Ambience. Fortunately, SF Spa was a short walk from my hotel, raising its appeal on top of already very reasonable prices and its tasteful, soothing ambience. I opted for their “SF Warming Winter package,” which included a steam bath, ginger body scrub, massage, traditional wooden bathtub soak, and foot wrap.Quick side note: You are provided with disposable underwear for the steam room and all treatments, and while I’m not sure if they’d frown upon nakedness, they also aren’t shy about leaving you topless during treatments (unlike the elaborate sheet draping routines that US masseuses perform to cover you up).The package I chose was awesome—specifically the ginger scrub (both warming and exfoliating) and the massage. I requested more pressure, so as a result got a traditional Vietnamese massage, which utilized some very effective Chinese massage techniques as well. The bathtub soak was a different matter; it was actually not in a wooden bathtub and really not worth it. You step into a plastic Jacuzzi bath, with some milky/creamy substance in it and rose petals floating in each corner, then lay down for 20 minutes as weak jets pump out water and alternating colored lights illuminate the tub. It was the furthest thing from what I imagined a “Traditional Vietnamese wooden bathtub soak” would be. The foot wrap was also nothing special—while nice, it’s just a paraffin wrap like you would get in a nail salon, another way to extend the package time.Nonetheless, I liked the ambience and rest of the services so much that I decided to return toward the end of my stay in Hanoi for a mini facial and massage. Both times, I had the same technician for the entire time, and had to share a room (but thankfully, with my boyfriend; I can imagine it being awkward with a stranger). Some of the technicians don’t speak good English, but they will call someone in to translate as needed for any transitions (such as moving to another room) that require instructions.While it’s not mandatory to tip, I gave a cash tip immediately following the service directly to the technician, to ensure that they received it. SF Spa is well worth the trip, especially for the rock-bottom pricing (compared to what you’d pay in the US, which would easily be 4x or more for the equivalent service).

They know their stuff. After a terrible massage elsewhere in Hanoi we tried SF Spa ( I think we went to another branch in Hanoi than the address above) it is slightly more expensive than others you can get but still at least half the price of London or Sydney for excellent quality. Both my sister and I had neck back and shoulders for 30 mins and had wished we had more time. Trained ladies who worked very hard, spa is clean but the act wearing the paper underpants nearly sent me over the edge but I dare say they are optional! Very good spa.

Generally good, but a bit hit and miss. We visited this spa 3 times on our trip. It's probably slightly pricey by Hanoi standards, but the decor and experience reflects this - lockers, fresh robes, fresh slippers are all included as standard. The first time I had a massage, but the pressure was far too strong given I'd indicated on the customer form that I wanted a soft massage. That was quickly resolved after I spoke to the masseuse, but it makes me wonder why you're asked to fill in a form if it isn't read.The second massage was brilliant, with a combined facial and massage. Pure heaven.The third day, I asked for the exact same facial and massage as the previous day. It was considerably worse with no consistency from the previous day. For 15 minutes of the facial the therapists sat on the vacant massage tables, which was completely different to the previous day where you were looked after for the entire hour. I raised this concern at the front desk and was offered a 5% discount on my massage only. I thought that was pretty cheeky considering my partner had the exact same treatment and was also unhappy. All in all, this place is fairly good, but not worth writing home about. For the premium price that you pay, I would expect consistency and a great massage on every visit.

High end spa experience- great prices!. I was staying at the Eco hotel next door, see corresponding review, and came to this spa twice for a 90 minute Vietnamese massage. Both experiences were phenomenal, but the first one was by far one of the best massages I have ever experienced. All the staff are extremely kind and helpful and the facilities are clean and relaxing. If you need a spa treatment I would suggest coming here, especially due to the hygiene in the city.

Excellent experience. The spa has a very nice atmosphere. It is clean and peaceful. I had a 90 minute stone massage and a facial. My massage was one of the best I have ever had. Thoal was my therapist and she is amazing! If you can get her I would absolutely recommend coming to this spa.

Very good Spa. The side street where it is located is pintoresque, surprising to have such a Spa there. It has nice decoration and looks like European high class Spa. We got a recommendation from the hotel and it proved to be a good deal. There is a good choice of massages at a good rate - around 20 USD for 60 min. You are offered tea and the changing rooms have lockers, so no need to worry about your belongings. The massage was good, meeting expectations. The only item I did not appreciate is the fact that you get the massage in a shared room (gender separated), where other people are getting their massages. Even if separated by a curtain, it spoiled the relaxing and privacy environment I expect in such a place

Devine!. I was not sure what I would find when I booked at given the range of reviews. I opted for the 4 hour luxury package- given the value and range of services in the package- Steam bath, aromatic oil massage, exfoliating body scrub, collagen facial and foot massage with reflexology. As noted by others, my taxi was paid for by SF, and I was warmly welcomed on arrival. Given the length, my time also included a free lunch and refreshing drink. The massage was excellent, and the masseuse paid special attention to some of the problematic areas. With each treatment I sunk into deeper much needed relaxation. Mid way my lunch was brought- a lovely Vietnamese home cooked chicken and noodle soup. By the time I left- i felt I was floating. As I was leaving that night for a 24 hour plane trip- this was perfect to get myself ready.I highly recommend SF and look forward to the day when I can do a similar treatment again.

Bikini wax. The spa is very clean and neat. The receptionists are lovely and are speaking good English. I have only been here for a bikini wax.The lady who waxed was kind and spoke some words of English. However, I have had more bikini waxes at several places, but this has been my worst experience till now. I got some small blisters as the wax was put on too hot. The waxing was also more painful and less gentle done then as what I was used too. Next to that the wax wasn't thoroughly removed and I had wax sticking to my panties for the whole day. Also no tweezer or other form of epilation was done at the end. I live in Hanoi and I won't go back to this place for waxing anymore. Other services might be fine as I liked the look of the spa.
Relaxing. Relaxing but not the greatest massage. If I remember correctly you filled in a form saying how strong massage u wanted but I believe my massage were a lot weaker then asked for.

A bit average. To set expectations - the spa is on the nicer side for decor, but you (and the other guests) will be walking about in short robes or terribly stylish shorts and there isn't too much concern for nudity in the dressing rooms. If you're ready for that, then this place will be fine. We had foot massages that were ok but not great. However, that may have been my fault as I asked for extra pressure when she started soft - so she never quite hit the right balance.
Relaxing Massage. Recommended by Lotus Boutique Hotel , my husband and I went to SF spa tried out the sport massage for 2 hours treatments. The massage was good and value for money

Inexperienced massage therapists.. Really disappointing experience. Staff are not trained massage therapists. Place looks nice, but is a complete waste of money. Noisy. Staff yelling at each other certainly takes away from that zen atmosphere. Avoid.

Waste time waste money. My friends and I were looking forward for a relaxing massage.The first impression were great and we were greeted by the staff great hospitality.However,No hot tea and no preparation were done to refresh ourself. The main issue that make us upset is one of therapist were actually falling asleep while massaging on my back and accidentally place her elbow and slip off my shoulders and hold my feet for two min with doing nothing. Another friend of mine feel that the therapists did not exert enough strength although he were requested by reception for more stronger massage.Only one friend say not bad but I believe it's because she just twenty years and no experience going for massage . Paying for 35usd is totally not worth at all.

Wonderful Spa at SF HQ. There were 2 SF Spas at Hanoi when I was there, I went to the main branch at cua dong which is further away from Old Quarters, thankfully we were able to walk in without booking (please remember to book beforehand, as it was fully booked the next day we tried going) The SF Spa at 30 cua dong wasn't too difficult to find.Once we were there, the receptionist was very helpful, she showed us the list of services they offered and we picked the SF spa for 2 hours. The massage itself was very soothing and they were very professional, they were quite talkative before the massage started, but as soon as they started they were all quiet. I would definitely come again when I am in Hanoi!

A great way to wind down. We went to this Spa purely because our tour operator had given us free vouchers and it was just around the corner from our hotel. We got the Hotel to ring them first just to make sure they could fit us in and then went along.We were greeted by friendly staff who took us to a seating area and gave us 'menus' of massages on offer. Our free voucher was just for a foot massage but as the prices were very reasonable we decided to upgrade to a full Vietnamese one hour massage. You also fill in a form where they ask you if there is any part of your body you want to concentrate on or avoid.You are then taking to a changing room with lockers and you are given a dressing gown, slippers and little paper underpants to wear. You are then taken in a lift up to the massage room which is a very relaxing area with gentle music playing.The massage itself was wonderful, with soothing oiled massage but also lots of slapping and chopping. At one point the girl climbed up and walked up and down my back - it is a good job these Vietnamese girls are quite small. We all came out thoroughly relaxed and feeling great.I would recommend this Spa as a wonderful way to wind down after a hot day's sightseeing and at a price which is a fraction of what you would pay in an equivalent western Spa. A 60 minute Full Vietnamese massage was 450,000 Dong (about £13).

Massages!!! . We came to SF on a recommendation from a friend and we weren't disappointed. We went twice and were very pleased with the massages and the relaxing experience. The spa has a nice ambience and the prices are very reasonable. Highly recommend !
Excellent place to relax after a long flight.. Great ambience good service and competitive prices. Vietnamese massage great complemented by nice facial.

Its a decent spa. We had a decent rub down here. some floors to climb because vietnam old houses go up and not wide.
its next to eco hotel and it was a good respite. the prices were not the cheapest but you get a nice ambience and treated well. We had a good time here.

AMAZING!!!. We went there after our two day trekking trip in Sapa...and booked a two hour package. It was incredible.The design of the spa is high standard, though also the equipment and perfectly trained and nice staff.I had a body massage, soak bath and foot massage...and I would have wished that these two hours never come to an end!It is so worth a visit!!! Best spa I have been to on my entire travels through SEA!

A nice vietnamese massage. i read about good reviews about this place, so i decided to pay a visit during my holiday in Hanoi. it was indeed a great place. the staffs are professional and friendly. They only have one male therapist, just in case you need more than one. Worth to visit.

Nice Vietnam message. Nicely decorate and well equipped spa. It is clean and professional. Luckily, I don't need to share room with other. Vietnamese message is great. The price is not the cheapest in Hanoi, but it worth to try it as not too much thing can do within Hanoi city.

Rude receptionist, unqualified massage . For the price there are much better places around. Firstly the reception staff were so rude when I questioned the price as they hadn't taken into account the taxi rebate offer. I was basically screamed at and after paying over 2 million I thought that was very poor behaviour. The massage ladies were lovely but they don't know anything about muscle tension. The massage was super generic as neither ladies have the ability to identify problem areas. It was OK but I wouldn't go back.

Good spa with friendly staff. Nicely decorated and well equipped spa. Not the cheapest in Hanoi but clean and professional. Keep in mind that many massages are in all men or all woman room. So with multiple women or men in one room. If you don't want this simply ask for a private room. We did a Vietnamese 1hour massage which was really good and relaxing. They could improve their service by offering a welcome drink. But overall very good. They even arranged for the taxi back to the hotel.
Great spa. My husband and I booked a package with 75 min massage and a facial. The massage was great. It's not your typical RTM massage but very relaxing. Facial was ok but I wouldn't recommend it.

excellent brazilian!. If you are - like me - weary of trying out a new brazilian waxing spot in a new and unknown city, unsure of language and other barriers when a stranger is dealing with your sensitive areas, well, i can only recommend sf spa. i had a very professional "full bikini" as it is called, done by a lady with more than enough command of the english language, a firm but gentle touch and in a very pleasant, clean and private environment. i was at the hanoi corner branch (30 cua dong street). i will advise against booking online, i had done that and was under the distinct impression that my booking had been approved, but there was apparently some issue with the system, so i was not expected. luckily i only had to wait about 10 minutes (with a nice cup of tea) for a free slot (mid week, just over 8pm). just call them, the receptionists spoke great english! after being led into the room, i was asked if i wanted to "clean up" and directed to an adjacent shower, where towels and shower gel were provided to freshen up - did not feel like it was mandatory, but hey. the waxing was done using the "right" kind of wax, the hard kind without strips, latex gloves and is of the "not for the shy" variety (i only mention this because i have been in several uk places where they provide some sort of paper panties, which i can only imagine complicate access and lead to greater embarrassment of all parties, but if that's what you're used to, then maybe this isn't the place for you). also did lower legs, great as well, but really wanted to write this review for everyone worried about getting a brazilian done and confirm all the great reviews already out there.

AVOID!!!. If you are a regular visitor to massage centre and are well aware what a good and a professional massage means, then avoid this place! My therapist had a strong cigarette smell and in general looked very much dirty with strong mouth breath (nails, feet, teeth...). With regards to a massage, at one point I thought the therapist felt asleep as he almost stopped massaging. At a 75-min massage, 25min was given to lower part of one leg!!! Was that person on drugs??? At one point I simply stood up and left, I could not resist it anymore. Therefore please find some other centres!

Great value and great massage. My wife and I did a couples massage session for 90 minutes. She had a massage and scrub, I had a sports massage. Cost was about $30 each, and the massages were excellent. Amazing the under 5 foot, under 90lb masseuse had the hand and finger strength she did. I felt fantastic after as did my wife. The facility was modern/rustic and very clean. Highly recommend.

Great Place to De-Stress. Was in Hanoi 6 weeks working 12-13 hours a day, 7 days a week and found the spa to be a perfect place to de-stress and re-energize my body. The Traditional Vietnamese massage is excellent. I had both the one hour and two hour service and both were great! All in all I utilized service 3 times and found the quality of therapist consistent across all three sessions and the effectiveness of the massages extremely good.I would definitely recommend the spa. Also, I was quiet impressed by the spa manager. She knows her business and is very client focused. If you are wanting a massage while in Hanoi, I highly recommend this spa. I believe it will be as wonderful experience for you as it was for me.Paul

Good massage, somewhat noisy. I had a 75 minute Vietnamese traditional massage - my first of this style. Loved the warm pads and towels. The masseuse's technique was very good - and she was very charming. For the money (and with the hotel-recommendation discount), it's a decent choice -- clean and with a nod to ambience, but the brochure pics are misleading. The massage tables are lined up in a row of 7 or 8 tables with some curtains for a bit of privacy - once it gets started, you'll melt away from noticing what's going on with anyone else! However, It's less easy to tune out the barking dogs and motorbikes outside - next time I might bring my earplugs, or they could turn up a fan or music. Be sure to reiterate if you have special instructions ... even though I asked for most of the time to focus on shoulders and back, it received attention only at the end. Overall good experience though!

A welcome break from the streets of Hanoi!. I visited SF Spa for a 60 minute sports massage, the staff were all very friendly and the peaceful ambience it a welcome respite from the chaos of Hanoi. The massage was very good, the masseuse seemed very well trained and focussed on my problem areas. The pressure was good, not quite as strong as my sports massages back home (but I think my therapist in the UK is bordering on sadistic!) Obviously you can get cheaper massages all over Asia, I've had my share of £3 beachside massages in Thailand but it's not the same. I felt the price at SF was very fair, at about £15 this was the same quality as a UK massage at about a third of the price.Definitely recommended after a hard days shopping!

Pretty good.. The atmosphere was very nice. The service was great.They treated us very well. The massages were average which is why the average score. I would have rated it one more higher but we felt for the price it was a bit lacking. This is one of the more expensive massages to get in Hanoi so it let us down from that standpoint. We found that in Hanoi it really came down to just whether the place was clean and the masseuse was good. We had tried others places and found the price didn't really reflect the quality at all.
Pretty Good. husband had a massage here it was good- not spectacular, price was a little high to be honest. Not sure we would go back although the location next to our hotel is great.

well worth it!. Went to the spa with no appointment and although they were busy they managed to take me.I did have the 60 minute body scrub but I would have liked the massage that followed to be firmer. I had requested a firm massage on the registration form. Apart from that ..all good.

Great massage! . It was perfect for us to go to this beautiful place when we landed. With the jet lag and after 12hours in a plane, the sport massage was more than welcome! Great service, clean and prices really ok. Totally recommend it.

Perfect escape and pamper. Warm welcome. Nice change facilities including locker for personal belongings. Took elevator to 4th floor for massage. I'd asked for a 75min sports massage to help recover the body/legs after numerous days walking around the city. The masseuse was great; she was Strong and very knowledgeable.

Amazing massage after a crazy day. Having never been to Hanoi I was a little scared about having a massage but the staff are very respectful and very security conscious with locker to place valuables and clothes. The first time I had a back,neck and shoulder massage(about $15 AUD) the next day I had a full body massage for about $30. Would highly recommend!

Great relaxing experience. Great value for money.. Been in Hanoi for 4 years and the first time I entered SF Spa, I knew it's going to be worth it. Had a lot of experience in different spas and this one is the best, in terms of ambiance and price. Probably the second best after Evian Spa in Lotte because that one has an indoor pool.Looking at the main entrance, I thought it was just a normal Hanoian spa but this one has a bathroom, reception and they offer welcome drinks and cold towel. They let you fill out a form before the massage so you can tell exactly which part will be the focus and which part of your body to avoid. They also for pressure of the massage.Overall a great experience! Will definitely come back and recommend this.

Good foot massage at the end of a long trip. Took my 3 teen and pre-teen daughters here for foot massages (350,000 dong each). Clean and peaceful place. Greeted immediately. All 4 of us were seated in large chairs together in one room, which was good for us as a family. 4 different massage therapists did each of our massages simultaneously . One full hour, and included a few minutes of neck and shoulders as well. Wish we'd discovered this place sooner as they seem to have a lot to offer and great prices.

Small details and very clean. Walking in, you're greeted with aromatherapy and it's very calming. Great energy in the lounge area. The rooms are very clean and ours came with its own toilet as well. My massage was relaxing and I fell asleep at the end. I asked for medium but it was on the lighter side. The only thing that was inconsistent was the actual massage techniques; when something was done to one side of my body, it wasn't necessarily done to the other. There also wasn't open communication during the treatment - they didn't ask us if the pressure was okay and if we were comfortable. Overall, it was a peaceful afternoon.

Hot Stone Paradise. We had a 90 minute hot stone couples massage at SF and couldn't have been more pleased. Best hot stone massage ever. Expert masseuses, stones really hot and priced very nicely. Make an appointment and they will pay for your taxi to the spa.Only negative is the spa room is not soundproof. You will hear outside noises from within the spa and this can detract from the overall quality of the experience. There are lockers for your valuables and they provide undergarment and robe.

Relaxing Classy Spa in Old Quarter Hanoi. SF Spa is a class act, from the moment you walk in the door until the parting cup of tea you are made to feel special. The rooms are large, clean, quiet and relaxing. Serene music and gentle lighting help set the relaxing environment and the masseuses are lovely and skilled. The price is a little above average but I wouldn't call it expensive considering that when you walk out you are on top of the word. Classy and worth every dong.
Nice experience. Was great experience, clean, good quality of massage, smart staff, I can't request anythin extra. Very good.thanks

amazing service and location. 3 trips in June! that's how good the service was.... Foot massage was amazing 60 minutes of divine even got the shoulders massaged! Second visit was 75 min traditional Vietnam massage Hubby and I enjoyed that and as I was in pain from riding a push bike (?lol) they fixed that up very well! went back on our last day to ready ourselves for long flight home for another 60 min Traditional Vietnam Massage

Great choice . We picked this spa having read the TA reviews. Following on from a great meal on a very hot evening we thought we'll go and relax rather than visit a busy bar. Both my partner and I had 80 minute foot massages and the prices were so cheap compared to the UK! Your personal items are kept in a secure locker. The foot treatments were carried out in a dedicated room with lovely big leather recliners, very nearly fell asleep!! As a whole the experience was enjoyable. The only negative feedback, the therapist used the pumice stone for too long on the top of the foot which is a very sensitive area and the paraffin wax was excruciatingly hot as they dump your whole foot in the heater at once. All in all though we really enjoyed it.

Skillful Vietnamese traditional massage therapist. Spending time in SF Spa is a wonderful experience. I had an hour of Vietnamese traditional massage. They use some kind of oil with nice scene to warm the whole my body up, what ease my joins and muscles. The therapist's skill was excellent and staff were professional. A must comeback place.

Warm stone massage is the best. Visited SF spa last month with family and finished my day exploring the Old Quarter here. Staff were friendly, helpful and professional. They spoke English fluently. We had a warm stone massage in 75 minutes. After the massage, our energy was charged up for the next day. The price was reasonable too, $29 for the massage. Worth to visit.

Impressed with the management and staff at SF Spa. I went there very early in the morning, the spa receptionist came, although beginners spa 9am welcome but they welcomed us enthusiastically, their english very good. The staff is polite and professional, and the spa is clean, quiet, and welcoming. Started as a hot tea and a nice chat with the manager ... It's all a great experience on my first morning in Vietnam!

Excellent service but don't compare it with the strength of thai massage. I am a massage lover and used to high strength massage. They have changed 2 masseurs for me and eventually called a male masseur, who is known to be the strongest in sf, to serve me. However, even in full strength that still doesn't quite reach my preferred strength. I will still give good review to this place based on the service you get but if u can take "a lot of pain" like myself, GO THAILAND!!

Perfect Totally. From the first moment I was greeted by friendly staff by a cup of hot ginger tea. The receptionist comes to me and have nice suggestions for massage. And then I picked Jejuvenate and Vietnam Traditional Massage. Very fast, around 2 minutes later everything is well - arranged and really perfect skill. Reasonable price as well. You get what you pay for absolutely. I highly recommend this spa to all.

Best foot massage ever . Amongst all the chaos of Hanoi there is this amazing spa once you walk in the noise from outside is drowned out and the ladies here certainly know how to take care of you. I had a foot massage it was so relaxing I felt refreshed and relaxed and ready to hit the street for some more walking I cannot say enough treat yourself.
Very professional. Great little spa tucked away on a busy street. Most professional massage service I have received in Vietnam. Well worth a try.

Professional but could be more private. Professional therapist who put me to sleep with aromatheraphy massage and facial. Extremely satisfied with my therapist who is skilled and experienced. As mentioned by others, massage was in a shared room (although no other customers was present) and door was opened. I could hear soft noises from the street as well.My partner had the herbal treatment and was not as pleased as i was- likely due to the an expectation gap/unfamiliarity as to the treatement provided.Overall a great experience for me - you get what you pay for.
Good but no privacy. this spa is very good but no privacyno individual room and people walking around looking at half naked bodyservice is very goodgood massage

Get the Vietnamese massage and facial!. I turned up at 8.30pm (without an appointment) and was warmly greeted. I got one of the 2 hour packages and the staff kindly swapped the steam bath for 15 mins more massage :) The cost was 980,000 dong, which I think is about £30/$45. Not cheap, but much better value than western equivalents. Missy Tinh (not sure if I spelt that right) did my massage and facial - both were very relaxing. I had said 6/7 out of 10 on the pressure scale and thought this was just right. Your belongings are locked away so it's all very secure. I walked back to my hotel through the Old Quarter's streets at about 11pm and felt perfectly safe. Would definitely recommend SF Spa!

Quality treatment and ambience. The relaxation started at the reception already, when I entered without an appointment. After a short wait, sweetened by ginger tea, I was guided to nicely appointed rooms with separate showers. The therapist was very qualified and gentle. Truly enjoyed the traditional Vietnamese style massage. Highly recommended. You feel years younger afterwards.

Clean, professional - excellent. Our hotel had given us a voucher for a percentage off treatment at this Spa. Worried after 2 very long day trips that we would not get an opportunity to visit the spa our hotel made a reservation and arranged for our tour guide to take us to the Spa directly as opposed to return to hotel after the trip.We were pleasantly surprised at how professional it was (having been to other Spa's in Hanoi earlier in the week). All staff speak English and are in a uniform. The previous spa we went to the staff were wearing jeans etc and it made me doubt if they were qualified. I had no doubts at SF Spa.It was quite busy with people clearly returning for more treatments and being turned away due to being fully booked.We were taken in a lift upstairs and shown into a relaxing room, given robes and slippers - clothing and personal belongings are put into lockers and you retain the key.Pleasingly they were able to accommodate my husband and I in one room for our Vietnamese body massages. My husband had a male masseuse and I a female, she was small but a very strong lady! The massage was very firm, but of slapping goes on which is fine but can take you by surprise! My aching limbs were definitely pummelled and stretched back to where they should be by the end of the treatment. They put warm pillows under your back which helps you to relax.Really recommend, not expensive and worth it! We'd have gone back if we'd been in the area longer!

Modern Clean Spa. Receptionists speaks good english. Menu contains extensive services, I went with with traditional Vietnamese massage and SF spa signature. They will inform you what is expected before starting treatment. Great service and profeaaional masseurs!

Could have been better. The massage itself is quite satisfying. I choose Aromatherapy Massage for 90mins and cannot smell any aroma for the time spent. Place is clean, they provide clean for-one-time-use underwear and robe, safe locker to keep your belongings. The massage itself is in shared room, which is quite common, although you can hear people's voice sometimes.Therapist will ask if her massage is okay with me or if its too hard, so I can ask for more delicate massage. Seems to be no-tipping for therapist policy, although I can be wrong. Had no chance to give the tip money as the therapist left as soon as I enter the changing room.Overall its okay for refreshing massage on a tired day. A bit pricey but worth the comfort.

Massage very good. Massage very good, comfortable, friendly staff, really good time ... We used the 75-minute massage package and feel refreshed and relaxed after a massage. And here there is little point bar. I like it very much. We will be back here next year! Thank you very much ... I will introduce a friend to come here hoping to receive a discount voucher.

Excellent Massage, but....... I visited the newer SF Spa near Lake Hoen Kiem with my fiancé on Friday, having just arrived from Brisbane. We had been to the original SF Spa on a trip two years prior and had brilliant massages and service as well in lovely surroundings.While my Vietnamese Massage from Hung was excellent, I wasn't so impressed with the standard of the finish of the rooms or the building in general. Gone was the foot bath to begin along with the warm ambience of the room.I can still highly recommend SF Spa for a great massage, I just hope that standards haven't dropped at the original location as well.

It's alright. This is one of the nicer spas we found in Hanoi. However it was nothing amazing, especially for the price we paid. Very nice/clean atmosphere, professional staff and you get a safe to put your valuables in. We had the traditional Vietnamese massage... It was just average. It was pretty much just oil slathered over me with the masseuse brushing her hands and forearms over and over again. Definitely looking for more pressure.

Nice spa. Pretty nice but not out this world. I like the fact they lock your valuables in a safebox and guve you the key. Has a nice tidy feel and saw several europeans there. Safe and good choice but guess there may be better. Price wasnt to bad.

Divine.. We booked this in the spur of the moment on a Tuesday afternoon and there happened to be two spots available for an aromatherapy treatment for 60 minutes. It might be a bit pricey but it is so worth it.We got a free taxi from the hotel and arrived at the spa. It's a beautiful setup, which instantly soothes your senses. We got a tea, changed into the provided bathrobe, knickers and slippers. After that we went to the second floor for a shower as we had spent the day walking around and didn't want to gross out the masseuse :DAfterwards we got our massages, which were just perfect. Great ambiance, soothing background music, lovely smell from the oils we had chosen and just the perfect pressure. It went by too fast and 60 minutes later, we had to leave to catch a train but we wished we would have had the time for the 4 hour treatment... Next time!

Nice spa, relaxing treatments.... We visited at 4pm on a Tuesday afternoon. There are two SF Spa locations in Hanoi, we went to the wrong one however the staff were kind and let us have our treatment there (the one by the train track).We opted for the Signature massage but swapped the Vietnamese massage to an aromatherapy one (no extra cost). Good points:Very clean, nicely lit and relaxing environment.Friendly staff and nice fruit juice.Relaxing massage in a room with comfortable temperature.What I would have changed:The Signature package is another 400,000 VND on top of just the aromatherapy 75 min massage (which was by far the best part). For the extra money you get 15 mins in a standard hot tub and small amount of face prodding with some sticky patches left under your eyes for 15 mins.This was good but I wouldn't say it warrants the extra cost. This is just personal opinion but I would save the money and have another 75 min aromatherapy massage!!

Relaxing, well-designed space with excellent, caring service. I left after a massage and facial feeling refreshed and at peace. My masseuse and the rest of the staff couldn't have been kinder or more thoughtful. On top of that, the amenities are top notch -- beautifully designed and spotless. SF Spa prioritizes the customer's comfort and are guaranteed to take care of you.
Relaxing foot treatment. I've choosen a foot treatment, which was very relaxing. The staff was very friendly.Nice rooms and tasteful furniture. Nice classical music in the background.

Nice spa. I've been there twice.. Both locations are very nice however the one on the center is more noisy (you might hear some boise from the chaotic traffic around). I had an outstanding foot massage with a therapist named Bien! Very relaxing! And great value for money!! If you step in after 6:30 pm it is very likely you will get a spot without previous reservation. Prices are very good! Tips and taxes are already included!

Great scrub. Visited last night for a 60 minute sea salt scrub. It was excellent, I walked away with my skin feeling baby soft. This place looks like a spa and is offers a relaxing experience. Recommend checking it out! Staff was very friendly.

S-U-P-E-R-B. Great place for a massage. This spa is definitely worth a visit.
The masseuse are all professionals and I must say that it is one of the best massages I've enjoyed.
Very reasonably priced and I visited the spa 2 times in 3 days.
Would highly recommend the Traditional Vietnamese Massage and HUAN, the masseuse.

Excellent waxing. I'm traveling for a year and not always sure where to find spas that can wax well. This one definitely does, one of the best waxing I've ever had. I had a bikini, underarm and half leg done. Very clean and comfortable atmosphere.
Definitely recommend!
If this review is helpful, please tick below:

Great relaxing spa for traditional Vietnamese Massages!. I went to the SF Spa a few times. What better way to start a vacation and get acclimated to the time change? It is a very pleasant atmosphere to get out of the hustle and bustle of the Hanoi streets. You are served tea or over beverage while you wait in a peaceful area before you are taken upstairs for the massage. It is a bit pricier than other massage businesses, but I preferred the better atmosphere (nicer furniture, reception, etc) to other places.

Good spa, tricky to find. Worth following the street address, not the map point. When you do, it is a well appointed spa with the normal selection of treatments available. Clean and well run, but busy, so worth booking in advance incase they are full up.

great massage. Just had a 90 min aromatherapy massage for 2 of us in the one nearest the lake. They fitted us within 30mins of phoning, paid for a taxi one way, provided a great massage for about £21 each. Worth every penny in my opinion. It was also nice that the therapists were hanging around for a tip like they are in so many places but this was one occasion where we would have tipped them without hesitation! We've had many massages in south east Asia at varying prices, this was great value for money and I'd definitely visit again if we were staying longer. Left feeling refreshed after the 4 hour transfer from Halong bay

A very relaxing break. On an extremely hot and humid day (and my beloved's birthday) we sought some relaxation before dinner. SF spa provided a great service and the friendly staff and skilled masseuse made sure we left feeling wonderful. Prices are at the moderate range.

Top notch! One of the best massages we had in South East Asia.... We visited here 3 times during our trip to Hanoi and each time was excellent.This is a very clean, well run Spa, with absolutely top notch masseurs... in fact my last massage was probably one of the best I have ever had... without a doubt they were the best massages we had in South East Asia in 4 months...Cannot recommend highly enough...

Simply best in the business . Visited this place based on the trip advisor reviews. At first we were hesitant to take the longer version of the treatments as we did not know what to expect but once we did, it was all regret, we should have gone for the longest version of the massage! Customer care is outstanding. Each individual, from the gentleman that opened our taxi door, to the receptionist and each therapist treated us with immense care and apt friendliness. You are made to feel special from the get go. The receptionist showed us in, explained in detail what each therapy entailed and then proceeded to give us complimentary herbal tea while we waited to be escorted to the therapy room. The rooms in itself are small and the ambiance very basic but, it was extremely clean and temperature controlled for optimal comfort. In reality that's all what you need! The one hour traditional Vietnamese massage was simply outstanding. It is a combination of palm, forearm and thumb treatment. Our two therapists Mien and Bien were simply INCREDIBLE, from all the massages I have had ranging from; Indonesia, Malaysia, Singapore and Sri Lanka, this was undoubtedly the FINEST...BEST OF THE BEST. Our sincere thanks and compliments to both these two therapist for really taking care of us and making this experience so very special. We are definitely coming back and requesting these two. I highly highly highly recommend this venue to all those who travel to Hanoi. Kudos SF Spa...This place is a WINNER!
Perfect massage - highly recommend!. Very clean, nice spa with reasonable prices and amazing service. A 60-minute full-body Vietnamese massage was the perfect end to my trip!
fantastic treatment!. We had a 1 hour full-body massage and it is really worth the money. We have been to the one close to the lake (right after water puppet theater). Highly recommended!!

Lovely people and took credit cards too. Really happy with my massage here - no fuss or nonesense. A secure set of lockers, very clean and had a great, relaxing time. Also, they emailed me a customer satisfaction message afterwards which I thought was very professional

Perfect way to end my vacation!. I have been to the SF spa the last evening before I left back to home and I couldn't be dreaming of a better ending then this ^^!We went to the SF spa in the evening around 10pm and they said the spa was full but they had another location close by, so they arranged a taxi for us that they have paid... They did a really good service there!Ones at the other location... It was a very cosy place, everything was really relaxed and they were very kind! I hace decided to take a traditional Thai massage (420.000 dong for 60minutes. They let us fill in a paper were you needed to fill things in how you would like your massage...Ones at the massage everything was really relaxed... They guided us and told us what to do. They really knew what they were doing as it felt really great! After the massage it was like I was in another world, I felt satisfied!If you like to get a good massage that is worth his money, I would recommend to go to that place!
great. nice, service-minded and quiet break from the chaotic yet liquid HanoiI had a shimmer scrub and a facial and left the spa feeling relaxing and totally at ease

Great massage. Nice and clean place a very warm welcome, and great massage, 1 hour for about 20$.You begin by a quick explanation about the different massage available, then I did wait approximatly 5mn and went on the massage room. It contained 3 beds but I was alone in the room.Open until 11pm.

Disinterested masseuse. Great massage but masseuse seemed to be quite bored. The spa is clean and very western. They do not offer any variation to what wS on menu. They were firm about sticking to menus, and I wished they were able to blend massage styles

Look No Further When In Hanoi. Make sure SF Spa is on your list of things to do in Hanoi. The place is very clean and modern. We visited the newer facility (they have 2 locations). This one in near the Water Puppet Theater. We (4 people/2 couples) had several treatments (foot massage, Vietnamese body massage, facial, and manicure). All were very nice and done by professional therapist. If you are traveling with other people it is a lot of fun to have a foot massage at the same time. Hot water and paper shorts make for good conversation. If you have a reservation (highly recommend before you go) the Spa will pay your taxi fare to get to their location. They are located in the Old Quarter. A suggestion for the late afternoon and evening would be to got to the Water Puppet show, then the Spa close by, and then out to dinner at the Gia Ngu restaurant (not to far from the Spa/very good ratings on Tripadvisor).

wonderful massage. Had a great experience. 60 minute Vietnamese full body massage - was very peaceful and relaxing. Clean spa facilities, excellent ambiance, great massage, good price! Would definitely come here again and recommend to anyone.
The Finest Wellness Spa in Hanoi. I had a body scrubfriendsssage. The staff are very helpful. The place is very cozy. The services are reasonably priced. I will definitely recommend it to my friends!

Tranquil serenity. SF Spa is clean, beautifully decorated and exudes a tranquil serenity. The staff are very friendly and accommodating. The treatment menu is extensive. My husband and I got different styles of massage, but they put us together in the same room which was very special. I had the traditional Vietnamese massage which was so relaxing and soothing, especially after 24hrs of travelling. Hubby had the sports massage which was great too. We floated out of there when we were finished :) I definitely recommend this place!

Best Thai massage in a long time. SF spa was simply superb. I'm not really fussed about decor, disposable underwear, electronic lockers with near-field-unlocking wrist keys, and/or fruits and tea after the massage. I care only about the treatment. I had a Thai massage which was one of the best I've had in a long time. Strong, active, lots of moving about. The therapist kept checking up on me though, which is a true sign of a great masseuse. Add in the fact that the location is top notch for those of you staying in the old quarter, this gets big thumbs up from me.

Cozy ambient, clean robe and friendly staffs. The ambient is cozy and environment is comfortable. They gave me a safe box to put my belongings with key band on my wrist. The robe and sandals are clean and nicely pack in packaging(look very new). I felt comfortable and safe to leave my son at the reception staff. The massage was great as per expectation.

It was much more than was I was expecting :). I was traveling alone and I came here tonget a massage on my birthday. The place is beautiful, clean, and girls are so profesional.When I came down after finishing my treatment they were waiting for me with ansurprice birthday cake!!! It made my day :)

“Fabulous massage experience!”. I was given a recommendation to go to SF Spa when another one was booked. I was very happy that this worked out because I received one of the best massages I have ever had. I had a 90-minute Sports massage. I was asked what level of pressure I would prefer and the massage therapist hit it perfectly. She was very thorough.We opted for a reflexology foot massage - 1 hour later not only were my feet very happy but so were my arms hands and shoulders. The staff were fantastic, friendly, very professional but didn't talk to you whilst you were zoned out in Heaven. It was an amazing and ultra-relaxing experience. Great price too! I would definitely recommend this spa.
Great . Went as a recommendation of my hotel and TripAdvisor Well worth itVery professional My wife's treatment was only 2 hours but went for an extra half hour

Good. Had a facial here as part of our tour package, it was very good. Only thing that spoiled it was the sound of the girls cleaning out some bowls or something whilst I was laying there relaxing and listening to the soothing music.

No Regrets. The hotel we stayed in recommended SF Spa to us. The spa looked very cosy and the staff were very polite and efficient. We had to fill up a form to give some information about us - any allergies, our health state, etc. What I liked in the form was that we were asked if there was any part we would like to put more concentration on and if there was any part we would like to avoid; and also the strength of massage we would like to have. We took the 90 minutes session. The massage was really good, the ambience of the room was very relaxing and we enjoyed every moment of it. A good place to unwind and relax.

nice spa in city. located in the centre of hanoi, small buy cozy. reasonable price, nice service, excelent stuffs. dont forget to ask the stuff if they still going to pay for the taxi (they did have this kinda promotion before）

Amazing spa. I booked a full spa day at SF spa with foot reflexology, hot stone massage, scrub and facial and all the treatments were absolutely amazing. The therapist treating me, Ms Hien L, was wonderful and made sure I had a great experience. I would definitely recommend this place and am also planning to come back next time I'm in Hanoi.

Good for hanoi and clean. Very nice environment and clean. Bit more pricey than other spas but feels more luxurious. Had the foot massage which also includes body work so would recommend it. Overall really nice experience but payment is cash only so make sure you are prepared! Free pick up from our hotel was great too

Relaxing and refreshing!. Was passed on the details of the Spa from our hotel desk who highly recommended it, and we weren't disappointed. Despite the streets outside the spa being full of people and traffic the ambience in the spa was kept you miles away from it. From the moment we entered we felt relaxed and at ease. The staff were attentive and the message experience was superb, we left feeling refreshed.

Amazing Massage!. My friends and I stumbled across SF Spa and as backpackers we decided to go to this spa as a special treat and spend a little bit of extra money. This was a gamble that paid off! I had an aromatherapy massage and it was so relaxing. You get a sample plate of all the different oils they can use which is a nice touch, being able to pick your own. The staff were very polite, the venue looked clean and very well presented, and the room was nice and warm and smelt delicious! We loved it so much that we went back a second time! PLEASE NOTE: Please make sure you look up the address properly if you are using Google maps as there appears to be another SF spa which is also within the old quarter which is not this one. We got very lost looking for this SF spa for the second time we went back. This obviously isn't this spas fault but I just wanted to let people know. This SF spa is the one right near the water puppet show venue in Hanoi. I hope this helps some people!

Fabulous massage experience!. I was given a recommendation to go to SF Spa when another one was booked. I was very happy that this worked out because I received one of the best massages I have ever had. I had a 90-minute Sports massage. I was asked what level of pressure I would prefer and the massage therapist hit it perfectly. She was very thorough. It was an amazing and ultra-relaxing experience. Great price too! I would definitely recommend this spa.

Best Foot Massage Ever!. This spa was recommended by a fellow tourist who saw us pondering outside another spa - her exact words were " if you want the best spa in Hanoi go to the SF Spa, not only is it cheaper but its the best massage I have ever had" ...... she was sooooo right! We opted for a reflexology foot massage - 1 hour later not only were my feet very happy but so were my arms hands and shoulders. The staff were fantastic, friendly, very professional but didn't talk to you whilst you were zoned out in Heaven. WOW!

Professional, experienced and clean. Went for a bikini wax and after reading the reviews I thought I'd treat myself to a little half hour massage whilst I was there. Both treatments were good and the masseuse seemed very experienced. Relaxing atmosphere. I felt like a valued customer, I wasn't spending much money there (compared to most of their treatments) but I made use of the complimentary pick up taxi and tea before/after treatments and didn't feel they were rushing me out the door. Would love to go back for a package deal.

Great value for money. Myself and a friend both had the hot stone massage a the end of a somewhat chilly, rainy Hanoi day. The spa itself is well decorated and very clean. The staff are lovely. Security of your posessions is good as there are lockers that have a digital keys which can only be opened with 'your' key and the managers combined. This 'key' is then put on your wrist so you can be massaged without it ever leaving your body. The elevator then takes you up to the treatment room. The hot stone full body massage was wonderful, at times I felt the stones too hot, but once I mentioned it ,they always checked I was comfortable. This type of massage can be a bit of a shock at first as the lady will mount the table your lying on and sit between your legs which can feel a little 'non british' at first ! Well worth it though and worth every dong. For this quality of massage in the UK, expect to pay approx double. Myself and my friend became addicted to the pampering and went on the have further massages during our travel in Vietnam.Choose a long session as the time simply flies !

Great way to fix your feet after exploring Old Quarter. After a long day walking around Hanoi, our feet were hurting, so we stopped by the SF Spa. My wife and I both received the hour-long foot massage, and it was an incredibly relaxing and rejuvenating experience. The spa was clean and well decorated, the service very friendly, and the massage was absolutely wonderful. We considered signing up for a full body massage as soon as ours ended. If we had another day in Hanoi, we would most definitely go back! Great deal!

A SUBLIME Spa Experience. I got my hotel (Paradise Boutique) to book the "SF Spa Signature" two hour package for me, and I added the Dead Sea Salt Scrub and Wooden Bathtub Soaking (Vietnamese Herbal) treatments, and experienced almost three hours of absolute bliss.I have had numerous different styles of massage through the years, including remedial, aromatherapy, and Thai, but this was the first time I have ever had a traditional Vietnamese massage, and it was nothing short of AMAZING...it must be experienced to be believed, as it goes beyond basic massage methods to incorporate stretching, which I found to be quite relaxing.The two therapists who performed the various treatments on me were good, and quite obviously experienced and well-qualified.I would have no hesitation whatsoever about going back to SF Spa, and highly recommend SF Spa for a relaxing and enjoyable spa experience.

Must Try!!!. Make a reservation with the help of the hotel staff and went with wife for foot massage. Complimentary one way taxi transfer to the Spa was accorded and paid by the Spa upon arrival. The place was nice amidst the busy streets and the staffs were polite and welcoming. Had the foot massage and it was so so good compare to those i had in Bangkok. A must try if in Hanoi.
Facial. Just had the most amazing, relaxing facial in the most fabulously warm cosy environment.Leaving tonight or else I would have gone back for another treatment.A must go treat x

Great massage in an okay setting. I came here at the recommendation of my hotel. It's located in the Old Quarter. The facility is clean but not fancy. I got a massage by a male masseuse named Hung in a room with 4 beds separated by see through curtains. The female masseuse watches me get undressed, put my clothes in a cubby and called in my guy.I got a 75 minute sport massage. It was very good. I asked him to concentrate on my lower back. The last 5 minutes he walked on my back, got on the bed with me and hoisted me (with just my panties on) over his head and stretched my back. I felt a little exposed but the bottom line is no more back pain - even after a travel day of 42 hours back home!
