It's not the cheapest massage in VN, but the $30 USD I spent was worth every penny.If you want a private room, be sure to make a reservation.

Best massage ever! . This must be the best massage we had in..... Ever! Atmosphere was great and place looks amazingly zen;) masseuse are truly professionals. You spend a little more then in de regulars bur its worth it!!

Peace in the middle of chaotic Hanoi. My friend and I had two wonderful massages at SF Spa. Recommended by our amazing hotel, Hanoi Merci Hotel, we welcomed our sport massages after 20+ hours of travel from New York. The facilities are very clean and treatments are very good. Coming from NYC the prices are insanely low. Get as many massages as possible!We also had a wonderful salt scrub leaving our skin soft and glowing. Highly recommend any treatments here!

Oasis in the middle fo the madness. We had the most unbelievable and relaxing treatments (aromatherapy massages) at the SF Spa closest to the lake. The spa came recommended by the Hotel we stayed in (Hanoi Moment) and wow, it did not disappoint. Relaxing and rejuvenating, a little piece of quiet oasis in the middle of the mayhem of Hanoi Old Quarter. Pity I only had time for just the one treatment. This establishment comes highly recommended. These therapists know what they are doing. Just what was needed after a long journey from Africa!

Devine. This spa is just Devine and you walk out feeling amazing and floating on air. We had the aromatherapy massage and can't recommend enough, this is one of the best spa treatments I have had in a long time. Thankyou to the lovely staff and for making us feel so pampered.Thank youElle

Good massage and salt rub. This message place was recommended by our hotel. They called a few hours ahead and made us a reservation. When we arrived we were greeted by friendly staff and a tasty beverage and towelette. The staff offered appropriate assistance to selecting our services. I selected a 60 min massage and salt rub. Both services were done very well. The massage was relaxing, but sufficiently hard. The salt scrub left my skin ridiculously soft. The cons...they gave us flip flops and disposable underwater. I believe they do dispose the underwear, but reuse the flops. Our massage took place in a group room and there was some shared nudity among female and male friends. I was periodically cold, but not freezing. My shower was also luk warm. Overall, the experience was interesting, but good. Afterward, they provided us some nice tea.

Great variety of available treatments. Our hotel booked appointments for our group of five. SF Spa accommodated our entire group within a few hours. Upon our arrival, we were welcomed with a drink and moist washcloth to refresh ourselves. The staff was very professional. Great variety of treatments available. While the staff provided recommendations for order of treatments (massage first versus facial), we didn't experience any pushy sales techniques. We completed questionnaires requesting areas to focus on during our massages, preexisting medical conditions, etc.After completing the questionnaires and selecting our spa treatments, we were escorted to our locker rooms. On the way to the locker room, we witnessed a staff member "recycling" slippers used by previous guests. Essentially, after the guests were finished using their slippers, the staff member repackaged the slippers into plastic bags for re-use. We each had our own locker with a key. After securing our valuables, we were taken upstairs to our treatment room. What we didn't expect was for our entire group to be accommodated into one large room. We were a group of three women and two men. For the massages, we removed all of our clothing and put on disposable underwear. While each of our beds were initially separated by gauze curtains, once the treatments started, the curtains were pulled back. If we looked up from our treatment beds, we could see each other. While we're all good friends, this was a little unsettling. The massage was okay. The room was a little chilly during the massage. I was happy with the body scrub. After the body scrub, I was provided a sheet to cover myself while I walked over to the shower room. The water pressure was great. Plenty of hot water was available. Afterwards, we could pay with cash or credit card. This was definitely a bonding experience for our group.

Great Ambience. I had a day to myself, so I thought I'd try a massage and a facial. At reception there was a little confusion, that I had wanted more than one Spa treatment. Once sorted, the experience was relaxing, professional and calming. I did have to move to a different room for the foot massage, which was understandable, however, there were a number of interruptions from other Spa colleagues walking through the room, which disturbed the relaxation process. The facial was magnificent, my skin was soft and not greasy. The best facial, I've ever had. One of the nice things about the language barrier is that you don't have to talk. This, for me is a bonus, when getting a massage.

My first vietnamese massage.. The spa receptionist told me that this is one of there specialty and a best type of massage that they can offer. That is why I give it a try. The massage is good but only gentle. The therapist is attentive and nice. The spa ambience is relaxing and clean. It's a good try but not a type of massage for me.
Relaxing ambience . Had a relaxing massage with my wife and the staff were friendly. Would definitely come back here for the 2nd time.

Professional and affordable!!. After being super nervous about getting a dodgy Vietnamese wax this place was AMAZING! The staff were professional, the place was calm quiet and most of all immaculate and the whole experience was totally recommendable! Affordable prices a little expensive in Vietnam maybe but you definitely pay for quality and it was one of the best wax's I've ever had!!

First stop out of India ... A real gem!. After travelling and living in India for 15 months, it was absolute bliss to have a world class spa experience. Clean, attention to detail, beautifully presented therapists, rooms, information and the treatments. A body scrub, massage, foot treatment and facial (not oversold by the staff) and I feel as though I have buffed off all the dust and stickiness, and am again myself. My therapist Hai was a sweetie, as I'm sure are all the ladies. My 'boy' came along for a massage at the end and was equally happy. Confident and therapeutic, understanding and helpful.

Tranquil oasis tucked away in crazy Hanoi. SF Spa is a beautiful day spa with very nice and clean facilities. I got a hot stone massage and my friend got a sport massage, 90 minutes each. The massages were amazing - soooo much better (albeit pricier) than the cheap ones we got at other local massage parlors. We didn't much care for the hustle and bustle of Hanoi, so it was a delight to feel so far removed from the chaos of the city. A great place for tired travelers to indulge and rewind!

Great Service but .... As you enter the spa it feels right away that you are being transported to a really nice place and you forget you are in the middle of a busy and crazy market street.The reception is welcoming but it feels soulless ... its like speaking to robots trying to sell a service. With that said everything was pretty flawless. The service was great and the lady that did my coffe bodyscrub and facial was quite good and very professional. The VIP room was decorated nicely and amenities were spot on.I will definitely go back here if I am back in hanoi ... I just wished that they are a bit more human in their dealings but thats small fry.

Top class massage but go to the correct place. My wife and I went here early morning with tired legs after a few days trekking. It was a great choice but we were lucky enough to go to the new place (there are 2 within 1 km of each other). It has only been open about a year and is very new and classy whereas the other place is 10 years old. The service was quiet, peaceful and very professional. A hot tub soak and a 2 hr massage with just the right mix of strength and relaxation tailored to your request. A questionnaire was given before hand to make sure they have all the right info...what problems you have, where to avoid, where to work on and what strength of massage you want.Secure locker for your cloths and valuables is given right at the beginning along with fresh disposable underclothes and a robe. The room was very nice and we left feeling relaxed and refreshed.Good price for a very professional service.
perfect spa. My friend-a receptionist book for me and i really impress with this service. it's unique with Vnmese traditional, it made me relax and comfortable after a long flight.

The best massage i have ever had 100%. After 5 days walking around Hanoi streets this is the place i needed to go and have a great massage.As soon as i walked i felt like it was going to be good, but after the 1st massage i booked again for the next night for another 2hrsThe massage therapist was that good i wanted to take her home back to Melbourne with me.I would recommend this spa for a relaxing massage and if you book i would recommend Ms Hien L to be the one.Looking forward to going back to Hanoi and to SF Spa

Sheer bliss!. After arriving on the night train from Sapa with aching muscles we headed for SF Spa. A long soak in a hot tub (with added milk and rose petals) followed by a 2 hour traditional Vietnamese massage....bliss. The welcome was friendly, informative and the masseuses very professional. The decor is very soothing...a stark contrast to the hustle and bustle of the streets below. We left feeling rejuvenated and ready to face the chaos of Old Hanoi .

Relaxation At Its Best. My husband and me were pleasantly surprised with our visit to this spa. Located at Old Quarter Hanoi the place is very neat, soothing and the receptionist was very friendly. With its discrete and efficient team of pros, the spa offers quality services. They have a nice selection of aromatherapy oils, proper changing rooms with lockers and provide towels, bathrobes, flip-flops, etc. Highly recommend the traditional Vietnamese massage.Worth every penny!! And certainly the next time we are there on holiday would definitely go back to this little jewel :-)

One of the best massages yet in Vietnam.... I have been searching for a good massage place for the two months I have been here. After some trial and error, SF Spa will definitely be my go-to shop for relaxation.The lobby is gorgeous and calming. The receptionists are very welcoming and immediately bring you tea or water. They offer you a vast menu of options for their services. During our first visit, we were able to get a room for three people to have a 1 hour massage, without a reservation. There were several other customers there as well, but they were fully prepared for unexpected visitors and the whole process was very efficient.You are asked to complete a questionnaire before you begin about the level of pressure you prefer, and if you have any problem areas they should avoid/concentrate on. The massage rooms are beautiful, and the noise from the street completely melts away. We opted for the 1 hour traditional Vietnamese massage, and were not disappointed. The therapist was very attentive and asked us if we were ok with the amount of pressure and if we needed anything several times throughout the hour. She seemed genuinely pleased to be there, which is a rare situation in my experience with massages here in Vietnam. I make a habit of checking my watch to ensure we receive the length of massage we paid for as a result of bad experiences at different establishments. We had no problems at SF Spa, and were not rushed out when it was over. They invited us to have more tea and relax in their lovely lobby until we were ready to pay and leave. I really appreciated this, because other massage shops have rushed us in, cut us short on time, and then rushed us out as if we were an inconvenience. They ask you to rate the quality of the massage when you are done, and are open to receiving any suggestions or comments. I received a lovely email from them later in the week thanking me for my patronage. SF Spa is a great find, and I will be returning as soon as possible.

Clean and relaxing. After searching through number of Massage shops around the hotel, I and my wife have visited SF Spa. We have received foot massage each for 60 min. Massage itself was calm and relaxing. The pricing was bit high (350K Dong) compared to other shops in the streets but highly recommended if you are looking for a clean place to get massage.

Not an ideal location but the massage was worth-it. We had a difficult time locating the place. However, we were pleasantly surprised by the beautiful and modern decor of the spa salon which was a stark contrast to the old quarter streets. There were lockers to keep our belongings and we were given clean robes and slippers to change into before the massage. The therapists were professional and skilful. We enjoyed the experience and would definitely go back again if we return to Hanoi in the future. We spent USD45 for 2 pax, 60 min full body massage. Not the cheapest in Hanoi but worth-it.
Enjoyable experience. Really enjoyed this day spa. Staff were excellent. If you a looking for a lovely day spa experience and quality massage then this should be on top of your list.

Great. I went to this spa in November 2014 . the location isn't good and its a little difficult to find. I selected Vietnam's massage and it was my best experience in massage. Clean , beautiful, calm place. Go there, you won't regret.

Blissful experience. My friends and I made a booking though the hotel. It is essential that you make a booking as they are fully booked at night (we overhead from the staff that they couldn't accommodate a customer who wanted to extent his spa).Though we arrived on time, we spent about 15mins waiting. Not sure what caused the wait, but we were served a drink while waiting.The facilities are clean and generally well maintained (though the air con kept making weird noises). My friends and I did the 90 min Vietnamese massage. The masseuse were professional and courteous. Way better than the cheap massage we got in the morning. The experience at SF spa was certainly worth paying for.

Beautiful moment . If you want a beautiful and professional massage this is the place to be!! The stuff is very professional and kind. The place is very clean. I suggest to make a reservation, because it is always full!

A wonderful massage. If you're in need of a little bit of luxury-treat yourself to a massage here and you will leave feeling soo relaxed. The staff at the reception spoke very good english and were very accommodating when I rang at 9pm. The are open until late.

Relaxing. My hotel had menus for their services and recommended them. I booked the night before and was able to get the time I was looking for. Staff were pleasant and welcoming. Building inside is beautiful. The masseur was very good and I walked out nice and relaxed. Would go back again for sure.

Professional and good. The people working there are polite and speak good English. I had the back, shoulders and neck massage for 30 minutes. Was satisfied. The facilities are very good and professional. They have lockers for your valuables. Such a relaxing place.

Relaxing traditional massage. This place is a mix of modern and Vietnamese style. Try their traditional massage which in away is unique because the masseuse starts from the head down to the body and feet.

Great facilities, good value. Went here several times due to the great service and good facilities. They have the usual range of massages and treatments on offer, delivered by well trained staff. Our pick was the Vietnamese massage which is a nice mix of pressure between Thai and Swedish, with a bit of light slapping on the side.Everything is clean and well presented and up to normal western standards. The only slight gripe is that you may have to come back in 30 if they're busy, however this only happened once, and truly falls into the realms of first world problems.To the people who expect a 5 star international grade experience, you need to moderate your expectations, or go and pay 3-10 times the cost, for the same, (High) grade massage, and a slightly nicer toilet...

Perfect Service. We walked in the SF SPA on our way back to the hotel and were warmly welcomed and asked to wait for a moment with a cup of tea. Then unfortunately, there was no vacancy to have a massage. They offered and called a taxi for us to take us to their other SPA location, where two ladies were waiting for us with cool tea and refreshing towels. They gave us the most beautiful massage.Very nice, calm and professional settings and their claim is true "everything is in place to let your spirit, mind and body get away".

Not a bad massage. We took the traditional Vietnamese massage (1hr) which is not bad. They use pressure points to massage and relax your body rather then many which just rubs your back and shoulders. Not the cheapest massage in Hanoi but still worth the money. Overall I would go back again when I have the chance.
Go to lake view sf spa . There are two sf spas and they are great however one of them is having renos done upstairs and it's hard to relax through drill surges and hammering.

Wouldn't recommend. After three weeks in this gorgeous country full of wonderful people I decided to splash out and have a massage, body scrub and bikini wax. By western standards it was cheap but by Vietnamese this place was expensive but I thought worth the expensive. The location by the lake was great, the place was clean and the actual treatments were ok but the service was terrible. From the moment I walked in the door it seemed I was a hassle to have there. When asked to pick an oil for the massage I asked what was in them and what were the fragrances and was told just to pick one! The therapist did a great job on the wax but hardly spoke at all. Every time I was asked to move, turn over and shown the shower it was like I was a dumb tourist who needed to be endured. At first I thought she couldn't speak English but at the end of the treatment when I was asked how was it and I told them- her English was great and she said that's how she treats all clients because she thinks they don't want to be spoken to. I didn't want a narrative throughout the whole time I just wanted to feel as if I was getting looked after rather than put up with. A real shame as the people in this country are amazing.

Learn from my experience. I experienced a Travel spa packages at SF spa on Cua Dong road today. This package consists of a steam bath/jacuzzi/sauna session, Vietnamese Massage, Mud Wrap, Mandi Susu (milk and rose bath), Mini Facial, Foot massage with Warm Stones. If I were to do it again, I would do things differently.First off, I shouldn't have selected the steam bath, and I would strongly suggests that people with low blood pressure (prone to fainting), any chest complaints or anyone already struggling with the Hanoi heat not do it either. It's extremely hot and I found it hard to breath; as a result, I ended up with a headache and feeling very dizzy after the 15 minutes was up. I accept responsibility for that, and was grateful they the staff brought me cold water and put the fan on me to help me recover. The Vietnamese massage was much gentler than I expected, however this is an oil massage so you should not expect the same pressure or deep kneading as you get from a dry massage. Covering my whole body in just one hour meant that the massage was not especially targeted. I would have liked more attention paid to my shoulders and back. There was construction work going on next door and the hammering was very audible through the wall during the whole treatment, which was unfortunate. The traffic noise also finds its way in. The staff re-arranged the order of my package so that I could do the Mandi Susu with my partner, who was having a different package treatment, next. The bath water was not warm enough, but the milk and rose mix made my skin feel wonderful. After that, I was served a meal and more cold drinking water, which was very welcome and finally restored my equilibrium after the steam bath; I think I enjoyed the second half of the package more than the first half as a result.I really liked the mud wrap and even fell asleep. However, if you want to do this treatment and you have allergies, you should definitely let the staff know when you are filling in your questionnaire before treatment starts. The mud contains something that makes your skin feel hot and prickly at first and then warm and tingly. I enjoyed the sensation but some people might react badly to it. The mini facial was lovely and involved a light exfoliation, some massaging and application of a few different lotions. Finally, the foot and leg massage with hot stones felt good and was much firmer and more satisfying than the Vietnamese massage.I think the staff at SF are talented and I think it's possible to have a really good experience here if you do a few things differently to me:--Ask lots of questions about the different options and really think about what you want (eg. if you want a firm massage to relieve tension, don't get the Vietnamese massage). I'm sure the staff would customise a package for you if you asked.--It sounds obvious, but take your personal weaknesses and health into account and don't try and be a hero, like me, if something feels wrong!--Check the Cua Dong location before booking and see if there is still construction going on next door; if so, go to the Cua Go location instead. Consider taking ear plugs to block out traffic noise.

Nice massage between two electric drill shots... Massages were very nice. The spa itself looks good (but could be cleaner). The real problem that led me to write an average review was the electril drill shots from the building next door. I know it's not the spa's fault, but when your business is selling relaxation, if your neighboor decides to fix his house/building a few days, you should wether close your business for a bit or at least offer compensation prices.. In the end, the expensive prices of the spa are not worth it. I'm very disappointed about the way the staff dealt with it, it's not professionnal at all.

A gift for yourself. My opinion on this place is based in a comparison to all similar places we visited during our three week journey in Vietnam.I can't imagine a better way to escape for a while from crowds, noise, humidity, heat... all the things you experience in Hanoi, than having a massage in this clean & professional spa. All sorts of treatments are available, including 6 kinds of body massage, 3 of foot massage, facial, 7 kinds of body scrub & mask including dead sea salt scrub, mud wrap, etc. Packages also available. Good prices. Attentive service. Highly recommended.

Lovely and Peaceful Spa Experience. This is not a cheap spa, but does seem to be of good value for the luxury service you receive. We went twice during our brief stay in Hanoi (to the Hanoi Corner location) and were very impressed by the beautiful and relaxing facilities and excellent massages we received. On our first visit we did a couples herbal steam bath (amazing) followed by an hour Vietnamese Massage (WOW!). On our second visit, just before we flew out to Thailand, we just did the massage. I would recommend the steam batch too, if time allows, because I was so relaxed before the massage started that I think I actually melted into the massage table that first visit. The massage cost 450,000 dong/person. The steam batch was 180,000 dong for a couple. I know there are likely many much cheaper options available, but sometimes you really do get what you pay for.

Excellent massage and great ambiance. My friend and I stopped in without an appointment and they were very accommodating. We each had a Vietnamese Traditional Massage, a Dead Sea Salt Scrub, and facial. Quite a good massage and very relaxing after a half marathon and trek in Sapa. Not the best massage or scrub of my life, but it did the trick and we both felt extremely refreshed after the two hours of treatment - worth the price and a cut above the other spas around town. The ambiance and decor were a plus - it was like an oasis in the middle of the hustle and bustle of the Old Quarter, very clean and comfortable.

Maybe, just for the massage.. The overall experience at SF Spa was relaxing and positive. I went for the following services offered by SF Spa at the Cau Go branch: 1) Vietnamese Traditional massage 2) Dead Sea Salt Scrub 3) Collagen Facial.It wasn't the best massage I have ever experienced but it was quite good. My aching muscles from a previous sapa trek did feel better after the massage. It was easier to walk up/down stairs after it. The scrub, however could have been longer though so that areas such as elbows, knees and feet can be really exfoliated. It feels pretty touch-and-go. The facial was very relaxing but I personally feel that the therapist could probably spend more time to help get the black and white heads out. A tiny imperfection about the otherwise professional service would be how the staff was a tad overly defensive when I gave them the feedback mentioned. Would I return to the spa for another visit? Yes. But I will probably only opt for the massage.

Walking on air.... As a special treatment for my birthday we went to this spa as it already hot high rates at TripAdvisor. We wanted to make sure that we would not be disappointed. Even without an appointment we got in an chose different packages-each could be adjusted to individual tastes, meaning some treatments could be exchanged with others. We were treated respectfully and friendly throughout our stay. The place is very clean and well furnished. The prices are higher than in other street spas, however its worth every penny! The Sport Massage was a relief - giid and strong, as well as the foot massage and facial (which unfortunately only included peeling and mask)...Relaxing place to escape the busy streets of Hanoi for a few precious hours!

Not the best for nails. I came here after searching tripadvisor for pedicures in Hanoi. Someone said this was the best pedicure they ever had, so I went! Once I arrived and saw the "best of" tripadvisor seals on the door, I thought for sure I was in the right place. (I did go to the address listed here). However, when I arrived they initially said they didn't do nails. Since I was already there, and already had blocked off a portion of my day, I looked at the menu of services to see whether I wanted a massage or other service. They then said that they would talk to their manager and find out if they could do nails, which they then agreed to. I was led upstairs to a room with 5 chairs set up to do foot massages, and given a choice of OPI nail colors. I chose green for my hands and pink for my toes, which the lady confirmed twice. She then put pink on my fingers, and left a lot of the paint on and around my nails. When I realized she was going to do the same for my feet, I asked if she would be scrubbing them. (Full disclosure: I have ezcema, which means my feet are particularly gross. They can crack, and bleed, and although they weren't doing this they were dry and just...gross. Feet are gross. Mine are grosser.) She said this would be extra, that all the $10 pedicure included was nail polish. I opted for the scrub service alone, which was fine. I guess...I mean we're in Vietnam and you can get a $5-$10 pedicure anywhere, and it usually includes that gross cheese grater for heels so I just wouldn't recommend the place for nails. That said the place smelled heavenly, and I bet they do great massags. I just should have taken them at their word that they don't do nails and not gotten a pedicure/manicure here! On my walk home I did see ANOTHER SF Spa (of course Hanoi has knock off salons!) and I wonder if maybe this is the place the other reviewer was talking about?

High end spa. This spa is definitely on the higher end of price range in Hanoi. I got the 1 hr classic viet massage for 450 vnd and my friend got the 1 hr sports massage for 499 vnd. Ask your hotel for the 5% coupon to save you some money.The place was really clean and quiet. They give you a brand new robe and slippers to change into. My classic viet massage was great, she focused on my lower back and avoided my calf as I requested on the form. However, my friend's sports massage was mediocre, she didn't focus on her problem areas. This was the only spa we went to Hanoi so I can't compare how it is with other spas. But if you do go, just stick with classic/traditional viet massage as I believe that's what they are trained to be good at.

A treat!. I rather enjoyed my massage at SF Spa. I made a reservation through my hotel (Holidays Gold Hotel) and they were able to get my desired time for the massage, even when my hotel called the make the appointment less than 24 hours before the massage.I had the Thai massage, which was delightful even though my hotel desk attendant and the receptionist at SF Spa warned me that it would be a lot of stretching, pulling, and not necessarily relaxing. The therapist was amazing, even though she didn't speak any English. She made sure I was comfortable and that nothing hurt, even though she didn't speak English. She made it work effectively. I was super pleased with the service and felt it was well worth the money, even though the Thai massage was incredibly cheap compared to US prices (only about $25 for an hour of intense massage.) The receptionist and spa manager spoke with English well.

A welcome retreat. I came to SF Spa (without making a reservation) on four or five occasions during my three weeks in Vietnam - each time they were able to fit me in with little waiting time and I have nothing but praise for the place. I had a hot stone massage which was bliss and the therapist used them expertly, not leaving them on muscles for too long. (I will say that at one point I was given them to hold after they had been used for massaging but they were still too hot - no real problem but worth noting as it might be uncomfortable for others.)The Thai massage was great too! It's pretty full on and I'd never had a massage like it but again the therapist was really expert in pulling and pushing my body into all sorts of positions and stretches - she even walked on my back! It was great and I felt confident the therapist knew what she was doing - that sort of massage would bother me if it was in the wrong hands.The two facials, two foot massages, and leg wax I had were also great.This place is clean, relaxing and inviting and the staff are very professional, with the reception staff speaking good English. It's also great value with services less than half the cost of what I'd pay back home. No complaints from me - if you need some time out it's a great place for some rest and relaxation.

Excellent massage, nice facilities. I went to SF Spa in Hanoi during my holiday in Vietnam. The place is nice and clean, and the service and massage is top quality. You get what you ask for and the woman massaging makes sure it is not too hard/soft during the massage. I can definitely recommend others to use this place, if you feel like having a massage for instance after a night on the train from Sapa or after a long flight. It is also a quite quiet place, where you can escape the constant noise from the scooters in the streets which is a bonus in itself.

Good spa service, but below-standard facilities. Frankly, I don't understand many of the reviews here raving about the quality of facilities at this spa. The building is old, tired, a bit dirty and not up to standards in the bathrooms, showers, etc. that I find acceptable. Ok, services are good - but the JW Marriott is a new, 5-star spa that's truly visually impressive, modern, clean and offers equal or better service.

Very good value. Over the course of a couple of weeks I had a half leg wax, bikini wax, full scrub (Dead sea salt?) a facial (express yourself?) a full body massage and back and shoulder massage. The waxing was professionally done, wax the right temperature, not too painful, all very hygienic - would recommend - massages also good, they asked a lot if the pressure was OK, - by the third time I feel like they can proceed and I will tell them if its not!. Somehow I expected more from the facial - it seems very expensive compared to everything else which is very reasonably priced, a bit more than the super local places but still competitive and providing a service well above average for their cost. Lots of little extras - tea before and after, and they will pay a taxi fare up to 40,000 for you to get there - make this a nice experience. Providing robes for people to change in to if you have to be naked/semi naked for the treatments would be nice, it sometimes feels like you are being supervised getting undressed!

A great massage. Excellent massage, lovely surroundings, and great value for your money. Not cheap, but worth it. Very kind staff. They will pay for your inbound taxi. Heavy construction going on in the building next door, so go at lunch time or evening, when quiet. Really great experience.

Must go!. I found this spa based on its reviews and my experience was incredible. We chose a spa package for 3 hours, including a steam room, massage, and facial. The staff was friendly and the facility very clean, well-maintained, and air-conditioned. We were pampered to the tee. Our masseuses were experienced and tailored my massage to exactly how I wanted it (I usually like a very firm massage and she delivered!). We were served a bowl of pho too, which was good. The only downside was that it was very hot trying to eat a hot bowl of pho after taking a hot bath. Overall an excellent experience and a great value. Would definitely go back!!
A good way to relax. I had the gentleman package, and it was a nice 3 hour massage and spa. With Pho for lunch. Will probably go back, as it was clean, professional, and an relaxed environment.

Absolutely Exquisite. After six weeks in Vietnam, I walked in and ordered the 3 hour Travel Package. In the US this service would've cost around $600. The facility was extremely clean, the products divine, and a first time experience in the bamboo mandi susu bath covered in rose petals. I had my own VIP room where I was served lunch (snack) and was treated like a queen. I will be going back before I leave Ha Noi. Just perfect!!!

An exceptionally good experience, highly recommended!. I visited this spa after researching a place to have both my back waxed followed by a relaxing massage and they came highly rated on here, Trip Advisor. Overall both treatments were exceptional, they used good quality products, brilliant customer service and a the therapist was genuinely interested in making sure everything was ok for me. I rate this salon 10 out of 10!!!

Great facial. I was a little uncertain about this place given some of the mixed reviews and the fact that it is purpose built for tourists (which translates to my as potential rip off), however, as my hotel recommended it I decided to give it a try. I had a facial and it was wonderful. The therapist was very professional, the face massage was very good and relaxing and the products used seemed of high quality. When I explained that I did not wish to have a head massage she gave me an arm and hand massage instead which was a bonus. If you are just after a pedicure or manicure (or perhaps even a massage) it is probably worth going to someone cheaper but if you are having a face treatment which involves the use of products, definitely suggest it is worth the extra to come here (it will still be a lot cheaper than for an equivalent treatment at home). I note that some people have said it's difficult find, I didn't think so but perhaps that was because my hotel was in the Old Quarter and so I'd become fairly familiar with the streets.

Nice Massage. It's a nice place for massage in the city area. Well trained massage. However reception was handled by a bit rude a s inefficient staff. Location was difficult to find. Taxi driver dropped me 1 block away. Will I go back? Probably not .. knowing there are so many other options in town.

Overcharged for steambath. I tried the facial treatment since my colleague tried the body Vietnamese massage. We also bought a steambath that costed 90,000 vnd for each as we thought we should go to steambath to relax before we went to massage. We did not know that the steambath was inside the massage room and both of us had to sit inside so called steambath room and then, we had to take turn to take a shower at inside the steambath room without any towels, bathroom amenities.The massage service was just average and nothing much to talk about. When settling the payment, i asked to speak to the Manager to complain about this surcharge for the steambath as it was not worth it, but the receptionist did not want me to have a chance to talk to. That was not the professional way to handle. The price is not cheap at all. My normal facial costed me almost US$ 30 and my friend US$ 28
Really nice and professional massage.. It was such a good vietnamise massage do it for professional people and so relaxing as well. Next time in Hanoi I will repeat!

relaxing break from the chaos. We were a bit hesitant given the mixed reviews, but SF Spa turned out to be a nice break from the hectic activity in Hanoi. We had great massages in Laos and Thailand- but Hanoi is different and massages can mean different things. SF is certainly more luxurious than those in Laos- and the price (about US $22 for a 1 hour traditional) is 2x that of Laos. But still a bargain vs US. And the massage was excellent. We went to the Lakeview spa (there are 2 in Hanoi)- and it was clean and the staff was very nice. Highly recommend.

Well worth the price. Instead of paying less money for below par massages we try to go less frequently but to better places. SF Spa is a relaxing tranquil environment in the heart of Hanoi. It was one of the best massages I have had in my life and we would highly recommend.

Could be better.... Being a frequent visitor to spas, I found it a bit strange to be escorted from one floor to another floor by lift, then be climbing up a winding flight of steps before reaching the treatment room. I understand this is because buildings in the old quarters sit on small surface areas and space is created by building up. However, it could have been more seamless if temperature and lighting could be kept more or less consistent throughout. From a cool and warmly lit reception, you go to a warm and brightly lit locker room. Then you take the lift fitted with stark white light, and make the last jaunt up a stuffy flight of stairs. The massage was above average but as a whole, the experience was not as relaxing as it has the potential to be.

Great environment, above average massage. Great welcome, peaceful surrounding, very pleasant staff, had an overall serene feel good experience in the hustle bustle old quarter. However, we had a 75 minute exfoliation and foot massage...The foot massage is not the best I've had in VN. For the price, it was in between... So it was still a pleasant experience.... But I am now in Saigon (aka HCMC), still looking for a great foot massage place before I leave for the U.S.If you are looking for a clean feel good place for a reasonable price, I would recommend SF Spa (this spa). If you are looking for a great 'feel good pain' and complete reflexology foot massage, this would not be it. Can't comment about other massages.

Great place . Got 2 full body massages in 4 days in Hanoi. The masseurs are really good and the rooms are super clean and nice. They soak your feet with hot water, fresh ginger slices and lime halves before starting the massage. Nicely lit. The wait time or 10-15 min before starting is annoying and sometimes during the massage you'll hear the staff outside the room or the reception talking loud. Overall great place though.

Great escape! . Very luxurious. Clearly only frequented by tourists, this place has all the luxuries of a western spa (fresh robes!) with Vietnamese prices and it is divine! All massages were fantastic. Good pressure! Very relaxing! Whole process flowed without a glitch! Sure you can get cheaper massages etc. elsewhere but this place is beautiful! Only suggestion would be great if manicures and pedicure were available too!

Good experience but unprofessional masseurs. We were introduced to SF by our hotel so we went for it without any expectations. We decided to go with the spa package which includes steam bath, massage and facial. My experience with the masseur was fair and the pressure exceeded my expectation. All was good until towards the end when it comes to facial. That was the point when my bf fell asleep from his massage. I could sense that his masseur stopped massaging him knowing that he fell asleep and she thought I was asleep too. Our masseurs then left the room for a long while. I decided to shift around on my bed a little to attract their attention and that was when my masseur came into the room. I would rate the spa a good experience if it wasn't for my bf's masseur who decided to skive knowing that her customer has dozed off... Really unprofessional!

sheer indulgence. Daughter and I have had short stay in Hanoi and as well as doing the cooking and eating tours we wanted to have a traditional Vietnamese massage. This was organised in advance for us by Vietnam AwesomeTravel and their selection of SF Spa was a really good one. Staff were quietly attentive and surroundings extremely peaceful and relaxing. It was so good we went back again the next day for a different massage!

Best massage I've ever had. I came here for the 3 hour travel package with my husband and it was fantastic. The rooms are beautifully decorated and surprisingly quiet and relaxing. The prices are more expensive than other Spa places on the street but the quality here is fabulous and still far cheaper than in Western countries. Do it once.

Honest massage. Just had the massage today. Never had a massage before so did not know what to expect. I had the vietnamese massage of 60 min for 450.000 dong. I had to fill in a form about injuries, health issues, preferred areas, intensity. I chose for a normal intensity massage. Staff is friendly. Spa is clean. You dont hear any noise from outside so you can escape hectic hanoi. The girl who gave the massage did not speak english so communication was a bit difficult. That did not stop her from frequently asking if "massage is good?" Wich i found annoying. That was the only downside to my first massage experience. Overall I was very happy with a good massage.

We were expecting more.... After having read so many wonderful reviews, we were expecting more than we actually got. We made reservations for two aromatherapy massages in advance. We chose our fragrances of oils and length of massage, etc. Upon arrival, we were asked to sit down in the waiting room. A guy came over and showed me a menu and asked us what we wanted. I told him we had reservations. He went away and then nobody came up to us again for about ten minutes. It was fairly busy in there. I went back to the counter and said that we had reservations for this time. She then asked my name and said to wait again. Then she came up to us and asked if we minded by in a group room since the couples rooms were all busy. I said it didn't matter, but was disappointed. They asked us to fill out a card asking level of pressure we desired in the massage. I chose 9 and my wife chose 2. We both felt afterwards that the massages were somewhere in the 2 range. After the massage, we had prearranged for the steam room. It was okay, but the masseuse waited outside and therefore we felt a little pressure to finish quickly. Also, there were no extra towels available there, only the original towel we'd carried in from the massage room. Overall, the ambiance was nice. Everything was clean. The price was okay, but was it way better than what you can get at a small local massage studio? Not really. It was average.

Good for the price - and a nice respite from sightseeing. My appointment was for a Back, Neck & Shoulder Massage and a Collagen-Biomatrix Facial at the Lakeview location (it's near the lake but there's no lake view, ha!). After my cool drink and completion of the usual first-time visiting forms, I was led to the dressing room to put away my belongings. Because I was only getting a 30-min massage and a facial (vs. a full-body treatment?), the staff member told me that I didn't need to change. Essentially, the vibe was "Just ignore the robe, slippers and other items in the locker, dump your things, and come with me." I even pulled something out to ask..."No, no, no, you don't need that." And off we went into an elevator. So, I went with the flow: Either the spa doesn't believe in relaxation from beginning to end or maybe just not that day...or maybe, locker items are for people who spa packages or something.My friend and I were led into a couple's room (she signed up for a massage, wrap and facial). I think because we walked in together, they were going to put us in one room, which was beautifully decorated by the way. The problem was, my friend is very modest and this was her first time in a spa. I wanted her to be comfortable so I echoed her request for separate rooms, but clearly, setting up a single room seemed to take the 3 staff members off-guard. They couldn't understand why we asked for separate rooms and there was a lot of back and forth among them...a lot. Sigh. Finally, we just gave up.As for my treatments, the massage was fine - nothing spectacular - and I was glad that I didn't have my usual knots in my back and shoulders or I would've been very annoyed that the technique wasn't very effective. Still, the massage was fine. The facial, which was something different that I'd never done before, was...different. I chose the collagen facial because an "antioxidant-rich and moisturizing mask" was involved, and my visits to Cambodia and Vietnam wreaked havoc on my face due to the intense sun and dirt (from tuktuk and motorcycle rides). I think I got some facial cleansing, facial massage, and then application of the mask along with whatever they brushed on top of it. While I was in that mask, I got a brief hand/arm massage and then I was left alone for a very long period of time. No explanation, just disappearance. I was underwhelmed re: the facial. Due to the technician's limited English, I didn't really know what was happening...and then it was over.I'd probably go back to try different treatments and to see if I would get a more satisfying experience, but for this first time, it was just okay.

Distinctly underwhelming. Went along with my wife based on the good reviews online. Lakeview branch is in a great location and, given the summer heat, they gave us water immediately on arrival. Decor etc is pleasant and it's all good and clean and they accommodated our request to get massages next to each other. All valuables securely locked away so that's not a worry. However, the massage just wasn't up to much. Had the all-body 75-minute Vietnamese massage and asked the masseuse to focus on my back and shoulders. The only bit of my body that felt like she had done anything to it afterwards was my legs. However, 24 hours later a large bruise came up on one of them, suggesting even there she hadn't done a great job. Immediately after the massage we were handed review slips (but no tea/drink as others seem to have received) while payment went through. I'd been given the massage as a birthday present by my wife, who was there, so I wrote only "great, thanks" and left. Honestly, however, I would not return - though my wife seemed much happier with her massage. The only explanation I can see for the good reviews here is that they're for the spa services rather than the massages or that the other reviewers have never had a good massage.
Good relaxing massage. Chose a 90 min Vietnamese massage at 670k VND. Not exactly cheap. But it was relaxing and the therapist is also professional and friendly. Enjoyed my 90 min there.

Good traditional massage. Professional massage with no hidden charges or "extras". Well trained massagers. Clean rooms with a relaxing athmosphere.Free tea before and after the Treatment. Prices are a bit higher than other SPA's, but it's worth it.(Full Body massage 60' with oil was 450'000 Dong)

Perfect ending to our Hanoi vacation. This spa was recommended by the staff at our hotel in Hanoi and they did not disappoint. As soon as we walked in after 2 full days of sightseeing, the aromatherapy oils and the whole ambiance of the place just gave us that calm feeling right away. Four of us had a 90 minute massage each: my husband tried the Vietnamese traditional massage, my parents tried the aromatherapy massage, and I tried their Thai massage, which was not traditional Thai massage, but it was good anyway. The masseuses were skilled at each type of massage provided and very thorough. We left this place so relaxed and happy. The price was reasonable for the level of service they provide. Highly recommended!

Good break from the bustle . Massages in Vietnam is not as good as those in Thailand. We were recommended this place by our hotel. Although the prices are slightly higher than the other spas in the old quarter, it is definitely cleaner and has a more "spa" feel. I also like that they provide info bialy wrapped robes and slippers for your use, and also provide a proper locker for your valuables.Call in advance to book your spot as they can get full especially in the late afternoons.

Great experience!. My boyfriend and I booked the SF Spa Signature package for 120 min. We went there with a cab and they payed for it. The receptionist was welcoming and friendly. We waited a couple minutes. They have changing rooms in the first floor then we went up with a eveluator to go into the steam bath. That was small but the room was really cool decorated. They have a great interior and a relaxing atmosphere. Afterwords we got a fresh orange juice and enjoyed our 75 min vietnamese traditional body massage. We had our own room and no one disturbed us. The masseuse was very discreet and friendly. She asked during the massage if everything is fine. We can totally recommend the SF spa and would go there again. The price-performance ratio is really good compared to european prices.

Nothing so amazing. The place is really clean and the staff works really hard on the ambience (tea, hot foot bath etc before massage) but the actual massage was just so-so and a little overly nervous-attentive for my taste. It was okay but a tad pricey for the massage and I've had light years better in Thailand and the Philippines (not yet in Viet Nam though, so maybe relatively speaking this is great for locale, dunno).

Top quality service and treatments!. I had a wonderful experience at SF Spa. They cost a little more than some other places but I have found in Vietnam (in general) that you get what you pay for. I had a 90 minute massage and coffee body scrub. My girl was professional, experienced and responded to my requests, positioning, etc. The massage was quality and exactly what I wanted. The body scrub was also amazing. It is a peaceful environment and embodies the spa experience.My husband also had a massage. He is a very muscular guy and often has poor massage experiences as he requires quite a strong masseuse. His girl was about one third his size but delivered the most quality, strong massage. He was very pleased.Take a little time off of the hectic streets of Hanoi and get treated at SF Spa!!

Absolutely recommended for the great service and ambience. Took up the Steam Bath, Vietnamese Traditional Massage(60mins), Dead Sea Salt Scrub(30mins), Foot Reflex(60mins).Chose the lake view branch as the photos of that outlet looks more cozy and it's newer. Very clean and hygienic place where disposable undies are constantly provided to change into new ones every time.A locker is provided to keep your valuables and you can opt for the amount of forced exerted for the massage.Was led into a super cozy therapy room and whole experience was really superb. My therapist really knows what she's doing! She's a sweet short hair lady who can converse in mandarin and went the extra mile on advising me about facial skin care upon seeing my acne skin. She even suggested for me to return the next day to collect a bag of tea that is beneficial for the skin from her free of charge. I'm deeply touched by her intention tho i can't make it due to a flight to catch the following morning. I pity that i didn't manage to catch her name.The foot massage was so great that i felt into a slumber halfway through it.To sum up, its a really professional, clean and relaxing place where i'll definitely recommend people to visit. Tho it's counted more pricey as compared to what you can get elsewhere out there, you really get what you pay for.

Wonderful and relaxing massage. Stopped in for a relaxing massage after taking a 4 hour trip backfrom Ha Long Bay. We got exactly what we were looking for... pure bliss.We were greeted immediately at the door and were offered tea along with the spa menu. After selecting the 75 minute aromatherapy massage, we were shown to our room and we put our valuables (money and phone) into a little metal lock box. The greatest part is that the lockbox key was kept on my wrist for the duration of the massage.The massage was perfect. Each masseuse applied the perfect amount of pressure to work out the soreness yet keep us totally relaxed. We're even considering coming back tomorrow for a more complete spa package!

We felt relaxed & calm when we left !. We booked SF Spa directly on the day of our treatment (we walked past the SPA & had already read about it on Trip Advisor). We found the staff helpful, polite and professional. We both booked a Vietnamese 60 minute massage and both asked for a Medium pressure massage. After being shown to a therapy room on the fourth floor, our massage commenced. The room was comfortable and relaxing with three beds in total divided by light curtains. We were only two in the room and so we found it spacious and comfortable. The therapists were professional and we both really enjoyed our medium pressure massage (equivalent of a firm massage in the U.K.). We felt relaxed and great when we left the Spa. A great find in the middle of hectic Hanoi !
Wonderful x2. My wife and I both had treatments. Ver impressed. Professional, smart, clean, relaxing. Will return before flight home

Let a mark in my leg. I went to the spa because of the hotel that i stayed in. Very good place. A paradaise . The girls of the reception speaks a good english. I asked for a foot massage and was really good. I asked for a stronge massage and i have it. My only problem is that when i wake up in the next day ( i did the massage at 7pm) i was with a mark in my leg because the massagist use her force in the wrong point. I travelled more than 50 countries and it never happen! Dont mean strong massage that the massagist will not care about the correct pression points. Im putting a picture to show. By the way... Her english was poor

Peaceful escape for the family from Hanoi chaos. This little oasis in the old quarter was a perfect relaxing escape for our family. The Vietnamese massage was awesome. They have a family room with five tables which meant we could be all in together. Great for our slightly anxious ten year old. Not so grata when our thirteen year old started snoring.
Great value and excellent massage. Highly recommend. The warm stone massage is amazing and the staff is very friendly. Very clean and a nice relaxing break from the city. Free taxi from the hotel!

Amazing High-end service for low-end pricing. This spa was a breath of fresh air. I thought it was going to be very high priced because the inside was so elegant, but the prices were amazingly competitive. I received an extremely professional massage and was very pleased with the service. The ambiance they created was Asian extraordinaire. Very nice people. Loved the service an highly recommend.

Clean and good. Flight to Tokyo is basically midnight thus travelers want to spend long hours at SPA. I was looking for reasonable and clean SPA. Here was enough to have nice and comfortable time before flying.Especially warm stone massage was great ,sometimes it was not clean but the stones in here were clean enough.Between long hours massages, light meals were served, it was good timing for me since I was hungry. One thing I have to say is Steam bath, it was too long to stay in a small and hot room. I don't recommend to choose it 'coz we can select a favorite one from saunas, steam bath and jag zee.

Great spa, super relaxing!. I went to enjoy in both of Spa in Cua Dong and Cau Go street. Decoration was cozy and friendly. Staff was so helpful and professional. Seem they really knew what i want! They have modern closet to keep all your thing. Crazy with some guests who were not pleasant here. Come and enjoy!

Disappointed with my visit. I booked appointments for 2 friends and myself through the internet and sure enough, they responded quickly. I am quite impressed by the speed of their response. We took a taxi from our hotel to the spa and the taxi fare was covered by the spa. As with the standard service, we were ushered to a waiting area where we served with ginger tea as we changed our shoes into slippers. We requested for sharing room and the three beds were separated by thin curtains for some privacy. The sharing room was unfortunately not a quiet room and we could hear alot of noise from the streets outside. My therapist started as normal but when I requested for extra aromatherapy oil for my back she didnt understand what I need, I repeated myself twice politely and her fellow therapist had to explain to her what I needed before my therapist went off making some comment. The massage technique and the flow seems somewhat "disjointed". Throughout, my therapist seems only interested in just getting the massage completed. with very little thought for the customer. Towards the end, I requested for a hot towel so that I may wipe myself and the therapist made a impatient sound. In most places, most spas it would be the standard to offer or at least check if the customer needs a hot towel after a oil massage. Ah well ...

Very professional. We visited the Lakeside spa twice during our stay in Hanoi and had to say we were very impressed with the way in which the setup works really professionally.You complete a form to let the masseur know what sort of massage is required before being led to the changing rooms. The security lockers work only by the receptionist and your own security tag being used together to open the lockers, very good.My wife also had a reflexology session and was highly delighted.These treatments are highly personal to each so hard to rate against others I'd had but we were impressed with the ambiance, the level of English spoken by the receptionist and the security. The masseurs could however speak a little more English to make this a five star experience.

Unsafe massage. When I review a massage establishment, I am less concerned with the decor or miscellaneous extras such as tea and rose petals.I am a qualified massage therapist so evaluate massage perhaps from a more technical perspective.I opted for 120 minutes aromatherapy massage.Upstairs to massage room with 3 tables, no one on other tables.Massage begins.Within 30 seconds, I could tell that my massage therapist was an inexperienced beginner.Light and fluffy massage strokes, very boring and ineffective.Then she switched to massaging with the point of the ebow, which is normally a valid masage technique. Provided you know what you are doing.My sad excuse for a massage therapist proceeded to repeatedly dig her elbow into the centre portion of my lower spine, which should never be done.Massage therapist continued even when I insisted she stop this dangerous and painful technique.As an aside, my privacy and the security of my personal property was compromised when two further clients and two more therapists entered room while I was being massaged. No privacy curtains between tables and all talk very disracting.Avoid this business.

Great spa. Super clean. Best massages. Very professional.. Vietnamese full body massage - Wow one of the nicest casual spas I've been to. We actually went twice as we loved it. I don't like fancy spas, I just like a good massage in a basic but clean place. This place exceeded my expectations. Recommended by our hotel, right near the hoan kiem lake area. It's super clean, very professional staff, very thorough process, and my massage lady was incredible. Out of this world. The massage rooms were basic but so lovely and clean. The music was very faint in the background which you could barely hear which is just superb (hate the music in these massage joints / tacky and always quite loud and repetitive. Grinds at my nerves). The staff were very professional and did not speak to each other which is another great point. Drives me nuts when they do while massaging you. We got the 60 min Vietnamese massage which is one of the best massages I've had. So much better than a Thai massage. Great joint, great experience. Highly highly recommend it. Prices were a bit higher than usual compared to similar places but still very cheap and reasonable.

very clean and thorough wax job. average massage. The spa was super clean and professional. For the full bikini, she will use the kind of wax you peel off, not pull off with paper. Sometimes that was a bit slow and painful where there was a lot of hair, but it did the job.NOTE: if you don't want her to wax the trail up your stomach or your feet, tell her before she puts the wax there.Massage: i got a 30min shoulder and neck and head, which was average. They had a special for a free 25 min foot massage.not was about 20 and average as well. I probably would just go for the waxing.

I would highly recommend this spa!. I found this spa online and after reading a few "mixed reviews" I decided to see for myself- I was NOT disappointed!I got a bikini wax and in my previous experience with salons in Asia, they don't really know how to handle "westerners hair type". This spa was different, the atmosphere was beautiful, relaxing and CLEAN! But most importantly, the lady did a fantastic job! As good of a job as I would get back home in Canada. I would recommend this place for waxing without a doubt. If I ever return to Hanoi and need a good wax or any spa services, this will be my first choice!Thanks SF Spa

nice spa!. we went to this spa as we were craving for a massage!We did the following- aromatherapy body masage => very good we recommend!- body scrub dead sea salt => very good, i recommend- renew foot spa => no need to do if you do the above...If I knew i wouldnt have done it.Otherwise nice renewal but definitely light scrub on foot- facial => good techniques, a bit long on the mask to wait. Not revolutionnary to me though...Overall great place, very nice inside, staff is very nice and qualified; I ask medium pressure and then a bit stronger and she adjusted perfectly.A very good moment of relaxation for a reasonable price!

Relaxing. Enjoyed a 120-minute traditional Vietnamese massage since there were no sport massages availible during TET. It was a very relaxing experience, and I felt really good after the treatment. The spa is very clean and the therapists are professional. Wouldn't hesitate to go back.

Beautifully relaxing. I have now been to SF Spa four times and three out of the four visits have been brilliant. The one time it wasn't quite brilliant was just due to the masseur not putting enough strength behind the massage. Every other time they managed to get the balance between pain and relaxation perfect.The set up is lovely and highly relaxing just being there!I imagine that the same therapies could be found at a cheaper price in Hanoi but it is a compromise for the atmosphere of the place.

Wonderful service & brilliant therapists. . I have just come back from an afternoon at SF spa - they picked me up for free from my hotel and I had wonderful experience overall.I had a back massage (I wish I could have tried the Vietnamese or Thai massage but I'm a little sun burnt on my legs and arms so didn't want to risk it irritating my skin!) a facial and a bikini wax (not quite as relaxing!)The back massage and facial were performed by one very sweet and friendly therapist, the pressure in the massage wasn't quite firm enough at first but I asked her for a little bit more and in the end my shoulders and back felt amazing! The facial was so relaxing and one of the best I've had. I'm a beauty therapist myself and go to many spas back in the UK... It was different from the standardised elemis or dermalogica facials I've had in the past but it was a nice change. She used lovely hot towels and a honey and orange face mask and did some wonderful pressure points round my scalp and face.I was a little apprehensive about the waxing (it's never pleasant but I usually go to someone I trust and know does a good job) however the therapist was brilliant, very experienced and even comforted me when it was painful! The prices are cheap compared to UK or US prices but maybe a little bit more expensive than some other massage places I've been to in the past in Hanoi. But the price is reflected in the quality of the treatment, range of treatments available and the lovely service and treatment rooms. I highly recommend this place if you want a caring, friendly and relaxing environment to chill out in :-)

Not worth it. My husband and I had both a hot stone massage and made a similar experience: it was given rather mechanically instead of using the warmth of the stones to work more deeply on the points that needed it. Rubbing stones over bones (ankles, hands, neck) wasn't quite it either... In addition my therapist seemed rather uninterested in her activity and left the room twice in the middle of the treatment without apparent reason nor excuse. Definitely the least relaxing hot stone massage I ever had.

Very relaxing and nice ambience. Have been to 3 different spas this time in Hanoi and SF was by far the best. We have been to both locations and find the Lakeside ie newer premises our favourite. Prices are on par with similar establishments ie around $15-$20 for a 1 hour massage. Yes you can get cheaper off the street, but you pay for the environment and professionalism. Would definitely recommend the Aromatherapy spa and Dead Sea Salt body scrub if you like a good strong exfoliation. A bit harsher than a Mandi Lulur but I loved it.

Good Massage, But Not a Steal. My wife and I had a Tradtional Thai and a Royal Thai Massage. We paid about 20 USD each for 60 mins, because they did not have any promotion going on. The Vietnamese Massage would have cost almost as much. Yes, the massages were very good, the ambience of the place is appealing, the service is good and the people at the reception can speak English quite fluently. A place like Healthland (and lots of others) in Bangkok can top most of this -- and can offer you 2 hours of Thai Massage for around 15 USD. But there are not a lot of places in Hanoi that are as good as the SF Spa. A reason for us to come back.

Beautiful spa and good prices. I had a 2 hour thai massage and a 1 hour foot massage at this spa before my return international flight. They had a special going on while I was there so these 3 hours of services cost only $35. The treatment room was lovely like one you would see at a 5 star resort in the US and the massage therapist who performed the thai massage was professional and did an excellent job. The foot massage was good but not as good as others that I have had all though one again the treatment room was lovely. The staff were all very professional and services started on time, I would definitely go back and would recommend this spa. The massages made the long flight home much more bearable. This spa, like serveral in the area, are open late in the evening as well for massages. which was great for me since I had a midnight flight home.

Fabulous massage and pedicure. I really recommend going to this spa. We turned up without a booking and were in the treatment room within 20 mins. My boyfriend had the 75 minute hot stone massage and I had the 30 minute Indian head, shoulder and back massage along with a 50 minute pedicure.The Indian massage was brilliant. Felt pulled around a bit and it was quite strong but felt great afterwards. After three weeks travelling around Vietnam my feet were definitely in need of some TLC and the pedicure was great and looks brilliant. The spa itself is lovely on the inside. The reception is quite plain but as you go up the stairs to the treatment rooms they really are nice. We were in the same rooms for the massages too which was nice. As we went downstairs they give you tea and fruit and because it was New Year we also got a free gift.Total cost for all that was less than 1m Dong - so £30 for three decent treatments. You could get it done cheaper elsewhere I expect but if you want some luxury like you have back home this is a good place to go and I would definitely recommend it.

Excellent spa experience. After walking around for hours and hours in Hanoi we were in need of some rejuvenation. This was definitely the place to do it! The place itself is clean and beautiful and the people are wonderful. My husband and I both had hot stone massages loved them. In fact, we went back two days later for more pampering :) We were pleasantly surprised when, after arriving by taxi, one of the staff came running out to get a receipt so they could reimburse us the taxi fare. What a nice touch.

A Gen in Hanoi. Totally Worth It! Try the Hot Stone Massage.... Had a 75-minute hot stone massage here. Serene, tranquil atmosphere. Friendly and informative reception woman was so helpful and spoke wonderful English... A gentleman did my massage and I was so impressed. I did the hot stone massage and his touch was perfect... I nearly drifted off to sleep. It was discreet and pleasant. I highly recommend it!

take a break and relax with a reflexology foot leg massage. SF SPA 30 Cua Dong Str. In Old Quarter! Hanoi. What perfect way to take a break afterA day of walking. The atmospher is quiet, off the street upstairs, beautiful really, comfortableChairs, soft lighting, trained staff.
Great Spa. The four of us in our group all got similar massages. The staff was friendly and professional. I got the best sleep that night during our whole trip in Vietnam!

Has potential but was disappointed. We went to the new spa in the old quarter after reading rave reviews. The spa was beautifully presented and the staff were friendly. There were four of us and we were all having similar treatments. My friend an I had the 50 min pedicure and half hour massage. Her pedicure was around half an hour in length and mine was around 11/2 hours - now my feat were bad but not that bad! My therapist was very particular and it was probably one of the most detailed pedicures I've had but I got very restless. My friend had finished her massage by the time I started and then had to wait until my massage was finished as my therapist had to paint her toes. We were there for nearly 3 hours for an hour and half treatment - lots of stuffing around - our other friends had left. We were told our taxi costs one way were covered but when we went to pay they charged us as the taxi had cost more than 40 000 dong so we had to pay the rest! My massage was fairly ordinary and my friend who also had the pedicure was left with 3 bleeding toes where she was nicked with the cuticle clippers which has developed into a fungal infection and secondary infection. It was a real disappointment as the place has huge potential.

Amazing Spa. While travelling, I went to the new location in the old quarter with my wife for her birthday.This was the most relaxing experience we have had in our lives! For $90 and tip we bathed in a jacuzzi, had multiple types of full body massages including hot stones, got wrapped in mud, bathed in milk and roses, and had a wonderful meal prepared as well as a special birthday cake all in a private setting for just us two. We splurged a bit on this one, but wow!P.S. The paper underpants that are provided were certainly hilarious as well. My wife's had hearts!

Best massage ever. We went here after getting back from a 4hr bus journey from Halong Bay. We had been backpacking for a fortnight before that and were both keen for a bit of relaxation - saw a good review for this place on tripadvisor and it didn't disappoint. Located on a busy street in central Hanoi I was dubious about how relaxing it was going to be but once you stepped inside you felt like you were a million miles away from the hustle and bustle of outside. Had the aroma 60 mins massage-they will work on any problem areas; back/neck/shoulders etc and at whatever pressure you want....absolutely amazing, would definitely return if ever in Hanoi.

A great spa in Hanoi. We visited the new sf spa on cau go lane and it was lovely. Clean modern and the staff were very professional. You can book online and when you arrive they give you a welcome drink. They also provide you with lockers to store your valuables while your having a treatment. The staff were excellent and the massages were very good. My wife and I had a treatment room to ourselves which made it all tge more private. For a mid range priced spa I would definitely recommend it.

Beautiful spa!. I absolutely loved this spa!! From the moment I stepped in the door, the staff were very friendly and were always bringing me glasses of water and tea. I had a 3 hour treatment package and my therapist recommended different things to suit my skin type etc which was great. The treatments themselves were fantastic - I have had a lot of massages all over the world and this was up there with the best! The building itself is lovely and inside is very relaxing and calm - the perfect spa really and very professional. I would highly recommend it if you are looking for a spa in Hanoi.

very relaxing massage. My hotel had brochers from 2 parlours and i chose this one as the hotel said they would give me a 15% discount. The welcome was not over friendly and i did not feel the need for me to fill out a form for a massage. Still the main reason for going the massage was excellent a 75 minute vietnamese massage. She checked that the pressure was ok a couple of times. On going to pay i was not given the discount as they said i had to have a voucher from the hotel. The front staff spoiled it for me.

Add us to those who loved the massages. We had an almost 3 hour spa treatment, for the equivalent of $60 each! Hubby opted for the sport massage, while I went for the aromatherapy, 90 minutes. We had our massages in the same room, and the ladies who treated both did a wonderful job. They made sure we were good with the pressure level, and had amazingly strong hands, for the entire duration of the session! We also both had one of their mud wraps, which was just ok, I'm accustomed to a different way of applying (lay down on a sheet, mud applied, wrapped and then blanketed in a cocoon, instead, we lay on the massage table, applied mud and covered us with a plastic sheet), followed by a shower (someone turned the hot water off, so that wasn't enjoyable in the least, but the staff were extremely apologetic, brought a handyman in, and the hot water was restored). Back home, this treatment would have cost about $500, I highly recommend it.

FANTASTIC massage!!!. Husbie and I each enjoyed a 90 minute sport massage today at SF Spa. The atmosphere is really pleasant - save for the subtle street noise which can't really be helped. The staff are all really professional and lovely. The treatment was first rate and compared to a similar treatment in Canada, the 90 minute massage is a total bargain at approx C$42. The real testament is that we have booked again for another treatment in a couple of days. Very relaxing and highly recommended!

Excellent. My husband and had two different treatments and loved it, so much that we are planning on going back again today to experience two more. I had reflexology and he a traditional Thai massage. Excellent way to manage jet lag.

Good Massage, but not the Service. Frankly, I had high hope of this place after reading all the positive ratings here. I actually did some extensive research and chose this place before I set off.We (a group of four) went there in the morning, since our flight is in the late afternoon. We opted for the Vietnamese massage, which was quite soft relative to the Thai one. The massage itself was good.All is good until the payment part when the cashier woman looked stunned when I told her that I was expecting change from her, since we had tipped the massage girls in the room already. The cashier's face went totally red and I can actually feel her displeasure when handing back the change. A bit disappointed at this.For potential customers: This place is willing to refund the incoming taxi fare or pay the taxi fare (one way) for you. And tip well!CONCLUSION: Spa was good. You can see this place is quite customer-oriented. They even gave you a questionnaire to fill in at the end, but the payment part totally spoiled the whole experience, so I will just give it an "Average" rating.

Fantastic. I loved this Spa. The treatments were amazing and the staff went out of their way to make sure the entire experience was very enjoyable. The hotel arranged a taxi for us which was paid for by the Spa, they also booked a reliable taxi to take us back to our hotel. Prices were reasonable and the facials were out of this world

SF Spa Hanoi old quarter. My wife and I visited SF spa on our honeymoon. Our Hotel booked us a taxi which the fare is paid for by sf spa. Very clean and inviting place. A welcome drink of water as you sit down and look at menu. We did 30min indian back, neck and shoulder (250vnd) then we had 75min SF Aromatherapy (560vnd) then we did another 75min Warm stone (599vnd). Massage room is very clean and modern with staff well trained with a massage we both enjoyed. Money safe box is supplied and key goes around your wrist which is very safe. Only negative is we had a room on level 3 road side so we could hear street noise, calming music needs to be turned up. They take visa and mastercard with no fee which was good. SF spa is a must try while in hanoi.

We're returning to Hanoi just for another massage here!. I have had massages in many places around the world, and this was THE best hands-down!My husband and I both visited the SF Spa on the last day of our Honeymoon. We had travelled up through Vietnam from Ho Chi Minh City and had spa treatments, including massages in each place we stayed. We had said over breakfast that morning that we loved Vietnam but probably wouldn't choose Hanoi again over other places we visited. After our visit to SF Spa we both vowed to come back just for another massage here!
