And three months later we are making plans to do just that!My husband had a Traditional Thai 120 min massage, which he raved about, and I had 90min aromatherapy massage and the 45 min Javanese Lulur body treatment. OMG - truly heavenly. The massage was perfection, the setting blissful, the treatment was indulgent and the service professional. Full body means full body, so if you aren't comfortable with your breasts being touched, mention this before starting. Although, I have to say, I had a full body scrub elsewhere earlier in the holiday and they did not go near my breasts. It felt disjointed and not as relaxing. I wouldn't have thought I would like to be touched on the naked breast, but it made the whole experience flow much better. It was not sexual in any way, it just felt normal and natural, so if you're unsure, I'd recommend giving it a go. You are warmly greeted at the door and given tea while discussing your options. She tailored our services for us and answered our questions. The prices are a little higher than other places in Vietnam, but still much, much lower than Australia and SOOOOO worth the money!Can't recommend this place enough.

Great place for a relaxing massage. I went on a saturday morning at around 9h30 and they took me straight away without a reservation (other highly noted Spa were telling me to come back at 10h30 even though there was no-one). SF spa is in a lovely building (don't be put off by the street being a little out of the way, it's means it's quieter than the other more central ones). The decor inside is just like the photo, the receptionist was really professional and the masseuse was really good. I had the indian head and shoulder massage and a basic facial. I have quite sensitive skin and at the end of the facial no redness, so the products they use of good quality and don't aggress the skin. I felt great after the massage and will probably go back in the week for a another, longer massage. Note that they have a small locker box as well for your valuables although I didn't use it. The prices are great value too.

Sooo Relaxing. Our trip to the spa just rounded off our holiday nicely. As soon as you walk in you feel you are in an oasis of calm away from the hanoi traffic. My friend and I both opted for the sf spa signature treatment and the girl very kindly told us it didn't include an aromatherapy massage and did we want to swap it in, which we did. The treatment was great, not rushed and very relaxing. Afterwards we rounded it off with a pedicure each. Not wanting to ruin the pedicures the sf spa staff booked us a taxi back to the hotel. All in all a great experience.

Pretty Good. I visited and two treatments - Indian neck, shoulder and back massage and a foot treatment (scrub, massage and paraffin wax -80 mins). The massage was very good and done second in a private room. The masseuse was skilled and it was quite relaxing. The foot treatment was totally self-indulgent. The scrubbing was thorough, the massage pretty good and the waxing a strangely pleasurable experience. Both feet are immersed in hot wax then wrapped in plastic film and places in heated plastic "shoes". The wax sets and is then peeled off after 15 minutes. Overall a very professional set up. My only criticism is that the foot treatment is in a communal room (room 22) with three other chairs. I had two ladies to the side of me having pedicures and nail painting. Both were chatting to the staff who used spot lamps to illuminate their work. This made it far less relaxing than I was expecting.

Good spa relaxing ambiance, not a good pedicure. I went and got the Spa Pedicure a few days ago. The ambiance was good, tea at the beginning, lights turned during the pedicure. However, the chairs didn't have the massaging feature, our service lasted 45-50mins instead of 60mins, and even if they said te scrub was included it wasn't done well. I won't go back.

Nice relaxing Ambience. I visited SF Spa for the hot stone massage and found it to be very good. I admit I don't get too many massages so my experience is relatively low. I found the spa had a lovely calming atmosphere and ambience, as soon as you walk in the hustle and bustle that is Hanoi seems to disappear. The interior design is lovely and you are welcomed with a lovely hot tea or water upon arrival. My masseuse Ha was lovely and in my opinion gave a lovely massage, was very friendly and seemed quite experinced. When I rang to make my appointment I specifically asked if I would be required to pay a tip on top of the cost of the massage (a very common thing in Vietnam and being Australian it is not really our culture to tip) I was told I only needed to tip if I felt the massage was worth it. In the end I did give a tip because I throughly enjoyed my experience. I gave Ha 100000VND ($6AU) but there was no request or expectation for one. I only paid the tip after I had paid for my massage at the quoted price and to my pleasure Ha was called to reception where I saw her being given the tip, so I was 100% certain that it went to her.Could I have got a cheaper massage somewhere? Probably yes but 599000VND ($36AU) for a 75 minute hot stone massage in my opinion is good value and I wanted to relax and not worry about getting tricked into a cheap massage and then be expected to literally pay the same price as a tip to the masseuse.I liked that before the massage you are given a safety box to put your valuables in (we all have iPhones, wallets etc) the box is locked in front of you and then you are given the key to put around your wrist during your treatment. It gave me a good sense of security.If I had more time I would go back for another treatment there are many to choose from.All in all I would recommend SF Spa to anyone for all the above reasons.The spa will pay for your cab there (up to 40000VND).

Excellent massage!. I went for a massage to relax my tense back after reading the positive reviews. Dropped in without an appointment and only had to wait a few minutes. After having been to several Spas during our trip, I was pleasantly surprised by the "real spa feeling". Relaxing atmosphere, very clean and extremely professional. One of the staff helped me deciding on the kind of massage for my back and the duration (without trying to push me into the most expensive option). I opted for the 90 min sports massage and a body scrub - the massage was lovely and though sometimes on the edge of what I thought I could take, it really was the first massage that really removed some of these persistent painful knots in my back. The masseuse was very skilled and attentive and checked with me regularly regarding the right pressure level. The body scrub left my skin wonderfully soft and moisturized. The only suggestion for improvement I have is to do the body scrubs at a bed away from the fan or to turn of the air con during the body scrub as I was getting cold when the scrub was applied. Overall - excellent!

Excellent experience- highly recommended!. My boyfriend and I went to Sf Spa for some pampering at the end of our stay on Vietnam. We'd read good things about it so decided to drop in and we were not disappointed! I had a body wrap and pedicure and my boyfriend had the 'Recover' foot treatment. We both had back, neck and shoulder massages. We both enjoyed each treatment and they were carried out to a good standard. The staff are very friendly and professional, the spa is well presented and the services are excellent value for money. All in all a very enjoyable, relaxing experience. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a good spa in Hanoi. Thank you Sf Spa!

Very Professional- Great Time!. Things done well:Very clean; professional and clearly well trained masseuses; exceptional service; relaxing and detailed decor; Things they could work on:Honestly, this place has nothing to work on, it was great. More info:My friend and I are males in our mid-20s that have been traveling Vietnam for several weeks during the summer. On the last day of our trip, we decided to get one final massage before leaving Hanoi for the States. I get massages multiple times a year and both of us had already gotten a few massages during our trip because of how cheap they generally are. Both of us agreed that our massage at SF Spa, though a bit more expensive than our previous massages on the trip, was well worth it and still a ridiculous bargain relative to home. Although we had arrived without an appointment, they asked us to take a seat in a nice little waiting area, offered us tea or water, and had us in a room within 10 minutes. The place obviously pays attention to detail in order to ensure a relaxing and comfortable ambiance. They sat us with our feet in warm rose water before our massage, in a perfectly lit room with the perfect temperature and volume of typical spa music. They brought us a little safe box for us to put our passports, wallets, etc in, and then handed us the key on a little bracelet for us to keep during the massage. I had personally never seen this type of security before but thought it was an extra little layer of comfort that foreigners would appreciate. I typically aim for deep tissues because I like firm massages but went for for the warm stone massage (75 min, 599viet so about 30us) on a bit of a whim. I was hesitant to choose this because they're normally not firm enough but the massage was actually incredible. The stones were the perfect temperature and the masseuse was very obviously well trained. She worked in order and balanced the stone work with hand work. It was actually a bit firmer than my previous warm stone massages, which I appreciated. In either case, the masseuse kindly checked on me twice during the 75-minute massage so I had the opportunity to ask for something different if needed. Great place!

Excellent!. I came here at the beginning of the year and I was a little disappointed in the body scrub treatment I had. I decided to take a friend here and give them another shot because the place is clean and professional. This time I had a 1hr Thai massage and I was blown away! I think it's was one o the BEST massages I have ever had - and I have had many! So, perhaps sitch the treatment and go for a straight massage? My friend was pretty impressed with her aroma massage also!
Super relaxing. I tried a couple of different options during my stay. The building is nice, the rooms are good and purpose built and the staff are very professional and offer very good service

Great spa place. We had a great time at SF spa. The setting and amenities are very nice and clean, service and care very professional, for a price half what you would pay in most hotels for such a venue (about 500 000 vd for a 60'-massage) Also we didn't have a reservation, we were taken in after only 10 minutes, and I really enjoyed the 75' stone massage. However, if you mean to go after 6pm, make sure to have an appointment because it was quite crowded when we left. Really wish I was still on the massage table :)

Good value. My husband and I both had a massage and I also had a foot spa. The surroundings were clean and pleasant, the staff polite and well trained and all in all it was a pleasant experience. We would go back if we return to Hanoi - we visited several spas in Vietnam and this one was the best value for money.

it was okay. it was my first time in Hanoi with 2 of my friends. we choose Warm Stone massage followed by a sea salt body scurb. frst, talk about the shower facility, it was clean & tidy, however, when we saw the steam jacuzzi next to the shower area....... the jacuzzi was filled with water and seems the water was "used" and never been released..... luckily, we didnt spend money on the jacuzzi even the staff said it was fun.....lol......massage was too soft and the scurb was too rough..... i can say the massage was comfortable cuz it was soft, however, the scurb wake me up. overall, it was not bad but definitely not the best. i would prefer massage in Thailand more.Receptionists can speak English, they are nice and helpful. they reply reservation emails promptly.

Worth a visit. A beautiful interior and very professional. You feel instantly relaxed when you arrive. The green tea in gorgeous little mugs was a very nice touch. Reasonably priced, although you could probably get cheaper, the ambience is the selling point here. Well worth a visit!

Relaxing moments. My husband and I were on honeymoon when we went there. We were extremely pleased with the hospitality and service of the staffs there. The ambiance is perfect. We tried the aromatherapy full body massage. Since it was during the happy hour, we received bonus of 20 minutes foot scrub. The whole experience was memorable. It is very recommended place to try in Hanoi.

Caring services. Decided to try the spa after reading the many great reviews. My wife & I decided to have the aromatherapy & leg massage. Both treatment were well executed by staff whom were caring! The spa is clean and cosy. Not sure about the costs versus other spa in Hanoi but it is definitely a bargain when compared against those back home.

Pleasant experience. I went there with my husband and we both enjoyed the aromatherapy massage. I had never had a massage before but the staff were pleasant, the place was clean and quiet. A very enjoyable experience.

Room for Improvement. Lovely place inside. Cab fare was covered by SF Spa. Went there once in the afternoon before 3pm. took the spa package there. Massage standard has room for improvement. Mine was too soft while my wife's was too hard. Tried massage around many places around Asia. Really can't compare the standard of massage here to the rest of the places I went before. The massaeurs were chatting between themselves and there was renovation works at the adjacent building.The staff even had a boo boo. It was agreed at the reception that mine would end with a foot reflexology but the staff gave a foot scrub. The foot scrub was great though. The Manager didnt even apologise for the boo boo when this was communicated to the staff at reception area. For the record they were polite. Seems like there was a breakdown in communication at the recep area. Need to brush up their act and standard of massage.

Money Well Spent. I wanted to get a 90 minute Traditional Thai Massage and a 30 min neck, shoulder and back massage. The lady working there was extremely helpful and recommended I get a 2 hour traditional thai massage with a half hour using oils dedicated to the upper back area. It was amazing. If you like thai massages and enjoy being pushed, pulled and everything else that comes with it, you will absolutely fall in love with this place! The service is amazing and the quality for your money is awesome. If I ever make it back to Hanoi, I will for sure stop by here!

Amazing each time!. I went here 3 times with my boyfriend and each time we both had EXCELLENT massages. You pay a bit more, but it is well worth it. The staff are very professional and well organized. The place itself is lovely inside, clean and relaxing as soon as you step inside.

Beautiful interiors.... My husband and I both had the 60 minute reflexology foot massage, atmosphere is excellent, you pay a little more for the nice interiors but its worth it, quiet no street noise, very customer service oriented.

Fantastic haven for a lovely escape - we went back a second time!. We came across SF spa online and were impressed by the reviews - and it siding let us down. After 14 days travelling Vietnam, 9 of us indulged in steam baths, aromatherapy massages and various package deals - and it was full marks all round. The spa is clean, relaxing and a world away from hanoi's bustle, although only a dollar cab ride from Hoan Kiem district. The SF Spa signature was so good that two of us squeezed in a second visit just before our 20 hour flights home - and it was the perfect note to finish on! The happy hour deal and free taxi was a nice touch at the end of a holiday when the Vietnamese dong are running out - I will recommend to anyone who visits Hanoi!

Relaxing Massage. My husband, my sister and I all went for an aromatherapy maaaage at SF Spa. The entrance was beautiful, service great and massage was very nice and relaxing. The only thing I would point out in the fact we were in a room of 4 and there was a lot of noise and transparent curtains between customers. A little bit more privacy and quiet would bring this spa to 5 star. Massage was lovely though !

Wonderful and Relaxing Spa. Was recommended by my hotel to try out this spa and I was not disappointed. Glad to see the "Trip Advisor Award 2012" sticker on the front door! On my first day I tried the traditional Thai massage. Very relaxing atmosphere and the staff are friendly and service-oriented. I was so impressed I decided to come back again a few days later to try the aroma therapy massage! There was some construction work going on next door but the noise stopped after a few minutes. Prices are reasonable, and I didn't even have to pay the taxi fare!

Loved it!. My husband and I went here on our last day in Hanoi and wish we had found this sooner.You are greeted with a welcome drink and ask to fill out a questionnaire (as you would in spas at home). We both felt they had done a good job of creating a relaxing atmosphere in the middle of the city with soft lighting, relaxing music, lovely furnishings and a great smell (from oil burners).I had a facial explaining I had sensitive skin which was well accommodated for. The thing I loved about this facial was that they also included a hand passage whilst the mask was in and a back massage at the end.I then had the reflexology as my feet had been sore and swollen since arriving in the country. As I moved to a chair for this treatment heat bags were placed at 2 parts on my back to make me feel more comfortable. The reflexology was amazing and my feet and legs were no longer swollen and pain free at the end.My husband had a one hour Thai massage followed by a one hour aromatherapy massage. He says it was the best massage he has evere had.They also provided a free pick up from our hotel and provided a drink at the end.The total price for the 4 hours (2 hours each) was approx AU$80.You can get these services for less but we found this to be outstanding value given the environment and quality of service. I think it's worth paying the little bit more.

Pampered. My fiancée and I booked one day before, and enjoyed three hours of generous pampering. Everyone was friendly, polite and couldn't do enough to make us feel comfortable and welcome. A wonderful experience.

Best message I've had. Our hotel referred us to this place and they had an offer which included a free taxi ride from our hotel (even though it was only a 5 minute walk for us) and a happy hour offer where you get another treatment depending on how much you spend if you visit before 3.30pm. My husband and I each had a 180minute 670k Dong message, he choose a foot scrub and I choose a deep cleansing facial.The place is an absolute delight, clean and professional and both our masseuse were very good - so good that my husband actually fell asleep! It's been a long time since I've felt so relaxed and this is definitely one of the two best message I've ever had - the other one being in Phuket a few years ago.We went to another spa a couple of days ago, can't remember its name as we just walked in when we were very tired after hanging around Old Quarter for the day. That was a bit cheaper at 550k and was ok, but we didn't have the same level of comfort and privacy, had to share a 5 bed room with another guy, luckily he was already lying face down when I had to undress myself. Here we had our own private treatment room, complete with a separate toilet and two wooden bath tubs. We just felt really relaxed, just as a perfect spa should be. Definitely worth the money!!

Random Act of Kindness + SF Spa speciality. Omg... Ive visited many spas and massage parlours, SF Spa would have to be my ALL TIME best, so far. I take it upon myself to have as many massages around the world as possible, being a masseuse myself i like to keep up with other cultures and traditions.When I entered, I was asked if I could help out with a student that was reading some English text ... I vowed to do a 'Random act of Kindness' daily, so I was privileged to be asked to help out. I sat with the young lady for 5-10mins reading her text out aloud so she could get a hang on English pronunciation.I choose a 120min spa experience which included the most amazing Stretching Massage. I LOVE this spa and will be returning every day of my Hanoi visit. You are treated like a queen right from beginning to end. The Host and Hostesses are quality driven whilst the Spa Staff are passionate about what they do. Thank you for the BEST massage in the world.
Fabulous Spa experience. Chose the 4-hour deluxe package and WOW! 240 mins of pure bliss and relaxation, didn't want it to end, and amazing value compared to Western prices. Worth every single Dong!

Professional and Clean. When looking for a nice relaxing massage or body scrub or facial. I would recommend this place for value for quality service. I returned three times to this establishment with my family and friends who enjoyed various treatments. I have been in cheaper places but they were hardly clean or professional not like this place. Other more upmarket establishments would only really offer higher prices in many cases. Very happy although a little noisier on our last treatment. Position of premises seems to be on the edge of the old Quarter. We were actually taken to this place by a Taxi driver who spoke Good English. Thought it was my best find in Hanoi

best massage and spa place in hanoi!. and its a shame we only found this the day before we departed!
the service was 10/10 as was the facilities and the massages.
when coming back this will be the one and only place we visit as the others were nowhere near as good! and great value for money as well..
well done guys!

Wonderful massage. SF Spa was recommended by my hotel. I had the most amazing neck and shoulder massage and manicure - I felt fabulous and didn't want it to stop. The Spa was spotless and the customer service was fantastic. I would highly recommend a visit to SF Spa when you are in Hanoi - I wished I had found it earlier.

Best massage, environment and ambience to match. Wow, I loved this place.The service was attentive, quick and made me feel special.I had a 90 minute aromatherapy massage.I was guided upstairs three flights of stairs to my room. The spa is dimmly lit and smells divine. The interior decoration is what you would expet at a very good western spa. There is plenty of wood to make you feel warm and welcome. My therapist definitely knew what she was doing. I have never enjoyed a treatment as much as this one. I paid 670K dong for the 90 minutes, which would be about $30. Professional, clean and affordable. A true oasis amongst the busyiness of Hanoi and a MUST stop for a refresher on arrival or departure.

A slice of heaven. I could write pages about this place but will just say - heaven, professional,caring, attentive, hygienic,excellent! It's not cheap by Hanoi prices but cheap by Australian prices. I had a hot stone massage (75mins), Dead Sea salt scrub with aromatherapy (60mi s), reflexology treatment (60mins) and a free facial because I had my treatment before 3pm, all for $75! I was there nearly four hours. If I lived here I would come back weekly!! Definitely treat yourself and go!
Excellent oasis. Very nice spa in the middle of chaotic Hanoi. Treatment, rooms, staff and relaxation standard were all up to Western standards with a local twist. Very enjoyable

Good massage from a nice place. I got a sport massage to relieve my muscle from workout. I've been to only few spa in Hanoi and this one seem to be one of the best. They have nice interior design and are well-equipped with good amenities. The massage was awesome and took my soreness from workout away. Their staff are friendly and tell good story about Hanoi.It's quite a nice place to come by.

Nice oasis in old town. Our hotel recommended we head to this spot with a massage. It was an odd recommendation we thought given the nice place right next door, but we enjoyed the time. Three foot massages and one regular massage were all enjoyed. The foot massages were strong and certainly helped help recover our feet from a long day of walking.

Very enjoyable shame about the train noise. Booked this over the internet and they sent a car to pick you up which they pay for. Very nice looking Spa in the middle of town and very efficient. Nice treatment rooms, very clean and the treatments were excelent for the price they charge. The only downside (and this depends on what time of day/night you go) is that whilst drifting away mid massage we were suddenly disturbed by the sound of a train travelling behind the property. It was a bit of a wake up call but I guess thats part of the attraction of a busy city with trains that run thru it (literally)

Outstanding Experience & Service. The staff & management at SF Spa deserve a great deal of credit for what they're achieving, which is a first-class massage & spa service in Asia. They've clearly listened to some of the criticisms in 2012 and upped their game, to the point where their professionalism and mentality is level with the best in places like Thailand, Singapore, and Hong Kong (where I live). I think everyone there deserves a lot of praise: ambience & customer care are excellent and the treatments I've had this week were superb. Don't worry about some of those old reviews, therefore: right now it's an outstanding experience & service.

You get what you pay for. I have been going to SF Spa every year since 2006,when they were located in a smaller building, in Hang Buom Street in the old quarter. I have always been very happy with the massages and the service provided. It certainly isn't the cheapest massage in town but the overall experience is well worth the cost. You get what you pay for and it is good value for money. At around $25 for a 75 minute massage, it's still only about 30% of the prices in my home city of Melbourne. I returned to SF yesterday and as usual left relaxed and refreshed. Highly recommended.

Luxury at an affordable price. This place was highly recommended by friends and it didn't disappoint us. We walked in off the street without a booking and the receptionist was very accommodating. We were asked to sit in a waiting area where we were served green tea whilst browsing the menu. The service from the waiting to the private massage room was seamless and very professional. Same service as I've received in 5 star spas back home. My husband and I had the sports massage (deep tissue) - as small and petite the therapists were, they were extremely strong. I followed my massage with a 1 hour foot reflexology. I walked out completely refreshed and energised. This place is a little more expensive than other places but not by much. It was clean and you can tell hygiene was important to them. We now pass on this recommendation as you won't be disappointed.

A fantastic experience in the hustle & bustle of Hanoi .... After several arduous days in Hanoi and surrounds we were recommended to try SF Spa by some freinds. Well we were not disappointed!After walking for some time to find this tranquile place amongst the hustle and bustle of the Hanoi Old Quarter, we were treated to a very pleasant experience. The environment and decor were very relaxing and the service was excellent. I opted for a 90 min "Sports" Massage and my wife a 60 min "Sport" Massage followed by a 60 min Foot Massage. What a way to relax after a busy few days in a busy city!Highly recommended.

Very good massages in a clean, well appointed place. There are many massage places in Hanoi but a lot of them are dodgy and creepy. Not this one. Went here last year and went again last March during my second visit. The place is well appointed, great massage ambiance and most importantly, the staff are skilled in doing the massage, which is the most important thing.We went to this place almost everyday and we got the aromatherapy massage and foot massage. They also have a happy hour (before 3 pm) and they throw in a free extra service, like a 30 minute foot scrub, or a pedicure, or a facial massage. They also pay for your taxi fare from the hotel to their place, if you meet a minimum expense.Very good!

Pricey but GREAT.... I have been living in Hanoi for 20 months and have been to many many many massage places around hanoi, ( blind massage, foot massage, so called spa ) many are TAM QUAT style of man handling your joints and stretching you with disregard for your screams...so I have been there..ha ha. I have had prices ranging from 6 dollars for a 60 minute "body oil massage" all the way to 50 dollars for the same the best average is around 200 dong ( 10 dollars ) for 70 minutes for body massage that is ok (but most places are not very clean ) so now SF Spa...it is very clean , very relaxing and very very professional massage technique ( all caution is taken to avoid body exposure) the rooms are well appointed and you quickly relax and forget about the thousands of beeping motorcycles and you walk out refreshed. The bests time is during a promotional period which gives discount between 9 am and 3 pm. The 2-4 hour full spa will be between 1-2 million dong( 50 -100 dollars) but you will have a new lease on life ...ha ha.

Felt like a queen. We found this place through trip advisor and we weren't disappointed at all quite the opposite, they paid for the taxi to the spa which was a lovely touch. Then when we arrived it was like we were in a totally different place as soon as we walked in the door nice pebbled foot path to the waiting area we were served very fast, we got some tea while we fill out our details. My friend and I both got pedicures and manicures and a amazing foot massage, the staff are very professional and good, when we finished it was very crowded so make sure you make a booking!

Excellent Spa. A quiet place just off the Old Quarter. Little more expensive than the basic places in HO Chi Minh or Hanoi but good value for money They ask your basic information and:offer an excellent quality massage in a nice atmosphere which is blissful after being on foot in Hanoi .

Excellent Spa Experience. We were tired and in need of some relaxation after a hectic day in Hanoi. We asked our hotel for a good place for massages and they recommended SF Spa; they even offered to pay for the cab from the hotel.From the welcome to the massage (90 minutes couples massage) to the farewell, they treated us like royalty, offering tea or water, assuring we were comfortable, and offering good value. The massage was excellent and the masseuse made sure we were comfortable with the massage throughout the duration.I would recommend them without hesitation.

Pretty happy overall, a few minor glitches. We were pretty happy overall with our 'travelers package' for around $100 AUD. Staff seemed quite professional, asking for our skin type before applying treatments. I informed them I have sensitive skin, but our milk and rose petal bath had some oil put in it, akin to Tiger Balm, and I had to get out almost immediately as the burn was insane. I have found around this and other spas that either the Vietnamese don't know what the definition of 'a hot bath/spa' is, or the hot water system just doesn't cut it. I think the latter might be unlikely as most hotels have unlimited hot water. Our baths and spa were luke warm and eventually became so cold we had to get out early. While the staff were filling our milk bath, we were letting the facials sit for a while. We could hear them bucketing water from another room into our bath, which seemed like they were reusing someone else's water. On the plus side, we received complimentary pho and juice halfway through our package. Overall, not terrible but not the best either.

Our favorite SPA experience in all of Vietnam!. Having experienced all levels of spas in Vietnam, I have to say we ended up liking SF Spa the best. We were going to go to La Sietsa Spa (slightly more expensive than SF Spa), but couldn’t get in when we wanted, so our hotel recommended SF Spa. I recognized the name from my Trip Advisor searches, so felt comfortable with the choice and am so glad we went.It was a perfect experience. First of all, it was the end of our first full day in Hanoi and we were fighting jet lag and air pollution, making the decision to do their four-hour Delux Package was a very easy one. It was four hours of pampering; it was bliss. Only $100 USD plus tip for magical ‘me’ time. This type of package in the USA would be $300-$500.When you arrive, you’re immediately whisked out of the hectic city and into a haven of peace and quiet. They offer you water or hot tea while you fill out a quick form on any health issues. Then you’re escorted to your room where they lock your valuables in a small, metal safe and put the key ring around my your wrist. The safe is with you for our entire stay. Our room included a steam/shower room, a large Jacuzzi (for two people) and two traditional massage tables. We’d chosen the steam room over the Jacuzzi, but if you’re a couple, it’d be fun to do the Jacuzzi.Starting with the Aroma Therapy Massage, the natural products and oils they use started the relaxation process immediately. You can choose the essential oil (delicate, naturally fresh, energy, indulge, forest fragrance or exotic), but we let them choose for us and we could immediately feel the improved circulation and release of tension as they skillfully massaged our tired bodies.Next came the Body Exfoliation with Dead Sea Salt. It’s called the Pearl on their menu and included an invigorating blend of essential oils. The FULL BODY (including breasts and stomach) scrub was stimulating and definitely exfoliated and softened the skin. I hadn’t realized how tender my underarms are.In the background, the relaxing music was subtle, allowing the sounds of the outside world to periodically enter the room: a horn honk, a train whistle, and birds chirping.Into the steam room to further moisturize the skin and then a shower and shampoo before the Collagen Anti-Aging Facial. I’ve been told that I’m past the point of ‘anti-aging’ but I’ll take an antioxidant-rich and moisturizing mask any day! Made from original collagen of cow skin which has an effect on the color and the texture of the skin…OK. But I do know that collagen helps provide firmness and elasticity to your skin. We actually fell asleep during this process. Not sure if it actually did anything, buy my face felt great afterwards.Finally, you end with a Foot Reflex Massage out in a central room with comfortable chairs. You’re offered some more tea and a little treat while they expertly work over your feet and lower leg. Reflexology is supposed to help balance your body by focusing on the foot’s energy points. It was a nice way to ‘re-enter’ civilization before stepping out into the world of motorbikes and mass humanity.Before we left Hanoi, we went back for a two-hour session which included the Warm Stone Massage (actually HOT stone) and Foot Reflex Massage. The Warm Stone Massage treatment blends the therapeutic properties of heated basalt stones with Swedish massage techniques to deeply penetrate tight muscles, improve circulation and promote a sense of well-being. And yes, we left with a keen sense of well-being.Overall, SF is very clean and sanitary. The linens and blankets are fresh. There are fresh flowers everywhere and the lighting and volume level of the music is perfect. The staff is friendly and professional. Not the cheapest place, but worth every penny. Every client is a tourist as it is way too expensive for locals to utilize.The only recommendation I’d make is that they should offer an Oxygen Bar. Hanoi is among the most polluted cities in Asia and the most polluted in Southeast Asia. Traffic is the main contributor to air pollution in the city, with the content of PM10 (particles less than 10 micrometers in diameter) being four times higher than the alarm level set by the World Health Organization. PM10 are a major health concern because they can be inhaled into and accumulate in the respiratory system through normal facial masks. By the time I left Hanoi, I had acute bronchitis … so beware!With an Oxygen Bar, I’d have gone very day and paid whatever price they wanted to set!

An oasis of relaxation in the bustle of Hanoi. SF Spa was one of three places recommended by our hotel when my husband and I were looking for a bit of pampering after a bout of traveler's dysentery (fun!). We chose SF because it was easy walking distance from our hotel, and it was a fantastic choice. My therapist Nguyet was top notch--she worked me as deeply and thoroughly as anyone I have encountered in the US, plus the facial I tacked on left my skin glowing and refreshed. While it's not one of the mind-blowingly cheap spas I encountered elsewhere in Vietnam, I feel the atmosphere and service are definitely worth the upgrade. That said, it's still WAY cheaper than similar places I visit in the US. If I could get a 90 minute massage here in Chicago for $35 I'd get one twice a week.

Immaculate, great ambience and service. It's not expensive by regular western standards - because it's not a hole in the wall. It's beautiful, impeccably clean and provides great service.The atmosphere is modern with a warm and natural ambience. Fresh cut flowers floating in water, stone and wood paths and dark wood with clean white sheets, soft red blankets and comfy beds and chairs. We could not hear the chaotic traffic at all, but I could hear birds chirping and they played relaxing spa tunes. Sweet! The service was great. They gathering sufficient info and they took care to ask about exactly what we needed and expected. Since I have chronic neck strain and sensitive skin, they provided a strong therapist and coconut oil, which was perfect. My husband and I were there for 2 1/2 hours. We both chose aromatherapy massages (75 mins), and I received a 30 minute neck and shoulder massage, and then we both enjoyed 20 minute foot scrubs, which was part of a promotion they had at the time. My massage was thorough and deep, and I felt the staff were extremely professional and attentive. Their products seemed to be quality, and they took their time. As for our valuables (this I appreciated) - they locked them in a safe and put the key ring around my husband's wrist. The safe was in our line of vision for our entire stay. I've read about other situations where money has gone missing, or there being a lack of security services. Not the case here. Overall, it was the perfect getaway from the madness grit of the city. I left feeling refreshed, and satisfied that I got full value (and then some) for my dollar. Altogether it was $USD67. Not cheap, but worth every cent. Just do it!PS: They offered us tea and served us water upon arrival. Nice touch!

Waste of time. This place is greedy and is a waste of time. My hotel called and booked for my friend and I and when we arrived, the lady at the counter did not pay any attention to us, she was too busy answering phone calls. She finally made us sit behind the reception and forgot about us - or at least pretended to forget about us. After 15 minutes I asked her what was happening and she seemed surprised that I had asked. She told me what kind of massage we wanted (finally) and went back to the reception where again she left us waiting. Anothe few minutes later I asked her again what was happening and she, again surprised, asked me if I had a booking. When I said yes, that my hotel had called, she said she was fully booked and that I had no booking! Why made us wait then?! I guess they are simply greedy and not honest people. One of the customer was also complaining about being overcharged so please be careful, this place obviously does not care about its customers. I will certainly not set foot there again!

Great selection of services and professional masseuses. I have travelled to Hanoi a few times and the SF Spa is always on my list of things to do. They have a great list of services - massages, facials, manicures, pedicures etc. I have had Vietnamese, Thai and Shiatsu massages as well as pedicure and a mens facial - everything was good and the service is very relaxing and professional. They sent a car to pick me up from my hotel (Ruby Elegance - excellent hotel) and I felt great afterwards.The last time I took my daughter with me and she had a massage and pedicure and loved it.

Excellent massage. Stylish and welcoming spa tucked away just off the Old Quarter. Pricier than the basic places, but still a good value for what you're getting: an excellent quality massage in a nice atmosphere.

just what I wanted in a pedicure. I've lived in Hanoi for several months now. After trekking all over the city exploring, particularly during the warm dusty months of autumn/winter, I have yearned for a good soak and a nice pedi. I finally found one! I agree, the SF Spa is pleasant and welcoming. It's a stylish little oasis in the middle of chaos. The staff is very nice and approachable. They have a full menu of choices. I got the spa pedi - a lovely soak in fragrant salts, an exfoliating scrub, lots of trimming and tidying, and a perfect application of polish. It's still not the full bubbly pampering of home, but very nice. I've done the other crowded, quick but expert, no frills pedicures that are on offer all around town. This is by far my favorite. I added a manicure for a total of 440K VND ($21). I will go back.

Good recharge option priced attractively. This place is not a place for people who want things good but at some ridiculously cheap rate. For US50 you can get a 2 hour spa package and to me that seems like a good and fair price to me. I was surprised to get an email from customer service few days later when I came back to my home country so there is a good level of service that the team there wants to have even though they know that they are serving tourists and probably will not be a repeat customer

Pretty good but expensive. I've now visited 5 spas across Vietnam, all for massage. SF Spa wasn't the best in terms of the massage but it is centrally located, very clean and safe. The customer service was good; I asked lots of questions about the treatments which were all answered immediately. The staff are knowledgeable and my masseuse also had excellent English.I'd say the prices were a bit steep and the prices differ according to the massage technique, not just the length of time. It was 499,000 dong for 60 minutes of sports massage. By no means was the massage bad- it just didn't match the price.

Great value. My fiancé and I were a bit overwhelmed after a few hectic days in Hanoi, and a few hours at SF spa was the perfect recovery.While not as cheap as some places we've been in SE Asia, for the quality (very clean, stylish decor) the value was fantastic. We paid around $70 for both of us to have various treatments over two hours each, which we estimate would have cost over $500 I'm Sydney.If you like massages and the like, definitely go here.

The best massage ever.... My friend and I visited this spa before flying home to the UK - we opted for the SF Spa signature 2hr pamper - for 2 backpackers needing some TLC, this was the best present to ourselves! It was amazing and lasted longer than the 2hrs stated. I feel like a new woman..I would definately recommend this spa, the service and staff were impeccable. I'll certainly be going again when I visit here in the future.

Beautiful. I would highly recommend the place. The staff were all super friendly and the place was very clean. I had quite a few treatments - my favorite being a fresh fruit massage. The cost was about a third of what you'd pay here in Australia.

Highly recommended... A hidden gem in the old quarter of HanoiMy wife and myself visited the spa recommended from the hotel.. My wife who is an avid user of Spa's indulged in a Swedish Hot stone massage and a body shimmer treatment. I took a Shiatsu massage and a free men's facial treatment on offer..To say it was an experience from the top drawer would be an understatement. Very professionally done and a fabulous experience. Value for money and a real bargain. A must visit when in Hanoi.

Good value for money, though not cheapest place in town. I've been in Hanoi for 4 days so far, and have been going to SF Spa every single day. It's a clean establishment with great service. The masseuse generally have good technique. Best value is the Reflexology foot massage, for 330,000 vnd for 60 minutes (equivalent to USD 17), but the Indian Neck, Back, and Shoulder Massage for 30 minutes is also nice (for 250,000 vnd). If you take a taxi from the Old Quarter to SF Spa, the spa will pay for the taxi ride. Highly recommend since its clean and reliable.
Best pedicure ever!. Lovely place - nice and clean, friendly, smiling staff!! Really enjoyed my visit and felt wonderfully relaxed after a pedicure and massage. Would highly recommend.

warm and friendly atmosphere. The spa looks good, quite pleasant to be in, everything made by wood and with ambient lighting, The spa offers a big variety of services: massages, waxing, face treatments, nail care and some packages. The price is medium: for example basic foot massage cost 330 000vnd/ 1 hour, manicure 80 000 vnd+color 50 000 vnd, vietnamese massage 60 min- 399 000 vnd and traditional thai- 420 000 vnd, the most expencive treatment is "Delux"- 2 070 000 vnd for 240 min (steam bath, aroma massage, body exfoliation with dead sea salt, collagen anti aging face and foot massage). I made a foot massage, which was pleasant, and a manicure without color (was offered O.P.I. varnish but limited number of colors). Would strongly recommend.

A very disappointing Vietnamese massage rub. We went for the Vietnamese massage as we wanted to experience this while in Vietnam. Definitely never heard of this as a popular or known form. Done shiatsu, Thai, Balinese before, but never Vietnamese.We asked the reception to tell us what Vietnamese massage is and was told it involves finger pressure with clapping movement. I told her I wanted hard rubbing and she recommended aromatherapy and I told her I didn't want oil massage.When the Vietnamese massage started, I was startled by the application of oil on my body. I thought I said I didn't want oil. Then I felt very annoyed by the light feathery touching by the masseur. I kept asking her to go harder. After my second plea, she went out of the room. I didn't know what was happening until someone came in and told me that if I wanted harder massage then I should go for shiatsu. I was naked and oiled at this point and I see no point to make any switches. Beside, the difference in the type of massage should be the technique and not the pressure. If I changed to shiatsu and it's done by the same masseur, it will still be soft. It's not like she is restricted by the laws of Vietnamese massage to only administer light rubbing for this particular massage.Terrible experience and would never return. This is not a cheap spa by Hanoi standards but I would have been happier spending the time and money elsewhere.They wanted to allocate us with a male and female masseur. I'm glad we rejected as the massage was conducted with us in underwear only and there was so much proximity to the chest area that you would never want to subject yourself in this with a strange man. What were they thinking?!

A pedicure treat. I live in Hanoi and usually pay less than $5 for a pedicure, but that's for essentially just a cuticle tidy and polish in a cramped salon. I had a friend visiting last week so decided to go a bit more upmarket and tried SF Spa. The spa pedicure is around $15 but a completely different experience to my usual place: the salon is beautifully decorated and comfortable, staff are polite and smartly dressed in au dai and the pedicure professional and enjoyable, including a good foot scrub. I wouldn't go here for all my pedicures, but would definitely consider it again when friends are in town or for a treat now and again.

offered more than what we wanted!!. used this place for a couples massage after referral from our hotel and it was very good. A week later we were in Hanoi on our return journey and booked in again. me for a 1 hr body massage and my wife 1hr foot,back/shoulders and neck. I had a lady masseur and my wife had a young male and wasn't totally comfortable with that but as it was just shoulders, neck etc thought little more about it. She was not offered the choice to begin with. The whole massage was very poor and unprofessional, just rubbing in circles. then as he asked her to lay on her back and he started massaging front of her neck, his hands moved downwards into totally inappropriate areas at which point she immediately stopped the masseur and complained to management, in fact 3 people overall. They apologised and offered half price which just to get out of the place and not cause a drama we accepted. My massage was just ok but that happens from time to time. We reported it to the hotel also and would strongly recommend if you use this place to be mindful of our experience.

not up to expectations. I was there earlier. definitely not up to expectations. the massuer was inexperienced and more interested to look at the clock more than paying attention to what's she's doing. the price ain't cheap btw.inexperienced pricey joint.

Treat Yourself. After a week in China we were in need for some relaxation. SF Spa was recommended to us by our hotel and they were right as this was a great relaxing experience. My wife and I enjoyed every minute and would recommend to anyone for a recharge of the system. Great value for money compared to what we pay in Australia for the same service.

Hidden Gem in Hanoi. This is a fantastic spa with awesome value for money. This spa is comparable to any international standards but nowhere near the expense. My friend and I had full body massage and facial for $50 (USD) each which was a 2 hour treatment. The staff are very professional. The massage was fantastic and the facial was very good. In the chaos and noise of the Hanoi streets, let this be you peace and serenity.

Do yourself a favor. Two female friends and I visited SF spa in October 2012 during a stay in Hanoi. We were recommended by our hotel staff and had an absolute memorable experience - 2.5 hours of being pampered from top to toeWe chose a selection of treatments including body scrub, massage and facial and thoroughly enjoyed each treatment and the combination. Very professional staff, very well set up and private rooms. Very good value for money and highly recommend

Simply amazing. The service is impeccable and the prices are very reasonable. It's clean and they use excellent products. I went back twice! They will even pay for one way of your taxi trip. I will definitely go back next time I'm in Hanoi!

Very good option - Ensure u get to the right address. What i liked- Quality of the massage - traditional herbal one highly recommended- one of th best massages ever (and im a massage addict)- work done on the location aesthetics (but dont expect superpremium stuff)- Open till 11 pm- offered to keep our belongings in a box under the massage table, really safeWhat i didnt like- Not clear location, shows another addreesnon ipad and had to walk all over the city

Spa Experience. Ok, heaps of reviews on massages - now one for waxing... that was interesting! Did a good job, but if you are having a bikini wax, you cannot be a prude! Leave that to your imagination! 2 girls waxing legs, underarms and bikini. I think they were commenting on the hairy Aussie, and kept making sure that I was ok. Service great, atmosphere great. Only asked to upsell once to see if I wanted a massage while I was waiting for the waxing girl to be available. Would recommend and go back again!

Good massage - an oasis of pampering and calm. This was especially heavenly after contending with the endless honking and polluted air in the streets of HanoiI selected a relaxing exfoliation for 609,000 VND for a 60 min treatment. The massage therapist had good technique and it was a refreshing experience to be slathered in a passion fruit scrub.Felt thoroughly rejuvenated after!

good massage. This spa was recommended by our hotel and they provided free transport,which was nice. My husband and I had a couple's massage. He had an aromatherapy one and I chose a Thai massage without oil.Other reviewers are correct about the price being based on the firmness of the massage, but the girl who was assisting us helped us pick the right ones for what we were looking for. Overall, it was very professional and we had a good experience.

Pure Indulgence. If you are looking to escape the busy streets and constant beeping, look no further. SF Spa was recommended by the hotel and we couldn't have been happier with the spa treatment. This place was as close to western spa facilities as I have seen in South East Asia. With plush decked floors, pool pebble paths and perfect lighting, this was an unforgettable experience.100% relaxing.The ambience was 10/10, massage and facial treatments 8/10, price was 12/10 and washroom facilities 10/10!!!Be warned, it is in an awkward spot to locate and it's difficult to spot, so make sure you use a map and if you don't see it at first and you think you're in the wrong spot, chances are you're not far at all.Enjoy it and take advantage while you're in Hanoi as you will not find another spa like this anywhere further south.
Shiatsu rocks. Very clean, formal, but for me an excellent massage. The massage therapist had incredible strength particularly in her fingers. I am going back.

Interesting Experience but Relaxing. My husband and I went to SF Spa for a 2 hour treatment. He got a 2 hour massage (Swedish) and I got a 90 min massage (Swedish) and a 30 min salt scrub. Total was about $100 USD for both treatments. The venue was very clean, the staff was VERY professional so don't take what I'm going to say next the wrong way. My massage was lovely and relaxing but not a deep-tissue massage (hence, why it was so relaxing). We got Swedish which was the lightest (& the cheapest). I believe if you want a harder massage, you'll need to pay for it. The only odd thing was when my massage therapist turned me over on my back, she also massaged my chest for a short time...and then did the same with the salt scrub. It was professional as I stated but I was slightly uncomfortable. This just isn't done in the USA so maybe it's a cultural massage difference. Either way, just a note in case someone might be more modest than I about these things.
Relaxing and professional. My wife and I had an Aroma massage. It was excellent and the staff were professional and the service superb. I would recommend to all.

don't waste your time,don't waste your $. 6 of our group went there . all has the same feedback, its expensive and not professional.they don't even serve you a drink after massage. all they waiting is Tip !!nice environment,you feel relax when you enter this spa. they serve you their menu. after you made your choice, after you finish what they done to your body...you will be unhappy !how to intro a spa which you spent money to buy angry ?

Wonderful Spa. A little bit pricier than other places around town, but still cheaper than places back home. The higher cost is certainly worth the service that was given. The Thai and the Herbal massages were amazing. A little hard to find, but they will send a taxi for a ride out there for free.

Decent spa, but adjust your expectations. I had an aromatherapy massage and pedicure. Overall, I was very happy with the service. It is a bit higher in terms of prices than other places in Hanoi (because, let's face it, you could probably get your nails done on the street while sipping a beer), but it was much cheaper than in NA, so I didn't expect western style amenities. They did pay for the taxi ride over from my hotel. The room wasn't completely sound-proof as others have mentioned, but I still enjoyed the massage. Everything appeared clean, but then again, I didn't look too hard and the rooms are dim for ambience. The staff were great, my masseuse and pedicurist were both very professional and sweet, I would definitely go back.
good massage, great service. I tried the foot massage. After a day walking around Hanoi it was really needed. The massage was very professional and the place is clean and relaxing. I recommend it !
Good massage. We both had a massage and a facial and my wife a nail treatment. All of them where carried out ok, it's not the best place to go I think but it was clean and the staff friendly.

Relaxing. I had a wonderful relaxing time at SF Spa . Very clean , the girls were well trained in their art and the girl at the door is very helpful in choosing the best treatment for you . It was well worth the money and cheap by US standards for the 2 1/2 hours I was there . The only problem is now when I get home I'll have to tell my regular massage girl that there's someone better than her .

Great massage experience!!!. Great relaxing Thai massage with a free facial treatment.The place was very clean ,perfect atmosphere and the people were very professional. Not cheap, but definitely worth it.
Spa in Hanoi!. We had a Spa pedicure combo and I can only recommend you to do the same! Nice and relaxing. Professional!

Relaxing, friendly. My girlfriend and I had a 1 hour foot rub here and a 1 hour massage. We were hot, sweaty and tired after a day of traipsing around shopping and really needed a break from the noise of Hanoi. This place was nice enough that I would have gone back because the prices were good, and the girls were really sweet, but I have certainly been to better. The massage was great, the foot rub was a bit weird only because of the funny seats we were in, they are lounge chairs that are just not quite right and our necks were uncomfortable. For once I wanted the foot rub to end, which I never usually do! I would recommend it as being safe and quite clean, good prices and worth checking out.

Excellent Aroma therapy Massge. Nice facitilities.One of the best massages i've ever hadPrice expensive for Hanoi standards, but worth it.Got a free footscrub due to promotionsWould definitely come back

Good thai massage!. We took the Thai massage by oil, which was wonderful. We enjoyed the fall promotion and could choose between two different 30 minutes free face/foot treatment. The spa is not cheap if you compare to the standars in Hanoi, but the facilities are clean and very good. I highly recommend the spa.

A good relax before my flight. I tried the treatments in SF Spa on the last day in Hanoi before my flight. It was really good experience.I requested a male masseur for my treatments. First, I enjoyed food massage, then body srub with salt, then aroma therapy and Indian massage (free due to promotion). Finally another female masseur did the facial treatment (free due to promotion). Totally I spent about 4.5 hours for all of these treatments.The male masseur was skilful and did quite well. However, he couldn't speak or understand English so I couldn't talk to him much.I had left some tips to him at the counter at the end before I left. I was not quite sure if he could get that because I didn't see the staff at the counter mark it down.Anyway, it was worth trying it. Remember to check their website to see if there are any promotions.

Worth it if you have time. Besides my nail lady having a frown and bad attitude the entire time and not telling me that I was getting extra charges for what she was doing, my male masseuse and foot rub were AMAZING. Go there between 9-2 for " Happy Hour" and it's worth the price.

Glad we made time for this. Our hotel receptionist recommended this. Clean and they didnt try to upsell me anything! Finally. the other Nail/massage place near St Joseph's tried to get me to do their massage/treatment etc, which annoys me. I had the 2 hour thai massage with oil. I found the therapist quite skilled. My cousin thought her therapist was better than the one she tried in Chiangmai - which was an irony! She had the 1 hour thai massage with oil. The rooms were clean and nicely appointed. It cost me around SGD60+ for my massage. Not the cheapest but at least after I got really relaxed and had a great night's sleep.

Good value, smiling service. My daughters and I had facial and massage services and were very happy.We were less happy with the manicure which did not use sterile tools and seemed more of an Add-on service.We have rebooked for the facial and aromatherapy massage and are looking forward to it.

GOOD BUT NOT THE BEST. i went there for the first time after viewing the comment from trip advisor. the environment was quiet and spacious. the staffs were nice. i chose the aroma body massage. the massage room was spacious too, clean and tidy. but i didnt like they use the red colour sheeting for the massage bed, also using the same quality sheeting to cover my body, it looked strange. i rather prefer they use normal white towel, looks more clean and feel better. the smell of the massage oil was not so good, a bit strange. the skill of the massage therapist was not too professional but still ok la. since i like strong pressure and she didnt follow my request disregard i was requesting her many times to use stronger pressure. overall service was good, will come back again. but one funny thing was that when i paid by cash in u s dollar, they didnt accept it and preferred to receive local currency. i didnt know why and at the end i paid by credit card.

Great service and a great way to get out of the heat!. The staff are very friendly and professional. The services are great value compared home and other spas we looked into in Hanoi. It is very clean and the therapists seemed to be very well trained in the different types of massage. The rooms are very quiet and clean and being able to shower off the oil afterward was exceptionally nice. They also have a little box for your valuables and give you the key to the lock during your treatment.

Professional massage services. We visited here the day before departing Vietnam to head home and walked in off the street with no appointment. They were very accommodating and fitted in my husband and me within 10 minutes of arriving. It was about $25AUD each for a 1 hour massage which is pretty good compared with prices back home although I have seen and heard of cheaper places in Vietnam. I felt the price was quite good value. The massage therapists seemed to be well trained and the environment was quiet and professional. The massages were probably less conservative than in western spas but other than this I'd recommend this spa if you're looking for a solid full body massage with a firm touch for a reasonably good price.

Great service!. It was the firs time I came to SF Spa for foot massage. My first impression was the staff's smiles. friendly and enthusiasm staff, excellent service. I would like to recommend this Spa for everyone!

Fantastic escape in Hanoi from Hanoi!. Gave it a try based on everyone else's experiences here -- we weren't disappointed. Booked via our hotel. SF Spa paid for the taxi to their doorstep. The lobby area is very clean with a nice pebble trail where they sit you down to present their service menu with a cup of tea!We chose the Thai massage ("hard massage") and Aromatherapy massage ("medium massage") -- 90 minutes for approx $30-$35 USD. Definitely not the cheapest in Hanoi I'm sure but a steal for what you'd get back home in most western countries.The service was professional and great to unwind from the chaos of Hanoi. We just wish it lasted more than 90 minutes :)One thing we really liked was the security -- they give you a lock box to put your wallet, cellphone, etc into and then tie the key around your wrist so it can't go anywhere! This was very reassuring to let you completely relax and enjoy the service worry free!

Good massage but above average prices. We went here several times during our stay in Hanoi, and always had a great massage. The prices here are above average in Vietnam, but the environment is great: Clean and relaxing. Absolutely recommended!

Very Impressed. When I asked the Tirant Hotel staff for a great place to have a massage, they recommended SF Spa. The Spa (or the hotel) did not disappoint. They paid for the taxi fare to the spa (a nice perk) and once there was treated in the most expert fashion. I had a reservation and after a very brief wait (a few minutes) and a cup of tea I was escorted to the massage room. The masseuse (Hung) was very professional and skilled--I couldn't have asked for anyone better. I'll request her when I return but I'm guessing the others that work there are equally good. Very relaxing, very impressed with the entire operation an at a very affordable price.

Must do in Hanoi. After two all day long tours (Perfume Pagoda and Ha Long Bay) - a spa treatment at SF Spa is a must do! The place was very clean and the people were very professional. My friend and I had a 60 minute sweddish massage because that was all we had time for (we had to fly out the same day) - and it was very relaxing and pleasant. We had wish we can do more. The girls who perform the massages were very sweet and was sure that we were comfortable and where very tentative about any where we may have pain. I would definitely go back. The prices are affordable and definitely much less expensive than spas at the big retail hotels.

Most enjoyable. My husband and I were recommended this Spa by our hotel owner (which gave us a 10% discount) and it was well worth the time and money. We both had a full body massage and I had a manicure as well. The staff are really attentive to your needs and really know their job, the girls who did the massages were exceptionally good with their hands and feet and we both felt wonderful and very relaxed afterwards. The premises is very welcoming when you first enter and the reception staff make you feel like you are the most important person there. I will return for another treatment when in Hanoi and would recommend this to any one who wants to treat themselves.
Very enjoyable. Great relaxing foot and body massage by Ms Thao. Spa paid for taxi thrip from hotel to Spa, nice clean premises and resonable prices, recommended by Essence Hotel. Well worth a visit

So Relaxing!. Had a great experience at the SF Spa. Went here on the recommendation of our hotel. The spa paid for our cab ride there, which was a nice surprise! I got the 75 minute full body aroma therapy massage and could not have been happier with my choice! The girl who worked on me was amazing! My boyfriend went with a 75 minute foot passage and was also very pleased. They had a special promotion going on and we were given a list of services to choose from that were complimentary. We both opted for the parafin wax on our hands and feet. This experience was also amazing. All of this and we only paid $50 total!

Excellence. Yesterday, I had my first waxing. Initially, I felt very confused because I got to know that it will cause pain. Surprisedly, I passed over my scare without any pain. I highly recommend Ms Suong - my therapist because of her professional skill.

My best spa experience in Vietnam!. I went to the spa in the evening. Our hotel arranged an appointment and a cab and the spa paid for the cab for the trip there (I was responsible for the trip back to my hotel). I scheduled a foot massage and head and neck so I had a total of 90 minutes. it was definitely the best massage and overall spa experience I had in Vietnam (I had three total). My therapist was Soug (I would highly recommend her). She does a combination of Sweedish and deep tissue work and really understands the muscles and how to get tension out. The setting was quiet, comfortable, relaxing and very clean. The staff were extremely friendly and welcoming. I highly recommend this spa.

Absolutely amazing. My partner and I went here twice while we were in Hanoi. We absolutely loved it. The staff were great. The place was so clean and modern. The massages we got were terrific. Couldn't recommend this place any more!

Great service & massage!. I had a 1.5 hour Thai massage and a honey steam bath here yesterday, and I oved it. The Masseuse was very professional and the facilities are clean, with a very warm effect on the soul. The price is right too...so, do not miss this opportunity to have a great realxing afternoon. I am definitely going back :)

Not into massages, but this changed my mind. I've tried massages over time and they do little for me, but the speical promo that offered a sauna session along with a 60 minute massage tripped my reluctance. The massage was so great that I went back two days later for a 90 minute massage. That aside, the spa facility, the service and the professional approach gives it my thumbs up. I'd go back again. And all for about AUD$30.00

Great place! Good massages and pedicures, and nice service. This is a great little spa. They had a promotion when we went, allowing you to choose an extra service to add onto your 60 minute massage. I got a free pedicure, which was actually much better than I expected it to be - OPI nail colors, 2 coats, etc. The massage, which was the main purpose of my going there, was also very nice, though not incredible. The service overall was exceptional: they paid for our cab ride there, they called a cab for us when we were leaving, and even walked us onto the street to make sure we were okay. Went with my husband and a friend; we all got different services but were all pleased. Definitely recommended.

Left So Relaxed. There are many spas in Ha Noi, but in the Old Town area SF Spa is defiantly the best. By the way SF Spa has been on Cua Dong Street for a while now. You enter a beautiful lobby and the one of the ladies will hand you a brochure outlining what they offer. They have just massages and many many special packages that I never used. Yes, as some said, they will try to up grade you but if you refuse they will not pressure you. You will be greeted in the lobby by the person that will be giving you the massage, and escorted upstairs to your room. They will then have you put all your valuables into a lock box for safekeeping. This I really like. They then washed your feet, smart move on their part. Most massages range from one to two hours and with the two hour massage, which I usually got, I walk away so relaxed and very refreshed. One of the smartest moves I ever made was to get a massage within two hours of arriving after a sixteen hour flight to Ha Noi. Also got one two hours before I left, which made my long flight home a real pleasure. If the girl isn’t giving enough pressure just ask for more and she will be happy to oblige. If you are looking for a therapeutic sports massage this may not be the place If you go there three times you get a ten percent discount, which I used often. I was in Ha Noi for a little over two months and visited the place once or twice a week. Had a different girl each time except twice. All were a little different in their approach but well trained, which I can’t say for the other places. Yes, more pricy than the others in Old Town, but you get what you paid for and then some. And this place is so clean and fresh.Just a little tip, if you leave and are hungry just turn left out of the spa and cross the next street, Pho Ly Nam De. There are three ladies that are serving excellent food on the street. I usually got the Vietnamese sandwich from one of them. But all had good food.

Good service, bad massage. Amazing service, they pay for your taxi to the spa and are extremely welcoming. Ambience was good but the massage itself was a waste of money. We paid for a 90min aroma massage with a complimentary 20 min deep cleansing facial but they gave us a total of 100 mins treatment only because they "combined" the shoulder massage into 1. Apparently both the massage and facial included a 10 min shoulder massage each so what should have been 20 mins got cut down to 10 mins. Anyway, the massage technique itself was not good. If a good massage is what you're after, this is not the place.

Very Average Massage, Nice Facility for Hanoi. Visited SF Spa with friends at the new facility. First impression was that the shop is considerably nicer than any other storefronts in the area. Kind of like a pretty girl standing out in a group of fat girls. Since none of us speak Vietnamese, it was a somewhat difficult process to narrow down Spa choices. One point to note: be sure to check their monthly specials. There was a sign on the table that they didn't tell us about when signing up. A friend noticed it while we were waiting to be escorted to our rooms. When we brought this up, they offered an additional 30 hot stone foot massage for free. Facilities: Not having visited other spas in Hanoi, I'd guess that the facilities are among the better options available in Hanoi. The rooms were clean and new, though I did not like having to share rooms. I didn't see any rooms with that would be exclusively used for one person. The jacuzzi also smelled a bit funny. Showers were available with the package and decent enough. Service: As mentioned by others, there was a lot of in/out traffic during the massage. The masseuse seemed confused as well since she asked me to get dressed after my 60 minute massage, only to find out upon escorting me from the room that I needed to undresss again because I was due another 30 minutes plus the fruit facial. Overall, the operations were the LEAST organized compared to every other spa that I've been to elsewhere throughout the world. Treatment: The actual massage was fine. But when I signed up for the relaxation package (advertised for three hours of service), I envisioned being massaged for more than an hour. The way it breaks down, you're only massaged about 70 minutes in total (60 for body massage and about 10 minutes for facial). The fruit facial was disappointing; it amounted to the masseuse putting a bunch of fruit on my face and leaving for at least ten minutes. During is time, the fruit juice kept running down my neck and into my ears, which was uncomfortable to say the least. It would have been a much better treatment if she had massaged me the whole time rather than just leaving me there to wonder what was going on. Summary: The value just wasn't what I had hoped for. I can't see myself returning and hope that other Hanoi spas that I will inevitably try over the next few days will be better.

Excellent waxing.. I went here for a back and shoulder wax. Yes even men look after themselves. It was as good as I get in London. Very fine service in a most relaxing environment. Good value for money. I go back to Hanoi in a few days and will certainly visit again for another treatment. Thoroughly recommended.

Very good massage in Hanoi. It's very difficult to find a decent, quality spa in Hanoi where the buildings are so narrow and dingy. So we were afraid to just find a place by ourselves as we weren't sure how safe or clean they were.This place was recommended by our hotel and offered free one way taxi ride. The place was clean and the massage was very good, though they seemed a bit shy to press harder. Nonetheless, it was very good that we came back the next day.

Great massage, bit noisy, lack of attention to detail. The reception area of the spa is a really relaxing well designed environment and definitely sets the tone. On closer inspection there are a few improvements to be made...bit of wiring poking out above a bit of panelling, cracked and worn veneer on the little tables and a really crummy bathroom at the back (guys...this really needs improving!) and all of the flip flops are a man's uk size 11. I have Vietnamese sized feet so I opted to go barefoot to avoid looking like a complete idiot and killing myself on the many shiny wooden steps up to the treatment rooms (this is not the place for anyone with access issues I'm afraid, much of Vietnamese domestic architecture includes narrow five or six stories and no lifts).Anyway, the treatment rooms are done out very adequately I think and staff make a real effort to make you comfortable and relaxed, dimming the lights, good plinky plonky sound track as in many spas, excellent essential oils and top of the line products. I was given an excellent 1 hr long Swedish style massage and then had a very good mani-pedi ( I know people have moaned about these but it is all dependent on your therapist and mine was very good - if you aren't happy with what they're doing, stop them and tell them, they won't bite).My one main complaint however, and this is by no means a deal breaker, is that if you are a couple, you mostly get your treatments in the same room which is fine for massages but not if your husband is getting a back wax! I just hope it doesn't extend to the more intimate female waxing that needs to be done sometimes! That, coupled with the fact that there is a lot of noise of therapists rustling about in each others products/shelves/ drawers is a bit of a drawback.My feeling on leaving was that I'd had a great time and the noise and back waxing in close proximity were an amusing distraction. I suppose on another day I would have found it annoying but I certainly wouldn't hesitate to go back for another treatment and I would certainly recommend it to others.

Tranquil retreat - and amazing massage. Recommeded by our hotel - this spa certainly lived up to expectations! Not the cheapest but by far and away the best I experienced in Hanoi. Beautifully laid out, excellent treatments on offer - well worth a visit!

very decent place. I visited Hanoi very recently from US and decided to get massages at SF and were totally bowled over by not only the massages which were exceptionally relaxing but also by the cleanliness of the place. It really is a hidden jewel in this exciting city!

Worst massage experience in Vietnam. Paid 250K VND for a foot massage that was way below average(avg price in Hanoi is 150K)Massage was done in a very noisy atmosphere where staff opened and closed doors to the room as it seemed like they had to enter the room to get to their fresh towels. Massage technique was poor and unlike the massage places I had been in Ho Chi Minh.I would advise that you avoid this establishment.

Most memorable things in Hanoi :- most relaxing massage so far. This is my first time travel to hanoi. SF Spa is one of the most memorable things in hanoi. We were recommended by hotel staff to get a relaxing massage package at SF Spa. No disappointment but it was over my expectation that we were welcomed by the great frontline service staff and recommended the most suitable massage package for us. I was so relax and I had my best sleep at SF during my stay at Hanoi. Although it was only one hour package but I was totally energized after the massage. The best thing of all, we felt the friendly environment that managed to get some travel information from the great staff, HA, she's a good recommender if you would like to get some travel information. That's the thing I didn't expect to get from a Spa. Highly recommended to have a try! Good journey!
