worth a visit. 1. the Adress has changed ! Check the website adress is 30 Cua Dong Str.2. nice and reasonable priced massage (1hr Thai for 310.000 Dong = 15 USD)3. clean rooms & showerwould come back..

A lovely spa experience. I went to SF spa for a Thai massage and pedicure, and was very happy with the service. The new premises are beautiful and amazingly quiet inside for central Hanoi. The staff were smart, skilled and professional and the prices were very reasonable. They will pay for your cab there, and arrange one to take you back. I'd be more than happy to go back if we were staying longer!

A great start, but dissapointing. As soon as you step in SF Spa you are delighted. It is beautifully furnished and the ladies at the counter are caring, smart and organised.Unfortunately as soon as we got up stairs for the massage we were disappointed. Noise (from a staff dining room?) came pouring in from the room next door. People came in and out throughout the massage. The massage itself was too soft - even after repeated request for it to be harder.We came out frustrated. Not relaxed.My partner and I both had the aromatherapy massage and it was very, very average. We would not go back and would not recommend to friends.

Great Relaxing Massage at a Reasonable Price. SF Spa is a great place for a massage in Hanoi. It is a proffessionally operated Spa & the staff are great. I had a two hour Aromotherapy masssge & left refreshed. There are several options available & i would highly reccommend SF Spa if you want a top quality massage.

out of this world. stepping into a sanctuary in ha noi was going to the SF Spa.The service was exceptional.reception staff had good grasp of english and were helpful.had a aroma therapy type massage with Ms Dinh..as someone who has a regular massage i thought SF SPA was in the top 3 massages i had received in my life so we went back almost every day when we were in ha noi.highly recommended.although there may be cheaper places to have a massage, or other treatments the SF SPA was top of the range of spas in Vietnam and worth a few extra dollars to have a proper focussed and beneficial massage in highly hygienic and tranquil setting.no trip to ha noi should be without a visit to SF SPA.thank you to all the staff for my de-stress especially Ms Dinh.Dr Karen ProwseSydney Australia

Nice place, pretty good massage, but sub-par mani-pedi. If I had to rate the venue, I would give it a rating of 4 -- pretty nice, by local standards, and I didn't notice any issues with cleanliness (though that could be because I was straight off a red-eye flight and half-asleep).The massage I would also give a 4 -- not the best I've had, but above average.The mani-pedi, however, is most certainly sub-par. Though the pedicure is called "spa pedicure" which usually implies not only a thorough scrub, but also wrap/paraffin/extra treatment, none of that was included, and the scrubbing of toes was insufficient. The cuticle treatment and nail polish application also weren't given sufficient attention.

Just what we needed!. Our hotel recommended this place to us. We both had a full body massage and it was really good. It is clean, professional and friendly. They even give you a box to put your valuables in during your stay, and you keep the key until you're finished.

Give this place a miss - don't waste your time. The entrance to this place looks really nice and clean... they ask you to choose your treatment and pay up-front, so we did. We then went upstairs and were shocked to see that it was actually quite dirty.... too late, as we had already paid. The actual treatment (75 min hot compress massage for US$30) was passable. However, it only went for 60 mins (not the paid for 75 mins) and the masseuse was clearly in a rush and didn't seem to take care in her work. When she was done, she just stood there waiting for me to get changed and leave. I felt like an animal in the zoo being stared at... It was all very uncomfortable and did not feel relaxing at all. It's cheap so I guess I couldn't have expected more... but I wouldn't go again.

Good staff, great price!. I found this place much better than in most reviews: clean, nice staff, good treatments and compared to Sweden: so cheap! Me and my friend had already decided to have massage, facial treatment and pedicure. Maybe that is why they did not try to sell more... Since we stayed there for three hours, they gave us dinner for free.We had to share room which was OK since we know each other, but that would of course not be nice with a stranger.There are much cheaper spas in Hanoi, but also more expensive. To us this was very nice for that cost.

Very pushy sale person and not so clean. Save your time!. We went there by referral of our hotel. Despite reading some negative review from Tripadvisor, we give it a try. What a waste of my afternoon!. We made reservation, still have to wait for 45 min. The sale ladies are extremely pushy trying to sell you more and more, and won't quit despite we insist. She tried to convince me that I "really" need a 90 min versus 75 min massage to cover my body (I am 5'5" and 140 lbs!).By the time I get into the room, the table/towel did not look clean, and I have to share the room with another guest, who is taking a shower, and his clothes were left on the chair. It is feel kind of cheesy, so I walked out of that place!

Wouldn't go back. Massage was OK but the hard sell was enough to put us off. We had decided which massage we would like (4 adults & 4 young adult children) but the hostess was extremely pushy and kept trying to sell us other products and a longer time. At the end there was a disagreement with the price as in the middle of the massage of 2 of the children they were asked if they would like oil. As they had chosen a massage with oil they said yes but when it came time to pay apparently they had used a aromatherapy oil which cost a lot more and were charging for it. No water was given before or after the massage. Not a relaxing experience

Amazing experience. We were afraid about this spa cause of the bad reviews, but it has been one of the best massages of my life.After a steam bath they continued with a traditional massage with herbs. Awesome!!!!It's an excellent experience with a reasonable price

No complaints!. I am suprised by all the bad reviews here! I went to this place twice, and both times it was good massage and nice staff.The staff greeted me at the door, everyone with a friendly smile on their face. When I was asked about which treatment I wanted, the girl sort of recommended the longer/more expensive treatments but hey! it´s Vietnam. After saying that I was sure about my choice, she accepted it without any problem. The massage room may have been old (wasn't really looking around), but the bed was good and covered with new towels. It had aircon and ambient music, and noone bothered us. The masseuses where not very good in speaking english, but they frequently asked to make sure I was OK, and when they saw me being in pain they went easier on me. (There is some pain involved in both of my treatments..)First time I tried the Thai oil massage, and it was just as hard and painful as they said it would be, but very pleasant afterwards. Today I tried the hot stone massage, and that was good too. Overall I would recommend this place!

Skip this place. Our experience with this place was not good. The brochure and lobby make it appear fairly upscale but once you pay and are escorted upstairs you realize that it is not that clean. The room was quite cold, which made for a somewhat uncomfortable massage, and there were people constantly coming and going from the room, which made for not the most relaxing experience. Also, be ready for a serious up-sell - you will be pestered to buy a more expensive package no matter which one you select. We said "no thanks" a number of times, but the hard sell felt pretty unrelenting. Then they really gouged us with unnecessarily high fees to pay with a credit card and a terrible exchange rate when we opted instead to pay in USD (which was very common and easy elsewhere in Vietnam). It's not expensive, but you get what you pay for...Later on during our stay in Hanoi, we went to the spa at the Hanoi Elegance (Diamond) hotel, which was a far far superior experience. We loved Vietnam and Hanoi but SF is a place to avoid.

Very good spa. I had a very good spa experience. The massage was very skillful. The space looks clean. The design is ok.The staff downstair is too pushy at trying to sell other products and it is unagreeable.

A joke- And not one to laugh about. I did NOT enjoy this place at all. Seeing a couple of brochures, my friends and I had our hotel call and see if they had availability for 4 people. At first, we were told that we had to wait an hour so I refused. However, they called the hotel back immediately and said they had room. So we took a taxi there which they paid for. We were greeted out front by a one of their staff and she was polite. The waiting area was nicely decorated. But it goes downhill from there. The receptionist came and asked us what treatments we would like. Being pressed for time, we all selected a basic steam bath and a massage, nothing fancy. When we told her that, her entire expression changed. She became sulky and unenthusiastic. She then began to collect payment even before the session began. Then the manager came, asking us if we would like to do the jacuzzi instead of the steambath, saying that the jacuzzi could fit 4 of us. We declined and she became pushy. Insisting that this is better and we would not have to wait. I declined like 3 times more before she left us alone for abit. From there, we waited like 25 mins. She just kept saying "soon" whenever we asked. Finally, we asked her if we could just have the jaccuzi instead so we could begin. However, we still waited another 15 mins before being ushered into the room.There certainly was a lack of privacy there. The staff kept walking in and out and chatting whilst we were changing. One even pulled the towel off my friend and pushed him toward the jacuzzi. After the jacuzzi, they told us to shower off but the showers had no hot water. And since this was winter, it was pretty unpleasant.During the massage, the 4 therapists were speaking to each other and laughing loudly. I felt this was unrelaxing and disturbing. Whilst doing the thai massage, she twisted my leg in an uncomfortable position and when I moved it back, she grabbed my leg, smacked it lightly and twisted it again. Massage was mediocre but the experience was ALOT worse.At the end of the massage, the 4 therapist just stood at the side, laughing amongst themselves, not seeing if we needed anything. When we went to the counter to ask if we could call a taxi, the manager ignored us completely and occupied herself with her nails and chatting to the receptionist. When I asked again, she waved her hand to signal me to wait. The only tinge of good service was the girl who greeted us when we arrived. She was the one who squeezed behind the counter, called us a taxi and helped us to direct the driver. Maybe lonely planet was served by her, explaining the recommendation.As for the spa experience and majority of service, it stunk. Avoid this place at all costs. Go to placencare spa. It's around the same price and FANTASTIC both massage and service wise.

No frills! Mediocre at best. My partner and I went here for a massage this afternoon. She got the hot stone massage and I got the Thai massage by oil. The waiting area downstairs looks pretty nice, but is very busy and the staff is brusque and unenthusiastic. The massages themselves were decent but nothing special. The thai massage by oil was a bit misleading, in that hardly any oil was used. Everything about the place felt like it was optimized for maximum throughput, so the entire experience felt like being on an assembly line.

Great place for pampering - note that the address has changed. The SF Salon and Spa has moved to 30 Cua don Street, in the Hoan Kiem district (website sfcompany.net). If you end up at the old address in the old town area however, they will pay for a taxi (one way) for you. They will also pay for a taxi from the spa to your hotel, if you happen to make your own way there.I chose the Aroma therapy massage. It cost 430 thousand Vietnamese dong for 90 minutes. I managed to fall asleep it was that relaxing. When I visited the spa was very busy and I had to make a booking for later in the day and pay a small deposit (though one deposit appears to cover a booking for 2-3 people). So if you are in a hurry, it may pay to call ahead. There are various packages to choose from including other massage types e.g. Swedish, Thai, Shiatsu, and other choices that inlcude body wraps, manicure and pedicure and waxing. Note that if you are a bit bashful, there were two massage beds in a single room so you may be massaged next to a total stranger.

Ok but not great. I visited this spa in July 2010 for a half leg and an underarm wax. I paid full price for both services (very reasonable by UK standards but probably not by Vietnamese), it is worth asking for a discount if you get more than one treatment. Non the less the staff were relentless in trying to sell me other products and I was made to feel a bit of a cheapskate for only having two treatments. The spa is open until about 10.30 and I visited at about 9.30pm, another lady had just come out of a massage as I arrived and as soon as the door closed behind her the reception staff burst out laughing. Not really a pleasent/polite way to behave. Anyway... the entrance lobby is beautiful worthy of a good UK spa and the treatment room was clean and well laid out. The lady that performed my treatment seemed competant enough but got board of cooling the wax before applying it about half way through the treatment. I didn't get burned but it was too hot.All in all, if you want a wax somewhere clean then this is a good place to go. If you want a relaxing/reasonably priced experience look elsewhere.

SPA?. I made the mistake of not checking TA because the spa was recommended by our hotel (Charming Hotel- rated very well by TA) and by Lonely Planet.Don`t be fooled by the glossy brochure or the entrance: the place is not that nice on the other floors. I booked an aromatherapy massage, manicure SPA pedicure for $35,they put me in a room for the massage where another client was having some other treatment, so I had to ask to be put into a single room which they did: the massage itself was ok but there was an incredible amount of noise all the time coming from other rooms and people going up and down the stairs. The room`s floors were not very clean.The SPA pedicure lasted 20 mns and the manicure 10.At the time of paying they made a big deal about the credit card and so rather than waiting any longer I paid by cash with $ and they applied an exchange rate was 18.5 when anywhere else was 19 (They eventually applied the 19 rate)All in all I would not advise anyone to go.

Loved the Spa, Very Impressed!. I have been traveling in Asia for 4-months and this is by far the best massage I have come across. The 90-minute Thai massage was relaxing, deep pressure, and very respectful. I loved the room, the ambiance, the products used, and the treatment was perfect. I will certainly go back if I find myself in Hanoi!

Outstanding. Better than the massages I used to get in NYC.. I just had a 90-minute aromatherapy massage from a therapist named Lang, and I can say it was better than any of the 90-minute massages I used to get in New York City at a fraction of the price. This is a very professional outfit, different from, but as good as anything you find in the West. I'll be back tomorrow. ***Note: Their website still has their old address and old phone number. The new and only location is at 30 Cua Đong, and th listed number needs an extra 3 between the area code (04) and the number 9262032, so the complete number is (04) 39262032.

Great Spa!. I was only in Hanoi for the day but really wanted a massage. SF Salon & Spa was located right down the street from my hotel (their new address is 30 Cua Dong). I was MORE than impressed. The spa is BEAUTIFUL and peaceful and tranquil. It was wonderfully decorated..even better than some spa’s back in the U.S! I got a massage ($14) and the room was dimly lit with waterfall music in the background. It was a beautiful, safe, clean and friendly spa and I would DEFINITELY recommend it to anyone in Hanoi!I have read the other views on trip advisor and am sad to see they didn’t have the same experience. They also did not take my payment before the services (FYI: you should never pay for ANYTHING upfront)Hope this helps!

Best massage but boring pedicure!!. I would recommend the Shiatsu Massage, it was amazing. The lady was fantastic. $17 for 90 minutes, much better than the $100 massage I had in Thailand a few weeks before. Spa pedicure was rather boring, and did not last the full hour, more like 45 minutes. Still worth $14 though. Nice way to spend the afternoon

Have to agree with the previous review... Steer clear of SF Salon.. My husband and I found this place in our Lonely Planet guidebook which came with a fairly good recommendation. Upon arrival at the salon we were impressed with the decor and the quality of their brochure so we walked on in. Our payment was taken before the services had been provided and as the prices were quoted in US$ we too experienced the high conversion rate when paying in dong.We were ushered upstairs and into a single room with two massage tables and a shower in the corner. The therapists then instructed us to get undressed with no offer of a robe, towel or privacy i.e. leaving the room or at the very least turning around. They offered my husband a tiny pair of disposable underwear for modesty but then stood there staring waiting for him to change into them! I then had to ask them to leave the room before he did so. They expected me to strip completely naked and when I asked for a pair of disposable knickers they refused.During the massage the therapists spoke continuously, often laughing - I have a feeling at our expense. I found this to be distracting and extremely rude. I had left my wedding and engagement rings on during the massage and at one stage my therapist held up my hand so the other one could have a look! Once the massage was over we were told to hop in the shower together to rinse off, again without either of them vacating the room to allow for privacy. I got out of the shower first and had to walk a fair distance to get my own towel to dry off. When I then tried passing a towel to my husband so he could dry off, it was snatched out of my hand by one of the therepists and handed to him (by this time the disposable underwear were completely translucent) and then she just stood there staring at him while he tried to retain some level of modesty and dry himself off at the same time!Once the services were over and we were taken back downstairs to the reception area, we were told by the cashier that she had given us too much change and that we were now required to hand some back.Not the relaxing experience either of us were hoping for and I would recommend anyone thinking of making a stop to SF Salon & Spa to rethink that decision.

High cost, low quality, insulting service. We were sadly disappointed with the quality of services at SF Salon. The staff were unprofessional and we left with the feeling that we'd been ripped off and treated like nothing more than walking dollar signs. We went in for massage and waxing services, and we were hopeful that the salon was of good quality by the professional appearance of their brochures and their higher end pricing structure. ($27 for 2 hour massage, $17 waxing)First, we were surprised by the method of collecting payment. They collected payment in full before the services began and used an extremely high conversion rate when converting prices (listed in $) to the local currency. They charged us 17,700 dong for each dollar, which is the highest rate we've encountered and 300 more than the luxury resort we stayed at!Once the services began, my husband and I were ushered together into a single room for all our services -- even waxings! The salon workers stood by as we undressed (no privacy) and chatted with each other in Vietnamese throughout our session (rude and distracting). Worst, we were subjected to the raging sounds of the street for much of our 2 hour session. The noises from the street echoed throughout the treatment room -- including screaming children and arguing adults -- and no one did anything to address the situation.Lastly, when our services were over, we asked the manager to change a large bill for smaller ones, so that we could tip the workers. Despite communicating quite well in English when collecting our payment, the manager suddenly didn't understand our request and insisted that she would split the entire bill amongst the workers herself. We had no intention of leaving the ENTIRE bill for the workers, particularly considering the circumstances, but we had to argue to get our bill returned. We ended up just leaving the small change we had, and the workers frowned when she gave it to them -- I guess they were expecting the huge tip she was trying to gather for them the first time. Needless to say, I can't recommend this spa to anyone. The prices are high, but the service is poor. We left feeling more stressed out and uncomfortable than we were when walking in! The best spa services we received were at hotels, and although they cost a bit more, we always received great service and the relaxing experience we were looking for. Stay away from SF Salon and Spa...

Very comfortable and nice!. The overall massage skill is very good and is very comfortable you would fall asleep. Iit is kid friendly and great.
Though you need to go into an ally to find it.
Best massage ever. I asked for a 1h30 Omamori massage (Vietnamese massage), it was perfect and like a medical massage. I will definitely come back :)

What a great way to end a great vacation!. My husband and i decided to go here on our last day of vacation. After spending 3 weeks hiking and walking many many kilometers I decided to get the foot massage. Highly recommend for folks suffering from foot problems, I have plantar fascitis so the massage was amazing and helped me tremendously. My husband had the swedish massage and loved it. So happy we found this place. The blind guys and gals have such a keen sense on where your problems lie in your body. If you have the opportunity to go here please grab it. They are superb and the prices are amazing. Non-profit organization and to see these folks given the opportunity to do this service is awesome!! Thank you so much.

Wonderful Massage at this Not-For-Profit. My husband, 14 year-old daughter and I booked a Vietnamese massage here, as had decided we would start at the top of the menu and work our way through all the different massages! We had read great things about Omamori on here and weren't disappointed. We were greeted with tea and then offered a shower and robes to wear before being treated to a wonderfully, relaxing massage which left me feeling a lot looser in the back and neck area. We will back to try the Swedish massage next!

Highly Recommend. I got the Omamori Massage yesterday and couldn't be happier. The guy who did mine (Su') was really great. He felt out all the knots in my back and I walked out afterward feeling like a new person. They don't accept tips! Or donations toward their organization (Blind Link). I wish they did because the massage was so wonderful! I will definitely return.

Seeing hands. The therapists at this spa are all visually impaired, however it the doesn't make the service you get any worse, on the contrary, this is one of the best massages I have had. One hour of total bliss. Make sure you take time to visit and unwind after a busy day in Hanoi.

Best Massage EVER!. Based on reviews here we took a taxi to Omamori. The drive was better than an E ticket at Disneyland. We made it and were greeted by a lovely woman offering tea. We were given robes and introduced to our masseuses. Not sighted, they worked effortlessly and offered well-trained good pressure massage. An hour later we had 45 minute foot massages. By the end we were walking noodles. The price? For two, 30.00 US and tipping WAS NOT ALLOWED.

Good massage by visually impaired. My boyfriend and I were exhausted after a long-day outing trip so we decided to find a massage place to relax and we chose Omamori Spa. We were warmly welcomed by the smiles of the staffs and they gave us a lot of detailed advice. Finally we chose the massage services called Zen in the heart. I must say it is really great, my stress was totally disposed of. Although the therapists are visually impaired, they have keen senses, they know exactly where my pain is. I think this is the best massage place in Hanoi for relaxing and enjoying
Wonderful!!!. A great place to relax and well-trained staffs. I have tried a lot of kinds of massages but this place is much greater than my expectation. I will definitely come back here

Best massage ever. Incredible experience. I've never had anyone 'feel' all my backpains and actualy taking them away for 80%. They advised me to come back 3 times to get over my problems. Unfortunaltely i dont have time for 3 times, but i will be here for a 2nd time, just before my flight back home. Dont hessitate, just go here for the best massage ever!

Irresponsible. When I made a reservation by calling, she said that she will call me back after checking its possible.. but she didnt answer.So I call again.I finally made a reservation with my name & phone number.But when I visited today, they didnt have my reservation. I really disappointed!!My schedule today has been broken!!

Omamori massage . This is a very decent place with well-trained staff. I had the 90min omamori massage and it was very professionally done. Definitely one of the better massages I've had and I was willing to pay the slightly higher price, taking into consideration that this is a strictly no tipping place and a bigger portion of the money actually goes to the working staff and not some unknown corporation. I would definitely go back again. Highly recommended!

Highly recommend. We decided to try Omamori after reading trip advisor reviews, and we are so happy we did. We both had the 60min full body and both very satisfied. The experience was relaxing, exact pressure, and my masseur was able to find all my sore spots that needed attention. Prices are as you see them, cheap compared to other spas (190,000VND for full body 1 hour), they don't pressure or expect tips. Although not in the old quarter, I highly recommend.

relax, enjoy and help the blind.. This is a great initiative to provide some blind people with work and English classes. The people who work there are skilled masseuses and do their work at the highest level. I had a hot stone massage and my boyfriend the classic one and both of us were very happy and satisfied with it. After you come in, you have the option to shower, then you change into a robe and then you are guided to where you will be massaged. This was a great, relaxing experience for me! i delifinitely recommend it! :)

Beautiful massages - especially for the bavk. My boyfriend and I both enjoyed our massages a lot. He had a backmassage and exclaimed afterwards that 'it was the best he'd ever had'. My fullbody was good as well, but the back part was best!

Best spa in Hanoi!. I have had over 100 massages all over the world and this was a memorable experience well worth the time and money.We had a 75' hot stone massage and a 45' foot massage at Omamori Spa today. After a so so experience at one of the other highly rated tripadvisor spas in Hanoi, I decided to post this glowing review. Not only is this spa way better in terms of massage quality, it costs less too. They would be very successful if they were closer to Old Quarter, but even with the taxi ride, it still costs less than the other top spas. Their English is not great, so ask your hotel to make an appointment for you.The massage itself was highly skilled and they use a kneading shiatsu technique. Pressure was excellent and they hit all the right spots. Apparently the massage therapists see a larger share of the money even though they charge less, so you know your money is going to a good place.If I had to write some cons, it is that it is not as upscale and the distractions make it a less relaxing experience. That being said I would still take this massage over most 5 star hotel spa massages any day.

If you need to pick 1 massage in Hanoi, Omamori hits the spot! . After my 22hr flight from NY, i decided I needed a massage. After reviewing some places, decided on Omamori. Went there early just as they were opening (good thing, they started getting busy as I was leaving). It is very hard to find, I was lost and going in circles on my motorbike and than I finally saw the light, it's hidden in a alley. I went in and was greeted with a welcoming smile and gratitude. As I was seated I was given a menu of the massages and another which had their business statement about teaching and employing the blind/visually impaired. I decided on the 90min Omamori Special. I was soon escorted to the changing room where I was told to change into their pants and shirt whilst keeping my underwear on (this isnt Thailand, it's very professional). After changing I was escorted to the massage bed where I was introduced to my masseuses, and told to take of shirt but keeping the pants on (the pants do not take away from the massage, don't fret). I was asked where if I had any pain or discomfort. I explained my right shoulder and back. Woah the pressure was perfect, and the attention to my aches were spot on (my shoulder honestly felt 100% better, my back is always in pain so that's a different story). Also she performed this massage on my neck, which I had never experienced and I was a bit tentative and stiffened up as the pressure made me nervous, but after I let myself go and allowed her to work this was the best feeling. My neck felt amazing what she did was quite magical. After the massage I was given some tea to relax and wasn't rushed to pay and leave, instead was allowed to sit, rest and let the massage sink in. I felt like I needed to tip the masseuse because it was that damn good, but was assured that the masseuse get a good salary and that they don't allow tips. Amazing thank you Omamori Spa, for making the start of my Vietnam road trip in one where I wasn't stiff and in pain

Book in advance to avoid disappointment!. Went here after readng the review on TripAdvisor, boy was I not disappointed! The lady booking us in was helpful and fitted us in even though we didn't have an appointment. We had a one hour wait so went to the park opposite, Indira Gandhi Park, which was was very nice, with fishermen. The masseurs were brilliant, we had the Zen massage (recommend this). Their sense of touch was significantly better than regular masseurs due to their visual impairments so they were able to detect and quickly focus on tension areas. Everything is clean, they all speak good English and the price is excellent compared to other massages in the area. They're located off the main road, down an alleyway but you'll probably see lots of people looking for this palce as it's that good.

Great Budget Massage.. As you probably have read from numerous reviews, Omamori Spa is run by a blind owner. She was the 1st employee of the Spa. The spa is located outside the tourist area so the price is reasonable. The facility is clean with communal massage tables (4 tables in a big room and 1 private room). There's a locker & shower facility. The massage is great with enough pressure to relieve my back pain, the blind therapist is professional throughout the 90minutes session. The organization that provides the employment & training of the visually impaired community has been doing such a noble and respectable works. The front desks are attended by University student volunteers. The students do a great job in organizing the schedule for the spa. I will visit this place again when I return to Hanoi.

Can't get enough of this place!. I've been coming to Omamori Spa for three months and have had about ten massages. The price is so good! The staff are so professional and friendly. It's not the most glamorous shower facility and changing area. This doesn't bother me though because the massages here are the best I've ever had! The therapists are so good at what they do and they really like to look after you. Highly recommended!

Go. Try..... Omamori Spa. 1. Massage level : pro.. (blind)
2. Low price (No tipping)
3. Room : small
4. Shower facility : not bad.......

Great massage!. We had a few massages in Vietnam until now, but this was by far the best. The place is hard to find but worth to look for it. We had the massages "Zen in the heard" and "swedish massage". Both were great for a fair price. They do not want tip, which also means no place for "happy ending" just for a very good massage.
Great massage experience!. Had a great massage at Omamori and happy to know that I contributed to Blind Link and helped visually impaired young Vietnamese. Thank you!

Nice massage and chance to contribute to community. This is my second visit, and this time went for a longer session - which was definitely worth it. The spa trains and employs staff who are vision impaired, and don't have access to the same resources that others have. The staff work happily alongside others who have sight - and you can see that this is a workplace with dignity for all.
Special experience. This is worth the taxi trip to a unique massage at this delightful spa. The visually impaired therapists have strong hands and a gentle touch.

Must Try. The best massage my mom and I had among Thailand and Vietanam. Very professional messagers who are visually impaired. Some of them can communicate in English and most of them used body language to communicate. There are two ladies who have excellent English. They asked about the pressure. The only thing to improve is.. Gentleman and Ladies are in the same room, unisex bathroom with lock.

Excellent massage . One of the best massages I've had and I'm very fussy about my massages. My masseuse was visually handicapped but that didn't stop her from giving me a great massage. She was attentive and very polite. She could speak English too so that was a major plus point. I wouldn't say the environment is great but the massage makes up for it and more. Would highly recommend this place! Btw, I went to SF spa the previous day but this one is way better.

Highly recommended!. Me and a friend visited omamori spa during our stay in Hanoi. While the place itself is not the most glamorous, I would absolutely go back and recommend others to do so.Having read a few reviews I was slightly sceptical. The entering and leaving of the treatment room whilst having your massage is a slight interruption but for me was not a problem.The staff are so welcoming, lovely and friendly and their no tipping policy encourages ethical practice. My masseur was able to identify tensions very early on and really focuses on my problem areas. Such a fantastic massage at an extremely reasonable price!

Exellent massage. A lovely charming little place, hidden in an ally. Booked ahead an came 1 hour too early, but had a tea and enjoyed the good atmosphere. Very clean, very nice style and the best massage we have had in Vietnam. Very kind and professional. Asked about the pressure (I like that they are aware) and we felt very comfortable. Exellent english. Like the fact that they do not take tips as everyone is payed for their work. Would love to come back very often.

Expert therapeutic massage. I have been suffering from the after-effects of a fractured and dislocated shoulder for a couple of years. A colleague recommended Omamori. I was lucky to have the privilege of being treated by the manager. As soon as she started the treatment, she diagnosed by touch not only the shoulder problem but also my lifelong problems with pain and tension in the neck and shoulders. She combined traditional Vietnamese massage with the use of pressure points. I felt pleasantly achy afterwards and the next morning I could feel that the position of my shoulder had improved. I'm looking forward to going back next week.Not only an outstanding therapeutic practice, but also an ethical business which deserves support.

Special massages. Excellent massage for young teenager girl and grandmother performed by blind and visually impaired masseurs. Very relaxing and invigorating at the same time. Good to support blind employment . No tips but donation goes to support of these people. Highly recommended.

They will solve your problems!. I used to visit more then 20 spa in Ha Noi and my summary is that Omamori is the best massage in Ha Noi. They're not so focused on your relaxation as other spa, but specialist tries to feel your problem and make a deep treatment to fix it. It's not luxury and clean, but staff is very careful and therapist skills are ever some!

This place is AMAZING. we went back twice in 2 days, the massages were excellent, left us feeling really good for days. I had the same girl on both days who did a great job on my knotted up back and shoulders and my girlfriend had 2 different people she really enjoyed, the second one she said was the best massage she had in her life (masseur's name was Thang). We've been going to blind massage places throughout our trip as the massages are generally great and I think the whole concept is just brilliant in every way. Omamori was far and away the more professional and seems to have a very serious program in place for training and well fare for the blind masseurs as well as for the customers. The receptionist's are extremely fluent in English and professional. The Masseurs themselves speak much less English but it didn't matter, I came for the massage and they are excellent at that and incredibly friendly and caring.Compared to other blind massage around Vietnam Omamori was actually a clean, calming and relaxing spa style centre which was nice. The price is more than other blind massage places we went to but still incredibly cheap at 170,000 VND. They don't accept tips but you can donate to the charity and each masseur gets paid a commission from the fee as well as the money being used to further train and care for more blind people. The centre workers donate their time and training for free very kindly.Go to this place for a great massage first and to support an amazing cause second, you wont have regrets.
So relaxing I feel asleep . Amazing, was so relaxing and comfortable I feel asleep. massages were performer by blind and partially sighter masseurs. Will definitely return in the future.

Family Trip. With 8 family members and the spa having 5 beds we separated into 2 groups to have massages. The spa was very accommodating and helpful via email whilst we made our bookings. On arrival you're greeted by some herbal tea and a tranquil courtyard. The massage is done after you change into some loose clothing, I personally felt amazing. My feet felt lighter and I was less tense and sore..The rest of my family loved it too. Would definitely recommend the spa. It's got a great relaxing vibe and a chilled out group of staff who are accommodating and friendly. A definite recommendation and a great experience for my family. Will most probably try to squeeze another one in for everyone before we leave tomorrow.

A unique and unforgettable experience. . The Omamori spa is a unique experience, and one I would definitely recommend. It's about 15min drive from the centre of town and a taxi will cost $5 appx. We had no problem getting there. The blind masseuse was very intuitive, and could very quickly tell which were the problem areas for both myself and my wife. The session included both oil and hot stone massage. We had no problems with communication both for booking and during the massage, and they organised a taxi back into town. My wife has had many massages all over the world and she tells me this is one of the best she has had.

Best massage in Vietnam!. We were staying in the old quarter of Hanoi and looking for a good massage place. My boyfriend came out with this place which was way to far away from where we were, considering we wanted to find a place we'd do by walking distance. We finally took a cab and honestly, that was the best 90 min massage we had. Massages are being given by blind people, the place is nice and clean, and the price is the most reasonable we found. We wanted to go back but our itinerary didn't allow it. You can reserve just a few hours before. We had massages almost everyday during our 2-week vacations in Vietnam, and that place is our #1 choice over all the places we went to.
Amazing massage in Hanoi. Lovely little massage parlour where the masseuses were all blind. Felt so relaxed and at ease! Lovely start to our holiday!

Good massage, friendly staff. Welcomed by friendly staff before you started. Massage provided by visual impaired masseur and it is great! They speak English and will communicate with you about the strength and areas you prefer to be focused on.

Professional massage in a modest place. Our chose of Omari was based on the reviews and it was a good one! My therapist was Mr Lan and my wife's Mr Tluoc. We were in one room. One of them didn't speak English so they helped each other to communicate with us. They both had professional movements, asking if they were putting enough pressure and adjusting according to our answers. We chose the tipe of massage that we needed after consulting with the receptionist and we were pleased by our choice: swedish. The girl at the reception was nice, helpful and attentive, she was able to create good atmosphere there. Of course when you choose a place for massage not in a luxury place and for a good price you must be ready for a small shared space.
Awesome. Beautiful place, they are not totally 100% blind but their massage is GOOD. Love their attitude and the place too. But the place is very ulu.

Excellent Massage. One of the better massage places I have been to. I have seen a few reviews that say the place is hard to find, however we found it fine with a 15 minute taxi ride from the historic city centre. The prices are very affordable even with the addition of the taxi ride (~80000 VND one way). The masseurs are very skilled and the ambience is relaxing. We liked it so much that we wanted to go again but could not find the time within our packed agenda. Will definitely recommend to others.

Awesome massage at affordable price. In comparison to the other spas I've seen around Hanoi, Omamori spa is very affordable. The location can be a bit difficult to find but I got there easily via taxi. There is not as much privacy as most people would be comfortable with but overall a wonderful experience with a great massage. Will definitely return when I am back in Hanoi!

Great massage at reasonable price. Massage was excellent but some downsides.............. Pros:I had a great massage! I'd give it a 5Price was very reasonableClean facilityCons:1.I had a difficult time finding this spa located down an alley, off an alley with no signage. I stayed in Old Quarter (and it isn't close). I took a cab which cost me $5 USD over and $3 return, it was dark out, and the cab tried to leave me off early as he couldn't locate the place. I had him call and he was able to find the alley but it was strange walking down it alone in the dark, and I almost missed the place but one of the girls ran out and brought me in.2.Considering all the super reviews I felt a bit rushed upon arrival and departure. I was offered tea at both ends but then quickly escorted to massage room or front door. Dressing area is in the bathroom area which is unisex (hence one at a time and I wasn't sure if they were monitoring the door to keep others out while I used facilities). 3.Massage area is also unisex, and separated by curtains (see picture), but not at the end that people walk down, so as I was having my massage, a man was being led right by my massage in progress to the next table down).4. Lighting is dim, but conversation between masseuses and clients are audible to all.Would I return? I'm not sure. Despite a good massage and a good price, the cost of getting there, and lack of privacy might deter me.

Fabulous experience . My friend and I walked around town to see where we could get a nice massage but then decided to look on tripadvisor first. It was a great decision as we found this place and thought we should try it out as it sounds interesting and we felt like doing something smart. Anyway, we got there, the service was outrageous, massage and the whole experience just simply enjoyable and we didn't feel pushed time-wise or uncomfortable. The price was more than fair, actually way too cheap if I compare other "average" massages we had in hoi an with the service omamori spa offers. Everyone who visits Hanoi should book into at least one massage there. The location is very hard to find so take a taxi and support this place as they really deserve it.

Worth every moment in 60-minute massage <3. I have just had a great Swedish massage from Omamori Spa. I was so lucky that I had Nguyet-Omamori's manager as my therapist. She was so friendly, helpful and of course very professional. She gave me such a good massage from all parts in my body: head, neck, back, legs...within 60 minutes and I completely felt relaxed with her service. Another thing I appreciate Omamori is that they were all very caring: welcomed me with a hot cup of tea, always asked if the pressure was too hard....Thank you alot Nguyet!!! I will definitely come back to see you ;) Highly recommend!!PS: They wont receive tips but they have a donation box for the organization :D

Vietnam massage . The massage was great! My (blind) masseuse asked me where on my body to focus, if the pressure was ok and if I was feeling cold (when I answered yes she gave me a blanket).It's a bit out of the city core, and a little hard to find, but this place helps these blind masseuses, and it's really cheap (170 000VND for 60min) so I think it's totally worth it!
Best massage ever. They really read your muscle.All my muscle tensions has been located and perfectly treated.I did feel so great and relaxed afterwards.This was the best massage I ever had.

Best massage in Hanoi. I booked the SPA as a birthday present for my friend. It was absolutely incredible, the skill our therapists had was beyond the best - by mile the best massage we had in Vietnam and also was the cheapest. We loved it that much that we came back the day after. The therapists were wonderful people and we got a chance to chat to them and hear their stores - it was so touching for them to share their experiences and life stories with us. I would definitely recommend it to anyone - a fantastic place with amazing therapists and a beautiful ethos! Absolutely cannot fault it.It is a small, remotely located SPA - it is clean, quiet and serene. I see some don't like the location of it, but for us it was great to see the other side of Hanoi (non-Old Quarter) while getting there, plus it truly is a hidden little gem.

nice massage, poor location. omamori is an association that want to help blind people finding them a good job as therapist.the spa is difficult to reach, in a little alley far away for old quarter. a young and really friendly girl welcomed us with a great cup of tea. we choosed (from the "menu") the vietnamese body massage called omamori. Unfortunately you have no private space and bathroom and changing room are the same (really small) room with no sex separation. massage was nice and really lovely, with good pressure and the therapist was trained and skilled. of course is not so relaxing like a true Spa, because all beds are in the same room and also bathroom access is located in the massage room so practically you are always surrounded by other people: not only other costumer getting a massage, but also people that need the toilet and you can even hear them speaking while in the room. basically the massage is AMAZING but in this way is not so easy to relax.we paid 175000 VND for 75 min, really really cheap! good quality massage! SUGGESTED

Massage Experience. My wife and I went here Nov 4. We had our hotel call for us and book our appointments. They speak some English so as it turns out we could have done it ourselves. We took the bus from the old quarter to here which was relatively easy, we had the stops wrtiien down and they were very helpful on the bus telling us where to get off. Having address was also useful finding the location. Once there we confirmed our appointments and decided on the duration of our massage. The masseuses were very polite and did an excellent job. Overall our experience was good and I would highly recommend them. Their fees were very reasonable and they support a good cause.

Excellent SPA in Hanoi. It is so peaceful place and i think the therapist was the best technique in Hanoi.I never had that good Massage in Hanoi, When you have chance to visit Hanoi, You should visit and I recommended to have Massage call "Zen in the heart" It was great experience.

Very good massage. A great place for massage. The woman was really good, and she did a great job on my back-pain. It felt like she just knew where my troubles were. Will definately come back for more massage there.

Excellent experience at Omamori Spa. Worth spending time and sweat in locating the place. I and my husband did enjoy their professional service. Eager to recommend it to all who want some relaxation at a reasonable price during their visit to Hanoi.

The best massage. Not luxury spa. It is a bit out of the way from old quarter. Taxi cost around 85k one way, but the massage is out of this world. The place is small so call first to book an appointment.

Perfect, that's the word..... We were looking for a good massage place in Hanoi with my girlfriend. Staying in the Old Quarters, where all the backpackers guesthouses are, the massage parlors there are either expensive or dodgy...We eventually found Omamori Spa through Trip advisor and made our way to the place by taxi. The place is fairly small, quiet and well decorated. We received a few more information about the place and learned that all the therapists were blind. The massage we had was most probably the best we ever had. Every knot I had simply vanished, and I was feeling so well after it!A few things to know, just in case:-As the place is small, just drop them a call to check their availability, and make a booking. -Omamori spa is ran by a Non-for-profit Organisation, therefore everything, including the prices, is transparent. Besides, you will hardly find cheaper for such a great time spent within their therapists hands.-All their therapists, although blinds, speak english pretty well. Do not be shy to tell them exactly what you'd like them to stress on.

Clean, professional, safe and satisfied!. I got the aromatherapy full body massage ($17 US) and my fiancee got a facial ($17 US), each lasting an hour. We were greeted with green tea and a fresh pair of sandals. We got beds next to each other in a dark room with 4 other empty beds (Saturday afternoon at 2PM).Our experience was fantastic! Extremely relaxing and professional. A little more expensive than other local spas, but well worth it. We'll be headed back soon.

Best massage I've ever had!. Everything about Omamori Soa is such a great experience. The Sapa itself is a small, intimate place but we're neat and professional. You're welcomed by lovely, friendly staff, given tea and then you pick from a choice of massages.The masseurs themselves are fantastic, they're very friendly, understanding of your needs and speak good english.It is also extremely good value!I've already been twice and would infinitely go again.

Is a beautiful weather today, but they cant see. There are many blind people on the street begging for mercy. But this team of people make an effort to pick up a skill and help NOT only themselves but other blind people too.Consider this as a good will charity and in return, a stress free muscle. How good it is? 2 birds, 1 stone..Note: They don't accept Tips, but you can always put some money on the donation box.
The best Spa in Hanoi.. The best Spa in Hanoi. All therapists are very experienced and the place is very nice, quiet, and relaxing. Has very reasonable package.

Best massage place in Hanoi. Excellent masseuses that do a an amazing job of massaging and taking care of you. Friendly service and calm atmosphere. Highly recommend and the prices are reasonable compared to other places.

Fabulous massage - worth the cab from the Old Quarter!. Lovely atmosphere, incredible massage, great price and good cause! A cab from the Old Quarter cost about 70,000. Calling to make an appointment was very easy.

Unique Spa Experience. This was a very different spa/massage experience. All of the masseuse's are blind. My entire family went for a 60min massage and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. This is a little hard to find as it is down an alley but once you are there, it is worth the journey. The front of house staff are all sighted and were very professional. if you are in Hanoi and looking for a different spa experience, try this.

Brilliant massage and great price. Had an amazing massage here, a full body 60 minute Vietnamese massage did just the trick. Highly recommended, very skilled and relaxing visit. With a family of 4 we were all very happy and were able to get a massage all at the same time with no waiting around.Considering the price my expectations were exceeded. A very nice location, a cab ride out of Hanoi Old Quarter.

Loved my massage. My family and i went for a massage. We took our 16 yr old son& 20 yr old daughter. It was great that they were able to give all four of us a massage at the same time. The way that the rooms is cut up by the silk curtains, it gave both are kids a sense of comfort knowing we were right next to them. My massage was fantastic. I would absolutely recommend it. The location was about a 20 minute cab ride, and the fare was 70,000 to 80,000 from the lake in the old quarter. The location was a little hard to find for our taxi driver- so note that the alley way is half way down the block.
Amazing fingers!. Great massage. Simple but honest place with great professionals. Loved the zen massage. Remarkable command of English

The massuers here massage with their hearts!. The massuers here massage with their hearts. Their sincerity makes the trip worthwhile. There are only three types of massages, omamori, sweddish and stone. We took the omamori 95min for 250,000 dong. Totally enjoyed it. This price is less than half of what we paid in the Old Quarters (see my review on another spa in old quarters) and the massage was a lot better. We took bus 9 from the Old Quarter to Omamori, takes only 25-30minutes. Once you alight, cross the road and walk into a laneway beside a cafe. You can use google map to find the exact route the bus will take. It will help you know which stop to stop at.

Feelgood!. I love this place! Friendly and professional people in a relaxed atmosphere where you can enjoy the feeling of being pampered while supporting a good cause. I tried the 90 min Omamori massage(250 000 VND), a good combination of relaxation and taking away tension by using pressure points - it was amazing!! The feeling of lying there listening to tender piano music while all the tension was going away..

Totally relaxed after a 90 minute massage. Took bus number 9 from the lake in Old Quarters and despite not knowing a single word, we were able to reach this massage place. Tucked in a small alley, the spa provides a cosy and comfortable atmosphere to its customers. The massuers were very professional and they were fantastic in their skills. Well worth a visit!!

Could be better. I and my girl friend visted ..........Spa in June. After having read so many wonderful reviews on tripadvisor, we had expected more than what we got. Upon arrival, we were asked to wait for 5 minuters. In fact, they leave us at least 10 minutes without any explaination. The massage was ok but therapist's english was poor. Overall, the ambiance was nice, everything was clean. A good spa but it can be better.

Brilliant. I had the Omamori Vietnamese Massage and it was really VERY GOOD, I felt that all the pain in my tense muscles have vanished.
Look for Hoa, he is really BRILLIANT and you will definitely thank me for recommending him. :)

Awesome massage~recommend. Pleasant & relax ambience. An experience to explore in Hanoi. Despite on the location which is a little challenging, they provide good service and cheap packages. Overall experience is excellent.

Wonderful experience. Please support this wonderful spa. They do wonderful work working with Blind Link, and I had a fantastic massage. I went back a couple of days later for another one. The staff were professional and warm. If your hotel is near Hoàn Kiếm Lake, hop on bus #9 (7000 VND, ticket bought directly on the bus, either direction, it makes a loop). It takes about 25-30 minutes, depending on traffic.
Absolutely wonderful experience. I had one of the best massages at Omamori. The masseuse was skilled and friendly. Great value for money and all for a good cause. Highly recommended!

A true massage. Firstly thanks to previous reviewers for their advice on getting to Omamori. We caught a cab the first time, then simply stepped outside and caught the No 9 bus back to the Old Quarter. The next day I was confident enough to catch the bus both to and from our hotel in the Old Quarter. The bus ride was easy, interesting and cheap, not to mention novelty value for the locals on the bus.Now to the massage - Omamori delivered the real deal - a genuine, expert and therapeutic massage. The masseuse asked if I preferred a strong massage, and then delivered it expertly. He knew exactly what areas needed attention and focused on those. Pure bliss, after having received some rather perfunctory massages at other establishments. I will visit Hanoi again and Omamori will be one of the reasons why. Yes, it was that good!On my second visit I had a lovely chat with one of the volunteers whilst I waited. I used the online booking system, and highly recommend this spa for its efficient, clean and friendly service and the most wonderful and well priced massage you could wish for.

Great massage. We found out about this place from another guest at our hotel. The massage was way better than the one we received from SF spa and we preferred the atmosphere. From the old quarter it is just a cab ride away. I really enjoyed the music they played during the massage.

Fantastic 90 min massage for $10 USD.. One of the best massages of my life. The facility is not fancy but is clean and comfortable. The staff is very friendly. You are not allowed to tip anyone but you can donate some extra money in a shoe box if you choose too. The shower facilities were a bit small and awkward. Next time I go I think I will shower beforehand and bring a little smock to wear while waiting for the massage ( the pajamas provided to change into were comically small on my American sized body). Truly loved the experience overall and highly recommend it.

One of the best massage I've ever had!. I went to Omamori Spa with my fiance yesterday. We booked via email and surprisingly they confirmed it pretty fast. I even changed my treatment's time and still the gave such a quick response. It is not hard for me to find this location, just look at alley 5 once you arrive at the address, walk and the first building on the right is Omamori Spa. They put a small blue sign at the front of the alley, makes it easier. The spa building is very small but very comfortable. Don't trust the pictures you see because the real one is beautiful. Yes, the privacy is lack here but I didn't have any problem at all with that, since the room is not bright. They set quite a cheap price here, and with that price you will get a VERY GOOD massage. I had one of the best massage in my life yesterday. This lady massaged me with techniques that I haven't had before. So relaxing and my body feel so light afterwards. I feel like I will come back again soon before I leave Hanoi. Such a great value. I left a donation for them at the end because I was very happy with their service and I wish many people will do the same thing since they don't accept any tip. :)

Great massage for a good cause. Getting here is easy. If you're staying in the Old Town (which you probably are) take the number 9 bus from the north shore of Hoan Kiem Lake and get off at Huỳnh Thúc Kháng. Look for alley 5 (Ngo 5) opposite the park. A cab will cost perhaps 100 000 VND, but why do that when you can take the bus for 7 000?The massage is amazing. I had a 90 minute Swedish massage for 200 000 VND (roughly 9-10 USD or 7-8 EUR). The staff working there are fantastic and speak excellent English. The masseur will make sure you're comfortable and that he's applying the right amount of pressure.They have changing rooms with showers and lockers where you can keep your stuff during the massage.I can't recommend this place enough.

Soothing. This was my second visit to Hanoi in 2014 and a return to Omamori Spa. This time I had a 90-minute hot stone massage and it was wonderful. She worked on my back for a good thirty minutes just as I had asked, then proceeded to use numerous relaxing, smooth hot stones that nearly put me to sleep. It's a somewhat small massage room, with 4 tables in one room divided by floor-to-ceiling curtains, but that did nothing to hinder the experience. It was very quiet, with calming sounds coming from the audio system as well as the comforting fragrance from the room's diffuser. All in all it was another great massage experience from a visually impaired therapist (which you would never know). Enjoy!!

Great massage!. I loved this place from the first impression to last. Very professional welcoming from the staff and the place is neat, tidy and has a peaceful atmosphere. The changing room with showers is quite small, so if I would have been there with strangers I would have been uncomfortable but I was alone in there so it was ok. There was one other person having a massage on the bed next to me - so I can address the comment earlier about not having privacy. I felt that my masseuse ensured my privacy at all times by helping me cover up with towel/sheets. There were double curtains between the beds, so I actually could not tell if it was a man or a woman in there. The massage was great, from first touch to last! My masseuse was really attentative and professional. Over all a great experience!I would recommend it to anyone, except if you are really uncomfortable with the privacy part concerning the curtains in between the beds.

Great Massage!. This place is out of the way if you are staying in the Old Section of Hanoi as I was. I took a half hour taxi ride there with a driver that did not speak English. He had a difficult time finding the place and just wanted to drop me off. I did not let him do that and he eventually brought me to the correct address. My massage therapist worked extremely hard! I had an 1-1/2 deep tissue massage and was sore for a few days after the massage. I get massages on a regular basis. Almost every single massage therapist quits working on my problem areas before the muscle has been released, but not my massage person at Omamori. I was very happy with the massage and am happy I took the taxi to this business. Not only was I supporting a good cause, I got an awesome massage. I was a little chilly however, because the therapist never put a sheet over me....just a little towel. Not sure why that happened. I was totally exposed, but what he heck, he was blind. If you are a modest person or like high-end spas, you may not like this spa. You are only separated from others getting massages by a curtain. But, it was a great massage at a very inexpensive price. Check it out!

Fairly good service but little privacy. Positives : - Masseuse was attentive, amiable and polite- Nice ambience and massage in a quiet room- Support for a good cause- InexpensiveNegatives :- Do not expect much privacy here. Treatment room is open to both sexes, with each of the four massage beds only partially hidden from view by curtains (if you take up any of the first three beds in the room, expect to have both male and female customers walking pass/looking at you at any time). Same for shower/locker room - unisex shower cubicles with only a filmy curtain to offer you a wee bit of privacy - Difficult to locate spa location and NOBODY on the main street knows its location. A TA photo posted some time ago indicates that the alley is next to Queen Café. This shop signage has been changed and currently shows a Vietnamese name. If privacy does not matter so much to you and you're keen to try this spa, I would suggest that you focus on locating Alley no 5 (known locally as Ngo 5) first when you reach Huynh Thuc Khang St. Once you're in Alley no 5, you'll find the spa on your first right.

Amazing massage. My partner and I had the best massage we have ever had at this amazing place. It is a little out of the way from the main tourist area but well worth it. The blind massage therapist was extremely professional and I felt very comfortable during my 90 min hot stone massage. We felt like we were walking on air when we left. All this for only 200,000 dong (£6.50 each!). No tipping is allowed although you can leave a donation for the foundation. Not to be missed!

Amazing massage for a real good price. Went during winter. The receptionist recommended the omamori package for my backaches. The masseuse was a woman who was slightly visually impaired. She was courteous, and could speak a little English. She hit all the acupoints, and my back has never felt better! What's more the prices are amazing. It's a little hard to find as it's behind a small alley, but if you're looking for a good massage at a real good price, you want to try this.

Brilliant massages in town !. Recommended by a Russian friend, I came to this place to use their services. I've been to many massage places in town and really into Body Massage. Omamori Spa did not let me down. They are running a big Winter Promotion from Nov so that seems to be a perfect timing for us. We booked 2 slots with Omamori Body Massage for 75 minutes. The place itself is pretty easy to find and they have a big parking lot as well. Came to the place you will feel relaxed by their fragrance oil all over the Spa and warmly welcome by the receptionist. She speaks a good English and very friendly, helpful. The guy who did the body massage for me was blind and can hear from one of his ear only but he was an brilliant masseur I've ever met. His service was exceptionally good. Thanks to the Winter promotion we only have to pay 160.000 VND ( US$8) for a 75" body massage and no tips are allowed here. I felt really satisfy with their services and will definitely recommend it to all my friends and family.

Excellent massages and good cause. My husband, 13yr old son and I visited the Omamori Spa having googled "good spas in Hanoi" - we were not disappointed. Although a tad difficult to find in the dark the small centre was delightfully laid out and the quality of the massages excellent. Best to book as only about 6 beds, no tipping policy is adhered - we all had the Omamori Special 60 minutes and only wish we had had time to go back. Highly recommended.

Great massages and a good cause. I went to Omamori Spa two days in a row during my trip to Hanoi. The first day it was 90 minutes of hot stone massage and the next day I had 90 minutes of "Omamori Special". While the hot stone massage was great, the Omamori Special was even better.Omamori Spa is a not for profit that trains employs blind and visually impaired people in massage. I liked how they did not allow tips as they believe the masseur/masseuse's income should come from the standard price.As the place was not very busy when I went there, I had the opportunity to chat with one of the masseurs and some of the support staff. I found these conversations very rewarding and they are very happy to practice their English.

The Best. You can believe all of the fantastic reviews. I am not a big massage fan but my husband has one almost every day when we go on holidays and we both agreed this was the best massage we have ever had. My hubby went with a 90 minute Omamori massage and I had a 90 minute Swedish massage. It cost us about 400k ($20 usd) for both! The only thing I can complain about is the fact we aren't allowed to tip! We did make an extra donation to the foundation though. Can thoroughly recommend to anyone who wants a fantastic massage whilst in Hanoi.

Wonderful experience!. After reading all of the other great reviews I decided it must make the trip, stoked I did! Very professional, great technique & a very relaxing massage.Take the time to make the trip, you won't regret it!

A beautiful massage for a beautiful cause. I choose for the hot stone massage and it was excellent. The lady who massaged me had very good skills and knew exactly what to do.The only thing I didn't enjoy was the temperature in the room due to the AC. I was very cold during my hot stone massage. I mentioned it a few times but nothing happened, I think they didn't understand me.

Really nice spa for a good price. The spa is located far from the commercial centre of Hanoi so we took a taxi. We got some tea and a shower before the massage. That was really nice. The massages were really good and professional. The prices are very low. We also loved the fact that this is a NGO. The only two remarks are that the massageroom was noisy (streetnoise - music) and one of us got the wrong massage (not the one we ordered). The massage however was really good! Everybody should go here and support this NGO.

What a lovely place to get a massage in Hanoi!. I went for a massage and foot reflexology today and it was lovely. I didn't want to leave! The man who did my massage was lovely and very skilled. The spa was beautiful and the atmosphere was very calm and relaxing. If you are in Hanoi, get a massage here. It was a wonderful "last day" activity to do in Vietnam.

Massage with a message. As others have stated you can have one of the best massages in Hanoi and give supprt to a good cause -so we both win.What I like about here and the other massage centre operated by partially sighted masseurs is that they are grounded in acupressure. I had a particularly good message last time I visited.If nothing else -give it a go -you will not be disappointed. Best not to have the couch nearest the door!

Simply, super!. This has been one of the most wonderful massaging experiences I have ever had, and I am a "heavy user". I cannot say more, than go there, experience it and enjoy. Very professional service that concentrates on your aching body parts. A reservation is advisable, since the place has limited treatment tables. To get there, taxi is one option (location a bit further from the tourist centre), but the bus 18 goes right by. You can ask the name of the bus stop when you make the reservation.

Worth travelling for a fantastic massage at a great price. Not only is this for a worthy cause, training up blind and visually impaired masseurs, it was a fantastic massage. Worth every penny of the £6 or 400 VND it cost us for a generous 90 mins massage. I had my first foot massage, very interesting, and a back massage, while my husband had a full deep tissue Ormamori which really loosened up a few stiff joints. In addition to the massage it cost 85-95 VND for a taxi from the old quarter. Look at the photos and take careful note of the address for the taxi driver as it is a bit tricky to find. The address as we would lay it out is Alley 5, 102 Bl Huynh Thuc Khang Street. 102 is down a wide, open to the sun alley (alley number 5) next to 103. Take the first right down the alley and it's on the corner. Great, modern facilities, English spoken, and, no, the masseurs we had did not feel as they they were in training, they felt top notch. Thank you.
Perfect time there. Best place for a massage in Hanoi, went there twice and always pleased.People are welcomming and the service is really high quality.You can go there without hesitations.

Best massage ever. I have done many massage and this is the best experience. 9/10. You get an amazing massage at an affordable price and more importantly, doing a good cause. I tried the hot stone massage ($250k). Was a little afraid before, but the staff was professional to explain everything. Service was perfect. Staff spoke good English. They remembered us as some of us visited before. My masseuse even asked me which part of my body was pain, to recommend the right treatment. Location, maybe be hard to find. It is located in an alley. Get a reliable taxi driver and you should be fine.

Best massage in Hanoi. I found this place through TripAdvisor. I go to Hanoi frequently for business and get a lot of massages - this was by far the best. The only one where the masseuse actually seemed to understand about the problems of the body, and not just be following a rote. I got more benefit out of my massage here than any other. And it is such a good cause - helping to support livelihoods for blind people. It is a little difficult to find, but follow the instructions and photos listed here and you will make it. It is about a 15-20 minute taxi ride from the Old Quarter, but totally worth it. They will also make house calls, but I have not tried this.

Amazing Massage. I did the Omamori Massage and it was 150.000 dong (around $7).I had an amazing full body massage from a blind man and I couldn't recommend any place more.They have a no tipping policy but you can and should at any time make a donation to Blind-Link as it is clearly a great cause > blindlink.org.vn

Amazing!!. This was the most beautiful experience.
Beautiful venue, amazing service, brilliant massage!
I would recommend this to everybody! Great value for money!

The best massage ever experienced. OMG this was seriously the best massage ever experienced. Deep tissue, painful at times but gone are all knots and niggles for the first time I can remember!
Better than any other spa in Hanoi and less expensive too!

Best spa in Hanoi. Wow I wouldn't consider looking any where else. This spa is amazing they are extremely professional and very kind. The most amazing thing here is the spa is a non profit organisation that trains young people who are blind to become massage therapists. When they have graduated they are then able to get a job working in the spa which gives them there own independence. I had a 2 hour massage which was amazing, so relaxing.I recommend you ring and book a appointment tel: 0437739919Easy to find its in the small street next door to the radio and television studio 102 Ngo 5 B1 huynh thuc khang, Dong Da, Ha NoiOr check out there website www.blindlink.org.vn/spa. Facebook: Omamori SpaBy the way no one has asked me to write this review they 100% deserve it. Go on book now and Enjoy!!!

Good Cause to Massage!. Good quality massage by visually impared masseuse. High recommended. 1 hour feet massage & 75 mins body massage cost us only VND280,000 (US$13!). We also gave quite abit of donations on top of that as I really want to support such good cause. There is a no tipping policy in this place. Really enjoyed myself thoroughly here and would definitely urge massage lovers to visit this place!Tips on getting to this place as we had alot of difficult finding this place:1) Tell the taxi driver the abovementioned address: No.102 Huynh Thuc Khang Street, Dong Da 2) When you alight, you will see shop no. 102 is selling CDs. Omamori Spa shares the same address as it is behind this shop. No point asking the people there as they seem to be clueless that this place exists. 3) You will spot a black background sign "Queen Cafe". Walk down the alley on the left beside it and it will lead you to the Spa. Discerning eyes will spot the small tiny blue Omamori sign on the left side of the alley wall. (See my pictures for clearer explanation)

Very nice, polite and clean place. Loved the place.. And as a foreigner i LOVE the no tip policy - there is no one expecting you to give XX$, so you do not have to feel guilty about not tipping western style.Friendly attitude and good English speaking people.When you go down the Alley, do not feel you are in the wrong place - at the first intersection the place is right on your right hand.

Well worth the taxi ride. I would encourage all massage lovers to go here. Taxi of approx. 100000 dong from old quarter. The spa is very nicely and simply set out. The staff are very professional and no tipping is allowed. My husband and I had the 90minute vietnamise massage with hot stones and we agreed it was the best massage we have ever had and we have had many in many countries. The atmosphere is very quiet and calm no chattering by anyone. I have a problem with stiff neck and tense shoulders and tonight I feel like a new woman and my husband says he feels as if he has a new back. First time customers get a discount it cost us 300000dong all up.Thank you Omamori Spa and wish you good luck in your worthwhile venture.

Good Value, Great Service!. I was looking for a professional massage while on business in central Hanoi and came upon Omamori Spa. It was an excellent choice. This spa exclusively employees both men and women who are visually impaired. The location is easily found, the facility is clean and comfortable, and the therapist was extremely professional. It was the best massage I've ever had, so good I returned two more times while in Hanoi. Not only did I feel refreshed when leaving, but I felt good about supporting this business. The blind and visually impaired of Hanoi have a positive career track to follow. Point of interest: tipping is not expected or ALLOWED!

Wonderful Massage. Omamori Spa is run by Blind-Link (See Blind-Link Volunteerism), a non-profit that provides employment, support and training opportunities for the Vietnamese visually impaired community. My 60 minute massage was one of the best I've ever had, and I've had 100's over the years. The facility is tucked well away off a busy street so the studio environment is very quiet and relaxing. They offer several types of massage at prices that are very reasonable. I have to say that I felt like royalty while I was there. Both male and female visually impaired therapists are available. They have a place to change and shower as well. Don't miss stopping by for a 60, 75 or 90 minute treatment session when you're visiting Hanoi. You won't regret it!!

Peaceful and relaxing massage. What an excellent place to have a massage! Omamori Spa has a warm and inviting ambiance that begins with a hot cup of tea in a beautiful waiting area and courtyard. From there, I was given more information about the great non-profit and visually impaired massage therapists. They have a few different types of massages to choose from and the staff speak enough English to explain everything in detail. I had a one hour massage and the massage technique is wonderful!
