Wonderfully Relaxing Experience. I went to this spa on my last day in Hanoi. I was quite happy with the entire experience. The tea they offered was very delicious and the full body massage I received was very good. I had done a motorbike tour in northern Vietnam the week before, so my back was feeling quite stiff. The therapist was able to work out all the kinks in my muscles. I left the spa feeling rejuvenated and relaxed.Overall, my experience here was excellent and I would recommend this place if you're looking for a great spa in Hanoi.

Wow, best massage all year. Got back in the evening in Hanoi from a 4 hour shuttle tour. Researched somewhere good and close to get a massage. Found my way to Mido spa, greeted at the door by a warm employee, offered a seat and a tea. After a few minutes deciding chose a 1 1/2 hr aromatherapy massage. It was getting a little late, around 10pm, but after a little more waiting was shown up stairs. Grateful to get a time, even without a bookingThe massage girl was brilliant, right amount of pressure on areas. The next day I took my partner back to get a massage for herself and the day after that she booked a 3.5 hr treatment. This place isn't the cheapest in Hanoi but safe and super clean, with great staff and facilities. Book early

Professional service, high quality massage. We lucked out and were able to walk in without an appointment. There was another couple five minutes after us who were invited back in an hour. From arrival to departure the service from staff was friendly yet very professional. We had a couples massage in two adjacent beds. The rooms were very slightly air conditioned - the masseuse was very diligent to ensure this was kept not too cold, and not too warm. The masseuse was very attentive throughout the entire hour and the massage was superb (my partner said it was as good as she has had back home. it was my first sweedish massage)

Aromatherapy massage. Uan was a great massage therapist-very thorough and strong. Quite relaxing and my body feels great! The only thing I would change would be that they put another customer right next to me during the massage. If he would have been quiet, fine, but I could hear moaning and snoring at times. The background music did help.

Good value. Me and my girlfriend scoped the internet for a good place for me to have a massage and her to have a wax (full leg and bikini) It was good value and we would recommend it even if they missed a few hairs on my girlfriend she was very satisfied afterwards. Would definitely go back.

Nice Spa, good massage and good prices. We booked 1h body massage in this spa after reading good reviews.A lot of shops are closed during Tet holiday (New Lunar Year) so it was great to find out they were open.The massage was good and not expensive. The atmosphere of the spa was nice and we enjoyed it.

Most beautiful experience in my trip . I can t say in enough words how much I loved this place, the owner and the person who massaged me, there is such an amazing good energy that completely helped me recover from a fall I had in the water when swimming in healing bay. They were so attentive, warm and with so much good energy that I am sure every person that goes through Hanoi should come at this place and let themselves be transported..

Had a good time but a bit expensive. The place offers many different types of massages. I and my wife tried out a new type of massage we have never experienced before and it was enjoyable.But it was a bit expensive.

Great day at the spa. I had a massage, facial and foot massage here after a long flight. Staff was amazing, they were able to cater to a few extra services without an appt which was also great. Found the upgraded facial a bit much, the mini would have been fine, but it was nice either way.Surprised the 1.5hr massage didn't include a foot massage, which is why I added that. Prices were great and I would highly recommend.

Not to discourage people from having a facial but this my experience. Having arrived in Hanoi very early in the morning and extremely tired from the uncomfortable trip by train from Sapa we (my husband and 25 year old son) decided that a full massage in a spa would revive us while waiting to check in in our Hotel.We found Mido Spa on trip advisor and due to the excellent overall rating we walked in. The reception was very good, we were welcomed with a very refreshing tea while waiting for the masseurs to arrive.We were taken to a room with three beds separated by a curtain. The room was not at all attractive but it does not matter when your eyes are supposed to be closed.We started with a sauna, the three of us were asked to go and seat in a cramped shower inside a toilet where we were blasted with unbearably hot steam. I have never had a sauna before but I was not expecting it to be so uncomfortable, I had to leave before the end. The sauna was then followed by a full massage which included a full facial. The massage was pleasant but the girls never stopped talking to each other in their own language and I found this very annoying especially when you are trying to relax.The facial came last but turned out to be a disaster, they used a towel to rub, and rub and rub energetically around my eyes and a strong suction pump to clean the pores. At the end of the 2 hour session we dressed up and went back to reception were we given a meal treat and a souvenir gift.When we finally checked in at the hotel I looked at the mirror and realized I was bruised around the eyes and on the nose. The red bruises lasted for more than one month and I am not sure if they were due to the suction machine they used to clean the pores or the pressure of the rubbing with the towels or even an allergy to some substance they had used to lubricate the skin or the bleach used to wash the towels. All I can say is that it has been very uncomfortable for the whole duration of the trip and only now, a month later, it seems to have settled. I do not want to discourage people from having a facial at the Mido Spa but I feel it is right to share my experience.

Great value, much needed foot massage. My girlfriend, her friend and I were greeted at Mido by a friendly English speaking woman who then got us tea. They came for their SECOND aromatherapy massage here, which they wouldn't stop raving about, this time for 2 hours. Apparently they do stuff with the hot stones you always seem to see in stock photography but never do.. Yeah they did that and it was less than $35 USD.I got the 1 hour foot massage for 240k vnd (about $10) and absolutely loved it. After walking all over my "dogs were barking" and it was a serious recharger. She even did my arms and shoulders briefly toward the end. Believe it or not, it's not the cheapest way you could go but you certainly get what you pay for and the value is definitely there as they know what they're doing.

Good massages and a retreat from the rain. We needed somewhere to go on a cold and rainy day and this place was very near to our hotel so we both went for a 1 hour Swedish Massage. We were given hot drinks, then the usual foot washing before heading up about 4 flights of stairs to the room. Our ladies were very friendly and were happy to adapt their pressure to our requirements. I admitted to feeing the cold when asked, so they brought us hot pads for where we needed them. The hour passed all too quickly. More hot drinks before paying - by credit card thank goodness.

Thanh 1 Was Amazing!. So visited just today and loved the recommendation here. Like any place, the person massaging you will make it hit or miss. My experience and that of my other friend was great.It was 550,000K VND for a 90 minute Shiatsu Massage. That's about $25 USD dollars. Now I know it's that that incredible $10 USD massage you been hearing about in some reviews but this place is clean, service is good and they take pride in their service as they push Trip Advisor everywhere so you know they want you to give a good review and do right by you. Most importantly, I felt it was safe. When I went there was no one else in my room because it was late at night. I got the full 1.5 hours, never felt rush and Thanh 1 did great. Here english was pretty good in that I could communicate what I wanted! She checked on my pressure and just a overall great attitude after a long day of walking and visiting. 100% legit! It was raining and we were the last customers out and they even get a taxi for us, walked us out with the umbrella and told the Taxi where to take us. Here's what I love. They know Trip Advisor is great for their business and they even asked us to review them if we liked the service. If they were a shady operation, they wouldn't take such pride in that. Thank you Trip Advisor peeps for a safe, great review of a awesome joint!

Excellent again!. In the beginning of December 2015 I travelled to Hanoi again and as in the 2 years before I visited Mido Spa 2 times for a relax after my walks through the city. And again everything was perfect: The reservations were handled professionally and there was a warm welcome in the reception. This year it was new that I could choose within a wide variety of oils for the massage. As in the years before I liked the clean and spacious massage rooms and I appreciated the possibility to take a shower in an also spacious and clean shower room. Again I received the massage from Thanh 1 (Thanh Ninh). She is able to adapt her massage style perfectly to my needs. Of course her polite, friendly and warm personality should also be mentioned. For me these features are nearly as important as her very good massage skills. All in all I spent again a very pleasant and relaxing time in this spa and I am sure I will visit it again when I travel to Hanoi the next time.

Not what I was expecting . After reading through all the reviews for this place on trip advisor, I decided I wanted a sports massage from this top rated spa. I walked in without a reservation and requested a 75 minute session. The reception staff were hospitable, offered me tea and a treatment within 5 minutes. Fantastic I thought! I had however witness the couple who stepped inside before me get told that there was no manicure services available for the lady & the the guy was going to have to share a room with me! The wife was not impressed and said that they would go elsewhere. As it turns out, there are about 5 beds per room and I was lucky to be on the end with the curtain closed. I initially wanted a herbal steam bath or jacuzzi that was offered on the menu to be told it was not available. Seems a few services on their extensive menu were not available.Now for the massage, it was anything but a sports massage. After 5 minutes I spoke to the lady who got her supervisor to help clarify the situation. Clearly the lady didn't know what a sports massage was and there for in my opinion shouldn't have been given the task. Her technique slightly improved after that however she finished the session 15 minutes early. I expressed my disappointment to the reception staff who were very apologetic, charging me only for one hour with an additional 20% off. This I thought was fair. So as my title reads, this place was not what I expected. It's a shame as there have been many who did enjoy there experience, maybe I was just unlucky on this occasion. The receptionist offered me a further discount for me to come back so I may let them redeem themselves later this week.

Attentive pedicure. I had a pedicure with a very nice lady. The place is very welcoming and has a wide range of treatments. If I had more time I would have liked to do the foot scrub and massage treatment. The only thing was that I had to ask for a machine to help dry my toes. I hope to come back for a longer session!

Loved it!. I've had a couple of massages before, but never a full spa package, so having the deluxe package was a real experience! It included a steambath (the Jacuzzi was broken, unfortunately, but the steambath was fine), the aromatherapy body massage, exfoliation, facial and foot spa. Ms. Hai took great care of me, throughout the entire 4 1/2 hours that I was there. Hai's English is quite good and she seems not only skilled (she got her massage/spa degree at a university, so she really knows what she's doing), but she seems like a genuinely nice person, too. The room was nicely decorated with dim lights, bamboo and flowers. It was a bit of a hike up the stairs to get there - by the time we got to the room, I was defintely ready for a massage! Reception was very nice, too, with hot tea upon arrival and lemon drink at the end. My husband also had a body massage. We were in the same room and he also enjoyed it.The deluxe package was 2,100,000 dong - not even $100 for all that pampering. Good value!Great experience all the way around - I hope I can come back again and if I do, I'll be asking for Miss Hai! Recommended!

Fantastic Spa in a Great Location. I had a facial at Mido Spa and it was the best I've had since I moved to Hanoi. The staff were friendly and welcoming. The whole place was well run and very clean. The room was peaceful and relaxing. I loved everything about it. I'll definitely be back!

Perfection! . I went for a quick mani/pedi before I left Hanoi and the lady that looked after me was excellent! I didn't notice that something was slightly uneven but she took the care to make sure that my nails were absolutely perfect! Thank you so much :) would highly recommend!

Fantastic spa. Loved this spa. Staff took the time to work out exactly what you want and made sure to communicate about any specific issues. The room was peaceful and the extra touches like a warm eye pack were a bonus. Highly recommend.

Crowded but worth it. . Went there at night right before closing. Booked a 3hr package and I have to say, if it isn't crowded... This is the place to go! The massage was awesome, the facial was professional and the service was exceptional. I personally would not wait an hour for this spa but if it is available, I would definitely go ahead!

Ms Thanh 1 is fabulous. I had a mido massage which is a combination of Thai, shiatsu, sports and aroma massage and Ms Thanh 1 was my therapist. She was fabulous!!! Her pressure was good, she checked that the pressure and stretches were right and she made me feel extremely comfortable. This truly was a great massage and it left me refreshed and relaxed. Ask for Ms Thanh 1

Very relaxing! . I've just had the most relaxing spa pedicure. My therapist Hai filed and painted my nails with perfection, then gave me the best foot and leg massage. Very clean place with professional staff. Recommended :)

Poor Professionalism and Lacking in Atmosphere. First, I’ll state a big caveat that we walked out of this spa, so I can’t speak to any of the treatments here. We had booked 90 minutes each for 5 PM on a weekday, and arrived early (around 4:40 PM) to see if we start our services earlier. The place was already packed and tons of shoes were lined outside the entrance (as it’s typical to go barefoot once inside a spa in Hanoi). After some confusion, the host understood that we weren’t trying to book a new appointment but already had an existing one (this did require some time though). She let us know we should return at 5 PM; no problem, we walked around the neighborhood and returned at 5 PM.This time, we were ushered to a seating area on a couch beneath the stairs since the front waiting area was packed. I think we must’ve been in the employee break area since we faced the employee lockers and were near their communal kitchen. We were given tea, and I asked to use the restroom, and was shown the way. While clean, I was not impressed with the restroom, which was functional but a bit unkempt, and not spa-like. Walking back out, I noticed the lavender colored walls and bright lights in the spa. I couldn’t help but think about SF Spa (that we had visited just days before and were unable to book) with its soothing, peaceful ambience, and where the person who greets you immediately comes to take your shoes away and provide you with flip flops.At 5:05, the host came out and told us that she would need 15 more minutes because the person before had done a package and they needed time to clean the room. As we were tight on schedule, we declined to stay, and let her know we’d be leaving. On the way out, she asked if we wouldn’t reconsider if she could get us in a shared room straight away. While she was polite and gracious throughout, I couldn’t help but feel that the level of professionalism here was lacking. And certainly, the ambience in the waiting area left much to be desired. I’d definitely check out SF Spa Hanoi Corner (haven’t been to the one by the lake) over Mido if you’re staying in the Old Quarter.

Excellent treatment. Me and a friend visited Mido Spa the 3th of January 2016. We both took some spa packages that included jacuzzi bath, body massage, scrub, facial and foot massage. We were also served food after the treatments even if that was not included in the package.The massage and spa treatments was excellent and some of the best I ever experience. Professional and very friendly staff together with the great treatments made this a very pleasant visit. All together a fantastic place to relax and get new energy.
Fantastic. I had 90 minutes of blissful aromatheraphy and it was absolutely amazing. Ms Huong is very talented, and I feel renewed and ready for more walking in this wonderful city <3

great treatment. Me and the wife both had a treatment here during our stay in hanoi. We were in the same private room which was really nice and the staff were very polite & friendly.I had the sports massage and would recommend it to anyone, the therapist was really strong and did a great job. My wife had a combination package and said it was really good as well.

Friendly service but too casual. The pre-massage service (ie. introducing of packages) is very good and friendly. Their massage service is okay, with friendly staff however, a little too casual for my liking. I personally would prefer a more professional approach.The rooms I was in has 3 beds and they don't separate according to sexes. They wanted to arrange me and my female friends to be in the same room even though we were going to be stripped down to our undergarments! In the end me and my other male friend got our own room with 1 shower and they expected us to shower together after our body scrub! They even wanted to stay in the room while we were changing out which felt kind of weird, so we asked them to leave first. Not sure if they were blur or this is their normal practice.I wouldn't go back again as the whole visit felt abit too unprofessional.

Great place for massage. Got tired of the walking and the noise of the streets and decided to get a massage.Ms. Hue and Ms. Van at Mido took care of my girlfriend and I. We had great massages for an hour to recharge. Highly recommended.
Luxurious Experience!!. Had a wonderful pedicure here. The place is extremely clean, the staff very friendly and English-speaking; the entire experience was just fabulous! Wish I could go back again!
Brilliant. Lovely experience, conveniently located, friendly staff and amazing massage from Ms Dhang. Would recommend this spot!!
Professional, well-trained masseuse. It was my first time trying the hot stone massage and it was definitely a relaxing and pleasant experience. The masseuse was skilled and attentive to my needs.

Heavenly. I had an amazing experience at the Mido spa in hanoi. I was pampered from head to toe. My masseuse was skilled, friendly and made me feel very relaxed. Thank you for a wonderful afternoon. I'll be back
Exellent. Excellent service. I felt all refreshed after a long trip around Vietnam. The staff was very friendly, polite and skillful. Worth for the price and time trying!

Throughly recommend, great service. We went here on a rainy day in Hanoi and it was well worth it, from the moment you arrive they take care of you. The treatment choice was huge, my wife went for a body massage whilst I selected the hour long foot massage, it was so good and relaxing I fell asleep, and my feet feel invigorated....if you are looking for a good one with great service try Mido.

Disappointing. We decided to go for a Christmas treat and both my wife and I selected a 2 hour massage. The costs were a little pricey but based on the reviews we were happy to give Mido Spa a go. We had a nice (and routine) welcome including a tea. After making our selection we were led to our treatment room and that's where it started to go downhill. My massage was okay but there were points where the lady was on her phone (standard for a cheap massage but not what I expected). We also think she was talking to the other masseuse about how to give his massage. My wife chose an aromatherapy massage. Firstly the masseuse giving her massage was the same one we experienced a few days earlier (at a different spa) and we didn't go back there based on his massage there. We suspect he may be a trainee, which is fine and we understand that you need to learn on the job (maybe just don't charge the same price). The masseuse then proceeded to urinate (loudly) in the adjoined to our treatment room - not great. He was then very poor in his massage (sounds similar to my experience of him previously where he sniffled a lot during the massage). There was very little oil used despite it being an aromatherapy oil massage. It was just a poor massage.To finish off the experience, they just reset the bedding ready for the next customer rather than get fresh bedding (my wife did comment that her towels smelt bad). All in all a disappointing experience. The front of house staff were faultless but we would not recommend.

Life saver!!. After 24+ hours of travel and not having the room at the hotel read because of arriving too early, Mido Spa was a life saver. Clean friendly efficient and was able to take me right away. Hot shower, steam bath, massage, facial, mani/pedi for around $75US. I left feeling clean and human again and my room was ready. Literally 1 minute from the hotel -super convenient and affordable in Old Quarter. Highly recommend it and would go again if I was staying longer.
Excellent!!!!. We had an excellent facial treatment aswell as a very relaxing cranial massage including the back, shoulders, arms and hands. All in all very relaxing!!

Superb experience and value for my wife and I. . We are on a three week Asian adventure, and were pretty twisted up and tired after a lot of walking and exploring, planes trains etc. my wife dragged me here to Mido and it was an excellent experience. For Americans, the prices are unbelievably affordable which gave us the opportunity to get packages we normally wouldn't. There is no hurried atmosphere at all, and the masseuses are nice and friendly. They speak almost no English though, so be ready to communicate with gestures. Also be sure to know "Cam on" to say thanks. As a guy who is not typically into anything like this, I am very glad we came and that I listened to my wife. ;)

Best spa experience of my 3 week stay in Vietnam.. I tried several spas in my 3 weeks stay in Vietnam but this one really was exceptional. The customer service was great, the facility was very clean, relaxing and overall well kept, and most importantly my massage was excellent! After having a few spa experiences where it was clear the massage therapist wasn't quite a pro, it was refreshing to be in the hands of someone who carried themselves professionally and delivered professional quality service. I left the spa feeling very relaxed and i'd highly recommend this place for end one staying in Hanoi.
Top Massage. Had a 30min facial & 75min hot stone massage for about $30. New equipment and friendly therapist. Would definitely come again!

Perfect Rainy Day Place. Went here on a rainy day for a massage and foot treatment. Nice location, close to my hotel in the Old Quarter. Both treatments were very relaxing. I've had more intense massage sessions, but for the price this place was solid. The staff was friendly and accommodating.
One of the best ever. A very well presented, clean and professional place. Polite, warm and friendly staff and I had one of the best massages I've ever had. Thank you Mido spa :-)

Most relaxing massage ever. The experience was great from the moment we stepped in and they made us take our shoes off. We were told to sit down and they handed over some food and tea. The place was extremely clean and the staff were most kind and polite. The massage was heavenly. I took a Mido Massage and would do it again every time. I strongly recommend this place and hope all of those who do go experience the pleasure I did.

Great feeling. My friend recommend this spa for me, I came there on hot day. I chose Thai massage with oil in 1 hour. It was extremely relaxing and I love that feeling. Super easy, comfortable and satisfied. I pay 400.000vnd for 1 hour and I never feel regret. The staff was well trained, friendly, always smiling. After tired working day, Mido spa is best choice
Foot massage. It was fab! With the sweatest staff ever!i got a foot massage with a lovely girl.it wasnt very cheap but it worth it. Glad to get it

Healing and Peaceful Place . Had the best hot stone massage. I'm a big spa goer and this is a must in Vietnam. It's peaceful and quite and the prices are worth it. It's still cheaper than the states and you feel like a new person when your done. Would definitely come here if your looking for a great Vietnamese spa experience.
Heavenly Healing Hands. Great atmosphere & warm greeting at the door. Beautiful massage and relaxation from Huong. I will return. Pure Bliss!!!
Quite good. Massage on the whole was quite good. But not the best in Hanoi. Rooms were clean. Polite staff. Service vis-a-vis price was aligned.
Excellent experience. Had a manicure today and was very pleased. Quick service and no wait. Results are excellent and extremely professional! Great place!

Perfect birthday party! . Thank you again! Really friendly staff! The spa was really nice and surprised us with a birthday cake and a local wine for our friend, which had birthday (and they didn't wanted to take any money for that!). As u can see at the picture ;)We would always come back!
Surprising massage. Nice and clean SPA with professional and kind staff. The thaï massage was amazing, strong and efficient stretching. We had a very nice moment. Higly recommanded place.

Amazing experience. Truely enjoyable experience - environment was nice, neat and decent! The warm stone massage was unbelieveable! Ngoc (the massage lady) was just amazing! Will Definitely come back when i am in Hanoi next time!
Great massage! . Nice and clean environment, staff very professional. massage was very good, highly recommend to go for a 2 hours massage at least!

Fantastic service . We had an hour aromatherapy massage today. We were apprehensive as we were not sure what to expect but were very pleasantly surprised. Had fantastic massage and no hassles for tips after. We walked in and were immediately served. Place was clean & staff are well trained. We are planning to go again for a 2 hour massage & maybe a facial. Highly recommended!

Professional massage . After reading reviews of cheaper places on TA, we decided to pay a bit more and try Mido Spa. The girls were very welcoming and friendly, and the spa was clean & professional. The prices quoted are what you pay - no hidden tip needed. Although after our great full body massage we tipped anyway! 60 min massage 390,000 VND. Will be back
Marvellous massage . Clean and elegant spa in Old Town, great menu of treatments. My husband and I loved our 2-hour Mido special, gently but firmly massaged all over, wonderfully relaxing.

You're in good hands.. Visited Mido Spa twice in 3 days with my partner. Excellent massages on both occasions.First visit we both enjoyed a 90 min hot stone therapy and today had the relaxing aromatherapy massage.A very professional and friendly service. We chose this spa on TripAdvisor as it was rated highly and within an easy walk from our hotel ( The Artisan Boutique hotel ).We have now put it on our recommendation list alongside the Linda Spa in Nha Trang and Eve Spa in HCMC. Prices are quite reasonable given the high level of friendly service.

Super place. This Spa is located in one of the small colorful streets in Old Town.Both the inside and outside are attractive, clean and well maintained.The service is great, the massages wonderful and the beauty treatment very nice as well.An excellent place for a nice break from all the hustle and bustle of Vietnam.

Poor experience. Unpleasant experience at this spa.Wasn't given a robe to use once undressed, I had to ask or a towel. Requested an aromatherapy massage, but oils only used on my back and legs. When the massage was finished both ladies stood and watched us dress!! Very strange. The towels we had used including the ones used around our face and head, very neatly folded and replaced. Obviously to be re-used. Dread to think how many times.Beware, as part of the reception area has a loose stone feature which my husband tripped on and took a nasty fall. There are many good spas in Hanoi. This isn't one of them.
Nice. Satisfied with massage . I have taken massage for two times and both of time i enjoyed the massage . Very friendly atmosphere too

Thao is really good. This is a quality massage place which has different strengths whilst getting massaged based on your needs. The lady that did my massage was Thao today who is absolutely fantastic. Thank you very much.

A great place to get a quality massage.. I had the Mido combination massage and it was very well done. It's a comfortable environment and the girl really knew what she was doing. She was strong enough to cause pain and that's the way I like it. I came back a few days later at the next opportunity and tried the Thai massage. It was also very good. The staff here appear to be well trained. It's a little more expensive, but you certainly get quality in return. Highly recommended.

Best prices, best service, best spa in Hanoi. We had a foot massage and an (awesome!) facial treatment. All in all, it took 1,5h and we only paid 25 USD each. Other spas here in Hanoi would charge you double for this level of professionalism. Highly recommended!!!

Impressive!. My boyfriend and I read great reviews about Mido Spa and found that it was right outside our hostel. We walked over and took a look at the massages they offered, and they immediately told us that if we were to chose them, we'd get a 10% discount. We were offered tea while they set up our room. I had the Thai massage with oil and he had the traditional Thai massage each for 60 minutes. We were both placed in the same room as well. The music was relaxing the the massages were amazing! The worked us from head to toe and were extremely professional. I would recommend it to anyone!

Good place. We have done the 75 min Mido massage which is quite a mixture of 3 different massages Thai, Vietnamese and something elseI found it to be relaxing and good enough, staff are friendly and professional, would recommend it blindly we paid a total of 50$ for two

Fixed what the other spa couldn't. After having a very mediocre massage at another establishment, I decided to give this place a try as it was around the corner from our hotel. My masseuse was Nzoc and she was excellent. She was able to give me a deep massage and helped get rid of some pain in my back and shoulders that would not go away for days. When i arrived, I received a cup of tea and was then led up to the 4th floor into a room (looked like a room made for couples). Room was a nice temperature. After the massage, I was led back down to the waiting area and given a cup of fresh lemon juice. This spa's services are a little bit more pricey compared to other spas in the area, however, it was a really great massage and overall worth it. The only thing was the matter of privacy when undressing/dressing - they ask you to undress but don't leave the room. This was the same at the other spa I went to in Hanoi.

Wonderful Spa in Hanoi. We've been to Mido Spa twice and each time it was a great moment. The staff was verry professional and pleasant. They offered tea when we came in and lemon juice after the massage. We had a foot massage, Thai massage, and a mix of different types of massages. Very pleased with the results ! We laid down next to each other in a peaceful room. Perfume and music were also very relaxing.We had the last massages before going back to the airport and the boss offered to take us to the bus station after the massage. What he did. It was 9 pm and the bus service was off so he took us to the airport !!! He refused the money we gave him... Never seen such a selfless behaviour !I definitely recommend this spa !Carole & Jean from France.

Second massage at Mido Spa. I've been to Mido Spa twice in the past two weeks, and each time was a great experience. I get the Swedish massage, because I need a lighter touch, yet improved circulation (they offer many different kinds of massages, at anywhere from and hour to two hours) and was both times very pleased with the result. The first time I had a man and the second a woman; both were very competent, pleasant and quiet during the massage. I like the music they use (very soft and Copland-esque) and the rooms have been clean both times. The person at the front desk (different each time) was pleasant and efficient, and always gives customers tea upon arrival and lemon juice afterward. All in all, a very relaxing ninety minutes. I've been to many massage parlors in Vietnam, and have had a large range of experiences. This one has been the best. AND, they take plastic!

Good service but massage no more than ok. The place looks good and proffesional but massage wasnt too good.. me and my wife felt that it was nice time to spend but with lack of touching in the right spots.
Amazing experience. Very professional and welcoming. My friend and I had an hour foot scrub and massage it was amazing. Definitely recommend and would go back next time im in Vietnam.

Fantastic, clean, professional and relaxing. I got the aromatherapy full body massage ($17 US) and my fiancee got a facial ($17 US), each lasting an hour. We were greeted with green tea and a fresh pair of sandals. We got beds next to each other in a dark room with 4 other empty beds (Saturday afternoon at 2PM).Our experience was fantastic! Extremely relaxing and professional. A little more expensive than other local spas, but well worth it. We'll be headed back soon.http://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g293924-d5566921-r313740920-Omamori_Spa-Hanoi.html#

Visited Twice. In the Old Quarter this spa is really nice. We had the 60 minute foot massage and were relaxed in no time. This spa is busy with both westerners and Vietnamese patrons. They provided a very clean environment, and our masseuses where well training and engaged us in conversation.

Would not recommend. I had a massage here with my boyfriend and was disappointed given all of the great reviews. The staff here were not very professional and there were people coming in and out of our room and talking throughout our massage. My masseuse also seemed to have very little training and I left feeling about the same as I felt coming in.

Great massage, welcoming staff. I came in, asking for a strong massage and I was recommended the Japanese shiatsu massage. Very warm welcome, and the therapist Thang spoke very good English and was very chatty. The massage itself was very strong, and very very good! I love a strong massage, and Thang did not disappoint! She was saying 'I'm very small but very strong' as she was standing on my back! The massage was so good I decided to come back on my last day just before my flight home. I decided to get the same shiatsu massage, and Thang also greeted me welcoming me back. But I got another therapist, who sadly did not do a strong massage like Thang and I had to keep asking her to go stronger. She realised this and was sorry so even offered me a discount because I wasn't entirely satisfied. I would still come back if I ever come back to Hanoi!

Hai was great!. I went to Mido for my first Vietnamese massage and also my first ever facial. Wasn't sure what to expect but Hai took excellent care of me. The massage was very good and although I was a bit skeptical of getting a facial it was actually very nice and I can feel the difference in my skin. It felt great to get some of the city grime out of my pores. Ask for Hai, she is very sweet, speaks good English and has the softest hands.
massage. My wife and I went to get a massage. The reception we got was very warm. It was one of the best massages I have ever had. Staff was courteous, respectful and professional.

Foot massage same room as nail polish - not comfortable. The interior design was nice. Spa attendants were also trained. The only element I didn't like about my foot massage was it being interrupted by another customer wanting to do nail polish. The foot massage room was dimmed and ambience was soothing when I entered. After 15 min, the lights were switched on to normal white lights to serve the other customer. It disrupted my rest as 1 person was having her nail polish done while her friend was continuously talking to her. I didn't like the smell of the nail polish as well. I thought they should have used a smaller portable light which I saw in other spa to not disturb the massage customers.

The only spa you need to go to!. I picked this spa due to its good reviews and decent prices. I emailed them and they got back to me very quickly - I asked for a discount because of the amount of treatments I was having and they offered me 20%. The man came promptly and picked me up from my hotel on his scooter. That was an experience in itself lol it wasn't the first time I'd been on a scooter in Vietnam, but don't expect a car if you are using the free pick up service! I was greeted by the manager, sweets and drinks were given and then I was introduced to Dinky - my lady for the day! She was absolutely lovely and spoke very good English like most of the staff. I had a Swedish body massage, deep facial, foot paraffin treatment and a pedicure and colour. I'm very happy to say that every treatment was amazing, and the nail varnish was OPI!! :) I spent 4 hours in the spa and it came to £30... Easily my best bargain of my travels so far! And to top it off, I was even given a lift back to my hotel. If I'm ever back in Hanoi, I'll definitely be going back to the Mido Spa! X

Perfect location, and service. Located in downtown Hoan Kiem, it's a few minute walk and you find an entire building dedicated for all sorts of spa. I got a bikini wax and I am highly satisfied with the service and the result of it. Also when I asked for directions, the owner/manager was kind enough to ride me there with his own bike (since it was a few KM away). It's a comforting shop that does the job well as a reasonable price.

Great People, Great Service, Great Value! what else.... Located a stone's throw from Hoan Kiem lake in the Old Quarter, Mido Spa is a very clean and cozy Spa that will make you feel at home with their kind and welcoming Vietnamese staff. I was warmly welcomed by Thanh Ninh at my first visit who's English was great and she even speaks French! my first language. The full body massage was very professional, I felt comfortable all along in the hands of masseuse Thanh whom I highly recommend for her great service, I came back the next day as a result. 2 visits in 2 days. Thank you very much! Merci! Keep it up ;) GUILLAUME

3 visits in 6 days says it all.... Really have to give this team top marks. On the days we didn't visit them we tested out other massage places and these guys we're tops. Duan for Shiatsu massage would be hard to beat and Mi was super for Swedish massage. We were very lucky to meet Thanh2 and Ting on the other occasions. Even after moving on to Danang and trying other highly regarded massage spas, Thanh2's hot stone massages were absolutely the best and I have been inspired to look in to massage courses when I get home. Ting's Swedish massage for my husband was great and even better the next time as she was able to adjust the style to a stronger version when requested. Both girls were a lot of fun and my husband and I were in the same room for our treatments. There are a number of stairs to climb to get to some of the rooms which might be difficult for some people. We loved our experience and highly recommend the team .

Fantastic massage!. I wasn't sure of what to expect from a Vietnam massage having been to Bali earlier this year. But Mido was excellent. I had the aromatherapy 60 min massage. Staff speak good English, rooms were great and massage was one of the best ones I've had.

Relaxation +. With the hustle and bustle of Hanoi this oasis is just what you need. Good price, good range of techniques, very friendly staff. We went back 3 times during our stay it was that good! Highly recommended.
Wonderful. Great service, had a lovely time (twice). Very relaxing! The team is fantastic, very friendly and professional.

Awesome!!!. The staffs are warm and friendly. They can understand and speak English. The massage is absolutely good! The whole place is filled with aroma which adds relaxation. They offer one free ride in a taxi.
Thank you Mido spa for giving us the kind of service and relaxation we need! Keep it up!

Great treatment and friendly staff. I was traveling in Hanoi on business; my colleague and I were recommended here by our business partner in HaNoi. It is a hidden treasure, a little hard to find but worth looking for. We both scheduled 2 treatments; mine were 75 min foot massage and 75 min hear all treatment ( Vietnamese treatment); massage with addition of herbal poultice sacks. The theropist massages with oil and than uses the heated poultice sacks to encourage healing and muscle relaxing. It is a bit intense, but felt amazing afterwards. The prices are very reasonable. Make a note, if you are shy/ modest, the rooms for massage are communal. Enjoy!Will certainly return on my next visit

Very good massage, pretty spa, friendly staff. Had a very pleasant massage here. Quality of the therapist's massage (Ms. Thanh) was very high. Feel much better after coming in with a lot of tightness in the upper back and neck area after some days of trekking through the caves. Definitely worth some of your time when you're in hanoi! You don't get a lot of massages like this outside of Asia, especially given the price.

Amazing Massage. From the moment you come through the door this place is fantastic!! Hot tea to soothe you while you pick the service you wantI opted for a 75 minute Aromatic Massage and was lucky enough to Hái massage me. The pressure was perfect but she checked in with me from time to time to make sure everything was still okay, which it wasI'm coming back here everyday I'm in Ha Nơi and having Hái do my treatmentsVery /strictly professional. After the massage given sweetened lemon water to drinkI'm addicted!!

Very nice facility, quiet in heart of Hanoi. Went with a co-worker and it was great. Much cheaper than the prices at our hotel's spa and the treatment was just as good or better. I got a 75 minute Swedish Massage and the 75min foot scrub and massage. So nice! Such a treat from the heat and walking! Very clean rooms and peaceful. Bathroom was very nice and there was air condition. Was very surprised by the quality of the service for the price, would have been much more $ in the states. Leaving Hanoi tomorrow but will return on my next visit for sure!

Very friendly spa in the center of old quarter. I've been here twice and both time, very satisfied.Staffs are well trained not only for massage technique but also for services, such as not to ask for tips, which you may often encounter in Vietnam & turn you down...The price seems to be a bit high comparing to the same level of spa, but considering its convenient location, it may be acceptable. This time, Ms.Tinh did a massage for me, though she is rather new, it was very relaxing & satisfying.

Amazing treatments. This spa is awesome. I visited this spa while on business in Hanoi to get some relaxation from my tired trip. The staff were welcoming and made me feel at home. The treatments were wonderful and priced right. I would recommend this spa for anyone who is visiting Hanoi.Lee - USA

A very relaxing place for a group of friends. We visited as a group with 3 guys and 1 girl desperate to escape the heat of Hanoi. When we arrived we were met with green tea and were allowed to browse the selection of massages without any pressure to buy. 3 of us got Thai massages and one person got a sports massages. The masseuses were very professional and the massages were amazing but. After the massages we had a cup of lemon water and there was no rush to pay the bill. This is a very professionally run spa that provides a really relaxing experience.

Incredible mixed style massage. After 28 traveling hours I ask for a massage place in my hotel. They called Mido (it's very well placed in old centre Hanoi) so I went walking and they received me with a big smile. After telling about my massage interest the woman attending recommend me a mixed style massage (Mido style) that includes some hard Thai and some oil massage. I went all in for the 2 hours, full body.At the end, it was perfect. Very kind and attentive woman with a lot of skill gave me the best massage I had in Vietnam so far. Explaining it is impossible, I can only recommend to go and try it.I'll be back for sure.

Best case scenario. Inexpensive and absolutely great. I spent 2 hours getting worked on after having had hiked for tons of hours in Sapa and before some very long flights. It was great! The workers were also very charming - and competent!
Best spa in all of vietnam. This is the only legitimate spa we went to vietnam. They have the music, ambience, technique and service. I would highly recommend this spa.

Relaxing and professional spa. Very professional service, with a clean and luxury feel. A welcome relief from some of the more questionable services in Hanoi. I had an Indian head/neck/back which was pleasant (although could have been stronger) and a very soothing 30min facial. After visiting a few other spas in the area I rate this one as the best.
Foot massage was great. We loved our foot massage and foot mask - lovely spa and a great atmosphere :) was recommended by our hotel and we were not disappointed.

Better massages esewhere. I came here with my partner for a 60 minute foot massage (240,000 vnd). The ambiance here is quite nice. They dim the lights and played relaxing music. They also wipe you down at the end with a piping hot towel, which feels really nice. My partner enjoyed her massage but mine was mediocre at best, and the two girls were not averse to chatting among themselves.In allocating three stars, I am taking into account my partners massage which she enjoyed. If you are heading South, there are better and cheaper massages available in both Nah Trang and in Saigon.

Spa pedicure and foot massage. Extremely friendly, looked after our every need. Very relaxed and calm atmosphere , great prices compared to similar at home. Well worth a visit when you have just arrivedRecommended by Silk path hotel .

Nice Facility, Really Sweet Masseuses, Just OK Massage. Since we have been traveling in Saigon and Ha Noi, we have been massageaholics! So, given the quality of the massages, perhaps we have been spoiled. First, we went to Mido Spa because of it's high rating here. Tucked away on a hectic street in the Old Quarter, the facility is very nicely appointed. Each massage room is on a different floor, so we had to walk up a few flights of stairs, but it got us ready for our massages. Our masseuses were very sweet and very friendly. However, I only gave Mido 3 stars because despite the facility and the sweet masseuses, ultimately, we were there for high quality massages. Unfortunately, although there is no really bad massage, our massages were just OK, nice but nothing great. The girls did not seem to have actual training as masseuses and were unable to give the deep pressure that my wife likes. Don't get me wrong -- we had a good time and enjoyed ourselves. It's just that with the massages that we have had in Saigon, we expected more. Perhaps we are spoiled by our other experiences and Ha Noi has a different standard than Saigon. We're checking out another place today and we'll report back!

Excellent service. Spent 6 hours in the spa to enjoy the paradise package. Spa had great hospitality. They replied my enquiry emails in details and offered me a 20% discount with taxi pick up/drop off between hotel and the spa.The lady who came to pick us up was dressed in traditional Vietnamese dress. She came early and waited for us in the lobby. Good spoken English which was easily understood. The masseuse who served me also spoke good English which I found her easy to communicate.I preferred harder massage after long day traveling outside but Vietnamese style wasn't stronge enough. Facial was a surprise. The masseuse was well trained with good facial massage technique.Spa cuisine was served at any time in our treatment. We chose to have two bowls of Pho noodles at the end of it. Taste was just okay but we weren't expecting fantastic food as it was provided by a spa but not a restaurant. It was a very good idea to have something to eat after 5 hrs of treatment. We didn't know they provided such service until we arrived.Exellent service. Highly appreciated.

Good and Great. Hubby and I went for a Thai oil massage. Hardly any oil used. Lots of walking on and stretching which was a mixture of good and great. Would suggest gentle not sudden pulling. Also perhaps some privacy whilst undressing. Eased our tired muscles ready for another hot day tomorrow in Hanoi.

A very pleasant experience. I picked Mido Spa at random as it was a few doors down from my hotel.The staff were very friendly and attentive, and for the most part they spoke English very well.The treatment menu had lots of great options, I went for one of the packages. It was slightly more expensive (for Vietnam) but the service was very good and the premises was clean and well presented.They provided disposable underwear and though there was a slight language barrier between myself and the therapist, I was pleased with the various treatments I had.I would definitely recommend Mido Spa to others.

massuers seem to be only 'going through the motion'. The skills of the massuers are acceptable if we didn't have a comparison. But since we did a massage with another spa (see my other reivews) . Mido is nothing to rave about. First, we have to climb a few storeys of stairs up to the massage room. Second, before the massage starts, they used room temperature water to wash our legs (usually spas use warm water!). Third, we weren't offer a robe to wear, it was simply strip and lie down. Fourth, no lockers. We did a massage at another spa which is 25min away from Old Quarter by bus. The visually impacted masseurs over there did a way better job and less than half of what we paid at Mido. If time is not at your side, you can settle for Mido. But if you have more time to spare, go the other one.

GO FOR THE WARM STONE MASSAGE. This is a very nice spa. If you haven't done a warm stone massage, you should try one here! They are so much more relaxing than a regular massage. If you have a particular area of muscle strain that you want to give more attention to, go for the 90 minute one. Be aware in this spa there are STAIRS ! and you might need to walk up 5 flights !! to get to your massage room. As with all massages be sure you communicate with your massage therapist as to your preferences for the room temperature, pressure of the massage, areas of pain to give more attention to and areas you wish to avoid (such as an arthritic joint, etc.) That way you are sure to have a perfect massage. The price is about average for a higher quality of spa. The staff were very sweet and setting up an appointment for the same day was easy. And they take credit cards,Give it a try! You'll like it.

Back feels amazing . Visited on Wednesday. Firstly to have my gel nail varnish remove as this spa was next to our hotel. My friend and I then decided to have a massage later that day as it had been raining all day and we had limited options in what to do. We had an Indian neck, shoulder and back massage. It was one of the best massages I've had in a while. Gentle and relaxing. The girls were so lovely to us. Felt very comfortable with them. Will be back to visit again this Saturday! See you soon midi spa!
Great service! Great massage!. I come on time and they are ready for my massage treatment, let me relax and its good experience! :)
Lauren. Great service! Got a massage, facial, and foot treatment. Great price and the service is very professional and very relaxing. Would definitely recommend going if you have a half day in Hanoi

Great. Went there twice within my 4 days trip in Hanoi. Only cost me about $400000dong per pax for a 60 minute full body massage, they even provide a maximum $40000 cab fee (one way). Staffs were friendly and it was enjoyable, I slept half the time during the massage. I will definitely go back there again!!

good service, friendly staff. We went to this spa on Swallow Travel's recommendation and also as it was a few minutes walk from our hotel. My friend and I were warmly greeted by friendly, professional staff.We had a hot stone massage after fifteen minutes in a steam room followed by a salt scrub and facial. I was really relaxed and tried not to fall asleep as I wanted to enjoy every minute of the three hour session.I will definitely return for some foot therapy next time.The prices were similar to most other similar places but well worth the money.

Heaven on a stick. Final afternoon in Hanoi after a month long motorbiking trip,absolutely wonderful way to relax, had the facial, salt scrub,mud wrap, hot stone massage, will definitely go back thereand recommend

Just what I was looking for!. Towards the end of my 2 week travels through Vietnam, I was desperately in need of a pedicure. This place was close to my hotel and had very fair prices. The staff was very friendly and greeted me with tea and fruit. I really appreciated the great pedicure (spa pedicure option) as it was wonderful all on it's own - I wasn't prompted for add ons for additional money, just everything I wanted already included. Very sweet and talented people there.

It's a very good place for relax.. This store is just near by the most popular area and the reception can speak very fluent English. The price is reasonable, and the waitress can also provide professional massage. The environment is clean and bright. I will definitely recommend this massage shop in Hanoi to my families and friends.
Nice Spa good prices. Me and husband both had a foot massage and was very pleased. Would return again. Price was 240000 for 60 min. Foot massage.

Nice spa. Nice spa, great service. Had a steam bath, facial and massage while my partner had a steam bath and massage. The steam bath turned out to be a shower compartment within a bathroom. Interesting but space efficient, in any case we liked it. The massages were good and my facial left my skin in a wonderful plumb state, although smelling of Aloe Vera which i am not keen on. We were offered food but had just had dinner previously so they insisted on giving us a little souvenir which was very sweet. All in all enjoyed it. They kindly offered a free ride from our hotel to the spa which they paid for. We noticed our taxi driver was taking us for a ride when he circled the street twice but they paid for the fare without a blink. Thank you again for a wonderful relaxing evening.
Great spa. I come to here when Hanoi is very hot. Nice spa and great service. I did the Sport massage, speacially it was very strong and by the man. Highly recommend.

Mixed views. We went in as a group of six and were very well looked after. We were offered a 5% discount being such a large group. The staff were friendly and could all speak very good english. I had the basic facial which was far from basic. It included a cleanse, a scrub, a deep pore cleanse, arm, hand, scalp and back massage. My only gripe was that my beautician kept sniffing like she had a cold. My partner got a pedicure and wasn't very pleased with it due to not having a thorough scrub done meaning there was excess amounts of dry skin left on her feet. I would have scored Mido a 5/5 had my beautician not obviously been sick and if my partner had got what she had paid for
clean, effecient,. ngoc just did a great shiatsu massage on me a few minutes ago and i would highly recommend this place to anyone.

Great quality massage - better than expected. I had a shiatsu/Thai/sport massage there and it was exactly what I needed: strong and a bit painful, but really effective after walking around with a backpack for three weeks.I think the place has changed a lot since the bad reviews it has received. They even refused to take any tip.

Amazing massage. Sheer bliss.. We went to this spa on our hotel's recommendation and also as it was a few minutes walk from our hotel. My husband and I were warmly greeted by friendly, professional staff.We had a hot stone massage after fifteen minutes in a steam room followed by a salt scrub and facial. I was really relaxed and tried not to fall asleep as I wanted to enjoy every minute of the three hour session.We then were given a lemon drink and noodle soup.We felt relaxed and my skin felt soft.I will definitely return for some foot therapy next time.The prices were similar to most other similar places but well worth the money.

Why go there?. Very pleasant service. The staff is smiling. It is fast and well done. A tea to wait, a fresh drink has the output. We do not want to walk? someone brings in motorcycle in our hotel! What better?

Great service, lovely people. We had a layover in Hanoi for about 12 hours one day and looked up this spa to spend most of our time at. I emailed them to book, they offered to organised a taxi for us from the trains station and then from then on, service was above and beyond. We were there for over 5hours and they even provided food for us as we were there for so long. Great staff and massages and facials were amazing and relaxing!! Would definitely recommend

Best massage in Vietnam so far. The massages are amazing, for about 400,000 dong you can get a 1 hour massage. The quality of the massage was exceptional. Before the massage began, I was given a choice of the different oils to be used in the massage at no extra charge, I went with the coconut oil. Great service and very clean! Would return again.
Great spa and good prices. The prices were very good. Staff very helpful in choosing the massage we wanted. Price was cheaper then the other top rated spas and was worth every vnd.
1 hour massage after 1st day in Vietnam. What a pleasure and way to relax after the first day in Vietnam (and a long flight). Really friendly and a great return for your money

Great service and good value for your money!. this spa is next door to our hotel, me and my friend thought to give it a try. It was a great experience! Good price and very relaxing massage. You will feel secure as you have your private room with toilet and you have your own safe box to keep your valuables while you are having your treatment. Great Job!

Great service at Mido Spa. Visited this spa with my wife. Service was very good, quality of the massage was also great. We've tried few other spa's in that area of the city, this one was best. In this place they are really care about the quality. Thanks, good luck!
Great Massage. Have been to this spa on two consecutive days. Great environment, friendly staff. Brilliant Massage. Access is via basement but opens to a very professional and clean foyer.

Relaxing and clean. After having a bad massage in Ho Chi Minh City I thought I'd give Mido a try. It was so clean, the music was nice and there was no talking! Lân gave me my massage, a lovely Thai oil massage for 75 minutes. He was very attentive and made sure I was ok - would go again :)
Highly recommended. Good service! Price acceptable! Free transfer back to hotel after massage! Definitely will come visit again if i come hanoi next time!You won't regret when u visit them!

Very good experience!. Everything here is very fancy. The room is clean and the staffs always be friendly. I just took a spa package here. Not only the price is very reasonable but service is also good. I think that I will go to this spa again next time.
Really good maasage!!. Whent there with a friend, they really knew what they where doing and i would always comeback if ever back in Hanoi!
Great massage. Pleasant and relaxing atmosphere and a good strong sports massage. The masseuse was partially sighted but it's all in the feel not the sight!
Best best best. it was a great massage and people were super nice. I went on first day and best massage shop in hanoi! Loved it:D

Great experience. I did facial treatment, neck and shoulder massage and eye wrinkle treatment and i am completely satisfied with the service i got. Friendly staff, beautiful tea and great treatments. Going to visiti this place again. Thank you

Relaxing massage. I had a relaxing aromatherapy massage followed by a spa pedicure. Nice, clean salon which is reasonably priced for the services you received. I would go back for the massages but would prob skip the nail painting
Relaxing. Had an amazing massage here - was well priced & the massage was great. The staff were very helpful & their english was good
Excellent experience . Had a foot massage there, the place is clean, friendly and highly professional. We will definitely come back again soon.

bliss. This spa was my pick from a few suggested by my Hanoi hotel. Picked for range of services plus value for money. We had a mini facial, full foot & lower leg massage plus I had a leg wax & it was wonderful. The girls were skilled and attentive & by the time we left we felt thoroughly pampered. A definite recommendation from me.
Relaxing. After a long day walking, this spa provided a perfectly professional and relaxing massage. Glad i chose to do more than just my feet as i fell asleep, no doubt much needed.

Delicious massage. The place is very well located and is very nice and clean. They have a waiting area with AC and while you wait they will offer you some tea. Once you choose your massage you go upstairs to a room with stretchers. The massage was very good and the masseur kept asking if I was Ok to what I answeres every single time : "very good". When you finish you walk down stairs and after paying you get offered a glass of lemon juice.Overall a very nice place with a very good massage with decent prices (60 min sport massage = 450.000 VND = $23 usd)

Wonderful Massage at Low Cost. There are hundreds and hundreds of street-front massage places in Hanoi, but the Mido Spa was recommended by the hotel at which I stayed, as a quiet place with good quality masseurs/masseuse and they were absolutely correct. The massage was a combination of a traditional Vietnamese massage and a sports massage. I left refreshed and relaxed. It was a very professional, high quality massage, at a low-moderate cost.

facial, body scrub and aromatherapy massage. I had 3 treatments at this spa and all were stellar, people commented on my glowing skin afterwards. I highly recommend this establishment, I had a room all to mayself and the same massuese for all 3 treatments, she was couteous and responsive when I asked for certain areas to be softer than others. I would highly recommend it. I just booked online and they responded very quickly and accomdated my preferred times so it was easy and hassle free to book. Definitely worth a visit!
Brilliant service . First time I've had a massage chose the aromatherapy it was relaxing and gentle, friendly staff and very helpful, clean place and safe

Don't make your holiday spoiled. I and my parents visited this mido spa twice in Tet holiday. As our hotel booked this spa as the trip adviser's rate was high enough, I even decided to pay 10% more for the tet holiday rate. The first day we three got foot massage, it was nice so far especially the guy with white hair, mom said his massage skill was great. When we come back from Halong bay we booked this mido spa again for our last massage in Hanoi, this was my MISTAKE. The manager made us wait for 20 mins first then said the massagers are eating dinner and they will get ready soon in 5mins. So we were waiting another 20 mins. I booked at 9 pm and it was almost 10pm and we were totally tired. I asked the manager that we don't want to get 2hours massage anymore bc it's too late, if you can do massage now we just get that for 1 hour, if not we just leave now. She was saying just "okay" for an hour even though she didn't understand at all.It seemed that the massager's were ready. It was my 2nd MISTAKE that I didn't leave that shop at that time. The three new massagers didn't know how to massage!! They just made us painful! I'm sure the manager made a call to the other spa(???) that she can bring ANY person available at that time. It was horrible and I felt so sorry for my parents. Don't go here not to spoil your holiday.

Great massage. This spa came recommended by one vietnamese friend of mine in Hanoi.Atmosphere was great. The staffs were friendly and communicative. Masseuses were undoubtedly professionals.Thumbs up! Highly recommended!

Not very good. Because of the good reviews we went to this spa to get a Thai massage and a Vietnamese massage. Both weren't very good.It seemed like they didn't have a clue what they were doing technically. Very disappointing.People were very friendly and gave us a discount. The reason for the bad massage according to them was: my staff is very tired because they have been working since this morning.

Soo nice!!. I went to Mido Spa today after reading great reviews and it did not dissapoint. Do yourself a favour and go here if you would like a relaxing treatment (or multiple, in my case) away from the noisy streets. I got the winter warming package - a steam bath, scrub, massage and foot paraffin treatment (2 hours total) for about $60AU! The staff had no problem with me wanting a scrub with coffee instead of the suggested ginger, so that was nice :)All in all, a wonderful experience for a great price!

Very enticing experience. I came with my bf and we got a couple treatment. The staff was enthusiastic and very friendly. Wide range of choices from facial to body massage. The price is a bit high but acceptable. Anyway, we will come back for sure.

Great relaxing Massage. I just had a great massage at Mido Spa in Hanoi. It was a 4 in 1 body massage ( Thai, Shiatsu, Sport and Aromatic) which left me feeling rejuvenated. The masseuse was very thorough and always asking if she wasn't too rough which is great. The service is friendly as well. Would rrecommendit to anyone especially after walking all day through Hanoi's beautiful Old Quarter.

Everything you want for a spa while traveling. Fantastic discovery in Hanoi. The massage was amazing as was the coconut body. Very friendly and helpful staff, wine on arrival, spring rolls on exit and a wee present due to it being the Tet holiday. Would definitely recommend, clean, professional and reasonable prices.

Great. These guys sure know how to massage! The place is a little quite place in Hanoi, which in itself is very welcome. I had the sport massage. It is very intense, for example, they use their full weight and lean with 2 knees on your shoulders, but that is a good sport massage. Price is very reasonable. Recommended!

Excellent spa for a relaxing experience.. We were staying in Hanoi for just a few days and were very happy to find the Mido Spa. We were able to walk in for our appointments. The facility is clean and welcoming. I had a 75-minute Sports Massage which was extremely relaxing and thorough--including a foot massage, head massage, etc. I also had a facial and eye wrinkle treatment which was wonderful. Great facial and she even removed a small cyst that had been bothering me for awhile (sorry, tmi, but I was very impressed!) I will definitely go back (probably tomorrow). Reasonable prices.

Great location and massage. I came to the spa after saw the tripadvisor. Easy to find the location. Great massage by male. After massage they offered the fruit. They were very friendly. I will come back again.
Just Lovely. Great staff and owner. Excellent price - discounted even more than I haggled for (unusual in Vietnam). Excellent clean setting. Am going again tomorrow - this time for longer :)

"How do you feel?" - "Very well!". After one year I visited again this spa 2 times during my stay in Hanoi in the end of November 2014. It was excellent again! I made my requests for massage appointments by E-mail and they were handled fast and professionally. I appreciate the warm welcome and the clean and spacious massage rooms, all provided with showers. On both visits I chose 2 hours aromatherapy massage, a perfect relax after long walks through Hanoi. I booked again Thanh for the massages, as I knew her from last year already and I liked her massage style very much. Her massages were very pleasant, she has good skills and works very cafefully. She is also very friendly and polite, always with a nice smile. Since last year she has improved her English skills noticably. So instead of the simple question "Are you ok?" she asked this time "How do you feel?" from time to time and I always could answer honestly "Very well!".

Excellent Service. I went in this Spa when I arrived in in the hotel nearby their place. (been two or three times during my stay)You are always received with the smile and a very nice cup of tea, just for the time you choose your treatment.the building as well as the room for the treatment seemed quite new and you can see that it has been well thought.Very clean, Good atmosphere, I have really enjoyed it.They were very professional in all aspect and speak well english.I have received a foot massage and a body massage by Thanh which has been performed great.With pleasure, I recommend this place if you are nearby.

An enjoyable experience. A massage was part of our holiday deal and was much appreciated after an 11-hour flight! The spa had recently been re-decorated and we were warmly welcomed with a drink before our relaxing massage which lasted about an hour. Pleasant surroundings and staff amenable. No idea of price as was 'free' for us. Will visit again if in Hanoi.

Skin saviour . I've never had a facial before, at home it's too expensive and I have pretty good skin anyway. However during my trip to Ha Long bay I got very badly sun burnt despite wearing sunscreen the whole time. A day later my skin went very bad, dry and sore and I broke out with infected black heads. It looked and felt horrible. Back in Hanoi was 8pm and my skin hurt so much I needed something on it, I was very tired so I walked into the first spa I saw. The place smelt amazing, Immediately I was invited to take off my shoes, negotiate what I wanted (natural skin care facial) 60 minutes for 400K. They gave me a cup of sweet tea. The therapist I had was very lovely and made me feel immediately comfortable. I locked my valuables in a safe with the key of my wrist and lay down. I then had my face washed, cream massaged into it, my pores opened up with steam and gunk sucked up in a weird little face vacuum, she then gave me an amazing face cream massage. At this point I was blissed out. The skin on my face had been hurting so badly for two days and it already felt better. Just as I was thinking it was finished, she placed a tissue over my face and then brushed cool a natural mushy banana avocado mask onto my face. It was heaven. While the mask set she gave me a small neck and hand message. When the facial was finished I felt so calm and my skin was like new, clean and glowing. Very happy with the experience.

Just OK. Good experience but overpriced for Vietnam and not so perfect massage condition.It's probably good if it's your first thai massage but if you are used to Asia, you will regret some lack of atmosphere and professionalism in Mido spa.

Great Place. Not usually a massage guy but decided to give it a try and attempt to relax. I was very impressed! The masseuse was great and I really enjoyed my massage. The prices are very reasonable and the facilities are adequate and clean.

Mido Spa Experience. The Mido Spa was located down the block from my hotel and I just happened to stumble upon it while walking the streets. Although I did not expect much from the exterior, I was pleasantly surprised when I entered the door. The atmosphere and environment was decorated very well and the staff was welcoming. They had me take a seat while I looked through their spa offerings drinking a cup of the free tea they had given me. They then gave me a tour of the facility, which was excellent. I opted for the hot stone massage and it was a very excellent experience. I feel relaxed and will definitely return if I am ever back in Hanoi.

Loved it. Wish I could have gone again. This spa is great. The masseur was super talented and it was an excellent massage. I wish I could have gone more than once. I really wish it was in my home town, but then it would cost 5x as much!

3.5 hour spa experience. We booked a 3.5 hour package via phone including body scrub, sauna, massage and facial for two people. We negotiated a good price for both of us and were brought pho half-way through the afternoon. Our treatment room was several floors up and was clean, cool and nicely decorated. The body scrub and massage were very good and when I requested firmer pressure for the massage it was delivered. The only problem we encountered was with my facial. I ended up with a dark purple mark on the tip of my nose which lasted several days. I wasn't terribly upset about it, but was disappointed there was no apology for whatever error was made during the service. My husband had no issues, and I have no doubt it was a simple mistake.I would return to this spa on another visit to Hanoi.

Bliss! . I spent 3 hrs here having a massage, facial, feet cleaned and a mud wrap. It's was bliss, very gentle and soft facial, the mud wrap has left my skin silky smooth and soft! The massage was relaxing but firm. The rooms are temperature controlled and they checked to see I was comfortable at each stage. I will be back next time I'm here

Lovely spa package. It was a bit hard to locate, but thanks to a hotel nearby we got some directions. I booked the coconut spa package for me and my boyfriend online, before we went to Hanoi. When we got there we got 10% discount because we ordered online, and that was obviously a nice surprise. Also, noodle soup lunch was included, and some extra free spring rolls because of the christmas holidays. The steam bath seemed a little homemade, but other than that it was a really nice experience. The massage was good, the scrub was good and same with the facial. We got to be treated in the same room as well, which I appreciate. They have a little box where you can lock up your things if you like.

Very friendly and reasonably priced. Me and my husband booked a massage and although we enjoyed it, it wasn't the best massage we've ever had. We both found it a little rushed as I think it was close to closing time. We booked 2 different treatments for the following day. I had a facial and my husband had a mud wrap. We really enjoyed our treatments and felt they went above and beyond. They even made us spring rolls to eat after our treatments. I would definitely go back. I think some staff are more professional and better than others.

Superb customer service, great massage.. A friend of mine and I came here today for massages before going to the airport and to be honest I'd say we would have missed out on such great massages and truly amazing customer service if we hadn't come. The price was definitely not THAT affordable but given the fact it was centrally located and the experience was great I'd say it was worth it. We went in for a couples massage with hot stone for him and aromatherapy for myself. The lady who greeted us at the door was extremely friendly, and the man at the end was so nice he was offering us a small traditional meal with spring rolls as a special Christmas gift after we were done. We would have stayed to enjoy the food if we hadn't had to leave right away to catch the flight. I've had cheaper massage with the same or even better quality in Thailand but the people here were so nice I could not not write a thumbs up review for them. Overall we enjoyed it a lot and would recommend our friends to come check it out when they come visit Hanoi. The place was definitely a little charm in the Old Quarter.
Nice spot. Went a couple of times after chancing upon this quaint place. Prices were reasonable and very professional and polite staff. Good for that break after negotiating the streets of hanoi

Great Massage, Reasonable Price. We had a couples massage with hot stones and oil. Staff were great, venue maybe a bit cramped, but quality of massage was good. Worth negotiating a discount before making a booking.Definitely worth a visit.
Good spa. I always rec friends coming here for spa&massage whenever they come to Hanoi. Price is acceptable, service is good and location is rite at Old Quarters.
Best Spa In Hanoi. I highly recommend this spa.Very friendly and professional staff. Will definitely go here again. The best!

Brilliant Massage. This spa was recommended by our hotel, and provided a complimentary taxi to get from the hotel. The prices were reasonable, the massage excellent, premises were clean and the staff very good, sending us off with a map and directions for where we wanted to go. I was only sorry we had not visited earlier so we could come back again before we left Hanoi! Highly recommend this spa and we will visit again when we return to Hanoi.

Too relaxing. All the staff are very friendly, the place is very clean rooms are nicley lit and comfortable and the massgaes are awesome also very profesional been here a few times already in my short time I would definitely recommend this place.

Best massage we had in a long time. Our hotel guided us to Vi Spa. We were confronted without complaining customers, so decided to leave. We went to Mido and did not regret it! Good people, nice and clean...and above all very professional. Watch out for the tourist traps! Mido is certainly not one of them.
Best in Hanoi. This spa is a great establishment. Massage was great. Things were clean. Had a lot of other services such as facials, baths, and saunas.

Don't go here for wax. I walked in asking for a eyebrow wax and facial. The lady spent 10 minutes waxing one eyebrow. Wax was so hot it hurt and there were a lot of spare hairs left. I get my eyebrows done all the time so I knew this girl was inexperienced. I opted out of the facial considering the waxing was so bad. Giving it two stars cuz the front desk lady apologized and didn't make me pay.

Excellent Spa.
