After My Trek to Sapa I asked My Hotel where was the Best Place that I could get a Good Massage , they told me go and try Mido Spa and I was glad that I did.As soon as you walk in Shoe's are off and you are greeted with a warm drink and a warm smile , you sit and go though the Menu off what is on offer.Once you have decided , you are taken upstairs to the Massage Room by the young Lady and the Massage begins. I must say the Young Girl was very good at her Job and meet my needs very well.Mido's Spa is very Clean and all the Staff where pleasant.To the Manager and all at Mido thankyou for a Great Massage and I look forward to seeing you all again on my next Trip to Hanoi.I might even come back and Marry the Girl that Massage Me , thanks for the Laugh's and Smiles.Kind RegardsMr Phil Johnson

great massage !. After sitting on plane and hanging around in airports for around 24 hrs the idea of a good massage was irresistible. The problem is finding a good masseur ! We were staying next door to the Midi at the Hanoi holiday gold hotel and they came highly recommended by the reception. I opted for the Thai massage with oils and Ding the masseursse was brilliant. Really strong deep massage which left me feeling relaxed and ready for the next 4 weeks on the road and all at about one third the price I would pay in the UK. They even have a safe deposit box for your valuables with the key hooked around your wrist.I'm sure you can find cheaper but value for money was spot on. Hoping to get back before we fly home...

Twice Goers. My friend and I visited Hanoi twice this year, because we LOVE Vietnam. The best experiences though, were always our time at the spa. We stumbled upon Mido Spa back in May 2014. It's centrally located in the heart of the Old Quarter. There we enjoyed a relaxing Swedish massage, facials and pedicures. Although, it wouldn't hurt if they had more nail polish selections. Mido Spa is open, bright and clean, which are important features we always look for in any spas. At the end of our appointment, we met with the spa manager who was very pleasant and even gave us directions to a good Banh Mi store. We came back to Hanoi in October and decided to walk to Mido Spa to say hello. The manager approached us at the door and immediately remembered us. We were surprised. He even recalled our love for Banh Mi sandwiches. Because we were strapped for time in Hanoi, the manager allowed me to shorten the length of my hot stone massage to an hour and at a better price. I remember it was pouring rain after we were done. A free poncho from the spa did the trick. The staff are all very friendly and if I were back in Hanoi for a third time, I would come again!

Last day in Vietnam !. It was my last day in Vietnam so I decided to get a pedicure done before the flight home. The staff at Mido spa were very welcoming and very courteous! Nothing was too much trouble and because I didn't have flip flops to walk home in only trainers they provided me with some disposable ones so not to ruin the nail varnish.Thank you so much to the staff at Mido spa to ending my trip on a high.

Great Experience. We were walking the streets of Hanoi, and decided to give this location a try. I must admit that the a/c was very appealing. Once inside the treatment began with hello. We (husband and myself) experienced the foot massage. Very relaxing. They managed to meet both of our needs -- we would highly recommend this location.

Good nail repair!. I only had a nail and toe nail repair done but I felt much better afterwards. The lady was very thorough and the staff were friendly. Mido Spa offer a variety of services at good prices.

Excellent massage. I had a 2 hour Mido combination massage, which was really excellent helped get rid of aches from lots of walking and sleeper bus journeys.Nice and firm, and stretched me out nicely, although I even managed doze off for quite a bit of it.The massage was quite a bit better than the one I had at SF Spa a few days before that.Also took the green tea scrub. In hindsight, it didn't feel rough enough to scrub much of skin so probably would have chosen another scrub next time.Professional environment and no extras. Recommended.

fantastic. Just walked by & decided to try a facial. I was very pleased, although suprised that my therapist was male. I always like to try new places but I have been back had a sea salt scrub & also swedish massage & nail colour as I don't think any others looked as good.

Absolute bliss!!!. Easily the best spa treatment we have had - and we've had quite a few. We both had the paradise package. 5 1/4 hours of blissful relaxation. The staff were amazing, facilities clean and we can't recommend the experience highly enough. It was one of the highlights of our time in Hanoi. Add Mido Spa to your must visit list when you are in Hanoi - you won't regret it.

Great massage and service. Visited this place because of their good reviews on tripadvisor. Was not disappointed. I selected the 75 min Mido combo package and was enjoying it so much that it only felt like 30 min. I wish I had got the longer package!

Perfect way to relax. After all the kayaking in the bay and the trekking, my friend and I needed to visit a spa. We were told about Mido by a staff member in the hotel where we stayed. Worth every penny. Clean and welcoming. The staff is friendly and they sit and chat with you while you wait. The massages are expensive when compared to other places , but then good things come with a price and we were absolutely satisfied and rejuvenated. They provide one way free taxi. So we took that on the way back. Will recommend this place to anyone who wants value for money.

Excellent shiatsu massage. Two of us had a 90 minute shiatsu massage this morning, it was great, best massage we've had in Vietnam. Staff were very friendly, responded to working on sore areas as requested. Thanks good value.

An absolute must for a relaxing time in Hanoi!. My partner and I are on holiday from Melbourne and were in desperate need of some spa time after a week of travel through Vietnam. We chose Mido Spa given the incredible reviews it had been receiving recently on TA and we were blown away.The staff are warm, welcoming, professional and accommodating beyond belief. My partner was hungry prior to our 2 hour package today and the owner proceeded to walk us to a local restaurant where he talked us through traditional food on offer, purchased some for my boy and then plated it for him (with a beer!) back at the spa!We have been back for packages twice in 2 days and loved every minute of it! We are already planning another package there before we leave.A MUST if you are in Hanoi!

Friendly service with great skills. Had a spa pedicure here with my boyfriend who had a foot massage. The scrub was great and the accompanied massage was simply divine. Shaping of nails and cutting cuticles were done skillfully. However there weren't any application of base coat and top coat, just a single coat of nail colour. But that sufficed as it was well done. I have no complaints. Owner was friendly and the masseurs were too, but not overly chatty. Would definitely recommend this place for a massage and pedicure!
Good!. Staff are friendly and services are value-for-money! Definitely one of the better ones in Hanoi at an affordable price.

One of the best!. I have tried a wide variety of massage and spa places around Indochina and this is one of the best! Everything very clean, people speak English really well and pricing is typical for the area. Will definitely come again here! Tried a couple places in the area and nothing even comes close to the quality of this one!

Thoroughly enjoyed... Walked in off the street and was approached immediately. Went in for an hour facial and felt so relaxed booked hot stone massage straight after. Could have easily dosed off. Very professional and totally relaxing. Highly recommend.

Affordable and Friendly!. Visited this spa today and had the Spa Pedicure (300K VND). Was able to choose from a good range of colours in the OPI nail brand - really good nail polish. I hadn't booked an appointment and waited less than 2 minutes before going through to the treatment room.My beautician was super friendly and gave my feet a really good scrub and massage before performing the actual pedicure (which looks perfect!). The entire thing lasted about an hour so was really good value for money too (equivalent of $15AUD). The service was finished with a delicious lemon drink and there was no push to get rid of us. Ended up meeting another traveller and had a really great time just chatting about each others trip!Will definitely be back for more spa treatments!! Recommend to others :-)

Relaxing and welcoming. Visited a number of times during my stay in Hanoi, being right next door the hotel where I was staying, it was a great way to enjoy some pampering and relaxation. Always welcoming and friendly staff. Clean and inviting environment. Refreshments before and after add to the relaxing atmosphere.

First time at a spa . It's my first time at a spa anywhere in the world, so I didn't know what to expect. Service upon walking through the front door was nice -- smiling man gave us cups of tea and led us to sit down with spa menus. I got a fruit facial which was 400 VND( ~20 USD) which on the menu was listed as a one hour long session. The facial was done in a dark quiet room with Zen tranquil music playing in the back. Although I could still hear the buzz of nearby construction tools, the atmosphere still remained relaxed and peaceful for the 60 minutes. I even fell asleep during a large part of it. My face was hand rubbed with many different fragrant gels. At one point a machine that emitted very hot vapor was held over my face while the lady did smoothing maneuvers with some kind of tools all over my face. After the rubs and hot vapor, a mask was put on and I fell asleep. When she entered the room again I woke up and she took off the mask and did a final rubbing scrub. She sat me up and did a quick back massage. I'm writing this review in the spa waiting room right now literally 10 minutes after finishing, so I don't know what effects there are on my skin yet, but it feels a bit sticky ( it's the lotion?)Dunno if I would do again. Might try a body massage later.

Taken care of. We read the reviews on trip advisor so decided to try this place we walked in to a clean well kept environment. The hostess spoke English and could explain everything. We booked a foot massage and full body massage. Starting with foot massage we enjoyed it as we were at first the only ppl in there then came others one by one.We were then told no room for massage so they gave us a second foot massage 'for free' body massage was good but hubby did not think it was as good as I did. Overall 2.5 hrs later we spent 13000,000 dong or $36 per person for all that!!

Massage Heaven. Great place to spend and hour or two unwinding in between visiting tourist attractions. Very reasonable price and located centrally. We walked in off the street without an appointment, although they advise booking in advance. Very friendly staff who were able to explain the various types of massages/treatments on offer. They even provided complimentary beers afterwards! I went for a traditional Thai massage which was amazing. The masseuse certainly knew what she was doing - I dosed off for 20 minutes or so during it! I only booked the 60 min massage but would definitely go for the longer option next time.

Good body massage but !!. My wife and I have just returned from a session at Mido spa, I had the 60 minute body massage which was great, very relaxing and just strong enough.My wife had the foot spa and massage which was good however people were going in and out of the room having other treatments which she found to be a distraction so ask for private room if possible.

Treat yourself!. A very clean and comfortable spa with a wide range of treatments and great value for money. My husband and I couldn't decide between aromatherapy and hot stones so had a combination. The massage therapists were magic and covered the whole body from fingers to toes. Open all hours so after a long flight, trek or hours of walking the streets it's so convenient.

Great retreat in Hanoi. My partner and I have just come back feeling very relaxed from Mido Spa. I had the 30min Indian back, neck and shoulder massage which was amazing. The lady got all the stress and tension out in my back leaving me feeling rejuvenated. I also had a mini facial leaving my face feeling really cleansed and glowing. My partner had an hour aromatherapy massage and has also come away feeling relaxed and happy with the experience. The place is reasonably priced, very clean and the staff are professional in making sure you are comfortable and happy. If we weren't leaving Hanoi tomorrow I would definitely go back to Mido Spa. Thank You :-)

Excellent & clean spa. Highly recommend Mido Spa. Very clean and welcoming atmosphere. They have a wide variety of spa options... I went for a 75 minute Thai massage and it was EXCELLENT. It was nice to find a place that offers strong massages as the ones in Hanoi aren't typically as so. It was a bit more than some places (520k) but I was very pleased. They also have a "happy hour" going on from now till November if you spend a certain amount of money. Ask in person or check the website. I'll definitely be back.

lovely find. I've been to many spas/salons around Hanoi looking for a good spa pedicure, and Mido's 300,000 ($15) spa pedi is definitely worth it. The facilities are clean, cool and comfortable. The spa pedi lasts just over an hour, starting of with an amazing foot scrub, followed by a foot massage and then the pedicure. The reason I gave it 4 of out 5 is the actual massage wasnt the best I've ever had, but it could just be that masseuse... Still I will definitely be going back.

Such a lovely discovery. I happened upon this little spa on my last day in Hanoi. It was such a wonderful find. The decor was so clean, the staff were so welcoming and friendly. The massage I had was a great price and exactly as described in the programme. This was one of the most relaxing experiences of my life. The therapist was so professional but also warm and friendly. I would recommend Mido a million times over. :)

Great massage, good price. this spa is very clean, staff were very friendly and professional, and the massages options are endless. I had a full body sport massage (60 min) and a foot massage (30 minutes) and both were great.

Great place, pedicure, atmosphere and staff. I went to get a pedicure with friends and the staff was so nice and patient.. The girl that did my nails invested so much was very nice and great atmosphere.. Very recommended:)

Great atmosphere, great massage. I went there with a friend and I have to say I would always come back again if I can. The massage was fantastic and the staff were very friendly. I can only recommand this spa.
Hanoi Oi. Awesome massage while we were there and they are friendly towards us. Always serving us with a smile before and after the massage

Great end to the holiday. My girlfriend and I went to Mido on our last night in Hanoi as a treat, and werent disappointed. The atmosphere is relaxing, the massage was fantastic, and all the staff there were so friendly. With so many spa's to choose from in Hanoi, I would put Mido on your list as its an excellent place to spend some good relaxation time.
Professional and relaxing experience. I enjoyed my massage here. There is a wide selection to choose from, and all are undertaken professionally in relaxing surroundings.
Good service!. Centrally located at Hang Manh street, Close to the famous Bun Cha store. Good service. Worth the value.

Super clean and professtional. I visited Hanoi when it was very hot. I gone to Mido spa after my hotel booking. Spa is very nice and very clean. Colld tea and fresh fruit before the treatment. I was very relaxing when used the basic facial treatment by natural fruits. The staff were very friendly and professional with many equipments. The masseuses where not very good in speaking English, but they frequently asked to make sure I was OK.I will come again next time. Overall I would recommend this place!
indian back massage. That was amazing and the massage attendance was very friendly and the service was excellent. I'd definitely recommend it to my friends.

High quality @ right price. For sure it's not the less expensive in old town but the quality is at very high level. Maybe you'll spend double respect other place where get a massage but having tried both I have to say this Spa is really the best. Sometime is nice to get higher quality.

Fantastic Service - Above and Beyond!. Mido is the best spa that I’ve been to in Vietnam!!! I traveled to Hanoi in June 2014 with a few friends. It was my friend’s birthday, so a few of us decided to get oil massages together at Mido.The massages were fantastic. The ladies giving us massages were very professional throughout the session. Rather than giving a standard rub, they customized our massages and paid extra attention to our troubled spots (for me it was my shoulders). We had been to some not-so-great massage places in other cities, and overall we really enjoyed our experience at Mido.The icing on the cake was that there was an actual cake! We filled out some informational forms, and my friend mentioned it was her birthday. When we were done with our massages, the owner and the staff ushered us to the lobby and brought out a surprise birthday cake, lychees, and Saigon beer!! As a personal touch, her name was even on the cake! They invited the other patrons to come and we all sang happy birthday together. The Mido staff went the extra mile to make my friend’s birthday special. It was incredibly nice of them and showed a high level of attention to detail. I would highly recommend Mido Spa, both for their excellent massages and customer service.

Good spa in the midst of the Old Quarter. Me and my girlfriend had a great time at Mido Spa, excellent thai massage(tips to the massusse), girlfriend had a bodyscrub and a facial. Body scrub was better. Definitely value for money and located in a good area.

Wonderful spa. My wife and I had a spapackage. We started with a jacuzzi and steambath.The massage was really good, the facial and bodyscrub as well. Really nice to be spoiled after travelling for a few weeks. We ended with a nice meal and a beer and were completely relaxed afterwords.
Great Value Spa. Really good staff, the owner was very friendly and helpful. Wouldn't hesitate to visit again if we were ever in Hanoi

Great experience & very relaxing. I don't go to the spa regularily, however if all were like the mido, I'd probably have to rethink... Great service, very professional and all of it in a very peaceful and relaxing ambiance. I can definitely recommens it to all who look to relax from the busy streets of hanoi be they in a group or - like me - by themselfes

Highly recommend!. Very nice mani & pedi... complimentary foot massage inspired a return visit the next day for a Thai massage. Massage was excellent, Thai massages are more of a workout then a massage, very intense, but felt fantastic. Great staff, very clean. Will surely be back next time I am in Hanoi to try some of their other services.
Great experience. We went here, looking for a massage. We were not dissapointed: great service and a great massage. The people here were friendly and the spa is clean. Highly recommended!

Fantastic. I was looking for a good place for a wax and saw this was rated in trip advisor although a bit expensive compared to near by places! Phong was lovely and I am glad I spend a bit extra! I was greeted with herbal tea and fresh fruit and then some lemon juice after. I was on crutches so he helped me and then took me to a nearby supermarket on his bike afterwards! Would not get this anywhere else, thank you so much!!!

Very Good SPA in Hanoi. Very friendly welcome and good massage. After the treatment, they offered us a goodbye drink. The only thing to improve: the masseuses should not talk together during the massage (even if it was just a few sentences). All in all i can clearly recommend this spa!

Excellent spa in Hanoi! . Me and a friend visited Mido Spa on our last day in Hanoi, and it was by far the best pedicure I've had in Vietnam. The staff was so lovely, and the place was very clean so the whole experience was just awesome!

Relaxing and good hospitality. It's was a very good moment, the welcome is perfect, and there is a good ratio price/quality, the massage Aromatherapy was very relaxing. Also, the manicure and pedicure were good, the place is pleasant and clean, and staff very nice. The boss speak French, so it was very nice to speak with her. I recommand.

Lovely spa in Hanoi, very relaxing. After a long walk in old quarter, I spent my time in a lovely spa in Hang Manh str with very good smell, very friendly staff,I choose coconut package with steam bath, body scrub, body massage... All with coconut, it made my skin very soft and amazing.I would like to recommend this spa and this package !P.s: you can pay by creadit card - no charge more.Great day !

Good spa, could have been better. Went here with a few mates for late night relaxation. Very clean and air conditioned and i was very happy with their service- however you don't get that feeling you are in a spa, they just put you in a room and start working on you theres no robe, dim lights, nice smells and soft music you would expect from a western spa. If you want the full 'spa' feeling then i would recommend going elsewhere. Not only that but after one of my friends massages the lady specifically asked him for a tip of 100,000VND - i found that pretty rude. Glad he didn't tip here that amount.

Friendly, clean and cool! . I went there for a body wrap and the staff were extremely welcoming and friendly! It was so lovely to walk into a clean air conditioned environment after walking around the hot city all day! I was really happy with the service and the body treatment i received. If you compare it to spa's in places like Hoi An it is obviously going to be a bit more expensive but you get what you pay for! Very happy client!Definitely going back there

Very clean and tidy.. Only way to see hanoi is by foot.and after many trips around the city. I find a relaxing massage at mido is the way to go. Not the cheapest in town but the most professional. Very clean.

a bit expensive for the service rendered. Enjoyed our 1 hour foot massage at this spa. I actually slept the entire way through the treatment. However, living in Bangkok I know good value when I see it. And for this spa, I felt it was a bit expensive for the quality and facilities of the spa. I was happy with the overall experience, however for the overall value, I rate this as an average experience. Also, they seemed to short change us by 10 min for the treatment which I didn't appreciate.

Very thoughtful and excellent service!. After reading the reviews on Mido Spa, I decided to give it a go since my hotel was nearby. As a standard procedure, they had me fill in a short form and found out that it was my birthday. After a wonderful and relaxing massage, I was greeted with a birthday cake and all the friendly staff! I was touched. The service was excellent to start with but that additional touch was just what set this spa from the others. Next time you are in Hanoi, do drop by!!

A day in the spa!. I went there to get a pedicure and have a brief rest from the sensory overload of Hanoi, but instead I signed up for an amazing 5 1/2 hours of total indulgence for a very reasonable price. It included a sauna, body scrub, full-body massage, mud bath, paraffin wax foot treatment and a bath in milk and rose petals. This may not sound like the best way to see Hanoi, but after several weeks of intensive travel, taking this amazing day of rest was wonderful. Not only was this one of the best massages I have ever had, but I so enjoyed going through all of the other spa treatments, some of which were new to me. The place is very clean and the staff is professional and well trained! Highly recommended!

Massage and nails. This spa was very clean and nice. The people were very friendly, and they give you free tea, candy, and lychee. They give very nice massages and also have good chairs for mani/pedi. It's not as cheap as you might think a Vietnamese massage would be, but it's a pretty good deal for the Old Quarter and still much cheaper than in other countries.
Good value!. Good value for money, and very friendly staff!!I had the hot rock treatment and was very happy, would go back agin!They give you free beer too!!Highly recommend!!!

Good value. This place is conveniently located and it's clean and good value. The staff are extremely polite and very eager to please. They were very accommodating too - they arranged to have us (our family with kids (who had foot massages)) to be all in a large treatment room, which was comforting, since we did not have to worry about our kids when they finished before we did.It is worth a visit for a session of relaxation and pampering, at a reasonable price.

Relaxing Treat !. Being a seasoned traveller and massages are high priority where ever we travel ,we visited the Mido spa in Hanoi. Although not as cheap as Bali. It hadlovely staff and excellent service. An hour massage was about $20 per personIt was a lovely relaxing massage and very comfortable surroundings.We ended up squeezing 2 treatments in our 3 days stay in Hanoi and Halong Bay

Absolutely excellent service and very cheap. I had a half hour massage and a pedicure and manicure (my girlfriend made me do it, yeah) and found the place to be clean and the staff to be unbelievable. The tension in my back from 10 days of lugging a backpack around was starting to affect my sleeping until I went here. Highly recommend. Lots of spas in Hanoi, but my advice is to go to this joint
Very good vietnam massage. I had a very good massage in this spa. The personal was very friendly and courteous. I will turn back, that's sure for another kind of massage.

Good experience, good value. I'm not a spa person so I don't have much to compare this to but I had a good massage, facial and foot massage with a free manicure for less than $30 and it was a good experience. The staff were very attentive and lovely.

great massage in a clean environment. I had the oil thai massage for two days in succession, loved the firmness and the stretching, My masseur was thorough and took the massage to an appropriate level without being uncomfortably intimate, ( if that makes sense). My wife however had the same massage from the same girl and didnt like it, she thought it had no structure. So each to their own. The staff were all very professional and it was a lot cleaner than other places we have been to in Vietnam

Oasis amongst the busy streets of Hanoi. I picked up a leaflet whilst walking past on our way back to hotel. We stayed at Golden Sun Suites (see Review) in Hang Quat Street. My daughter and I decided what we would like to experience and our hotel made an appointment for us 2 hrs later. Easy to find we sat in their waiting reception room was offered a herbal tea and mints and before long we were whisked away upstairs for my foot massage and daughters facial. Both were delightful. We then went downstairs to have our nails done. Manicure and pedicure. Lovely mother daughter time was spent at Mido Spa. Many thanks

Very friendly, and well-priced. We were staying at a nearby hotel and walked by this spa. It seemed nice, and after checking Tripadvisor we decided to give it a go. I had a 1 hour Sweden massage, which was quite good. My girlfriend had a 30 min foot massage which she said was very good, and a pedicure, which she said was average.The staff were all extremely friendly, helpful and inviting, and the prices were quite reasonable. We would likely return in the future.

Terrible foot massage. My friend and I went for a foot massage - having both lived in Hong Kong got many years we know what a proper foot massage is. These girls were both absolutely clueless making it up as they went along and trying to do this then that. It was a waste of time and money. We should have known when we were told we didn't need to book - sure sign they're just putting anyone on the job

Great service for the value!. 3 of us just happened to walk past the shop and were invited in by the service staff. Initially we wanted to do more massages but settled on foot spa treatment (400,000doung).We enquired on if we wanted to include a manicure,how much more would it cost. And the lady actually threw in free nail painting(not the manicure suite) and discounted the entiret treatment to 350,000doung per person. We were like wow,bcoz we didn't even asked for a discount. They also tried to make our waiting more enjoyable by providing nice sweet mangos and tea for us. During our treatment,the 3 service staff were very friendly and chatted with us,sharing with us some common Vietnamese terms,their lifestyle,and we also answered some of their questions abt our country. It was like talking to new found friends. Overall we had a pleasant experience even though the treatment wasn't the best of the class,it was the service that wowed us. I recommend this place if you are looking for a nice place to relax and chill before continuing on tour Hanoi journey!

Heavenly foot massage. On the last day of a wonderful trip to north Vietnam, walking through the Old Quarter my partner and I happened upon the Mido Spa. Friendly, professional and very reasonably priced. They even threw in a cut and file for my partners feet and hands (no colour for him!) Just what we needed - a little piece of serenity before heading home. Thank you.

Great Massage. I had an extra day in Hanoi and decided to go for a massage to kill time. I got their brochure from the hotel I was staying in and thought their prices were reasonable. I was welcome by friendly staff and offered some tea. They'll give you beer if you prefer that. Since it was in the middle of the day I got to have the common room to myself. I got the Swedish massage and the masseur was really good, I dozed off a little bit. I added a 30-minute foot massage for a small price and that was well worth it. I left Mido feeling relaxed and rejuvenated. Highly recommend it.
Very nice spa. The folks at the Mido Spa did an excellent job to accommodate 4 of us at very short notice and provided us with wonderful massages as a very reasonable price

Go, go to Mido spa. Excellent service. This is the first time, i was walking in Hanoi old quarter, we went to spa (also with my family). I feel wonderful when two girls massage for me (body massage for 2 hour). They speak English very good. I like their treatments and friendly. Thank Mido spa. We are ready to go other place. We will come back next few day.Highly recommend!

Pedicure at Mido Spa . We (couple) came without a appointment and get right away a pedicure. The women are very friendly and courteous. They speak quite good English and French. We got a tee at the beginning. Our treatment last for one hour. The rooms have airconditioning. The toilet should be cleaner.

Awesome and delightful. I was able to customised my servicesThe staff was friendlySteam room and hot tub was availableAnd a 2 hours massage for 750,000 d - is really affordable oh yeah I was lucky enough to go back 3 times (heaven on earth)
A moment to relax. Even thou the girls don't speak English, the hostess receive does and receive you with kindness and a big smile. I had the sports massage, and was awesome!

Great Relaxing Experience. Normally I don't write reviews of the places I visit. However, my experience at Mido Spa was fantastic. The staff were absolutely friendly and the service 5 star, I highly recommend Mido Spa to anybody that wants to unwind after a stressful and busy day in Hanoi.

Mido Spa is my choice !. I walked around the Old Quarter of Hanoi n Hoan Kiem lake about few hours in this afternoon n I felt very tired. I thought about the foot-massage at the moment! When I walked to Hang Manh St, I saw Mido Spa. I just stood outside n looked around for find some helps. A Mido Spa's staff opened the door, smiled n said Hello wt me n then invited me come-in. She showed me the massage list n I chose the 60m foot-massage. I felt very very enjoyed with her experience n I asked her about the body-massage! Woaaa! It's so lovely n I felt really happy with that! I talked with my Aussie brother-inlaw n he took my sister to Mido. They said They was be really happy with the experience massage, the friendly staff with their smile n the customer service. All is perfect! We'll visit Halong bay tmr n come back Hanoi next week n certainly we'll go back Mido few more times. We loved Mido Spa <3

Everything was perfect!!!. I came here with my friends on a trip to Vietnam as a recommendation from our hotel. I did not expect much but it turned out to a pleasant experience for us. Everything was excellent, customer service was great, staff are very friendly and helpful. I will definitely come back here next time.
Great relaxing spa. Great spa, visited twice with my gf during my 4 day stay in Hanoi. Recommend getting the 90 mins plus treatment. Guaranteed to fall asleep.

Relaxing and atmospheric, amazing value. Having had cheap massages in a few places in Vietnam, whilst mido spa was very slightly more expensive, the difference in price was more than made up for by the difference in quality, ambience and professionalism of staff. So much so, we even went back for more during a brief stop over in Hanoi another time!The staff were very friendly and welcoming, and the environment was very relaxing and much more like what you would expect from a spa. On both occasions we got our treatments straight away with no need to book, and the second time even got a discount for returning! This made the total cost of 2 full body 60 minute thai massages less than $20!The massages themselves were very relaxing and a high quality compared to some we experienced elsewhere. Certainly comparable to a decent spa in the UK.WIsh we'd had more time in Hanoi as we would certainly have gone back once more. Rebecca and Ally

Polite staff and great treatments. When arriving in Ha Noi it was extremely cold. We got annoyed by the rain and the freezing temperature, so we decided to give ourselves some spa treatments. We walked to a couple of spa's in the neighborhood around the Old Centre. We walked past Mido Spa and it looked really nice with affordable prices. When we went inside the people were very polite. We asked for two types of treatments and they made a reasonable price for us. The staff is really nice and speaks good English. We ended up spending almost three hours in the salon. But we had a great time. They did however reused some towels, which isn't really hygienic. And we bought a treatment with masks for our hands and feet. We had to put our hands and feet in hot wax. After it dried they pulled the dried up wax from our hands and feet and put the wax back in the same pot. I hope they don't use the same pot of wax for other costumers, but I'm afraid they do. Anyways, the trearment was nice and the staff was very polite. I would recommend going here for a massage or getting your nails done. It's a reasonable price.

Lovely Facial. Myself and my husband both had a great facial here on our last day in Hanoi.Ok,so there are probably swankier places to go for treatments in Hanoi but we felt the service was very professional and were both pleased with the facial and service.Our skin has been lovely since. On the whole,a good experience.Friendly therapists and a great treatment.
Friendly & Professional. This is located next door to the hotel I was staying at while in Hanoi (Holiday Gold Hotel). Staff where helpful and I think fairly reasonably priced.

Better quality massage. Hanoi has many massage and Spa establishments, so which one do you choose?As a qualified massage therapist, I am forced to be critical of the often poor and sometimes even unsafe techniques displayed by many of the supposed therapists working at many Hanoi businesses.After two 120min aroma oil massages, I have no hesitation in recommending Mido Spa.Prices are mid range for this type and duration of massage.But after the (still cheap) price is forgotten, you need to be happy with all elements of the treatment.My therapist listened to my preferenes and adjusted the massage style accordingly.Good massage technique including nice flow.Hint... As with most massage places in Hanoi, you need to ask for a private room if you do not want your massage interrupted by talking.

What a great spa it is lol !. I'm tae hee from Korea.travel by my self in Vietnam. :-) I met receptionist on the road suddenly . to ask location of some spot. she's really friendly . so i visited this spa next day . Massage also really great and comfortable and also professional !  rooms also really clean and cozy. :-) everyone is really friendly.  Next time, if i go to Hanoi, i definetly go there again. Thanks for that great experiences.

Great spa escape!. My friend and I went for the 30min foot massage. We were greeted out front in by very friendly staff but not pushy. Once inside offered tea before being shown to our room where we were able to sit side by side and visit during the massage. The ladies working were very professional, friendly and great at massage. At the end we were offered another cup of tea before departure. I wish we could've stayed all day!!
Very nice spa!. Very nice spa! Good massage in clean and well furnitured rooms. Good aircondition and heater element during colder days. Nice showers and good personel. Very recommended!

Body scrub delight. Very happy to come across this spa as we found there not as common here in Hanoi as we thought. Wife had body scrub for an hour and I had the Vietnamese / Chinese body massage and we were very satisfied and recommend this spa. Owners are very welcoming and appears only opened for less than a year. They even offered tea or beer before or after. Very professional.
a very good experience - highly recommended!. I have been there this Lunar New Year.I tried face and foot massages that I enjoyed very much. the staffs were very caring. The prices were reasonable.

Best salon ever!. This salon was absolutely amazing!!! I'm from the United States but was in Vietnam while studying abroad. My friends and I went to get manicures and pedicures on my birthday. The ladies who painted our nails were fabulous. They were so nice and did an amazing job. We mentioned it was my birthday, and they said happy birthday. After our nails were dry, we started to leave. Before we could go, all of the salon employees came out carrying a big birthday cake and sang happy birthday. I was so excited!!! We had a mini birthday party in the nail salon. I have never been to a salon with such nice people. Afterwards, they showed us a delicious pho restaurant. It was incredible! I had such a great birthday and experience at this salon. Everyone who works there is phenomenal. They are some of the nicest people I have ever met. Everyone should go here!!
Great visit. Nice ambience and excellent service attitude. Location happened to be near central attraction area. Massage skills are fairly good and good place for return to massage.

Mido SPa. a good experience. Really friendly and very eager to please people.The masseurs knew what they were doing, inquired under the message whether you enjoyed it what they were doing, as in if you wanted the message to be harder or softer etc.It has an amazing location nearby backpacker hostells in the Hoan Kiemh district. We were staying at Hanoi Central Backpacker 2, and it were just on the other side of the street. They also offered us to teach us some message when we asked for it, but unfortuneatly we didn't get the chance to as one of us were sick and I hurt my thumb while playing volleyball.I would definitly go there if were to ever be in Hanoi again and I hope other people will try this out as well.
Relaxing evening. The staff are very pleasant and provide very nice foot and body massage. They offer several style of massage at reasonable prices.
Amazing!. We just got back to our hotel and we have never felt more relaxed! Great customer service and lovely staff! I have had plenty of massages and that one was by far the best! Thanks.

Above and beyond!. Absolutely loved our experience here! They were short staffed because of TET so we had to wait a little but they more than made up for it. Three of us had a foot massage and scrub and it was so good we all dozed off. The ladies were so beautiful and gave us celebratory wine and lucky money for New Years good luck. Our massage was topped off with a mini shoulder rub and some delicious spring rolls! Cannot recommend highly enough.

Worst spa experience in Vietnam. Am shocked to see this spa has decent reviews on trip advisor. This was by far the worst spa experience I have had. My boyfriend and I came here on Jan 30, admittedly vietnamese NYE and TET holiday - and in the beginning we were willing to cut a bit of slack for this. My boyfriend asked for a 90min sports massage and I had a 30min sea salt scrub and 60 min aromatherapy massage. There was no instruction to get undressed and zero professionalism - we got undressed and piled our clothes in the corner of the room while the staff watched. The ladies talked to each other throughout the massage. The lady massaging my boyfriend answered her mobile phone twice which was resting on the massage table near his head. We heard customers downstairs and owing to TET holiday there was no receptionist, so the lady massaging me ran downstairs to serve them. She came back and left again for at least 10 minutes. Then she returned, spoke to the other lady and left AGAIN. At which point the woman massaging my boyfriend stopped and starting massaging me. Then she swapped back and a third girl began to massage my legs. At this point I had had the same leg massaged for about 25mins of my 60 min massage. To say it was a massage is a stretch of the word - she rubbed up and down my leg applying oil but zero pressure. When they realised there were more customers coming - the girl massaged each of my arms for about 1 minute and my another lady came to massage my head. I cannot express what a shambles of a massage this was. No symmetry in the techniques, three different staff and completely uneven in terms of time spent on each limb. To make matters worse, as we were redressing my boyfriends masseuse started asking us for a "tip,tip". It took us a while to work out what she was saying and when we finally did we were shocked. The massage were so unprofessional and interrupted we thought they would be more likely to offer us a discount. Shocked - my boyfriend offered 50,000 vnd to which she said "100 please". The second lady (my masseuse) then rushed in the door to ask me for a tip.. I was livid. I handed her 50,000 vnd but she kept asking for me more to which I refused. We were literally cornered by the two ladies in the room who kept asking for more money- all before we had even gone to reception to pay. Whilst tips are not customary in Vietnam, we would certainly have tipped had it of been our CHOICE to thank the staff for a nice experience. The massages were not cheap - this is not a cheap spa - and for the prices they are asking we expected a professional, calm and relaxing experience. When we left we were shaken and appalled at the behaviour of the staff. They would not let us leave the room without us tipping them both. I do NOT recommend this spa in any way. The claim to offer "swedish, thai, aromatherapy and sports" massage styles but what we experienced was not a massage in any way. It was more a thorough application of oil and rubbing of the skin. The ladies were aggressive requesting tips and we did not have a choice but to hand over the money. Terrible, terrible experience. For the same amount of money visit SF Spa.

A lovely spa. I had a fantastic Thai massage here followed by a body scrub. The best one I've had in Hanoi so far. The therapists and other staff were all very friendly and happy. They were really helpful and spoke excellent english. Lots of tea and drinks offered and a very comfy treatment room!I am a beauty therapist in England and this place definitely matches up in terms of quality with spa's I have visited there (better than some actually!) and I can't stress enough how fantastic the massage was... Floated out the door afterwards :-)

"Are you ok?" - "Yes!". During my stay in Hanoi in November 2013 I visited Mido Spa 2 times and I enjoyed it very much. I liked the clean ambience and the friendly atmosphere. During both visits I took the aroma massage. I was in 2 different massage rooms and each of the 2 rooms was spacious, clean and comfortable, provided with a clean shower room. Most of all I enjoyed the massage by Thanh, who gave me the massage during both visits. She is a very nice and friendly girl, polite, caring and with very good skills for the massage. At the beginning she asked if I prefer the massage strong or soft and during the massage she asked from time to time: "Are you ok?" The only honest answer I could give was "Yes, I am!". I appreciate this kind of behaviour very much and it is symbolic for the entire spa. True wellness is provided here!
Love this place! . Very nice massage and kind therapist!! Want to come again. Thumps up!

No ambience - go elsewhere. My daughter and I just came back from having a manicure and pedicure. While we were waiting for our therapists, they ushered a gentleman into our room to use the toilet which was about 2m away from us in a little room. Nice. Then after a perfunctory foot buff and some very quick rubbing with a scrub the girl put cuticle cream onto my nails. After this she did the usual and THEN removed my old nail polish. Honestly - I was planning the next pedicure to do the job properly as I was sitting in the salon. My daughter was giving me the thumbs down while we were there. The whole time the girls chatted to each other loudly in Vietnamese with various other staff wandering in and out for a chat. Then my nails were cut with a clipper and were a bit rough and so I had to ask for her to smooth off with a quick filing. Honestly, for $15 each or 300,000 VND each, I would have expected a lot better. This took about 40 minutes and I would go back next time to SF Spa which was a lot more professional and around the same prices.
I had a life-changing massage today. First of all, Mido Spa is super cute. An older Vietnamese transformed into a massage parlor and wellness center? A+ job on that one guys..

Tranquility amidst the chaotic streets of Hanoi. I stumbled upon this gem as I was looking for the war museum. After over 2 months of backpacking, my back was pretty sore and they offered Thai massage with oil for 450,000 Dong. Slightly expensive for Vietnam but the experience was more than worth it. Very clean, extremely hospitable staff and they even gave me tea AND a beer when I was done. My masseuse Giang was a little ninja kicking all my muscles butts. I highly reccomend this place for a break from the city life.

A great place to have nice care and good relaxing. If you wish to experience a real Vietnamese hospitality and care, you should visit this place. Very kind personnel, and really good quality massage. When you come in, they provide you with cold wet napkin and hot green tea, while you are choosing the desired procedure. This is what you really need after walking outside. Another green tea is waiting for you after completion of procedure. They also have sauna, bath and jacuzzu.I do recommend this spa for those who travel to Hanoi and would like to plunge into traditional Vietnamese culture and envinronment.
Excellent massage and ambience for a reasonable price. The service is excellent and the masseuse has really great technique. It's reasonably priced compared to the other decent spas in hanoi

Amazing luxury feeling. Loved this place!Affordable prices and excellent treatments. My spa pedicure was beyond my expectations. So beautiful!I had to try the foot massage wich was amazing.The girl Hâ did both treatments and was outstanding.Next day I returned for another footmassage by another staff, not as great but still great customer service and I recieved a package of coffee wich was very nice.Would go back again and again!!

Great footmassage!. Ah, the footmassage here was amazing! They also massaged my hands and shoulders for free. I fell asleep after 10 minutes, it was sooo good. You also get a cup of tea! Only thing I have to say is that the workers should put the sound on their phone off :)

Great Massage!. A very good massage place right in Old Quarters. Pros: Great Masseuse. Amazing massages. You're received well when you enter. They give you a taxi drop off to your hotel after massage (per their brochure, we were staying close by so didn't bother)Cons: Ask for a private room. We were given a common room with curtains between beds. We were told it's a private room. Though to their credit, no one else came in while we were there but we didn't know that'll happen.Note: My wife got a Swedish massage and I got a traditional Thai massage.

Vi Spa highly recommend this place. Every second day we had a hand and foot massage while we were walking and travelling so much in the heat. The staff were amazing, friendly and our experience were top quality. They listened to what you required and gave you more. We tip our ladies every time. My friend had full body for an hour while I only had foot and hands. She enjoyed her and slept thru many of them. GREAT VALUE FOR MONEY AND GREAT EXPERIENCES. JUST DO IT.

Great massage, lovely environment. Friendly welcoming staff, lovely clean environment with great air con, lovely welcome and most importantly, a fantastic massage ... add to that, it was great value for money ($45 for 90 mins). Felt great afterwards - although they did find some painful spots!!

Relaxing place. We stopped by here on our first week in Hanoi and we both had a back massage. The reception area is lovely and relaxing and the staff are friendly with good English. They offer you a free tea and sandals to walk to the rooms. The massage rooms have a few beds in it but are separated by curtains and there seems to be a separate floor for men and women. The massage was incredibly good and relaxing and although the lady didn't speak much English she was friendly and made me feel comfortable. We enjoyed it so much, when we came back to Hanoi 2 weeks later we went again. Same friendly service and relaxing atmosphere. My husband had another back massage but I chose a foot scrub. This was an hour long and lovely and she even through in a mini arm and back massage. The lady was friendly and spoke a little English. The scrub included a foot and half leg massage and my feet felt great afterwards.

I've been walked all over before.... But never quite like this. We both had the synergy massage. Truely awesome. So much power from a someone so small. This is no where near the cheapest in town but it's by far the most professional place we've visited on this trip. Spotlessly clean, incredibly polite, an awesome experience from start to finish

Best synergy massage ever!!!. We have stayed at MK Premier Boutique (walk distance from this SPA) and they have recommended this place and offer us 10% off discount. We've tried the synergy massage - 60min of full body massage. The girls were very good and we felt renew after there. Highly recommended.

Great aroma massage!. Had a nice 1 hour massage today! (390vd ex tip so good value) The ladies are friendly and speak good english!She asked me if the pressure was alright and changed it when I said it could be a little harder. Great airconditioning so not too warm. Lots of promotion Would def go back!
Massage . The Synergy Massage was awesome. The pressure was good with a combination of different massage techniques. A good recommendation.

Great massage therapist - Nhan. I visited here twice in my short stay in Hanoi and both times had Nhan as my therapist. She was wonderful and did an amazing job, she also made sure I was well looked after before and after the massage. I would highly recommend.

Overpriced. The prices here is more than those surrounding spas, but the flyer looks amazing so we attempted,I choose the thai massage with oil, but just a little bit of oil on a spot of my back…Those ladies was polite but too gentle for a massage ( I didn't feel relaxed or tired after that )The shop looks clean~
Synergy massage, french manecure, gel nail. My wife & I spent 1 1/2 hours here. All round great experience. Relaxing, with professional & courteous staff. Definitely worth while.

Synergy Massage & body scrub. Had these two treatments with therapist Ngoc. All I can say it was a great experience. Been to massages before but this was one of the best ever. The therapist was also excellent. Thanks to all at Vi Spa. Highly recommend!

Great massage!. Loved my combo massage at Vi Spa. The combo of Thai, shiatsu massage techniques was perfect after a long day sightseeing in Hanoi. The spa even paid for our taxi to our massage. Will be back!

The most amazing experience ever!. Just had a facial at this spa and I can honestly say that I want to go back already. The best facial I have ever had. The girls were lovely and welcoming and friendly. I feel so relaxed. After my facial the girl even French plaited my hair for me which was a beautiful touch. Would highly recommend this place. Excellent value for money.

Perfect gel manicure!. I had a gel manicure done here today. I have never had one before but was so impressed with this one! The lady who painted my nails was so precise and careful throughout and always checked thoroughly after each coat dried to be sure it was perfect. All of the staff who work here are friendly, helpful and polite and the place itself is very clean and has a nice relaxed atmosphere. If I didn't have to go back to England tonight, I'd definitely pay Vi Spa 2 another visit.Thank you!

Foot massage - brilliant. After wandering around the streets of Hanoi, my feet needed some lovin'. Vi Spa was our choice & a half an hour foot massage was ordered. It was that good, we stayed for longer. After a trip to Ninh Binh for a couple of days, we returned to Hanoi & went back for another session. Well worth it!

Disappointed . Our hotel recommended this spa and as it was nearby I decided to give it a try but found it to be disappointing. I had a basic mani/pedi. Staff friendly enough and the atmosphere relaxing but the room was stuffy and I was not offered any water on arrival. I am not sure how sterile everything was - also my cuticle on my big toe was cut so close it is sore. The polish on my finger nails has chipped after two days - I am on holiday so this is not due to any housework! Yes it was cheap enough but I would prefer to pay a little more and get a better result.

Massage. I went and got a massage this morning with my mum and brother. We all thoroughly enjoyed it and will most likely go back. As soon as you step in the door you can smell the beautiful oils. When you leave you fell all fresh and nice. It is seriously so amazing I loved it !

So relaxing. I think this has got to be one of the best spas in Hanoi.
Had a back, neck and shoulder massage, foot massage as well as my toes painted all for a great price and it was done all so very well and so relaxing!
Would highly recommend.

Foot massage. We got a 15 minute foot massage for $2 (promotion is good until 3pm). Really quite good. The masseuses did talk a little bit, but they were not overly distracted. Good amount of pressure for me. Free Wi-Fi too!

Best spa experience in Vietnam provided by Minh Hang. After a tiring day touring the beautiful places in Hanoi, I stopped by the trip advisor recommended Vi Spa. The place was simple yet elegant, in comparison to the many other spas I've been to. Minh Hang was my masseur & I had the best body massage in Vietnam. Since my visit last Thu (7/4/2016), I was back again 2 days later for another relaxing massage by Minh. Look forward to being back again in 2 weeks time! Thank you Vi Spa & Minh for a great relaxing experience.

Noisy and staff talking all the time. The massage was very soft and they not focus on the massage. Very soft and no pressure! They look bored about their job and don't put effort to the massage! They look around the place and talking and laughing. Not recommended!

So relaxing!. Staff were very friendly and professional and the spa itself was very clean. They give you a locker to put your belongings in with a key. One of the best massages I've ever had - so relaxing! :)

Best manicure and pedicure ever. What a wonderful spa for a relaxing treatment. I went for a manicure and pedicure and got so much more. The therapist, Nhan, is a very experienced, friendly and helpful young lady. If South Africa was not so far, I would have been a very regular customer. Thank you Nhan and the ladies of Vi Spa 2.
Amazing "Amazing Package" . A perfect, very clean spa. Very good service, welcoming staff, very thoughtful people. I felt relaxed after the amazing package of 5:30.

Excellent value and skilled masseuses.. We were staying at the MK Premier Boutique Hotel and were recommended the Vi Spa 2 by the concierge. The three of us had 1.5 hours of full body and foot massages. We were all satisfied with the level of skill and service. An excellent value as well. We will definitely return.

Surprise in Hanoi!. We came across the place at the tourist centre next to Hoan Kiem lake. We tried the Relaxing Package and it was fabulous! The whole body massage, facial treatment and feet treatment were truly relaxing and we felt so refreshed afterwards. The massage therapists were very professional and we high recommend Vi Spa to anyone who would like a little escape in the hustles of the city.

Best facial I've had!. Thank you Vi Spa! My daughter and I both had facials and two other family members had a foot massage with scrub. All were outstanding! The staff were professional and more than exceptionally qualified!

Foot massage so good we decided to also get back massage . This place was great. They could message our group of 4 people right away - 15 min for $2 each is a great start. The foot massage was so good we all decided to get neck and shoulder. They gave us a discount and the massage was really good.

Great leg wax and shoulder massage . I hope I have the right branch of this wonderful,spa. Went yesterday. Lovely lady waxed my legs and gave me a fabulous head and shoulder massage (6.00 pm on the 29th March). Thank you for making my last day in Hanoi special.

A good choice.. I have just returned to my hotel following a 90 min massage at this spa recommended by my hotel. The hotel made my booking earlier in the day and they were expecting me when I arrived. I was impressed with the cleanliness. The staff were welcoming and understanding in what I wanted. My masseuse Yung gave a very responsive massage which I'm sure my body will appreciate tomorrow. Water prior and ginger tea after was enjoyed.

The best pedicure I've had. Wonderful friendly salon. I was a bit nervous as I was recommended to go here from a spa I wished to visit, but as they did not offer pedicure service, and they sent me here. A brilliant experience. The best pedicure I have ever had (and I've had many!). Highly recommended!

Best massage in my life. Most countries I visit I get a massage but this place had the best massage I've had. I got the 90 min synergy massage a combo of Thai and Japanese massage. I left feeling absolutely refreshed and amazing.

The best massage!. I'm picky when it comes to massages as they are often too soft for my taste... The "Fusion" massage was just the right mixture of massaging, pressing and stretching. The lady (Tho) who massaged me did a great job and I felt like reborn highly recommended!
Gel nails. An excellent pampering session - gel nails for the equivalent of £7.50. Lovely staff , Green tea fantastic. Worth a visit

Great massage. Great massage, always very relaxing and very professional. My husband and I went there 2 days in a row. The only thing I would not recommend is manicure. The enamel peeled off the day after. Everything else is really good

90 min of relax, I was having treatment for my feet and get extra bonus _15 min of legs massage. just " fantastic experience" _ very clean ,the service was 1st class, girls were very professional . You are not going to regret this. The place have nice atmosphere ambient light and soft music, what more could you want. The benefit of the oil treatment was very good and wish last more than 2 weeks .

This place leaves you with the desire to come back for more pampering!. After having tried several massage places around the region, this place (Vi Spa) left me with one of the most positive experiences. The setup and lighting of the spa is warm and calming, and the staff and masseurs are polite, friendly and professional.The massage professionals (masseurs) are highly skilled and are able to perform different massage techniques.I went for the 75min Thai massage with oil service (which was one of the more pressure intense massages offered by Vi Spa), and was not disappointed. During my session, the masseur would calibrate the pressure at which she pressed at different pressure points to ensure maximum effect without significant discomfort. In addition, the masseurs do speak good English and are able to comprehend requests for advanced massage techniques.The Spa also offered to provide me with a free one way taxi either from (my Hotel in the Hanoi Old Quarter to Vispa) or from (Vispa to my hotel in Hanoi Old Quarter). This offer was a big plus for me, as it made travelling to my hotel after my massage session all the more convenient and relaxing.This place is a full-fledged Spa that offers Facial care, Foot & Hand care and Body Massages at reasonable rates. Given the positive experience, I will most certainly return to this spa to try the other facial, foot and hand care services Vi Spa provides.

Heaven in Hanoi. I had a really stressful trip to Vietnam and in dire need of some relaxation I asked my hostel where I could get a massage. They said ViSpa 2, it's just up the road. From the second I walked in, I felt a sense of calm. Hanoi is a little chaotic and this little slice of heaven is a great getaway from all the hustle and bustle. The receptionists were as lovely as anything, offering tea to start your visit off and lemon juice to finish. Every single time I went (6 days in a row!) I was not disappointed. I think I tried every massage on the menu (loooooved the Thai massage), got a body scrub, a facial, a mani, a pedi...well the list goes on. Amazing value for your dollar, wonderful staff and by the time I left I was so relaxed I'm not sure there would have been an iota of tension left to rub out! Love love love this place. Thanks for the relaxation ladies!
great. You are a very beautiful and clean spa. Very good service. i fell very relaxed. People very good and nice smile.

Needed a Princess day. Lovely women all wanting to give you some tlc.Very welcoming. Straight away shown to sit down and asked if you would like a tea. Then asked what you would like.I had my first hot stone massage. It was beautiful I did not want it to end.Everything was clean and presented well.

Lovely service and wonderful people . Make sure you go to the correct address; the address is below in another review. Anyway, I just walked in from the street and found myself getting my nails done. Not a problem. The lady I had did my nails so gently and took care of every finger. However, there was some construction happening next door which made the spa a very uncomfortable place to be in due to the noise level. But let's be honest. We're in Vietnam. I don't think I've heard silence for weeks... it probably would have annoyed some people but I got over it very quickly.Though the best part is, she gave me a 50% discount due to the noise!! The construction will be over soon so make sure you go visit. They are lovely people.

Very special place. After visiting Vietnam a few years ago I knew that they had some awesome spas available. But these people run such a well organized business, you are put at ease from the moment you enter and take of your shoes. Arriving in the middle of the day without a reservation did not seem to be a problem at all, the staff are many so you are not left waiting for another group to finish. I felt that I was their priority the whole time i was there. Very impressed!!

Highlight of Hanoi!. ***There is only 1 Vi Spa now. The location on 5 Chân Cầm, Hàng Trống, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội, is permanently closed. Google map will direct you to this closed location so make sure to go to No7 Hang Buom Str, Hang Buom Dist, Ha Noi or use their complimentary one-way taxi service to not get lost (which is what happened to us).Pros:* Spacious and clean spa right in the Old Quarter.* They pay for one-way taxi ride to the spa, just coordinate with your hotel. * Hard-to-beat prices: 90 min synergy massage for ~$28.92 USD, 30 min head/neck/shoulder massage for ~$11.13 USD, 60 min facial starting at ~ $17.80 USD, and basic mani-pedi for $8.90 USD. All services and prices you can find on http://vispa.vn/.* I loved and highly recommend Thum. Her head/neck/shoulder massage was phenomenal and I basically melted by the end of the session. Her strokes were deliberate, methodical, and soothing. She gave just the right amount of pressure without it hurting. I am not a fan of repetitive motions using the elbow and arms, and Thum mostly used her hands and fingers which I liked. She also gives an excellent facial. I’ve had a lot of massages and facials before, and Thum definitely knows what she’s doing. * Staff here is so friendly, professional, and warm. When we came back a second time, I was not happy with my massage (just not digging the technique) and asked for a new person, they waived my unsatisfactory massage. Cons:* Not sure if you can request a certain masseuse, I loved Thum so much I asked to have her again upon my 2nd visit, but they said she wasn’t working that day. And when I complained about the new masseuse, she brought in Thum!!! So she definitely was working that day…* We got our massages in the communal space with 6 beds divided by curtains, so you could hear new customers arriving and leaving. There was also some construction going on so that disturbed our sessions a little.

Relaxing in Hanoi! . There are so many options for spas in Hanoi it can be very overwhelming trying to choose, but my hotel recommended Vi Spa and I was very happy! The foot treatment and massage was perfect after a long day of walking around Hanoi!

Waxing and foot spa! . I came to look for waxing. When we (me and my husband) were there we desided to go for a foot spa and massage. We did not regret that. For more than an hour we were hypnotized by the amazing massage. Our feet were like new when we walked out.
Great massage. This was a good place to relax on our last night in Ha Noi. The staff are very nice and looked after us well. I. Would come here again

Very professional . I visited Vi Spa 2 twice during my visit to Hanoi. I had a manicure and spa pedicure during the first visit and the ladies were so thorough. I didn't feel that I was being rushed through so they could get the next customer in. They showed excellent attention to detail and everything was clean and hygienic. It was a relaxing experience made better by the fact that the ladies weren't all loudly chatting away to one another in Vietnamese. It really was peaceful. I returned the next day for a hot stone massage and it was just perfect. Vi Spa 2 offers a range of massages but I chose this massage because I do not enjoy deep tissue and traditional Thai as I find them incredibly painful and not the least bit relaxing or enjoyable. The ladies regularly check if the pressure is okay so you get what you're after. They provide lockers with keys for your belongings so you don't need to spend the entire time wondering if your bag is safe. It was hygienic, gently lit and exactly what I needed/wanted. I would definitely go back knowing that they provide outstanding service in a clean, welcoming and professional environment.
Relaxing Massage after a long day. Good price and a very relaxing massage. Normally they close at 10 on it it was longer open till the massage finished. Friendly workers.

What a wonderful experience . The experience was beautiful. The staff are very friendly and compassionate! My boyfriend had the 60 mins massage and loved it. I had the 75 mins facial- It was one of the best I have ever had! We will be back for another treatment! (Kristy )

Excellent Spa. My boyfriend and I visited Vi Spa after a busy day in Hanoi and it didn't disappoint. I had a gel manicure with Linh and she did an excellent job. She was really friendly too and made good conversation. My boyfriend had an aroma massage with Hang and said it was the BEST he's ever had - and there have been many around Asia. Thuy on reception was also really helpful and provided all the information we needed without being pushy. Overall a really professional experience leaving us feeling relaxed. Would definitely go back!

Best massage I've had!. I chose Vi Spa as it looked professional inside but the prices weren't too high. The receptionist Thuy was very helpful in advising us what kind of massage would best suit what we wanted. She wasn't forceful or pushy in advising us.The spa itself was very professional, giving us green tea as we waited, and it was very clean and quiet inside. The massage was the best massage I've had (and I've had a number!). Ha was fantastic, applying great pressure and immediately reacting when my body was tight in places. I came away utterly relaxed and wanting another one!Overall it was absolutely fantastic and brilliant value - I'd highly recommend!

Great massage in nice surroundings. I walked by the spa by coincidence, and decided to treat myselfwith a massage.They offer a wide range of massages, and I decided to have 1 hour swedish massage.The separate room was nice, clean and with aircondition. I had a nice shower with clean and fluffy towels. The massage was amazing - Miss Oanh was very skiller and gave me one of the best massages in a long time. She really knows how to massage.Very professional and clean service, I will surely revisit this Spa next time I comeback back to Hanoi.

Great Spa. So great the body srub I had with Thuy last week when I was walking around the Old Quarter. Highly recommend for those who wanna have some relaxing moments after busy and tiring times. Very caring, professional and welcoming staff. They also speak good English (to my foreign friends of course, becos I am Vietnamese)

The best spa forever!!!!!. This is the best spa in Ha Noi. Friendly staffs, helpfull receptionist and skillfull therapist. The massage room was clean and nice music, too. I love all of them! Highly recommend!!!!

Highly recommend this relaxing massage. I felt calm the moment I stepped through the door. A cool iced tea before the massage. The lovely Dung was my masseur. Everything is thought of even down to locking my bag away and placing the key under the towel so I knew my possessions were safe. An lemon water after the massage was the perfect ending. Please visit and enjoy their lovely hospitality.
Very nice. This is one of the best spa in Ha Noi! Friendly staff and very professional service! I will come back again!

Great staff Thuy and Duyen. Hi guys
If you are looking for a good massage visit this place and ask for Thuy and Duyen :)
The place is clean, staff are friendly.

Very good relaxing massages. We used the Vi Spa 2 four times while in Ha Noi. A small discount was offered as we were staying in a nearby hotel.
Thai massage was very good

This is the place to go for a Hot Stone Massage. I've just had a blissful & restorative 75 minute Hot Stone Massage. Ask for "Ha". She is very good. All my travel tension gone and my extremely stiff back now has more mobility. The rates are very reasonable. My massage cost me around $US25. The premises are very clean.

Nice Pedicure. I went for a pedicure. The lady was very nice and I'm more than satisfied with my nails now.
I paid 100k VD, removing the previous colour incl.
Very fast free wifi.
Excellence!!!. Visited twice during my stay in Hanoi, consistently high quality service. Best hot stone massage and pedicure I have ever received. very safe and welcoming environment.

Just like in the movies..... My husband and I walked in to treat ourself with a massage after being running around in the country for over 8 days. We picked Vi Spa as it looks clean and gives the typical 'Zen' feeling. We decided to pick the promotion for the Synergy massage, 450.000VND for one hour plus a free foot massage of 10min on top. I can tell you these ladies look small but don't underestimate their strength! It was a real experience and just like in the movies, the lady literally walked over my back, pressure points with their elbows and other different skills, this all in a very clean environment. Something to point that there are lockers for your belongings. It's maybe a bit over the regular price however absolutely worth it!I can recommend this place to everybody who's looking for professional massage in a clean place in the middle of the old quarter.
Amazing spa. Thank you for a lovely experience... Lovely staff very polite and excellent at what they do. Had an amazing spa pedicure...

Beautiful service!. I found this spa as I was walking the streets of Hanoi. I had a manicure with gel polish. What an amazing job! The ladies here are so lovely and welcoming. I can't wait to go back and have more treatments!

Good way to start a holiday. My hotel recommended Vi Spa. Very professional and courtesy. They take customer service seriously with a survey before and after. Had the 60 min foot massage and found it very relaxing , especially since there was a short head and neck massage after. Good safe and clean establishment.

Don't go for the manicure.... I chose this place to get my nails done as it had OPI products in the window. I think some of them had been there for ever! The first colour I chose had gone so gloopy they had to take it off and I picked another. The second was very thin but they persevered with that one... Main problem was that there wasn't a table or nail bar so the lady had to hold my hands whilst sat in a chair and paint them without resting them on the surface and twice smudged the nails she'd just painted with her own hand! She appeared really nervous and judging by her own nails I wasn't sure she painted nails often... She did 2 coats which wasn't really enough as the polish was so thin and missed a few bits on the sides. The manager was hovering over her checking what she was doing which I think made it worse. It wasn't a relaxing atmosphere... Pick another spa for nails!

Nice experience.. Truly revitalizing. I did a "Vi Spa experience" here, with 2 hours of steam bath, body scrub and aroma massage - at only $40! The massage lady was skillful and cheerful, although her English was limited but she really did lighten my mood.

Truly a good find.. Vi Spa 2 is a normal-looking spa that is everywhere in every corners of Hanoi, but their service is that stands out. Everything is done promptly and fast, me and my wife had a really good time here with their foot message - for just a couple of bucks ($59 for both). Surprisingly my wife liked it - and that's really rare, even in the States!!!
Yet another good spa.. Spas are everywhere in Hanoi, and Vi Spa 2 is one of them - and it is a good one. Excellent maybe a little bit exaggerated, but I really liked the way they treated my shoulder.

A hidden gem!. Not only this spa was new and fresh, the staffs here were truly helpful. Not to mention this is located at the center of Hanoi's old town area, making Vi Spa 2 very accessible to tourists. Ms Ngan's performance here was simply fantastic, it really made me felt alive again after a long day of walking around Hanoi.

Great new spa!. Looked like that we were some of the first guests here, as the opening ceremony was finished a day before. Because of that, the amenities here were brand new (as of August 19) and the price here was quite ok (our voucher value was 25$ each for body massage). Fluent English was spoken here, and the staffs here were quite accommodating yet skillfull.

Awesome treatment!. I had a 90-minute massage in Essencia Spa yesterday and I have to say that it was absolutely wonderful. My therapist's skill was so professional and experienced. Their receptionists did really a good job, welcomed me warmly with herbal tea and enthusiastically explained their services to me. I am planning to come back and highly recommend it to others.

The best massage in Hanoi !. I have been living in Hanoi for few years now and have tried a few massage places around Hanoi, and I have to say Essencia is the numero uno.You have plenty of choice "a la carte", and having tried different massage, the technique is different every time.The staff take care of you really well, great smile, polite, respectfull. The masser ask you the strengh you desire and if you want to focus the massage of one part of your body. About prices, it is a bit more expensive than somewhere else : about 660 K VND for 1hour massage. But if you go between 10am and 2pm, you get 40% off. I let you do the calcul.To resume : it is a place I would advise to anyone visiting hanoi or living there.PS : Do not forget to book.

Great spa and restaurant. Did not stay at hotel but used restaurant and spa. Food was really nice and service was excellent in restaurant. Went to spa and had hot stone massage, wish I'd had the 90 minute massage, it was so relaxing.

Massage. After a lot of stress preceding our trip my friend and I decided to get a massage. We both had a Mother Earth massage which included hot rocks and oil. Loved it. My girl had really strong hands and even though sometimes hurt she really loosened up all my muscles. If time had permitted would have gone back
Massage. A relaxing, enjoyable massage in very pleasant surroundings. I went with my wife and we had a couple's room that was elegant and well equipped.

Best massage and service - awesome value for money. From the moment you walk in, it's 5 star service. I had a 1hr foot massage and my masseuse was very knowledgeable and skilled; it was one of the best massages I've had. Finished off with a ginger and rose foot bath scrub, and some tea, watermelon and nuts to finish. Highly recommend, not overpriced for a hotel spa

Very good massage. Had the "street vendor"'combo that included a massage and a facial. Excellent massage with hot stones, Heong was the name of the masseuse and she was very, very good. The facial was nice but nothing extraordinary. Overall a very good experience, paid about 40USD which I think is a bit overpriced as compared to what you get in Bangkok but will definitely recommend.

Wonderful massage, super customer service!.
