On arrival not only was I informed that I had a 20% discount due to the fact I was staying in the hotel, I was given a tea and sweat treat whilst I chose the massage I wanted. The receptionist was very friendly, helpful and welcoming. I chose the Mother Earth massage (for one hour), which I highly recommend! I had been a little concerned that I did not have to fill out a form as I have done for other massages I have had, but I told the masseuse about my knee injury and she listened and changed the massage in that area to avoid further damage. It was a wonderful massage, that was done with the pressure I had asked for and the hot stones were bliss (never tried before). On completion I was given more tea with fruit, and looking at the time realised that I had actually had more than the hour, a lovely change from the norm of clock watching! I highly recommend this service at the Essencia Spa (located in Essence hotel).

A nice get away. We booked an arrangement in the morning, after arriving by train in Hanoi. We asked if we could take a shower before the massage. People were so professional, so friendly and the massage was really good. We had a shoulder/head and foot massage, but got more then we expected!

Amazing spa! . From the moment we walked through the door, we were doted on! The customer service was exceptional, and the massage even better. Had the spring massage - all 2.5 hours of it, and thoroughly enjoyed every minute. Keen to do this one again! A little more expensive than elsewhere, but the treatment was well worth it!

Amazing massage!!!. From the first step, I was warmly welcomed by sweet receptionists and the spa service I took was so great. Essencia Spa brings me to heaven of relaxtion. I chose “Mother Earth” which uses warm stone to melt away tension and I was totally satisfied with that. Highly recommend!

Foot massage and facial. Heavenly!!From the moment I was greeted at the door by a charming young man who escorted me to the spa to the gracious welcome at spa reception to the marvelous treatment...I was treated decadently.The massages street side are nice but when compared to this experience, my therapist Ms. Huong treated me to her experience like an art form. Fantastique!!

Relaxing massage in lovely venue with friendly, skilled staff. You get what you pay for. Yes you can find cheaper spa experiences on the streets of the Old Quarter, but this spa located in the Essence Orient Hotel is very clean, well-maintained and professional. For about $30 AUD, the one hour aroma massage was good value from the moment you walk in the door. You are greeted by English-speaking staff and given tea and a cool washcloth once you are seated. Then you are taken to the treatment room. My husband an I had a massage side by side and the room was tastefully decorated with low lighting and pleasant music. The staff spoke excellent English and asked about focus areas for the massage and how strong you wanted your massage. We liked our massage so much, we came back after a 3 day Ha Long Bay tour for another 1 hour aroma massage. As it was in the afternoon before our flight home in the evening, it was no trouble to have a shower after the massage. I wish we could have tried some of the other services - they sounded great as well.
Amazing Spa. First class service at this little gem. I had a scrub,massage and facial and was in bliss for 2.5hrs. Definitely worth paying a little bit more for this spa.

Excellent Experience - highly recommended. I visited the Spa after several days trekking, in need of a massage for my tired muscles. I chose the 60 min aromatherapy massage and requested a firm pressure. The massage went beyond my expectations and was at once effective in releasing muscle tension and was yet also relaxing. The Masseuse was solicitous and professional and the room clean and smart. Thankfully the massage is on a proper table, not one of the chair like ' beds' you often see in Hanoi - much better ! I was served with tea and refreshments on arrival and after the treatment by the charming Receptionist. It was a lovely experience and really great value for money.

Great service for a great price. Essence Spa was very nice. The therapists constantly asked to make sure that you are okay. The staff is VERY friendly. I booked the Spring package and was impressed with the service. The dinner at the end is also a nice touch. If ever in Hanoi, I will visit them again.

Essencia SPA is for SPA Lover. Visited 3 SPA in Hanoi for 7 days stay in Hanoi. I like Essecia the most as the reception staff were very caring and friendly, take time to explain to us the package offer to the customer advantage. They offered a refreshing cup of delicious tea before and after your massage. The rooms were very clean and the masseuse polite and careful. Not the cheapest of prices but for the standard it was worth it. Don't scare off by the listed price. There is a discount on happy hour and booking in advance.

Very good value for money. My girlfriend and I each booked a "Mother Earth" package which includes the hot stone therapy and facial for 1.5 hours. We had a good discount. Overall very good experience for couples. Facilities are very clean, staff is very friendly and helpful. The booking process is very simple and recommended since we didn't have to wait at all for our session.

Overall excellent. Place is very nice, service outstanding. Not the best massage or facial that I've had but worth the try, specially during happy hour, otherwise too expensive. Explanation about the massage was really helpful to decide which one to chose. Check in with tea and check out with fruits made it very special. Thank you!

Delightful staff professional and exceptionally clean. By far the best spa experience I've had in Vietnam, the ambience is wonderful. The staff were very caring and quiet and respectful. They offered a refreshing cup of delicious tea before and after your massage. It was pure bliss. Very busy but no hussle and bussle. The rooms were very clean and the masseuse polite and careful. I had several different massages and enjoyed the fact that by staying at the hotel I didn't need to contend with the traffic afterwards. I went to the spa in my bathroom and slippers. I highly recommend you book as soon as you arrive in Hanoi. Not the cheapest of prices but for the standard it was worth it.

Never get enough of spa . Did a bit of research before we decide to go to Essencia Spa & Massage, and I am glad we made this choice.We walked in on the first day and they were pretty full, so we only had 1 section, and of cuz, it wasn't enough and so we booked it for the next day again.We had a 90 mins body massage + body scrub on the 2 day and it was amazing! Will definitely go back if we visit Hanoi again in future.

OK massage. Despite of the 20% discount for first timers, I would say that the prices are still relatively high. When we got there for our appointment at 5.30pm, we were told to wait for 15 mins because their schedule was running late. Why were we impacted by other people's screw up?Both of us tried the swedish massage. It was not too bad, the strength was just right. However, the lady's hands were really rough, so it felt almost like an exfoliation. As our massage room was right by the corridor, it was quite noisy as we could hear people talking/ laughing.When we were done, they offered some tea and lotus candy (pretty good!).

Quite relaxing!. My wife and I chose the hot stones therapy and we highlight recommend it! Usually when the massage is good, time goes very fast, and I can tell you the time flew!They have a very good spa. Try it!

I'm not a spa person and this place made me one!. Wonderful spa services and staff at Essencia. My husband and I actually came back a second time it was so terrific! I had the honey body scrub which was lovely but the next day came back for the Mother Earth massage (hot stones) and that really knocked my socks off! I thought I'd died and gone to heaven. Do visit this place and we went during the 10 am-2pm time slot where they offer buy one get one free on all services.

An experience of a lifetime. Had a 4hr package treatment with a discount. Had a warm welcome, from the reception, the therapists, staff at the restaurant. I received such an excellent and individual attention according to my needs. The environment is so warm and serene. Essencia spa is definitely my new hangout spot. Big up to the team.

Thoroughly relaxing time at Essencia Spa & Massage. We had a 30 min head and shoulder massage and a 2 hour spa in Essencia Spa & Massage. Both were done expertly. The masseuses were obviously very professional and experienced. The ambience in the room was done just right to provide a soothing environment. It will definitely be good time of relaxation after a long day out or before the start of a new day. Like many others, we took up the buy one get one free promotion from 10am to 2pm. Very reasonable prices!Thumbs up!

Spa Review - 2 for 1 deal - amazing massage. After looking around at the top 5 places to get a massage in hanoi, found this great 2 for 1 deal that Essence was having during 10am-2pm. Arrived at 9am, to book in our massage for 1pm. Both my husband and I got the himalayan salt (i think that's what it was called) massage which included hot stones. Both masseurs were very professional, and adjusted the pressure to suit our needs. Room was clean, music and smells were at the right level, and for ~1.2M or so, for two 90 minute massages, it is at the mid level, but a great bargain.

Incredible. Had a 35 minute foot massage my first night in Hanoi after a long day of walking around. Nearly nothing has ever felt better in my life! Easily the best foot massage I've ever had. Went back the following day for a salt/honey scrub, basic facial & hot stone massage. Definitely did not disappoint! The therapist Tim tells me she has been working at the spa for over a decade & I could definitely feel the experience in her treatments. If you go during"Happy hour" from 10AM to 13:00 you get 40% off treatmens over 50 minutes (not sure if this is just for hotel guests or not but definitely worth asking). I found the prices to be extremely reasonable. Cannot recommend enough!
Bliss. A one hour massage melted jet lag shoulders and kick started my stay. The therapist was taking no nonsense from knotted muscles! Charming and restful experience.

Fantastic evening meal and massage. Stayed 2 nights and was very impressed with the professionalism of the staff. All very helpful and friendly. The highlights were a superb 3 course evening meal and a couple of massages from the spa. The massage staff knew their business and from start to finish it was a most relaxing experience. The hotel was clean, tidy, and the room comfortable and quiet, despite being in the heart of the Old Town

birthday visit. i loved the hotel and the spa...they were both highly recommended by sophisticated traveling friends who were impressed by integrity and charm ... it was also my birthdaywhich they knew....so i arrived to a celebration of flower petals surrounding a cake andtowels in the shape of swans...pure magic...ps i so enjoyed the spa that i went backthree different days for different treatments!!and the restaurant was delightful as well!!!
Spring offer. The very best is the professionalism of the massage team, they were more that excellent, the room clean, easy to access, a very good moment...

Best Massage in Hanoi. Our room reservation had a free 30 minute foot massage. We had it on our first day, and after having experienced it, we booked for the honey and salt massage. It was very good and I really recommend this place. Friendly receptionist and great therapists. Plus we love the free tea, lotus seeds and watermelon.
Awesome spa . Amazing massage and facial! I got one of the packages on my first day in Hanoi and I ended up booking another treatment. The customer service was phenomenal.
Very good massage!! . We think the massage was very good! We paid around 700.000 Dang for full body massage with hot stone. Worth all the money!

Highly recommend this place!. I highly recommend the Essencia Spa & Massage to anyone who is looking for quality service and a great massage. I asked for someone to use more pressure points in the massage to relieve kinks in my neck from travel and computer work. I had a wonderful girl working on my head and shoulders and back massage who more than did what I hoped for and asked for. I think she had worked at the hotel spa for nearly 10 years. I believe her name was Kim and she was so attentive and had good sensitivity to the pressure needed for my back. They gave a great discount when you returned the second time, which I did just before flying out. After each massage, there was tea and watermelon served. I would definitely recommend this place.

We got more than we paid for!. My husband and I were looking for a spa experience before taking our night flight from Hanoi to London. We saw that Essencia Spa and Massage came highly recommended. We thought initially it was quite expensive for the packaged treatments. Looking at about £70 per person for 4 hours (something like that). We decided to go for it as it was our last day...we hadn't spent as much as we thought we were going to on our trip and it was our honeymoon after all! We did the Winter Package and it was INCREDIBLE! Started with a honey and coffee body scrub and wrap. My husband had never experienced any kind of spa treatment and he was in heaven. After this we both had a 30 minute soak in a lime and rose petal bath and they bought us in some tea before THE MOST AMAZING 60 minute full body massage. I get quite a lot of massage and have to say this was up there with some of the best I have ever had. I went to another place and my body felt amazing. This was followed by a never ending facial which actually put me to sleep. My husband was a picture with his yellow towelled head band but he loved the facial. Both of us looked completely refreshed after our treatment. The ladies were so lovely and polite and worked blimmin hard for 3 and a half hours. The rooms were clean and warm. The music was fine....not too loud or too repetitive. We both felt we would pay the same to do it again. You would pay triple that in the UK for what we got.

Serene spa experience!. My husband and I had hot stone massages here, side by side which was very nice!We were warmly greeted by the staff & given tea before and after our treatment.In addition to the hot stones the therapist also worked on 'pressure' points on the body.I'd chose a different treatment if I was going again. Full body aromatherapy would I think be more relaxing but the therapists we had (two sisters!) were lovely and did an excellent job!
Delightful way to spend an afternoon. We both had the Aroma Therapy Massage and were very pleased. The masseurs knew their stuff and the surroundings were peaceful and calm. Highly recommended.
Perfect. We asked for the Mother Earth massage, it was perfect. Very kind and professionnal staff, clean space and the most important excellent massage with hot stones. We felt really relaxed.

feel so great & happy. It was my first time to use this spa, actually I have several spa facilities in Vietnam.
But this spa is the best I have ever had in Vietnam. Friendly and efficient stuff welcomed me with gentle smile, served a tasty lotus tea with sweet, enthusiastic and experienced specialists. You can not go back home without spa experience here!

Made me want to join tripadvisor just to write this raving review!. I had the pleasure of using Essencia Spa two times in late Sept-early Oct during my trip to Hanoi. First I just did a normal massage, and the next day I did a 4 hour package. The package was sooooo amazing! I had a time of my life and was treated with such luxury, I was regretting using other massage places in Hanoi and promised myself to only use Essencia Spa in my future Hanoi trips and stay at this hotel! After the spa package, I was told before that I would be given a traditional Vietnamese painting gift but it wasn't available after I did my spa as they ran out. I was very disappointed, but they asked when I was to leave for Seoul and where I was staying. I was leaving the very next day and they said they will get it for me and have it personally delivered to my hotel lobby! They personally delivered and thanked me again for using their spa services and wished me a good trip back. Now that is what I call impeccable hospitality! I will visit this spa and stay at this lovely hotel definitely in the future! Plus I never forget to tell my friends visiting Hanoi to make sure they stop by for a bit of luxury!

First class SPA facilities. We had the "street vendor" package, that is a massage and facial. Absolutely superb experienced staff. Fixed by shoulder that pysiotherapist in UK had previously failed tondo. And facial was excellent, skin super afterwards! Tganks again, Mark & Julie,ages 55/54 from UK. May return later this week before flight home

Truly Fantastic1. This was an exceptional spa. Truly professional and one of the top three for me ever. I had the mother earth massage and a facial. I almost fell asleep many times I was so relaxed and she stayed in the room the whole time. Other places I have n=been they leave for up to ten minutes which is very annoying, but here, Phuoc stayed and continued massaging while the facial treatments occurred. It was a great experience capped off with fruit and tea at the end.

Massage. This was the best massage ever!!Good sturdy massage and the masseuses asked regularly if the pressure was OK.Please go there! This is how it should be done! Also for a newcomers to massage which are hesitant… GO!

Summer Package. We upgraded to the "summer package", so glad we did. The attention given by staff throughout our massage/spa was exceptional. We were continually asked if "OK". Great experience, totally relaxing and wanted to do it again the following day. Highly recommended.

Hidden gem in the middle of Hanoi. Must extend this review to the cafe as well as the spa because our package included a light lunch. The spa experience was absolutely lovely. Four hours of pure bliss in the hands of a wonderful staff. The facility is not fancy by any means but it is extremely clean & comfortable. The welcome was truly from the heart. We relaxed and sipped our tea while waiting for the treatments to begin. Body scrub, body mask, massage, flower bath, facial, and foot treatment. Amazing. Lunch following in the cafe included a very large and tasty bowl of pho served by wonderful, sweet staff members. My only regret is that we didn't have the option to stay in the hotel. I didn't see rooms but I would be willing to bet that they are as outstanding as the rest of the operations. Loved!

Very professional service, international standard . I had a herbal treatment massage and a facial on the first day. The room is very cosy and clean, they even have a wooden bathtub for flower bath if you like! The masseur is very professional and attentive to your needs. They do massage on your acupoints, and the treatment is very therapeutic. Facial is good and I could actually fell asleep during the session. I actually went back a 2nd time during my trip, and got a body scrub and oil massage this time. Massage is still fantastic, but the salt and honey scrub I choose could be a bit too harsh for my sensitive skin. Highly recommended if you want to look for a good, strong type of treatment massage as the other typical Vietnamese spas I went is often too gentle for my liking.

Great location, great staff. We stayed here before and after our trip to Halong Bay. Hanoi is a busy city and this hotel is a quiet oasis in the middle of a fun, crowded part of town. You can't hear the bustling street noise so you can be sure to have a restful sleep with all of the action right at your doorstep. The restaurant has some wonderful food, we didn't have a bad meal any of the times we ate in the hotel. The Spa is not to be missed, it was one of the more relaxing massages I've had in a long time! The attentive and friendly staff adds to the whole experience, I would return for sure the next time I'm in Hanoi!

A wonderful experience . My partner and I enjoyed an indulgent 2.5 hour pampering package it included massage, body scrub, facial and herb bath. Every aspect was perfect! It was the perfect way to spend our last day in Hanoi.

2 hours of heaven on earth . It was so good that I wished I can be here the whole day. The lady who handled my request was able to understand my needs and suggested a perfect 2 hours routine for a aching post- sapa Trekker. My therapist , Dao is attentive and professional, yet not intrusive:) I am particular about ambience and cleanliness too, and the place passed with flying colours! Many thumbs up for everything !

A Real Highlight Of Our Stay. We stayed at the Essence hotel for 9 days and did 3 trips to the spa. This was a real highlight of our trip and was a real sanctuary when we wanted to escape from the chaos that the Hanoi Old Quarter can be. The staff are very good; I was able to have the same masseuse on all 3 visits (Yen) who was very professional. The treatments are very relaxing and the spa is very good value. I defiantly recommend you visit the Essencia spa for a relaxing and soothing treatment and great staff.

Magic. I tend to rate spas on how easily I'm able to fall asleep. As a physio, I constantly think about how well the masseuse knows my anatomy. If I'm thinking in my head "what the heck is he/she doing to me?", I can't fully relax. If I fall asleep because the massage is on point and delectable, I pass out. Essence Spa was the latter. My wife and I made appointments every night we stayed at the hotel. They made me pass out every time so that I could dream about what I saw sight seeing that day.

Spoil yourself here. My wife and i booked for massage and facial here today. Very professional, great service and it was so good. We felt very relaxed and revitalised after it. It's more expensive than other places but it is quality plus. We would Go here again and again. Thank you Essencia Spa

Feel Pampered!. After spending a long day walking around Hanoi, I was looking forward to my 'Mother Earth - hot stone massage", and I wasn't disappointed. I was welcomed with refreshing tea and ginger sweets, which got me in the mood to be pampered. The room was perfect with the right level of soothing lighting and music. My masseuse, Tam was excellent, she made sure I was comfortable with the level of pressure and the heat of the stones, ensuring that I had a pleasant experience. I have had many spa treatments,which have cost 4 or 5 times more and haven't been as good as the Essencia Spa, so I would highly recommend a visit.

First rate massage. Brilliant post flight massage of head, neck, back and leg/foot massage. 65 mins at discounted rate as I am staying at the hotel. Wonderful!Did exactly what was requiredClean, calm, serene.Highly recommended

nice treatements and good service. I had a refreshing facial (Approx £10 for 30 mins) and neck, head and shoulders massage (Approx £10 for 30 mins) and my partner had the Swedish massage (Approx £20 for 60 mins) . receptionist was very welcoming and recommended treatments for us, we were in a couples room and both therapists were great and spoke good English so we could explain if wanted more or less pressure during massage etc. the room was nice and peaceful with relaxing music and room was a good temperature. Can't fault it, especially with 20% off as hotel guests.
Amazing massage. What to say? Lovely staff. Amazing massage service and great value for money. I had the 90 minute got stones massage and it was one of the best I've had. Highly recommended.

Great location and service. We are staying in the Essence Hotel Hanoi and after our last massage experience in Hue (which was not good at all) we decided to go somewhere close by and that would give some more attention to details. Also we didn't want to walk around the Old Quarter trying to find a nice spa as it is so hot and humid outside. My partner and I shared the same room and had 2 hour packages - massage & facial (me) and massage and foot scrub (partner). We both had no complaints about the service and experience. It was also the first time (out of 3 massages in Vietnam) that we were asking if there was any part of our body to concentrate on. The prices are more than those small spas on the street but it was clean and professional. We also got 20% off as we were guests of the hotel.

Revitalising for body and mind. After a long, hot, sweaty, noisy, busy, crazy day walking through Hanoi, I was lucky enough to spend the afternoon at Essence getting the Winter Spa Package. Had the most amazing time being pampered and relaxed in a peaceful and clean room. The flower bath - a hot Japanese bath full of flower petals and fresh lime - was absolutely divine, as was the excellent massage and facial. My masseuse really looked after me, and knew exactly where my sore spots were. Topped off with a delicious dinner of beef pho. The service and experience were second to none. Will most certainly return to Essence when I'm next in Hanoi.

2 Hours Joints Relaxation. After exhausting adventure around Hà Nội in the middle of the day, one thing that naturally happens in my mind is that I need a relaxation. I am in desperate need of joints relaxation. Luckily, I remembered that I got a coupon from Essence Hotel for buy 1 get 1 package. The spa itself is located inside the sister hotel of Essence Hotel.The reception is quite nice and relaxing. I took body massage and facial for 2 hours. It turned out to be one of best massage I ever had. The therapist is very professional. The room atmosphere is very calming. The interior design and lighting placement are just good. I felt re-energized after the session. Honestly, I prefer a full body massage rather than facial massage. If I can choose the massage package again, I would like to take 2 hours full body massage.Anyway, I recommend this place.

Relaxing 4 hours. I had a wonderful time at Essencia spa. I had a long spa package and the staff were very helpful and professional. The environment was clean and relaxing. The massage was excellent. It was very relaxing. When I was finished, they had prepared a meal for me. I was expecting a little snack but it was a wonderful spring roll with noodles and herbs from their restaurant. I highly recommend this spa if you are looking for a relaxing time in the busy city of Hanoi.

A Jewel in the Old Quarter. After 3 days trekking in Sapa, my friend and I were ready to pamper ourselves. We had come to the right place! The Spa (body scrub, herbal bath, massage, facial) was amazing and reasonably priced (there was a promotion on while we were there), the room was luxurious, spotless, and quiet. Great bed, awesome service with excellent English at the front desk, and amazing breakfast buffet. Wish we could have stayed longer!

Amazing Essence Spa!. This is a wonderful spa - I would highly recommend booking a session (or two!). It is obvious that Essence has put a lot of thought into the design of the spa as well as the spa menu. I booked a body therapy and a foot treatment and was thoroughly impressed with the professionalism of the staff and the quality of the treatments. When I am next in Hanoi (which I hope is soon) I will be booking with the Essence Spa without hesitation. You will not regret it either!Please note that I am a discerning (read 'picky') traveller, but have yet to be disappointed with any of the Essence offerings. I honestly love what they do! A great group of people.

Quiet place to relax in a busy city.. This spa is great, with great service and the price is more expensive than most places but for top quality service and treatment, this is the place to be!Everyone is very welcoming and very friendly. Plenty of treatment to choose from and the therapists are great, always asking you where you would like to focus the massage on and which body parts hurt. They are always making sure if everything is okay, from the strength of the massage to the room temperature..etcAfter a busy and hot day out, it's always nice to enjoy the massage here. Even for last minute reservations, they always make sure there is a spot for me! If you have sore muscles from doing a lot of sports back home and would like a strong and tough massage, I recommend the therapist "Dao" as she has very strong hands!Overall everyone is great and very good here! Highly recommend this place and I will definitely come back!

Very Relaxing. Great Spa with A host of different therapies to choose from. I had 3 different types of massage each one very relaxing and reasonably priced. The level of care you receive when you arrive to when your treatment finishes is excellent and all the staff are lovely. After walking the streets of Hanoi all day a massage at the end is a must.

The best spa&massage ever!!. I've visited Vietnam twice. The first is Ho Chi Mihn city and the other is Hanoi.Hanoi is very beautiful place and has a variety of places to visit.But there were some misc problems, which were that there were no spa or massage I wanted to take.The spa & massages were better in Ho Chi Mihn city than Hanoi.Because Ho Chi Mihn city has many spas & massages which are very unexpensive and very comfortable but Hanoi doesn't.I was wondering to find any good spas and finally I found it.That was the very Essncia spa!!!amazing atmosphere and staffs, very comfortable and cozy. luxury too.It was a little more expensive than others in Hanoi but it was rational price.I recommend you The Essencia spa and if I visit Hanoi again, definately I will reassure that service.

Our first choice in Hanoi. Will definitely choose to stay here again. Very nice staff, very chatty and helpful, very nice rooms without any noice (we had a room with the window pointing out to the small street), perfect location and a really nice spa. Staying here was like a home away, be prepared for a lot of communication from the staff though, we thought it was charming and very interesting :-)

Excellent Service & Quality. The service staff at reception did her best to accommodate my request on the arrangement of the Autumn package, despite a miscommunication in the booking schedule. She was extremely warm, friendly and professional. The masseuses that attended to us were wonderful and attentive to all our needs, albeit i wish she was more thorough in the body scrub and massage. Overall, we are very pleased with the quality, service and value of the package. It was excellent!

Very busy with tripadvisor recommendations!. A close location to our hotel but hard to find since the hotel map did not label that street. We just kept asking! Prices were 660,000 vnd or $31. We mentioned we read it was about $21. They said we would get a 20% discount so we didn't quibble. My husband and I both had good massages together. We tipped them 100 vnd each which was probably more than necessary. If we go back in two days, we will get a 40% discount.

Clean and helpful. We went thanks to the TripAdvisor reviews. Had the 60 minute aromatherapy. Desk staff was polite and helped arrange bookings for us even though they seemed rather busy. Massage staff were also polite and adjusted strength as requested. It was clean, although not as clinically clean as you might expect at a high-end spa. But then, the treatments cost about US$22 per hour (after our 30% discount from the Essence Hotel) so a fair deal. We went back a few times during our Hanoi stay.

Perfect arrival in vietnam. After a very long for flight I found the hotel had a spa. It was very profesional, calming and just what I needed. The massage with hot stones was excellent and I came out feeling well again!
clean and professional. Very good hot stone massage. Staff were professional and massage was very good. would recommend and return.

The best way to ease away the aches and pains after a day of sight seeing in Hanoi.. This experience was sheer bliss! A foot massage sounded wonderful after a full day out tramping around the city. I was not disappointed. It started with a lovely welcome drink of ginger tea and fresh fruit. The room was lovely and relaxing. My masseur was very caring and asked a few times if I was comfortable with the amount of pressure she was using. She worked right up my leg too not just my feet. When I thought it was all over, I sat on a seat with my feet immersed in a warm ginger bath while she gave me a shoulder and head massage. I didn't want it to end. I had opted for the 70 minute massage which I would highly recommend. Thank you Essence Spa for a great experience.
An excellent massage.. Thank you I had a really lovely treatment that has left me feeling wonderful.It was carried out professionally with skill and in lovely surroundings.

excellent spa. a nice hotel in the old quarter of hanoi, crowdy street, but nice sap, very good service, good massage, professional.place is clean and comfortable.personnal competent and speak english.prices are reasonnable.

Excellent Spa in Hanoi Old Quarter. We decided to go for massage treatment after reading many glowing review on Tripadvisor, we were not disappointed. From Spa reception Suzy greeting us by wonderful tea to well trained, helpful therapist. They were profeesional, even asked us few times if we satisfied with their service. No complain and would highly recommend.

Wonderful massage and facial. I decided to treat myself to the hotel's spa and it was well worth it! The spa atmosphere was peaceful and the service was exceptional. Both the massage and facial treatments were inexpensive and completely worth it. Definitely would recommend to anyone wishing for a relaxing 30-90 minutes!

High class in Old Quarter area. Rated as the top Spa in TripAdvisor and also the top restaurant associated with this hotel, so wouldn't want to miss it. Made the booking the day before, nothing goes wrong from the moment I arrive till I leave. I am quite sure they are a class above the rest but I haven't tried all the spa rated here but Essencia is a good choice to rest and relax while you are in Hanoi.

Awesome massage, great value.. My husband and I had a full body couples massage for 1 heavenly hour. Total cost $51US which was fantastic value. Staff warmly greeted us before serving us a cup of tea. Tam and Yen provided us with what I would rate as the best massage I have ever had! They were very professional and checked a couple of times if we were comfortable. Their timing was very much in sync, the service was very relaxing. Our only regret is that we left it until our day of departure to get a massage. Would have gone daily otherwise. Another cup of tea and some fruit was a nice way to end this service. Would highly recommend.

Heaven! That's how we felt!. We stayed at Essence d'orient hotel and as we loved being pampered, we booked our 1st 90 min of Aroma Therapy with Essencia Spa which is on the 2nd floor at the hotel. The small reception at the Spa is cozy and well presented. We were welcomed by the smiling therapist and were served tea. We were then directed to the couple room, the massage was pure bliss! The therapists were very professionsal and we were asked where we want them to focus the most. We both wanted a good massage on the back, which we got! We were given 20% discount as we were resident at the hotel. We decided to revisit the spa for a longer treatment, the winter package, 3.5hrs long. I got a fresh coconut full body scub, followed by a flower and lemon bath, full body massage with essential oil, a second full body massage using a hot dry herbs bonbon, facial then a back massage. At the end of it, i was sleeping! This followed by a meal in the restaurant and a gift from the Spa. The meal, gift and massage was all part of the Winter package. For our 2nd visit, we were given 30% off. I will definitely recommend and go back to Essencia Spa. Thank you for making our stay memorable. I will miss all this pampering

Perfect. We visited the spa after a long day travelling, we had the street vendor package which was amazing and relaxed us so much we fell asleep! Very reasonably priced and extremely professional... Highly recommended
Great spa. Did body scrub and massage. Staff were attentive and very service oriented. Definitely recommended! Prices not on the low side but hey, it's value for your dong!
Convenient & Cost-Friendly Massage. Great service. Attentive staff. Comfortable setting. A top quality experience without the high price!

Totally relaxed!. Tried the spa because it was in the hotel where we were staying which was really convenient. Treatments offered were well explained and assistance given to select the best treatment for my needs. Overall, great experience and I would back.

Perfect end to the day. My friend and I both had 90 minute spa treatments after a long day walking around Hanoi in the heat! It was a perfect way to end our afternoon. The spa rooms were great, the therapists were great and we didn't want it to end! I enjoyed it so much that I went back the following day for a foot massage which was also brilliant. Would highly recommend the spa and the therapists!

Relaxing Spa after a Busy Day in the City. I opted for a one-hour back massage, and it felt great after weeks of travel in airplanes, busses, and taxis. Hanoi is noisy and a bit unnerving with all the scooters and motorbikes, so it is nice to be in the peace and quiet of the spa. On U.S. standards, the price was very reasonable. There are plenty of options of treatment. On another day, I had a foot massage, which may have felt better than the back massage. Highly recommended.

Massage and 4 hour spa package. My friend and I had a 4 hour spa package. It included a salt body scrub, bath in roses petals, a full body massage and a face-firming facial. The package was great, everything was great. The therapist are very nice and professional. I would definitely stay at Essence and use the spa again.

Pampered Treatment. My partner and I had the 2 1/2 hour "Spring" package at the Essencia Spa. It was well worth the price as it included a body scrub, mineral soak, massage, facial and, finally, a refreshing meal in the spa cafe. Our experience was positive and we'd recommend it to anyone. The spa is modern, clean and the staff professionally trained.

Quiet Serenity. In Hanoi for six days and while there are literally hundreds of spa establishments of various degrees of quality, many trying to persuade you to use their service. I did not need to worry about this as I was staying in the beautiful 'Essence Hotel,' and so had the privilege of using their high quality spa facilities. From the minute you are escorted from reception to the spa desk, everything is just of such calm and quality, you are taken through the many options and while the process is explained to you you are provided with some Vietnamese tea. The masseuse was very skilled and professional and continually checked that everything was OK - how could it not be in such a great atmosphere.I would definitely recommend that whether you're staying in the Essence Hotel (and you should) or not, ignore the street side spa options and head for this great facility.Thank you all.Alexander Lobban
Brilliant Massage. I had the one hour hot stone massage whilst staying at the hotel.excellent massage by professional staff in lovely surroundings. Best massage in Hanoi !!!

Just the best. After a long day out this is just what I needed. the staff are just lovely and on top off that it was one of the best overall massage I have had.......wish I could take my lady home with me. Come out feeling very relaxed and would go back again.

Superior Service. We enjoyed a very pleasant 60min full body massage at Essencia Spa, when we stayed at the Essence Hanoi Hotel. We were served tea and fruits/nuts before and after the massage. The atmosphere was very quiet and relaxing and the therapists were super-friendly, well trained and considerate.

Best Spa in Vietnam. As is everything with the Essence group and its wonderful staff. Suzy and the girls run a very professional and personalized service that really compliments your stay in Hanoi. The atmosphere is great and our whole family enjoyed a relaxing spa experience. Very reasonably priced and well worth a visit after a hectic day out on the streets...

Essence Spa Hanoi. This was a much needed and very relaxing experience. The atmosphere was quiet and intimate and my masseuse was very polite and considerate. I had the 90 minute natural therapy treatment which cost $50A.

Good addition to Essence Hotel!. Visited the spa when I was staying at this hotel. Had a 1 hour full body massage and it was very pleasant and professionally consucted. The girls which work here are lovely people with a beautiful heart. Only thing I would reccommend is lowering the prices. Essence is a 3* property, I paid something like $25 USD for a massage which is very expensive for Vietnam standards. Obviously it is done by a professional opposed to someone off the street however I think a lot more residents of the hotel will visit the spa if prices are lowered slightly.
Lovely Spa. We stayed at the essence hotel and used the very reasonable guest discount to go to the spa twice. The whole experience was lovely and I highly recommend it after a day of sight seeing.

Lovely and relaxing . As part of outlet month of Asia tour we went here to have a bit of a pamper for my birthday. We were able to walk in off the street, only a short walk though the old quarter, past the lake from our hotel. The Orchids Spa staff were very friendly and accomodating, calling in an girl early to give me some amazing lashes. My girlfriend had a foot massage, that extended while she waited for me to to finish. It was then on to a pedicure, I'd never had one so it was a bit of a treat, feet really aren't all that attractive, leaving my feet feeling to beautiful to go back out in the rain in price was very reasonable for the service we received, and lucky they had free wifi as all the other people there were glued to their phones.A recommendation

Fantastic!. I have been to both of the 'Orchid Spa' beauty salons in Old Quarter and they are of such a high standard! I got the eyelash extension here at a third of the price they are at home 700k vnd ($28) and they were beautiful, the shoulder massage at the end was a very welcome treat! The staff are so nice, the salon is exceptionally clean and they have very good English. Although I think they get mostly walk ins, I think booking a few hours in advance is a good idea. I got shellac nails in their sister salon and was so so happy with them, and only 200k ($8!)

Relaxing and clean . The three of us (mum, dad and 11 year old son) had very tired and dirty feet after walking around the Old Quarter for the day so we looked up Trip Advisor and chose Orchid Spa - it was exactly what we needed! Mum had shellac manicure and pedicure while dad & son had pedicures and foot scrubs. It was lovely and cool and the seats were comfortable. The staff were lovely and patient with my ticklish son. We came out feeling refreshed and pampered. Total cost vnd740,000 which we paid using our card.

Relaxing time. Amazing time in this spa, I chose the relaxing massage it was heaven, my boyfriend took the Thai massage and was really satisfied too. I recommend this place, massages are great and so cheap.

Good services. We went twice with my friends, first we did our nails with Shellac gel so it is supposed to stay 3 weeks or more and it was great except for one of my fiends, two days after the nail polish is already fading, so it may depend on your therapist. We also did a 60 min back and shoulders hot stone massage and it felt really good. Do not hesitate to mention to your therapist if you want a soft or strong massage because she will not ask at the beginning.
Mani/pedi. Fantastic job. I feel like they really took the time to make sure it looked perfect. Good feet scrub too. All for $9

Great massage and pedicure . A really lovely salon, with professional and kind staff. I had a great foot/leg massage, which was the perfect pressure, followed by a lovely pedicure. It was a good price for both- under €10 I think. A great visit. I'd definitely go again.

My achy body was rejuvenated!. I had a mani, pedi and 1 hour massage. The staff spoke relatively good English which was helpful when you wanted to tell them what you want. Prices for their service was great - reasonable, but not too cheap. I am always a little weary about places that offer massages for USD3/hr like some massage places I noticed during my visit to Siem Reap. The massage was divine... she cracked all the right places and made much of the aches and pains from sitting on a Vespa for 4 hours plus doing a walking food tour that day disappear. This spa can get quite busy so it's best to make an appointment. It is located near "Walking Street" so just be aware that if you go when they've closed the street to cars, the music/noise from the street can be quite loud and ruin the soothing mood you were thinking of having for your massage.

Great Eyelash Extensions from Tam!!. I came in without an appointment at around 12pm and they were able to fit me in. But soon enough, the entire lobby filled up with people. Very popular place!Tam did a amazing job on my eyelashes - the setting was very relaxing as well. I would come again to have them redone. Highly recommend!Cost is 700k dong for eyelash extensions. It was not in the brochure but I knew they did them because it was recommended to me by a friend :)

Pedicures . This place is lovely. A short walk from our hostel and recommended to us by our hostel staff. The prices are great and the treatments were amazing! If you need some down time to feel normal after being a backpacker for a while then this is the place. There's so many spas in Hanoi so it's a little overwhelming trying yo decide which one to go to when they all call you in from the street, but this place was perfect. Oh and quiet. And quiet is what we needed. We were greeted with tea and cold water! Loved it

Excellent gel removal + mani/pedi. For just over USD $11, I had the gel removed from the nails on my hands and feet - as well as a professional mani/pedi. And when I scuffed my toe within 1 minute of leaving the place, they very kindly redid the polish for me. Very efficient, clean and professional (with food products - OPI).

Great service at reasonable prices. This spa was recommended as it was close to our hotel and we were very satisfied with the foot massages especially after a full day on our feet touring Hanoi. They close at 10pm but last booking is at 8.30 pm and they were very accommodating of our large group. We went back again on our last night in Hanoi as we were very pleased with the services.
Lovely service and prices. Me and a friend got French pedicures here for just 100.000VND each, we came when it was empty so we got very attentive service. Overall we were very happy with this place

Eyelashes done. We did eyelash extensions here and it looks super natural. The ladies were very gentle and nice to us since we were freaking out. We asked for natural but in the end it might've been better to get a bit thicker lashes to get the 'wow' effect and not having to wear any more make up.

Mani/pedi. We dropped by this spa in the morning and they were able to accommodate three manicures and pedicures without a problem. Everyone there was very nice and friendly. The results were great and the cost is very low!
So chilled. I've been here a few times now. I've gotten facials, massages and waxes during my month in Hanoi. Really chilled modern spa, good prices and professional staff

One of the worst massages ever. Orchids have two shops. I went to the one north of the lake, not the one west of the lake. I have gotten dozens if not hundreds of massages in my time, both cheap and expensive, but this was the second worst massage I have ever had.It was painful more than anything else, and when I persisted on indicating that it hurts (ex. adjusting my body so she doesn't press the wrong spots, saying ouch, and even stop, etc.) she just laughed, and pulled my body parts back to continue what she was doing. I wish I left without letting her finish. Had bruises after.Go to Mido Spa instead. Went there 3 times and had a great experience each and every time.

The best Vietnamese massage. I have been to countless spas I'm Vietnam for massages and I had one of the best Vietnamese massages at this place. It was strong, effective, and relaxing all at the same time. I would highly recommend a Vietnamese massage here.

Great value pedicure . Had a basic pedicure here which had everything I needed. Foot soak, nail trimming, heel file and polish. All for VND 90,000 which is about $5 Aussie. All up about 50 mins which was a bit longer than they said but it was nice and cool and relaxing inside.

Great massage and facial . We were met with complimentary tea while we decided what treatment we wanted, followed by a small foot bath which was lovely.I had a facial and my boyfriend had a shoulder and back massage, and we both enjoyed our treatments. The facial was more of a face massage but was incredibly relaxing and left my skin very soft afterwards. Only downside is there is some noise from the street outside but it was the middle of the day and the staff can't help this. Overall I would highly recommend this place for a massage or a facial! Excellent value and very relaxing.

Good Massage. My hotel had helped me make a booking with Orchid Spa for 2 pax, doing body massage, manicure, pedicure and eyebrow waxing. I had an additional body scrub added to my body massage.The massage and body scrub were very good, strength of the lady who did the massage was good, she also did a very thorough scrub for me. The manicure and pedicure were done quite well, perhaps the nail polish they use was about to dry up soon. The eyebrow waxing was not painful and the person would ask if the shape is ok.

Amazing service. Initially I had a problem using their booking system (I didn't want to leave my credit card details). Instead I sent a message through their website and within an hour, they emailed back confirming the booking.I arrived at 09:00 for a men's special package. They have free wifi so you can internet browse while you're having feet washed in preparation for the massage. I was lead to a room with three beds but there were no other customers there. The spa provide a locker so you can feel safe about your valuables. There was no outside noise and the room temperature was good. The aromatherapy massage was really good, helping sort out my back and right shoulder pain. The same goes with the foot acupuncture, helping out my sore feet. The last part was the facial treatment, which help smooth out my skin.I don't know why but I was given a 10% discount.
Very pleased. I've done a pedicure which was absolutely satisfying. The staff was really friendly and did a great job. Can really recommend that place.
Thai massage. Friendly staff, cheap price (around 400k vd with a tip for 75 minute thai massage) calming environment and really relaxing massage. One of the best i have ever had. Highly reccommended!

Time to Relax. Orchids Spa experience was nice. I was greeted with a hot cup of tea on arrival. The spa is clean and the staff was very nice. The manager was also very helpful. I requested a Shellac Mani and a Regular Pedi on this visit and the service was adequate. I paid about $13. The supplies were clean but not sterilized between clients. They offer many color polish selections and nail designs. Overall, I would recommend this spa for anyone looking to get off their feet for a little while and relax.
Thai massage and manicure. We went to the Luong Ngoc Queen shop (not listed on Trip Advisor, but on the web site). I had a great Thai massage and my wife really liked her head massage and manicure.

great for relaxation, affordable prices. Went to Orchids Spa twice during my 5 night stay in Hanoi for a foot massage and a back massage. Prices are very reasonable compared to other massage places as well. Staff can understand basic english. Look no further if you're looking for a place to relax.

Great eyelashes extension! . Amazing eyelashes extension.Took 14mm in the middle and 12-13mm the rest with a C curl. It looks really good! And the lady was very kind. Almost slept the all time :) I definitely recommend this place for eyelashes extension. (Price: ~ 30 dollars)
Not Impressed. The spa was just ok for me. I had a massage and a mani/pedi. They did an ok job at both. It was not the most sanitary place to go.

Great foot scrub and massage. My husband and I stopped in for a foot scrub and foot massage after a morning walking the humid streets of Hanoi. The girls did a great job, bringing our feet back to life and the environment was clean and inviting. I thought the price was quite reasonable too: 250,000 Dong per person which included a 15 minute foot scrub followed by a 50 minute foot massage.

Lives up to high rating . Visited this spa for a 3.5 hour visit of pampering before heading home the next day. Had Shellac manicure, Thai massage, and a facial. Everything was brilliant. The women working there were all very nice, the building is clean and nicely designed with a good atmosphere, and the treatments were to a high standard. A million times better than some of the backroom so-called "spas" here, and worth seeking out.

Will visit Orchids Spa again. Me and my friend did foot care, massage, manicure and pedicure there. It was a wonderful experience, the salon was clean and comfortable. The lady boss speaks fluent English and we chatted with her while getting our nails done. Super friendly and welcoming. Highly recommend you to visit the salon.

Relaxing Massage. Me and a two friends decided to treat ourselves to massages at Orchids Spa. I found the prices to be very good for a 60 minute massage. The spa was convenient within the Old Quarter and very clean. I found the massage to be so relaxing and I felt great afterwards. The only knock I had was the women did not smile very much.
Wonderful service. I visited orchids spa today with two friends- the staff were incredibly kind and professional, along with reasonable prices. I would recommend and hope to visit again!

Pleasant waxing experience. I had an upper lip wax here yesterday and the therapist did an excellent job. I would recommend to others. I've been in Hanoi for three months and other places I've been to have done a terrible job of waxing. I would definitely go back to Orchids Spa.

Definitely recommend. I walked into Orchid Spa on the off chance that they would be able to fit me it (it was a Sunday at 11am and the weather wasn't great so didn't think I'd have much of a chance!). They fit me in straight away.I had a foot scrub - which was lovely, especially for feet that have done nothing but walk for 2 months. I wouldn't have this done on its own though as it was over pretty quickly! I then had a shellac pedicure. Probably one of the most perfect pedicures I think I've ever had. She even did my little toe perfectly which most people laugh at!! Then I had some waxing done. Underarms and half leg. the was wax really great too. Very thorough. I think it was done in the room where they would normally do massages. If it is they I would think the massage isn't very private.It all came to 540,000 (£17/25 USD) so really cheap. Really great value for money.

Highly recommend. We went to the salon in the Old Quarter. Hubby had a massage which he said was very relaxing. I had shellac mani & pedi. The ladies did a though job and the shellac was faultless. Salon was very clean. Highly recommend.

Eyelash extensions . Needed a fill for my eyelash extension that I had originally got in Canada. They turned out amazing and the price was reasonable. Would recommend to anyone wanting extensions or needing a fill!
Very happy. My husband and I had a pedicure yesterday (first time ever for him!) and then a full body massage today, very happy and feeling very relaxed.

Floating on Clouds. I had one of the best massage and body scrubs ever! After 2 weeks of travel, a friend recommended this spa. The experience was an oasis. The spa is clean, and I was greeted with a cup of herbal tea, and had the most relaxing massage. I then received an aromatic coconut scrub, that was thorough and gentle, and exfoliating at the same time. The experience was really a slice of heaven. The receptionist speaks limited English, but her vocabulary was much better and more extensive than my Vietnamese. The spa menu is in English.

Awesome service!. I went in Orchid Spa for a facial last night. The shop is very clean and practical, nothing fancy but has a comforting atmosphere, smells good from fresh flower displays and essential oil. I had my facial and a pedicure. Both are perfect. The staff were gentle and made an effort to ensure high quality service. One note on the facial: it's more of a facial massage than a "facial treatment", I also got message for neck, arms and leg, so on the whole it feels great and it's really good value. A bit downside is I don't feel my skin is very deeply cleaned at the end, a higher end package may have that extra benefit. I would highly recommend the spa!

Awesome eyelash extensions!. I got eyelash extensions done. The manager is awesome. Highly recommended. I'm from Canada and she did a better job then anywhere I've got them done there! Really good place for travellers

Nail treatment of international standard. Had a gel/shellac manicure for the affordable price of 180.000 VND. I we're looking for qualified staff and good products. She were using OPI and IBD and the place and the tools were clean and inviting. Looks like they do beautiful single lashes as well. Wish I had discovered them at my arrival to Hanoi so I could have had many more treatments. Go there!

Great Massages!. Recently visited Hanoi, and found this spa on our last day - sad to say. I wish I had found it the first day, then I would have gotten massages here every day. The spa was nice and quaint and the massage was great. There were a few local people receiving services, so that was reassuring. The prices are reasonable with a good selection of services and nice staff.

Foot and back massage. This was OK. There are not nearly as many spas in Hanoi as in the rest of the East like Phuket or Bangkok... And the lack of competition shows a bit. If you are in desperate need of a foot or back massage, it will do - but there are definitely better places. Also, it was very annoying that the therapists kept chatting when we were trying to relax during the session!
Nice salon. Had my waxing done and went for a manicure and pedicure the next day. Staff were friendly and attentive. Recommend this place to anyone with a budget!

Customer Service Still Lives. Very nice ladies work at this spa. They have all the highlights of a western spa with the great customer service. I arrived well past the final appointment time and they still served me. I had the body salt scrub/massage and it was wonderful! Absolutely wonderful. I went back the next day for a manicure! Tops!

Worst waxing. The 50% off I got was not enough to make me feel better about the bruise I got while getting waxed. Had to stop the service as obviously the girl is not trained to do this service. Receptionist offer 20% off, which I refused, to finally get a 50% which she didn't seem happy to give.

Great stop in old quarter. I love this spa...always stop for a foot massage when I am walking around the lake area. Very clean, price is good. They also have body massage as well as just foot massage. I think they have a couple of branches, but this is the one I always use.
Pedicure . Brilliant pedicure !! Staff really attentive & great products used -OPI ! If I had more time I would have had a massage as well .....

Amazing spa!!. We went here to soothe our aching joints after a week of travelling and my goodness it was amazing. Hot stone massage for 75 minutes for £15 English pounds. Came out feeling like I was floating. Amazing staff and very talented x

Stunning. Could not recommend this place more. The staff were so lovely, made us feel welcome as soon as we walked through the door. Had a 75 minute hot stone massage for an absolute bargain at only 450,000vnd (around £14/$20).
Would definitely go there every day if I lived in the area!!

Quick and easy. Went for a manicure which was delivered competently and fast. Not luxurious in that there was no hand massage but for 90,000 vnd (£2.80) what do you expect? The place was very clean, the girls charming and when I had a coughing fit, they bought me soothing green tea.

Loved the hot stone massage . We found the prices here to be excellent and the staff was very professional. It was my first time doing hot stone and it was wholly relaxing and enjoyable. Can't go wrong here.

don't spend your money there. I went there for a full body massage + body scrub and waxing. First, you cannot take appointments by phone because they do not speak english. Then, logically I would have prefered to begin with the waxing and the scrub and then finish with a massage but that was just a dream. They do not care. And they talk during your massage. And you have absolutely no privacy (shower, waxing). Massage was OK but i will not go for another one. Waxing service is well done and so cheap tho!

Great Leg Massage. This spa was really good value for money, clean and the ambience was very relaxing with essential oils burning inside, I was already relaxed by the time i was on the massage bed. Would definitely go back.

Don't go for a manicure. We had a French manicure. It was simple in that there's no hand massage etc like we would get at home but hey it's insanely cheap compared to that. However, the whole layer of polish totally peeled off after about a day. They also had 3 women working on us as they were trying to hurry to get to some walk ins who were after a massage. They had told these people they could do it straight away then made them wait. While 2 of the people who were attending us seemed to be confident the other had no idea. They made the white part of the French manicure very fine so the nail could still be seen which wasn't good. They appeared to be using OPI products but as it all peeled off perhaps they were not authentic. Go elsewhere.

Great Service!. My friend and I decided to try out a massage there because the price seemed to be fair and the place looked very nice and clean from the outside.It turned out to be a really great experience! The ladies who are working there are really nice and friendly, and are definitely very skilled and professional.The Thai massage made us feel very relaxed and energetic. Might come again before the end of our trip! Thank you!

Foot and back massage. Having had foot and back massages around Asia they are not to the same level of Thailand in Phuket specifically but still good.In general we enjoined the time and went back for a second round.One tip for them would be not to speak to the other ladies when your busy with your client

Foot massage lacked power and passion. I like a firm massage. Otherwise I regard it as a stroke or a slight tickle which when you want pressure is frustrating and something you can get your partner to do- badly but at least then it's free. This foot and leg massage was akin to your grandmother tickling you with a lace handkerchief. They had no idea about the muscle groups or any pressure points To add insult to injury they karate chopped my forehead which was as you can imagine- not relaxing. Went with my sister she thought it was rubbish also.
Great spa!!. Excellent service - wash feet and warm tea on arrival. Staff are lovely and provide very good value for money. Went here twice and would definitely go back!

The best spa I have ever went to . The spa was looks very professional from the outside. You can either book in or walk in depending on what treatment you want. The service was efficient and very good value for money. I ended up spending my last two full days in Hanoi here. On arrival they offer you tea and wash your feet before any treatment. My treatments included pedicure, manicure, shellac nails, foot massage, body wrap, facial, hot stone massage. I would recommended them all!

Great service and value. We visited this spa twice! One day my friend and i went and got a pedicure and returned back the next day for a manicure as well as the price was great and the job done was great too. Appeared clean and very accessible to get to. We paid 100,000 dong for the pedis/manis. It was 100,000 more for shellac and 10,000 for each nail art :) recommend.

Great Spa!. I love a good spa and visit them frequently while traveling. This was hands down one of the best places I have been to. The staff is accommodating, prices are competitive, and the quality of services is top notch. I'd highly recommend it to anyone looking for a great manicure or massage.

Good place gone bad. I have been going to this spa for 18 months as I live in Hanoi. Today a range very bad practices occurred. Men walking in and out of my massage rooms, door left open while I was getting undressed, when the women in my room left, 3 loud older men were brought in, only light see-through curtain between me and them as they undressed, after several requests from the me to the massage women for the men to leave the room. I wrapped a towel around my nearly naked self and went 4 floors down to complain. I did not pay and I will not return to this place. I see the young women at the desk is new and the place is under renovation with workmen walking around too. Maybe it has changed management. So disappointing and upsetting.

Thaï massage was amazing. We had a couples massage for 75minutes and it was absolutely amazing. The ladies are very strong and professionnal. The price was really cheap for a gréât massage, and i would definitely go back
Amazing service for the price.. Highly recommend if you want a quality spa experience for less than your hotel would charge. I booked the massage, facial and mani pedi package.

Fantastic spa experience! . Great service! Friendly and helpful staff. Relaxing experience. Highly recommend for massages and manicure. Great products used and wide range of Opi colours available. Privacy and attentive to detail. Victoria and Daniel, Australia.

Great find. My husband and I came across this place and stopped inside for a break from all of the walking we had been doing through the city. The outside is beautiful in contrast to a lot of stores in the area. The inside is new and trendy. We were instantly greeted with the best tea we had in all of vietnam and attended to. Pricing was unbelievably modest for everything we got done. We got Thai massages (very unique but amazing experience), facials, foot massages, pedicures, and manicures. The staff were all very nice and we highly enjoyed the relaxing break from the busy city. These ladies work very diligently and hard. They spend time on you and give quality services.
Great customer service but Mediocre facial . I don't have much to say about this place. The staff is super friendly but my facial was mediocre. I wouldn't return if I ever go back to Hanoi.
Amazing!. This was actually the best massage I got in Vietnam! Based on the outside... no one was more surprised than me! Wish I could come back!
Great massage for a great price.. Just visited this lovely spa. After having our feet washed and drinking our herbal tea we had a great massage.Recommend.

Wonderful service. I gave just had the best foot care and body scrub at this spa. The ladies are so nice and really good. You cannot help feel relaxed and feel like sleeping. Vey attentive and quiet. No hassling you for add other services. Best spa ever

Professional Spa place. Had pain on muscles from the hard bed at the hotel and i got a really nice and relaxing hot stone massage today in this place. Pain is gone and i feel light as a feather. I will recomend you guys to visit this place if you are in Hanoi city.

Average and easily could have been better. Overall the service here was ok but not great, to be honest. The massage was fine but during the massage they started my facial so it wasn't really that relaxing. I asked for a stronger massage and the lady didn't really do a very strong one. Also, the power went out during the massage, which was fine and actually kind of nice because they set up candles. However, the girl that helped with the candles then stayed and was chatting with the lady giving me a massage, which was a little annoying.Overall, I'm surprised this place has rated so highly as I found it average at best, even for the cheaper (compared to North America) prices. A massage I had in HCMC a few days prior was definitely superior.

Can't understand why it can even claim itself "massage". As a Hong Konger who knows a bit acupuncture, I've tried Chinese massage in Hong Kong and Shenzhen, as well as Thai massage in Bangkok (I'm a frequent traveler to Bangkok) but never had Vietnamese message so after reading those positive reviews on Tripadvisor (and its Certificate of Excellence) I've decided to give it a try.The front door façade looked clean and professional I must say. It was actually hard to imagine there's such a place with tranquillity in the bustling Old Quarter of Hanoi. Me and my mom had the 60-minute foot massage (230,000 VND, about 10 USD) and were brought upstairs after the staff cleaned our foot with warm water on the base floor. The room upstairs has a drawer though the lock is not functioning. But that's ok. What is totally NOT ok is the pressure, there is NO pressure! Message is about pressure point, if no pressure is given then how can it even claim itself to be giving a massage? The staff keeps rubbing my feet (Yes it's non-stop rubbing up and down) during the whole 60-minute, and I've asked specifically to the staff, for 2 times, to give me "stronger" pressure, but zero improvement.I genuinely feel cheated and totally can't understand why other travelers would give this place a 5-star. Next time, if I'm going to do massage, that would be in anywhere but not Hanoi.

Quiet place to pamper yourself . My partner and I both had massages here, they were fantastic. One of the best we have had while in Vietnam. Made sure the pressure was ok during the massage. Very quiet place with a calming and relaxing atmosphere. The ladies here are very nice and good at what they do. It's a shame we found it on our last day.

Amazing Pedicure. I actually went to Orchid Spa in the Old Quarter, 34 Luong Ngoc Quyen Street, Hoan Kiem District. Which is another branch of this but it was very close to my hotel. There doesn't seem to be a listing on Trip advisor for the branch I visited.I loved this place, very clean, the staff are great, I had a pedicure for 90,000 dong with Opi nail polish and it lasted for absolutely ages, well after my holiday had finished. Definitely the best place for beauty treatments in Hanoi. I couldn't keep my daughter away from it, facials and waxing, prices were very cheap.

Mani-pedi-footscrub. I dropped by without an appointment. It was very busy but they made the time to give me my manicure, pedicure and foot scrub. I asked if it was really ok or that I should come back later, but they said it was ok. They were very kind, and very quiet, which made it a nice relaxing experience!Unfortunately, they were too quick with all the 4 royal layers of nail color (maybe still a little rushed?), so they didn't dry well, got damaged right away and the manicure chipped off within 1 day. Pedicure did not have this problem. Overall, this seems like a nice salon, but make sure they have enough time and that they let the nail polish dry a little before applications another layer.Considering the price, I would come back here again.

Refreshing experience. Went in for a quick hot coal foot massage before my flight back. Even though there wasn't an option for 30mins, they were flexible enough to charge me accordingly. Service was great. Felt refreshed instantly after the whole experience. Would've gone for a longer session if I had more time.
great! . I treated my girlfriend to a manicure and foot scrub and she was very happy! the ladies are very friendly and thorough :) the prices are great too!

Excellent value, great service!. After researching all the spas in the area I am glad I chose to go to this one- over 2.5 hours of relaxation, all for under 45$, all in a well-decorated, tranquil environment. I had package A: (Thai) massage, mani, pedi, and facial. All were well done, comparable to services I paid much more for back home- and perhaps the most thorough mani/ pedi I've had in my life! I'll definitely go back soon.

Great little spa in the old quarter. We came across this place whilst having a beer at the beer corner. Girlfriend has a pedicure. She thought it was very good. All normal foot treatment done. At only 3 pounds it's amazing value as at home it could be 10 times the cost! Would definitely recommend whilst in hanoi.

A great place to pamper yourself..... I live part time in Hanoi and I have been using Orchids Spa for about three years. Their services are great and the staff is well qualified. If you have never tried a body scrub....do it!! The most amazing feeling you get is like new skin.

Great value! Very clean.. Came by for a quick pedicure and some waxing with 2 girlfriends after getting back from trekking in Sa Pa. Our pedicures were 90VND ($4.50) and the waxing was also reasonably priced. Good location in the old quarter. They're open at 9am until late. Very clean! Pedicure lasted about 1.5hrs and the girl was very thorough. My feet felt like new afterwards. Would definitely recommend!!

Nice spa treatment . I flew in to Hanoi today from Hong Kong and decided to treat myself to a little spa session. I found this on trip advisor near my hotel and decided to try it out. Overall, good value for the money: about $50 U.S. For a 2.5 hour treatment (I did their package A): manicure, pedicure, massage, and facial. The ladies were nice, everything was clean, it was cool, so good experience. My only complaint would be that I struggled to find a comfortable head / neck position during the massage -- I think something about the table set up is a little different from what I'm used to, so my neck wasn't as relaxed as I'd like. But otherwise they did a good job and I'd recommend it!
Pedicure. I have been here with a friend. We were both very happy about the careful, correct and great work. Definitely something to recommend.

Enjoyed it. I had a foot treatment at this lovely place and I thought the service from the we enter till finished was good. I had a foot treatment and my friend had a body massage. My foot massage was very good and girl who did the foot therapy had good skills and done a good job. When I said, I need to leave earlier, they only charged the time I used which is unusual for a spa and I was very pleased with it. I could see that the place is busy with many customers. Certainly I would go back again as I did not have enough time to enjoy the treatment and next time I would go for 2 hours therapy.

Amazing Spa!. Just left the 'Orchids Spa' and... I'm already planning my next treatment.. The VIP treatment already starts when entering the oasis of tranquility; you're offered tea that is served with a smile and unless you have made reservation, they'll offer you their spa-menu - other spas might have a more extensive menu but their treatment is most likely more mechanical. The prices are very competitive and... What more can I say? Go there to pamper yourself in an oasis of calm tranquility!

A nice treat. I just popped into one of the orchid spas on a whim and it was a really lovely experience. I had a pedicure which lasted for about an hour and the staff were very polite and friendly. I am backpacking at the moment so having a good pedicure for a cheap price was a little luxury for me and I really enjoyed the experience. I hope to pop back in on another day for a massage.

Highly recommended. Mum and I had neck, shoulder and foot massage there three times. It was very clean. And the two masseurs were very good. They used the right firm pressure for mum and softer pressure for me. And they never asked for tips. It is US$2-3 more expensive than other places but definitely worth it. We have visited somewhere else. The service was terrible, massage was pooe and got bitten with mosquitoes. I highly recommend orchids spa at 34 Luong Ngoc Quyen, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi.

Best avoid marigold. Had a massage at their marigold branch on hang bong and it was mediocre to say the best. The masseurs talk and you hear the sound of traffic and construction (at least when we visited). Technique was it was OK - some times it felt half assed and the service aspect is almost non existent. This branch is also priced 20% more than their other branch by the river

Great spa in the old quarter. I had the Thai massage, was very good and at 320k for 60 mins very cheap. Felt great afterwards, just what was needed after a day walking around Hanoi. Also had my eyebrows waxed - was okay.

Facial treatment was very good. The place is clean and there are lockers where you can safely store your stuff.The lady who performed my face treatment was very serious and dedicated, it was very good and relaxing. The price is also fair, 420k dongs for 75mn.
Great facial!. I had 3 facials here on a recent trip to Hanoi, they were great! I left with all areas of my face, back, neck, chest and head massaged.

avarage. after having poor exeperince van xuan foot massage spa for 5 bucks which is ver near by orchids, we wanted to get some proper massage. I have been to many spa in vietnam mostly central (nha trang) and thanks to my therapist friends in my homeland I know what's good treatment and also bad one from my experince so , as we enter the place about 18pm they seemed to be not happy and interested to sale any package then we both choosed to full body massage 60min for 300 thousands VND about 15$ it's still more expensive then what you get in south but less then general hanoi well I am here traviling quiet budget and I can't afford 50$ for treatment so unfortunately I found the massage very avarage even not worth it and my friend too..but what I reckon it's not about the place it's about person who is doing the massage and how many massage she or he made before you already. .so my advise try the remember who gave the massage and next time try another untill you find the good one and don't go to spa late evening cause most of the therapist already exhausted to focus and deliver what you need (not their fault )..so tipped 50 thousand Dong as i do min in Vietnam even I don't like it just to respect. .
A must when in town. I got the Thai massage and it was great just hard enough without being painful. Price is very reasonable price $20AU (including tip) for 90 mins.

loooong maaaaaaasssage. me and my sister got the summer package. $50. they scrubbed all our dead skin off, covered us in coconut lotion, wrapped us up, towels over faces (like babies in cocoons) then massaged for over an hour, 45 min facial with lemon steam. MAZING. loved it. Do it. We smiled deliriously for hours afterwards.
