relaxing massage a must. Hanoi, old quarter area has a lot of walking, and after all that a good foot massage or aroma body massage relieves all the stress and pain. Orchids spa has 3 locations and reasonably priced. make an advance booking so you wont be disappointed as they are busy especially in the evenings as a lot of tired tourists want to get a massage and be ready for the next day.

Perfekt Spa! Van has hands as strong as a god, but is gentle as a butterfly!. Van has hands as strong as a god, but is gentle as a butterfly!I have been here 3 times now and will returnere each day i'm here in Hanoi!

Loved the hot stone massage!. I had the hot stone massage which was fabulous! Best massage I've ever had and was much needed after climbing mount fansipan the day before! Clean and comfortable lovely atmosphere with dimmed lights and gentle music! A welcome rest from the busy streets -I didn't want it to end! A real bargin pick up a price list outside x

Excellent massage. Very dedicated staff who assist in a Great massage experience. A lot of other spas in the area are more expensive than this one. We loved the treatment . The spa caters for bot male and female customers. The oil massage for 60 mins was a delight !

What a great way to end our trip. After a month of travel around Cambodia and Vietnam, a massage and manicure was the perfect way to end our trip. Catering for both males and females, my partner and I couldn't speak more highly of our treatment. The hot towels at the end of the massage was a great touch.

We loved our treatments at the Orchids Spa!. Visited Orchids Spa with my husband after picking up a brochure outside the shop a few days before. We went to the Hang Trong branch and we were very happy with all the services we tried. We have already made our next appointment. I had a manicure and pedicure (90,000 vnd each) and an anti ageing facial. This goes for about 75 minutes and included a nice neck and scalp massage, as well as a small amount of arm and leg work. Aah.... The facial! It was sheer bliss. We usually try to have some sort of spa treatment everywhere we travel - it is a little luxury after the trekking and touring. Quite honestly, the ones we had today rated right at the top. They were probably the best we have had anywhere. The place was clean and beautifully scented - you step into a different world from the noisy, dirty street outside. By Vietnamese standards, this place may be expensive but in comparison to Australia / UK / Europe, it is fabulous value and in my experience, much better quality. The only improvement i could suggest is that they think about providing those towelling wraps with the velcro closure or elastic at the top that you can put on when you take off your top for the facial. Looking forward to our next visit!
Best stone massage. One of the best I have experienced! For 90 mins at only 550000 dong. They have 3 outlets at old quarter all within walking distance

Walked in to request a pedicure which looked so good my husband had one too.. Nothing fancy but clean. Excellent pedicure. We both enjoyed the salt scrub which was not only relaxing but calluses were completely scrubbed off. Would go back for a massage if time had permitted. Thumbs up.

Good service for good price. We went in here while we were shopping. After a very poor experience in one of the up-market places we were a bit sceptic. But the foot massage was heavenly, at only 25% of the price. We came back later for a full body treatment. Not as good as the foot massage but still way better then the expensive- we don't care about you - can't you see i am texting attitude before. They have three locations in Hanoi. Service is friendly, place is clean ( as far as you can see in the semi dark). Except for the manager the girls do not speak English so communication is limited.

Great massage. Came here on my last night in Hanoi. On my first night I visited another spa nearby that was highly rated and seemingly popular on Tripadvisor, only to come out disappointed.Orchid spa is really so much better. The staff aren't as friendly as the "popular" spa granted, but the quality of service and facilities are so much better.They even had lockers in the room, which really gave peace of mind.

Great value. Lovely peaceful place my friend and I had the 45 minute back and shoulder massage in a room together .excellent all round.when you arrive you strip off and wear these baggy boxer shorts was a bit of a giggle.think it worked out to 12.50 aus dollars each.we plan to return another day

Good value and friendly atmosphere. If you want to go for beauty treatment at a reasonable price and where you feel at home, this is the place for you. In particular, I liked the comfortable setting for pedicures.
Great service, friendly staff. This is the first time I have been in a spa. Got the 75 mins body massage snd I can't expect more. I will come here monthly for a massage.

Great foot massage. I have had many massages in Thailand and one in Vietnam, this has been one of my more favorite massage experiences. The place was clean and I wasn't suffering in pain and felt very relaxed for a full hour. I recommend this spa for a nice massage experience.
Great massage at a good price, I keep coming back. As a current Hanoi resident, this is the best spa I have found. Reasonably prices, clean and professional. I keep coming back!

Impressed.. I enjoyed the hot stone massage I received. It was a good combination of deep muscle and relaxing massage. Yes, the bed was in a room with four other beds, separated by curtains, but it's no big deal. Expensive, by Vietnam standards, cheap by US standards.

Best spa in Hanoi. After a long day of sight seeing, Orchids Spa was EXACTLY what I needed. I got a facial and a pedicure. I had a lovely foot bath (possibly because it was obvious my feet needed it) before being led upstairs for the greatest facial of my life. Even though I ordered a facial they gave me quite a massage as well which was lovely. Everything was very clean and very professional and the masseause was amazing. After a week in the polluted, muggy Hanoi, my skin thanked me. After my facial/massage, I was led down stairs for my pedicure in such a relaxed daze. I got another lovely foot bath before the pedicure which was also fantastic.I highly recommend this place.

excellent facial massage. The whole experience was food. I was given tea, then my feet were massaged and cleaned for 5 minutes. Then i went upstairs, yes its a communal room with only curtains dividing the room, however i was alone and i had a locker for my stuff. Then some steam, different products which smelled amazing and natural on my face for 50 minutes. All for 290 00dong which is worth it!

So relaxing. I have been to the Orchids Spa on Hang Trong twice now, the first for the foot care package - 75 mins 460,000VND including scrub, massage and paraffin mask and then for a shoulder and back massage 250,000 VND (45 mins + 40,000 for 60mins). Each time I just popped in from the street and was able to secure a space straight away. I was provided with a drink on arrival and a foot soak. I enjoyed the ambience of the spa, both times I went on a Sunday and I was the only customer. It is quite modern and nicely lit, the music is soft and relaxing, and the chairs for the foot treatment are very comfortable. The lady I had (same both times) didn't speak much English, but I don't mind this as I don't want someone chatting alot anyway! She did however check I was ok and that she wasn't hurting me which I found reassuring. The back massage included work on the arms, hands, head, neck and briefly the legs as well, tough at times (perhaps just because I'm so stiff) but worth a little pain for the great feeling afterwards. This place is certainly more expensive than others, but for the relaxing vibe of the place and the thoroughness of treatment and attentiveness of staff I would recommend.

Superb Thai massage. Yes I know we aren't in Thailand, but we do prefer this style of massage. This spot is good for a firm styled massage, not the light fall asleep type. It is priced higher than others but for us it was worth the extra dollar. 400,000 dong gets you 75 mins, 490,000 - 90 mins

No relaxation or privacy here!. I was here at the beginning of April by myself and had a massage and body wrap treatment. It was 90-minutes and cost 490,000Dong. It’s a very nice looking place and the main floor is very clean and professional. But that’s where my good impression stopped.Upstairs, I was given a locker for my things. Massages are done in a communal room. “Privacy” is granted via a completely sheer curtain between tables. There is also a large bathtub in the room, not closed off at all. I’m suspect if you opt for any soaks, this is where it is done. I was given a pair of sheer disposable underwear for the wrap portion of my treatment. There was no robe or towel or anything to cover myself as I walked across the room to my table. Awkward.Treatment commenced by my attendant rubbing some sort of lotion all over me and I ended up face up on the table with my chest completely exposed. Oh wait…the sheer curtain was closed. I was then wrapped in a towel and left to relax for 20 minutes. Sounds nice, however, since I was in a communal room, my relaxing involved listening to conversations between the attendants, and a lot of skin slapping noises as the attendants worked on their clients. Then, I was shown to the bathroom to shower. The bathroom door had a window that was barely frosted. It was off the main massage room. I could see the person outside getting their massage. Surely, if they looked up, they could see me showering. More awkward. When I came out, I was given a pair of cotton shorts to wear during the massage. The massage itself was so rough and painful, I was more tense coming out than I was going in. At the end, she used a hot towel to get the oil off, which was nice. Unfortunately, she rubbed so hard, my skin was literally peeling on my arms. When I was getting dressed (no change room by the way, you get (un)dressed right in the communal room), I took off the shorts I was given. My attendant came back, folded them up, and put them back in the pile for the next customer. That’s disgusting. I have no idea how many people before or after me will wear those shorts.I did not tip and I most certainly don’t recommend this place!

Excellent spa. I went to Orchids Spa today on Hàng Trông and it was amazing, I asked for a body massage with foot scrub and foot massage, the lady advised me to pick the massage that includes the feet to make it cheaper, the massage and foot scrub was amazing and very cheap!!! I was very pleased she informed me of a cheaper option, very professional!!!
Great value. Very professional and clean. We had a 75 min Thai massage and 75 min hit stone foot massage for $33 usd. Highly recommend

Relaxing way to end the day.. There are three Orchids Spa in Hanoi and my wIfe and I visited two of them. After a hard day walking round the city we twice had a full body Swedish massage for an hour. We both thoroughly enjoyed the experience and it was great way to finish days excursions.

Orchid oasis!. We picked up a few brochures as we wandered around the Old quarter but styled on Orchid and very happy that we did. Staff very friendly, clean environment, good choice of treatments at competitive prices. Recommended.
Peaceful,clean,nice staff. Had a very good relaxing foot massage , nice comfy chairs to relax in , very clean beautiful spa & great professional staff , one of the nicest spa I visited in Vietnam
Great foot massage. My friend and I stopped to rest our weary feet, the staff were great, good ambiance, everyone was very friendly. We had the hot stone foot massage, it was wonderful.

Lovely Spa and Massage place. I defiantly recommend this place, for a massage. Very relaxing, clean, staff are really friendly. My partner and i had several massages there, and foot treatments, and thoroughly enjoyed it.
Great service friendly staff. Husband and I got full body massage. Friendly staff. Clean facilities. Good location. Would go back if we weren't leaving hanoi.

Terrible massage. I stopped by this place as it was close to my hotel. What a mistake it was. There was no stroking or pressure points, just constant rubbing of lots and lots of oil on the back. I would rate the experience the 2ns worst out of 100 in SE Asia. Don't let the professional facade fool you.

Pedantic and Not Disappointed!. After spending a few days in Sapa trekking I was in desperate need of some foot work. Orchids was close by to the hotel so won my business. I booked in for a foot scrub, pedicure and foot massage. They worked around for timings that suited me too.Upon entry you are greeted with a smile and some tea before they commence your treatment. There are five levels and all with something different for treatments.The foot treatment was just what I was looking for and more. I also booked in the following day for some waxing. I'm pedantic with my full bikini wax, but was not disappointed. The eye brows were well shaped and happy with that too. I had the same technician, Hai, for both treatments and she was very professional and attentive to what I requested.They have three locations; however I went to the one at 108 Hang Trong.I left extremely happy with the treatments I had and would return if I was to be in Hanoi again.

Very good massage and no tip begging. Very good place and very good massage. Contrary to many other massage parlour in Vietnam the massage therapist don't ask for compulsory tip at the end. Not that I don't like to tip, but a compulsory tip is not a tip, it's a hidden fee. This place doesn't ask for such a compulsory tip and the massages are very good, went back 5 times. Highly recommended.

3 hour visit to Midori. Had an amazing afternoon of services at Midori during our stay in Hanoi. Ma. Hue was wonderful! I loved my sea salt scrub and 75 min Swedish massage. Perfect for getting out all of the knots from weeks of travel. The foot massage was great too. Ms. Hung in the reception area was very friendly and let us shower one last time before heading to the airport.The quality of the services far exceeds the ambiance. We were in a shared room with others who were also getting massages. This was not a big deal to us as there were curtain dividers and the staff took extra care when bringing a new guest in and out to make sure all were comfortable. This is a simple spa, with hardworking and caring staff. We enjoyed our time here very much and will return the next time we are in Hanoi. Thanks, Midori!!!! :-)

amazing. i was a bit skeptical, as this was my first vietnam massage and didnt know how it would go. honestly we had the best experience, i am female and had a male masseuse, mr. duy. he has been doing this for three years and constantly checked in with me to ensure the pressure was okay. very attentive, professional, and put me at ease, also really got to my pressure points and knots. i did the steam room, 90 minute swedish and foot massage. great sendoff to the airport, and a wonderful price. mrs hung (organizer in the lobby) was also extemely helpful. midori services go towards a great cause, give it a try!
Great massages . Had two massages here (Vietnamese and Shiatsu). Both were really good. Place is spotless and staff v friendly.

Excellent . My boyfriend and I turned up here without an appointment but the staff were more than welcoming. We were greeted with a herbal tea and given information about the massages on offer. We requested different massages (Swedish and Thai) but they still put us in a room together which was lovely. The Swedish massage was mostly soft but with some harder kneading in requested areas. The Thai massage involved much more stretching and clicking but both were excellent. Both masseuses asked us if we wanted them to focus on certain areas and asked several times during the massage if we were happy with the pressure. My masseuse even plaited my hair at the end of my massage! Overall, extremely professional service and very friendly staff. This place is made all the better for its help with the blind and visually impaired.

Best massage in Vietnam !. After a long trip in Vietnam & Cambodia , I can say that this is the most professional massage we got. It was great, very relaxing and they also considered our requests for the special massage we wanted.

Wonderful massage and a great cause. One of the best massages I have ever had! They did an amazing job. It was very professional and they made us feel very comfortable. We went in without appointments and they got us in without any issues. They made sure to ask before we went in if we were comfortable with a male masseur, I had a large bruise on my leg and they communicated to the masseur well to stay away from that area, they asked during both of our massages if the pressure was okay...overall it was just a great experience. And I liked that it supports the visually impaired/blind in Hanoi and helps them lead independent lives. Would definitely go back and recommend to anyone!

Welcoming and professional. We arrived at Midori Spa without a reservation but they were very happy to accommodate us and arranged a private room for the two of us. We were given hot tea upon our arrival and afterwards. My back massage (which included shoulders, neck, head) was utterly divine and my husband had a foot massage which he loved (also he got his legs massaged which was a nice bonus). I would recommend this place because the masseuses are very professional, polite and friendly. Also - it was great value at 200dong for my 40min back massage! Thank you!

Best massage in Hanoi. I have been living in Hanoi for 6months and this is so far the best place to get a massage! The quality and professionalism is always kept up to the highest standard! The massage is perfect! This place is also centrally located and price is very good! The quality is much better than in other more expensive places! I can only recommend!

Professional massage . Our hostel recommend this spa for us to have a great massage. We liked the thought of the project of the massages. We had a warm welcome and did not have to wait for a massage without reservation. We have been massaged by mister Thuòo and misses Huê. The massages was really nice and relaxing. They took their time and were really professional, we felt much better after the massage, thank you so much again!!!
Excellent place, very recommended. . Great prices and quality massage. Very recommended to visit. Little bit hard to find but worth it. Clean rooms and polite staff.

Holy wow what a wonderful massage!! . Mum and I went twice to Midori spa in old quarter. They were half the price of others and twice as good!!! They may be visually impaired but you don't have to see good, it's all about the feel and touch and they have it. I had Ha (speaks wonderful English) twice and he did the very hard shiatsu on my back. I told him exactly what I wanted and he found the spots and worked hard!! It was amazing, he found the places that no others have and I feel amazing!! Mum had Deep and LAN who were also great and made her relax and feel a million bucks. Thankyou very much for your wonderful service. Highly recommend.
Very Good. I got a warm rock massage from Lan who was very considerate and helpful. Helped my sore back amd shoulders from walking and carrying bags a lot.

Lovely Staff & Affordable Massage. Located just behind our hotel ! We found this place with very lovely staff and affordable price ! Easy to find the location. We did not make reservation and walk in . 1st we have served by lovely staff with cup of tea while waiting for them to check teh availablity. About 8mins we had been told that was full and let us come back after 1 hour. The staff keep apologized for letting us wait. she is very cute. We go for have our dinner and come back after 1 hour, we had start our massage and the staff was very kind, We feel satisfied with their service :)

Lovely spa. Had a traditional Vietnamese massage here after reading other reviews on TA. Wasn't disappointed, the massage was excellent (if a bit different to what I'd be used to!) and the staff were excellent,very polite and friendly. I didn't book, they were very busy but I only had to wait around 15 minutes. Would recommend.

Great warm stone massage. We went here twice during our stay in Hanoi. The massages were amazing, the atmosphere great. I would like to highlight the warm stone massage i had my first visit - it was absolutely amazing.

Best massage in Hanoi. We went there twice during our stay in Hanoi. The service was not only impeccable but is also delivered by skilled masseuse who are visually impaired. Midori spa offers opportunity to people with visual impairment, and the massages we've had were at the highest quality compared to many other spas in HCMC and others in Hanoi.
Lovely experience. Quiet and relaxing place and atmosphere. The massage was perfect.I'll be glad to go again on my next visit.

Great massage with social impact. Midori Spa is a great massage studio in Hanoi. I tried throughout my stay here the Swedish, Vietnamese and Japanese massages and came back every day, because they were not only really good, but had also good prices (around 10€ for 1 hour massage).And what is even better, they train and employ visually impaired people, to give them a chance for employment and better chances in life.I totally recommend going to Midori Spa when you're in Hanoi and you're looking to relax with nice massages and supporting local social enterprises.

Relaxing massage - great value and service!. We stumbled across this place first after shortlisting a few to potentially try from Trip Advisor. Really pleased we ended up here, not only is it great value (around 300,000 dong for 75mins) but it's also a social enterprise supporting partially sighted and blind masseurs. We liked it so much we went back again later in the week!
Spa - Massage. My friend and I had an amazing massage from Lan and Danh!! They were lovely and welcoming and gave us a great massage for a great price!! Thank you so much xxxx

Best value spa in the city . Midori Spa's massage therapists are all visually impaired, and their rates are lower than their other spa, Mido. Don't be fooled into thinking this is because the service isn't as good; if anything, the visual impairments make them better, because they rely on feel rather than sight. Miss Lan gave me one of the best massages I've ever had, and Mr Ha did my husband's sports massage which he said was amazing. We're heading back for our third visit in 3 days later this afternoon!

Great massage spa. Excellent little spa, the massage is high quality and good value. It's also a social enterprise that trains and employs blind and partially sighted masseurs so you're also helping the disabled by going here. Really recommend it!

Professional service and high standard of massage. My fiancé and I came here after doing the Vietnam mountain marathon in sore need of a massage, and we found the perfect place in Midori spa. It is amazing that this place is also a social enterprise that offers job opportunities for the visually impaired, as the service and standard of massage are definitely on par with other highly rated spots. I was served by Ms Lan, and my fiancé by Mr Uan. We both got the 60 min sports massage. The massages totally hit the spot, and greatly relieved the tension in our muscles. They were also both very attentive and asked at appropriate times if the pressure was too much or too little, and acceded to our requests to focus more on certain tension spots. The price was also highly reasonable - 280vnd for 60 min sports massage.Would definitely recommend this place!

The best massage in Hanoi!. My partner and I went here after hearing about it from some friends. It is in the back of an alleyway, and up the elevator. Once we got there, we were greeted with super friendly staff, and the pleasant aroma of lavender. We got welcomed with artichoke tea, honest staff, and refreshing air conditioning.We then got recommended good massages based on our need (chronic pain, and back shoulder problems) -- instead of getting up-sold for unnecessary massages.We got a Thai massage and a Shiatsu massage from Uan and Lan-- they were phenomenal. We walked out of there feeling like brand new human beings. Great strength, and they really gave a lot of love and care in their massages.Definitely go there for the amazing service and massage. You will feel transformed!
Best massage ever!! . Such a stunning experience. Got a Thai massage and it was the best. Totally relaxing and wonderful service!!

Great Swedish massage . This was both mine and my girlfriends first Swedish massage, 60 mins for 240. We have previously had a Vietnamese one in Hcmc. We both left here with a sense of euphoria, it was so nice and relaxing. I have a slightly bad back and it felt amazing afterwards. I only wish I could have one every day but we leave tomorrow. Way way better than the hcmc blind massage.

Let's make this place 1st on Tripadvisor.... They deserve it. I went 3 times during my 3 days stay in Hanoi. I had a different therapist each time: each equally good. I had the 1h Swedish massage: to put it simply, these were the best massages I had in south eat Asia in 5 years of travelling!If you add to it that the price is very reasonable compared to other massage place, that the place is super clean and the staff super attentive, I'm not sure why someone would choose to go somewhere else.I personally went there based on the reviews and I discovered once arrived that the spa employ (and train) visually impaired staff. Best excuse ever since: "Honey, I'm going there not for me but to do a good deed"

Outstanding . Friend and I came multiple times and enjoyed 2hr Midori massages by Ms Hue (great), Mr Ha (great), Ms Oanh (great), and Mr Uan (outstanding). Really great people, so glad to have found this little place.
Amazing!. If you're going to get a massage from anywhere, get one here! It was amazing! And they support people who are visually impaired earn an income. I'll be going back tomorrow!!

Amazing Swedish Massage,best ever!. I knew it from the start of the massage, this is going to be great. The techniques used and the sensitivity which he put in was great. The massage (swedish) was really the best I have had in my life and I have had quite a few, living in Thailand. My friends had similar experiences, but I was just glad I had Mr Uan. If only I could have had another one:)I regretted only signing up for 1 hr!;)So, yes, Highly recommend the place!!

Best Service. My boyfriend and I sought this spa out after we saw the reviews on TripAdvisor. When we arrived they were very busy and had a 2 hour wait so they called up their other spa (Mido spa) who were available and they took us in a taxi (free) over there.We had two Swedish massages which were good, and in a nice double room. Even though the Mido spa was more expensive they gave us the massages at the price of the Midori spa which was very nice!

Try only the Vietnamese Massage if you must! Over-priced!. Walked past this spa and decided to give it a try. Ambience was fairly nice and place was clean. They were accommodating in allowing us to take a shower before the massage. My folks opted for the Vietnamese while I opted for an aroma/shiatsu massage. From the title, you can tell that my massage was bad whilst the folks had a decent experience. It wasn't the pressure - it was the therapist's inconsistency throughout the whole 2 hour session. Seems as if she didn't know what she was doing and could only do a few types of strokes. Also came across as she was just waiting for time to pass. The head massage was her caressing her. Felt so irritated that I was tempted to tell her to stop but it was already towards the end anyway. For the price that this place charges - you'd be much better off going somewhere else. Wonder foot is a much better option (check out their FB). The receptionist did offer me a discount after hearing the feedback but it wasn't about the money. It was an unneccessarily bad start to my holiday. I still paid full price and hence would like to share this honest review.

Quiet but lovely spa treatments. I was the only client at the spa, probably because I had booked to go in the morning. I had a lovely relaxing morning of steam bath, massage, body scrub and facial, all for the equivalent of £30, plus a tip. The atmosphere was calm and silent apart from the inevitable quiet music.As they knew it was my birthday because of the form I completed on entry, they had arranged a birthday cake for me when I had finished - such a sweet gesture.I would highly recommend this spa if you want a quiet atmosphere and quality treatments.

Amazing massage. Me and my partner came here 3 times during our 6 night stay in hanoi And had the most amazing massages every time.I had 3 90 min Swedish massages and a 30 min foot massage by Mr un and my partner had the same by Ms Hue. We were welcomed by a nice cold tea and given a menu of what we wanted And then the receptionist came with a form to ask for any areas to work on or avoid.The massages are done by the visually impaired and this place really does help in giving blind people and career and a life in vietnam. The prices are very good value with the 90 minute Swedish costing 360vnd.

Strange location, lovely massage!. To het to the spa you go trough some basement filled with scooters. You take the elevator to the third floor, where the spa is locatie. It is a bit strange getting there but totally worth It! Lovely massage, nice People!

Go here!. Beautiful staff, incredible service, you feel relaxed the second you walk in. They greet you, give you drinks and then you get the most professional masseuists! Go here! A little hard to find at frist, but if you find the elevator you are at the right place !
yes. Excelent. Thank you. We ll be back. 90 min midori special body massage. 440k vdn. Very professional.

Very good Foot massage by Hué. Very nice place, quite and clean. Prices are really afordables. I ve been massed for an hour by Hué. It was a dynamic massage, that finished by neck, shoulders and back. Thank you Hué. It was really pleasant I recommand this place.

GREAT MASSAGE WITH FRIENDLY STAFF. I got the 90 minute Thai Massage and my girlfriend got the 40 minute Indian, Back, Neck, and Shoulder massage and the 60 minute foot massage. We left happy campers! Highly recommend!
Very good massage.. This is what you need once you have spent a day walking in the city. Very professional and clean. We tried Thai massage and thei dedicated special attention on your focus points.

Friendly, inexpensive, and best massage in my life. I arrived with my teen daughters not sure of how it would be - I've had an indifferent massage in Thailand and hoped this would be better. It was terrific, we all hope to come back. I did an hour shiatsu and hour Indian back and shoulders. The shiatsu in particular was marvelous - I studied it in Japan with a professional shiatsu masseur and this was as good as any I got there.My daughters were also very pleased with theirs (Facial, hot stone, Indian and Swedish). Highly recommended.

Amazing foot treatment. Arrived and was warmly welcomed with a smile and lovely herbal tea. The massage and scrub was amazing!!! Would highly recommend this service! I can see why it is so highly rated in Hanoi, really good price compared with others! Mr Ha and Mr Thuoc were great and also done a surprise arm and head massage which was nice. Thank you!
Loved it!. I got 75min Shiatsu massage, price was reasonable and the quality of performance was also satisfying. I will definitely visit this place again.

So good we went back . Midori offer great treatments at a very good price. We went here twice during our three days in Hanoi for facials & massages. The treatments were really good and the staff were amazing - really friendly and make you feel at home. We tipped our therapists and both times the staff on the desk made a point of ensuring we could see the full tip went directly to the therapists. A great spot.

Seeing hands. The staff at this spa are all visually impaired, something the doesn't make the service you get any worse, on the contrary, this is one of the best massages I have had. One hour of total bliss. Make sure you take time to visit and unwind after a busy day in Hanoi.
Great !. It was the first time for my little brother ! We had a steam bath and he loved it ! For myself I appreciated it also ! And the staff was really nice. I will recommand it !
Relaxing. Another great idea in Vietnam. Blind people are trained allowing them independence and work. Fantastic service and a calm environment.

Midori special massage. Two people. Friendly greeting. Got service quickly without reservation for the 120 mins midori special massage. Both therapists were friendly and allowed for a relaxing session. Massage included various techniques and we both came out very relaxed. Rooms and practice clean. Good benefit from head cushions.

Good massage, value for money. We are 3 guys who wanted a simple, clean massage to rid the muscle tension built from trekking in the mountains the past few days. After reading about Midori Spa on tripadvisor, we decided to visit and found the shop tucked in a busy alley.It's easy to miss the entrance, the only indication was a small propped signboard with the name on it. You enter down a small ramp into a motorcycle carpark and take the lift to the 3rd floor.Ambiance was good and the guy and the counter was polite. We had the 1h vietnamese massage for 240k vnd and the masseuses were highly skilled. They told us to inform if it was too hard or soft. Back massage was good as it got rid of all the tension. Ended up feeling refreshed and ready to explore the city.Would visit again if back in Hanoi.

Mixed reviews on the massages. I like strong massages and that's what I got here. I thought my massage was great and my back was sore the next day. However, my fiance likes softer massages and they massaged on her spine (ouch and be careful!!!!). She didn't enjoy that and I was pretty mad afterwards. It took her a couple days to heal. Thus I'm saying this is a mixed review place (my massage was great but my fiance's massage was bad). Ended up here since the other top places were all booked so make sure you make appointments there.

Excellent foot massage . Myself and my boyfriend both got 30 minute foot massages after a long day walking around west lake. We got a drink on arrival and the ambience was immediately calming. The massage was absolutely perfect and soothed our aching feet and legs. The therapists we had (unfortunately I can't remember their names) were great making sure the pressure was right, and it was absolutely spot on! We felt so relaxed and refreshed afterwards. It was amazing value for what we got and we hope to go back before we leave Hanoi. I would highly recommend this spa to anyone. Perfect!

Relaxing, affordable massage. Excellent service at Midori Spa. I felt relaxed throughout, and the gentleman giving me the massage was attentive and thorough. Very clean place. The woman who welcomed us was professional and helpful. An excellent experience in VietNam!

Great massage and staff. We had two massages and intend to return for more. Staff were lovely, our masseuses were Mr Uau and Miss Oanh who were both great. Very clean and professionally run! Reasonably priced. Recommend to all.

Very relaxing massage. My sister and I both got 1 hour foot massages from Midori spa. It was amazing! Great ambience, quite, cool, and not too much light. Ms Hue and Mr Thuoc did our massages. They were very gentle and good at their job. Felt very relaxed after. And such a good price. 200,000vnd for an hour. Well worth it, going again tomorrow. Other massages looked to be very well priced too.

Relaxing and affordable massage!. This was a great place to have a massage after travelling and walking around. The staff were great and our masseuses Ms Oanh and Ms Lau were very attentive to our needs at all times. There are a number of packages available and they are all quite affordable. Definitely recommend!

Very nice staff; clean. The staff were very nice and the price was reasonable. It was clean and organized. However, since it is right next to a hostel, it was very loud when we went; we could hear people drinking, partying and dancing. That kinda kill the relaxing atmosphere. We went again the next morning and it was much quieter.So, go; just don't go there at night.

Really enjoyable relaxing experience. . We had the coconut spa package which was amazing value. We really enjoyed it from start to finish. The staff was super friendly and we both felt very at ease. Would defiantly go back next time in Hanoi! Thank you very much.

Poor to average rating. The "spa" is on the 3rd floor from a "basement" car park. Not the best entrance to a place of massage.Water served before and after.360k for 75mins combo but we couldn't wait for it to end. We told the staff that the therapists' massage was OK but the experience was spoilt by the discomfort of the bed hole. The hole is so big and hard around the head. It was too long lying face down with such pressure on the head that we both had an imprint and headache during and after.We couldn't wait for it to finish or at least to turn over. The massage was disjointed. Back was done dry then oiled. Then back was towels off. Back of legs down dry then oiled then also towels off.No oil was used on the front?? The staff gave us a discount to make up for the complaint which is the right thing to do but it was not worth the money spent even with the discount.We wanted to help as this place supported the visually impaired but they did to get the ambience right.The therapist was squashed to the corner that each time she moves around, the steamer was in the way and it made a lot of noise.

Really excellent and professional massage!. Had an excellent massage from Mr Ha, who was absolutely great. His English was perfect and constantly checked if I was ok. I have a burn on my leg and he was very careful to avoid it. Would definitely recommend anyone to have a massage here - lovely and peaceful place!

We wish we came back for more.... The spa does not look fanciful or classy from the outside, but once you step inside and as soon as your massage session starts, you know you are in the right place. They are really very good at what they do! And at such affordable prices too! Go give this place a try! :)

Good Massage by visually impaired. My colleagues & I visited Midori twice in our 4 days there. Midori is located in the middle of a small street that felt like a backpackers street - so we were a little unsure when we passed by it. But we decided to go anyway as we found out that the masseurs were visually impaired.The staff at the reception was very friendly & the masseurs greeted us too. As they are visually impaired, they may not be as sensitive with the lights, so you might have to help yourself if you would like the room to be darker. The massage was good as they were sensitive with the parts of the body that needed more attention. The staff also checked in with us occasionally on whether we were ok. We took a 60mins massage each. The price was very reasonable and I would recommend others to come here - it's also for a good cause to support the visually impaired to be gainfully employed. :)
Good massage and great cause . What a great concept this is! A social organisation helping the blind by training them. A good massage, good price and lovely service and atmosphere.

One of the better massages in my life. I take massages on a regular basis and tried the many different techniques. Today's massage was the first that was performed by a blind therapist. It was one of the better massages in my life. My gut feeling says they are much more sensitive when it comes to spots that need attention. A friendly welcome, clean and tidy rest- and massageroom. The 90 minutes combination massage (Thai, Shiatsu, Aroma and Sport) also lasted 90 minutes. Another spa in Hanoi I have been to (SF Spa - Lakeview) cheated with the length of their treatment.Midori Spa is definitely a place I recommend.

The greatest foot massage!. Came to this place in search of a decently priced foot massage to ease my weary traveller feet. And I was not disappointed! It was a beautiful little spot, the staff were kind, and the massage was incredible. Even though my friend and I had only signed up for foot massages they did a bit of a whole body massage! It was amazing. My feet are very happy and I left feeling entirely relaxed. I would definitely recommend this place!

One of the best massage I had in Asia!!!!!. I asked for a vietnamese massage...It was just perfect...not to strong, not to soft...The masseur was friendly, polite and professional.I would definitely recommend this place!

Completely Satisfied!!. I'm writing this from Midori Spa lobby because my Indian massage left me so relaxed that I just feel like hanging out here and drinking tea.. We shall see when this kool-aid wears off Uấn's hands were simply magical. At the end of our 60-minute, full-body session (staff was very kind in creating a customized plan), I had no further request! I thought I might need to ask for extra attention in my neck or arms since I was so very sore upon entering, but he was so thorough that I only thanked him repeatedly for the relief.There are also several options offered (Thai, Vietnamese, Swedish, Shiatsu, Stone and Sport/Recovery) so I will definitely be coming back for more!The space is beautifully arranged and there is calming music playing, so if you are looking for an experience that is soothing for your body, mind and spirit, this is it!!

Great leg massage with bonus arms and shoulder. After finishing a couple of treks, I decided to treat myself to a leg massage and foot scrub at Midori Spa. It was just what I needed! The staff were incredibly friendly and I left with newly revived feet and feeling very relaxed. I also loved the bonus mini arm/neck/back/head massage at the very end. The room I had wasn't private as it was partitioned by curtains but I didn't mind at all -- everything was very clean and relaxing. I'd definitely recommend Mr. Thuoc.
Nomal massage. It's just a nomal spa not true like picture. Not relaxing at all because noise from staff phone. They talking long time. very unprofessional service.

Therapeutic. This was the most relaxing and therapeutic massage I have had in a very long time. It did not feel like a "by the numbers" massage; the masseuse actively searched for tense and cramping muscles and comprehensively released them. I will be going back!

Phenomal massage and professional, relaxing service. I was looking for a massage after spending the past 2 days caving in Phong Nha and decided to try this place after searching on TripAdvisor. I get massages at home once every month or so and I like the tough deep tissue techniques mixed with some relaxation. I got the "Midori special massage" - 75 min for 360,000 vnd. This massage incorporate 4 techniques - Thai, Shiatsu, Aroma, and Sport and was so perfect for me! My leg muscles are usually a problem spot for me and were particularly sore after my climbing trip but the massage therapist was so amazing!! After a massage I tend to feel more sore for a few days and then feel better but I actually feel so much more loose and relaxed immediately! I really enjoyed the Midori massage because I got my regular sport/Swedish massage but also experienced Thai, which moves your muscles all around and stretches them, plus som shiatsu which was cool. The 75 mins was definitely enough time to cover every body part thoroughly. I thought I might get a foot massage after but my feet got lots of attention here too. My massage therapist was Uàń and I would absolutely recommend him!Overall, an incredible experience and one of the best massages I've ever had. I would recommend this to everyone, but of course pick the massage techniques that are appropriate for you.
Very nice stuff . Very nice stuff with a very good massage. I recommend the traditional vietnamese massage and the other full body massage

Great massage . I went to this place twice during my visit to Hanoi. I won't lie I was hesitant however curious and loved the idea of visual impaired people being employed.: wow what can I say... The best massages I've ever had.. They were fantastic.: the first time I had a lady the second time a man. Both were professional trained and knew exactly what they were doing.:

.Massage with Meaning. Mr Ha was my masseur and he was skillful, respectful and helped ease a long flight and busy Hanoi from my muscles. Also knowing my visit was helping people with vision impairment to earn a living contributed to my feeling of spending my tourist dollar wisely.

Treat your feet. After walking all day every day for a week, our feet were very sore. We showed up at Midori spa and they offered us some tea as we browsed the options. We decided on the half hour foot massage, and bargained a reasonable price for both of us.The massage was fantastic. They constantly checked up on us to make sure the pressure was ok. It's true that you could hear people outside, but it didn't bother us. We left the spa feeling rejuvenated and eager for upcoming adventures. A must!

This spa addict is very happy. My husband and I found our way to Midori Spa. We didn't have a reservation and they were very busy. They got us in fairly quickly, although they had to ask some other people to come back. My massage was very good. As stated in other reviews this massage supports the blind and their training is excellant. My husband says his was the best ever. There were 3 or 4 beds in each room. My husband started out in another room and then was moved to my room when we had a facial. The facial was not done by a blind person. The only criticism that I have is at the end of the facial they put a oil on our face which they left on. We left very happy and very shiny.

Wonderful technique, clean, and for a good cause.. This place can be a little difficult to find. You'll have to take the lift up as it is not on the ground floor.The massage that my mom and I had here was the best we had in Hanoi. The staff were friendly and courteous, and were clearly well-trained in their massage technique. What I loved about this place was the good cause behind it - they provide employment opportunities to the visually impaired, and helps to show that they are able to do their job equally as well, if not better, than their counterparts. When we left the rain had started, so the receptionist was kind enough to call us a cab and shelter us with an umbrella to the main road. Thank you so much, and if we ever went back to Hanoi, we would definitely return for some pampering!

I felt really comfortable here.. We are a group of 4 and anywhere we went, they told us they don't have a capacity for all of us. When we came to Midori they were really nice and made a room for all of us! The guy at the reception offered us a tea with a kind smile on his face. We chose a 90min swedish massage and the masseurs were very professional. We felt really comfortable. The place was clean and cozy. Perfect!!!

Good Experience!. I had the 90min Swedish massage while my husband opted for the traditional Thai massage. Both the female masseurs are very skilled and the service at the front desk is great. The room we are allocated is private (just the two of us) and very comfortable. The price is reasonable too - 750,000VND for both of us.
Massage. Great massage! Personel was very nice and the prices were also good (approx. 14USD/90min). Clean place and a pleasant atmosphere. We will definitely come back!

Amazing massage from an amazing place. The spa was recommended by a Vietnamese friend. When we got there we found out it is a lovely spa AND a centre to support the visually impaired in the workplace. What an amazing idea!Myself and my husband got the Midori massage for 90 mins and I was so relaxed, I must have passed out! The massage was incredible, and Mr Hà and Mr Uân were so lovely, very considerate and checked with us to get the pressure right for us. We felt like we were on a cloud afterwards. Totally recommend it.

Recommended!. We had a massage today at Midori Spa and we highly recommend this spa! Ms. Oanh and mr. Ha did a great job, made sure we were alright during the massage and made us feel very comfortable. The guy at the front desk was also very kind! Would definitely come back!

Great Massage. Found this massage place by google near by spa and massage. Read their review before I visit this place. The price is reasonable and I was given 5% discount due to it was off peak hours. My Therapist (Hue) she is very good in doing her job. Well done and keep up the good work.

Very good massages + less pricey than other better spas. I can recommend Mr. Uan, he performed a very good and strong footmassage, body massage was just as good! He knows exactly was he's doing and you can feel he's committed. Very much recommended! My partner was just as enthousiastic about other masseur, place is quite busy: a good sign and cause! Go there and enjoy!

Relaxing Message. My wife and I received massages from Ha and Truoc. The facilities were quite clean and the massages were a good value. Communication was a bit strained, however everything else was professional and satisfactory.

Good but not great. I decided to go to Midori Spa based on great reviews on tripadvisor. I can not say that I was hugely disappointed, overall it was an average experience. Maybe because either I set my expectation too high (based on reviews) or I already had other much better experiences to compare (I tried several massages e.g. Balinese, Javanese, Indian, Turkish, Thai, etc.)Now I will share my experience of "stone massage" at Midori spa.The pros:+ friendly english speaking staffs+ good cause for the blind (visually impared)+ clean restroom+ stone session was good, but...+ cheap (360 vnd for 75 min session), but...Cons:- ambience is far from relaxing, room is too small (probably 2x3 m) and the music sounds rather sad- stone session (ca. 30 out of 75 min) was good, the rest was nothing to write home about. The management should do more professional training for the masseus/r if they want to maintain a good business.- location is not ideal, quite hard to find and the surrounding is very busy- though cheap, it is not a good value for moneyI think I wouldn't have missed anything if I had not tried Midori spa in Hanoi.

Very unsatisfied . I went To Midori because I read great reviews on trip advisor. I was very disappointed with the massage. The masseuse was very unprofessional and she did not seem comfortable or knowledgeable. My wife was with me and had a very similar experience. The only redeeming qualities were a clean place and a good cause- the blind.

Relaxing spa. We went to Midori Spa to have a shoulder and back massage. Contrary to a few places we had seen before, the place was very clean, welcoming, and run in a way to make you feel at ease from the moment you step in. The staff is very friendly, the price reasonable, the massage very professional and the overall atmosphere ideal for a good relaxing time. We definitely recommend it! My masseuse, Mai, did a great job and made sure to check periodically that everything was going alright. My boyfriend's masseuse, Ha, and his mother's masseuse, Huong, were also very professional, discreet, and great at massages. Also, it's "blind massage", which I wasn't familiar with before but it's a cultural practice to provide respectable, accessible jobs to people who are blind or have very heavy vision impediments. We were glad to support this. They have lots of options for massage, including Swedish, Thai, and "Sport" (which is apparently more aggressive than the last two), but they also have more soothing massages (which is what we went for) as well as hot stone treatments, facials, mud treatments, etc. Thanks, it was great.

Nice place, good massage. Upon arrival I was served hot green tea with a candy, straight after that I was invited for session. The place is clean and tidy, very quiet which keeps you relaxed from any outside noise. Masseuse girl was very caring - after massaging each part of body she would ask if everything was ok. Also feet is my sensitive area, so I was afraid she would press too hard and hurt them, but she did an amazing job.
超級棒的服務fantastic time ever. I visit Hanoi for 5days and my girl friend and I had massage everyday and midori is the best one !!
great and affordable massage. we opted for the basic package and it was great. all massages are given by people who are blind and somehow i guess this heightens their other senses.

Lovely massage. My friend and I decided we needed some serious pampering after a long mountain trek! We booked in for the 3 hour coconut spa package - massage, scrub and facial. The staff were all absolutely lovely. They really put in a lot of effort. The place is set up for a great cause - to employ those who are visually impaired. The pamphlet says that the staff are trained monthly by staff from mido spa (very highly rated on TripAdvisor). We were both very happy with our treatments. We had two men do the massage and scrub (it is a cultural thing to scrub the chest in a body scrub, but they asked us if we were comfortable with that and were very accommodating and polite). I had Mr Han for my massage and he was great. I had Ms Oauly (not sure of spelling) for my facial and she was also very good. The staff did talk a bit much to each other throughout the treatment which was a bit distracting. Otherwise we were very happy!

Excellent . Booked a Swedish massage for me and my partner and we were both extremely impressed! Very professional and targeted the right areas, so we both came out feeling very relaxed, perfect after a day of walking around for hours on end. As soon as we finished we booked in for a spa bath and Thai massage the following night. Highly recommended!

Absolutely fantastic!. We had an hour long Vietnamese massage and it was amazing. Within 5 minutes of arriving we were already on the massage table and in heaven. Massaging the legs, back, shoulders, arms, feet and head the Vietnamese technique of clapping and tapping worked a treat. My masseuse, Mr. Thuoc, was fantastic. He knew when and where to apply more pressure and his clapping technique (although the first time I've had this done) was first class. Both my partner and I left Midori spa feeling refreshingly dazed (Her masseuse was Ms. Hue who was very accommodating to her sore legs). The spa is more than just an amazing initiative to help the visually impaired, it is a spa with high standards and great customer service.

I enjoyed so much I went back twice. I noticed this spa next to my hostel and thought I would give it a go. I always try to support ethical projects when I am travelling. This spa employs visually impaired people as it can be difficult if you are visually impaired in Vietnam. I had two massages done. I had a head and shoulders done which I really enjoyed. I also had a swedish massage done. No fault and can't complain. I also had two facials done. It was my first time getting a facial done. I had the basic one which made my skin so so soft and it was so relaxing. I then went back and had facial natural mask one done. Thank you to Ms Ngoe, Ms Lan, Ms Mai and Ms Oanh for my treatments.

Benefits all round. This was a real find, reviews on trip advisor led me to this place and I'm glad they did. The environment was very clean and everyone in the spa was professional. The massage left me feeling relaxed and pain free and also like the cost (not expensive) was going to benefit an individual who may, in this country, struggle to support themselves and their families as all the masseuses are sight impaired/blind. Great experience!
The bwst foot massage. The enviroment is clean n comfortable.the foot massage is really good. Recomended mr.thuoc. he have a very gd skill.

Wonderful massage great cause!. Our experience here was so lovely. This spa is located in a small street and can be easily missed. Make sure you book in advance as it got quote busy. The staff were so friendly and very skilled! It was honestly one of the best massages I've ever had. Such a beautiful experience and for such a great cause. Would highly recommend.

Great service for the price. This was the first massage place we went to in Vietnam so we were not quite sure what to expect. My husband liked that the massage therapists were vision impaired because he felt like the money was going to a good cause. The massage was just ok, but the place was clean and the staff was friendly. I appreciated it more after we looked at other massage places and even tried one in the same price range. Midori was a significantly better massage for the price.

Massage for a good cause. The spa is clean with very basic facilities. The staff is very friendly and skilled. Me and my husband both had a good experience. This is an NGO-run spa to support the visually impaired staff which I think is really awesome and worth the experience. The place is a bit difficult to locate so do ask locals to point you to the right ally, don't blindly follow Google maps:) Price on an average is US$ 20 for a 75 min massage.

It was ok. I chose the traditional vietnamese massage. It was ok, the staff didn't speak good English and she just went through the motions. I asked her to put more pressure but it was not strong at all. Anyway it was just ok..
There was a welcome drink, and the staff were friendly, place was clean.

Not too bad...not great. I got Shiatsu and my partner got the Midori massage which is a combo. Her masseur had nails too long which was uncomfortable. She didn't enjoy her massage. My masseur didn't speak English, no problems, but didn't ask about his pressure. I had ordered a strong massage and had to ask 3 or 4 times along the way for "stronger" to feel it. When it was strong it was quite painful...which was good. But it went soft too quickly...maybe they don't love pain here as much as I do :PPlace was clean and friendly. Massages weren't bad. But not great either. I think if you're into relaxing or medium massages it would be good.
Quality massage. I've been twice because the massages were very good, the staff professional and it's worth to pay a bit more for it.

Amazing!. The best massage my wife and I have had.Extremely friendly and professional. It looks a tad dodgy when you walk to the elevator and go up, but when you walk in, you are greeted with hot tea and a very relaxing experience.

Very nice Spa place for fair prices.. We selected the spa because of its good tripadvisor reviews and can only agree. The services and prices are very good and we booked a foot massage followed by a Thai massage of 75 minutes the next day because the service convinced us. On top of that, I was very impressed by the social approach of the Spa employing blind people. The massage was excellent and you can tell that they have been trained well. So go for it and enjoy your stay.

Very impressed . Although quite hidden (we only found it by reading the street stand for the storey) my sister and I had an excellent experience with Midori spa. My sister had badly sprained her ankle the week before and all staff were friendly, professional and accommodating to our requests. Prices are reasonable compared to other spas in Hanoi Old Quarters.It was heartening to know that services are provided by the visually impaired and we could be a part of supporting this business. We were greeted with tea and a very pleasant ambience. My sister had the Indian head, neck and shoulder massage with Mai. This exceeded expectations with relaxation and Mai focused on knotted areas by initiative. My Thai oil massage by Hue was just the right pressure for the lasting feeling of whole body relaxation.

Highly trained staff. This massage was recommended by my wife. She was highly impressed. So I had to try it. Sometimes, a massage only feels good- but no long lasting effect. This massage was therapeutic. The woman who did my massage was highly skilled and was making adjustments and getting all the right pressure points. Excellent job. This is my new massage place in Hanoi.

Affordable spa and massage. Midori Spa is a gem. Although its location may be difficult to find, it has friendly staff with a good service attitude. The place may be small, but it offers comprehensive packages. Its prices are also more attractive than other spas. This is one option you should consider if you are looking for a spa package.

Beyond expectations. I went here twice. First I had a Swedish massage. They listened and executed very carefully as I wanted some parts of my body harder massaged than others. The second time I did a facial. I could really see the difference after the facial. My skin was more glowing. During the facial they also gave a little head, shoulder and arm massage. It was perfect!
Nice and clean, very good massage!. You are taken care of by serious people, place is nice and clean, blind people treat you with care, massage is wonderful, very good value!

Quite oasis. We had 90 minute Mindori special massages and they were great!
Tucked away in a cute little alley the spa is great if you are looking for a good massage and less fussed on decor.
Reasonably priced. I would go back and also recommend.

First day in hanoi. First off they picked us up at our hotel. My husband and I booked a 90 minute couples massage followed by a coffee body scrub. All we can say is wow. So enjoyable Very professional. Very lovely therapists.
Excellent massage.. I had massage here for 3 nights. I would recommend the midori special massage. Service and skill of the therapist is excellent.
Best massage I've ever had!. Excellent service, professional massage that was very relaxing for a good price. Would highly recommend to anyone looking for some chill out time from busy hanoi!

A really touching experience. There's quite a few shabby and dirty 'spas' around Hanoi. I found Midori very clean and, to me a plus, there's no fancy or expensive decoration. To me, the quality of the therapist, who almost lost all his eyesight over the years, was very high. I would say I visit spas around the world montly and the quality of the masseur I (Mr. Lon) had would be among the top ones. Finally, I found the price of 240.000 dong an hour very competitive with other places around town.

Great experience. We had sport and shiatsu massage. Both options were great. I would recommend trying Midori special, which includes variety of options, such as Shiatsu, Sports, Aroma, and Thai. Highly recommend this place.

Great service and good value. Really good massage for a very reasonable price. All staff were very helpful and the quality of massage was great. It is also a nice concept to support the local visually impaired.Thanks again!

This is the spa if you want quality, not fluff. . I've traveled extensively and have gotten massages and various spa treatments most everywhere I've gone... from the most simple, perfunctory to the most luxurious, and the ladies I had at Midori were top notch. The spa itself is pretty basic so if you're looking for luxurious lounging this isn't the place. The quality of services though, are what counts. As you have probably already read, the massages are performed by visually impaired people, and the girl I had, Ms Mai, was extraordinary. Great hands and wonderful technique (I got the basic 60 min Swedish) especially her work on my upper back. I then got a body scrub (highly recommend the green tea... my skin felt amazing afterwards) and a mini facial, both performed by Ms Hue 2 (not to be confused with Ms Hue 1) and while the scrub was basic and got the skin-softening job done, the facial was pretty extensive for being a 'mini'. Ms Hue also had a great massage technique (both on face and scalp) and I thoroughly enjoyed her as well. Overall, great experience and excellent value for the money.

So relaxing . My girlfriend and I went here for a 75min 'Midori special'. The spa was tucked away from the street on level 3. We had a mr lan and ms Hue complete our service. They were very welcoming and the massage was incredible -came out feeling so relaxed and loose. Would recommend !!

Great concept. This massage centre is a great concept because the masseurs are visually impaired.I have had lots of massages in the past and this ranks as one of the best. My treatment was carried out by a guy called Lan ( I think ?) his wife has just had their 3rd child the night before and here he was back at work the next day offering a great service. I wish him and his family well for the the future.My wife had treatment with a young lady called Mai and equally sang her praises. The treatment cost $25 US for the two of us for one hour including a tip, I must say great value. They even sent a taxi to the hotel and paid the fare. Please give these guys a try it certainly worked for us.

Excellent massage, lovely staff, and great concept!. I had the 45 minute Indian massage today and it was so good I wish I had opted for a longer treatment! The masseuses are visually impaired and I think this is a brilliant way four them to earn money and provide a excellent service, highly recommended.

Best massage. Just had the most amazeing foot and leg massage ever Midori Spa is easy to find and has the most relaxing atmosphere ive ever been to and my maseuse was so pleasant and accomadating wish i could take him home as an older person he was really gentle on my ageing and tired feet and legs 10 out of 10.

Best massage I have ever had . My mum and I were looking for a massage close to our hotel. To our delight we found midori on TA only a few minutes walk from us. I am sooo super glad we chose this place. It is one of the best massages I have ever had and I have had a lot in my time. If you are near this area I highly recommend it. The staff are wonderful the atmosphere perfect.I left feeling like I was walking on air

Great Spa. We had a day to spare in Hanoi a decided to treat ourselves to a Spa.As I have a very bad back and neck I'm quiet reluctant to go for a massage. Last 3 massages I tried all made it worse. In this case i actually came out of the building with less pain! The staff is very friendly and the therapist are competent. My girlfriend and I both had a blind therapist which was perfect and regularly asked whether he was pushing to hard or to soft. After the massage we both had a mini facial and eventually left 2 hours later with a satisfied feeling. The fact that this company helps a good cause only adds to the value.

Fabulously relaxing!. After 10 days since our last massage and having spent the last 3 days cycling, trekking and climbing in nihn bihn and tamcoc this was the best medicine for our fatigued feet! This spa employs staff that are visually impaired and my husband and I had a lovely experience here. We arrived without an appointment and were asked if we wouldn't mind waiting for 10 mins as the masseuses were busy with other clients. Obviously we didn't mind and happily waited. When it was our turn, the manager was apologetic that we had to wait and we were greeted by our therapists and shown into our room. The soft relaxing music masked the city noise outside and from the first touch of our therapists we were in paradise. Lovely foot massage, very relaxing and felt rejuvenated. Don't miss out on helping a great cause.
Great massage! . Had a really nice 75 min swedish massage. I highly recommend this spa! Clean rooms, proffesional and friendly staff. Overall a really relaxing and good masssage. Thanks! :)

Great Spa. This massage parlour was excellent! The masseuse are all visually impaired but have very good massage techniques. The manager is also very welcoming and even paid for our 1 way cab fare to the massage parlour. The money goes to aiding the visually impaired which is an excellent concept and something that is very meaningful. Definitely do come and support them!

Best massage of my life. I had a 90 minute Vietnamese style massage. It was easily the best massage of my life. My masseuse was very in tune with the subtle reactions I made to her touch, and adjusted immediately. It was so incredibly relaxing I lost sense of time. If you're in Hanoi, definitely make this a mid day refresher.

Good massage. I had a midori massage for 90 minutes and my partner had a Thai for 60 min. and a foot massage for 30 min. We're both in one room and the masseuses didn't talk all the time as mentiond here before, and if they did - they did it very quietly so it didn't disturb my boyfriend to fall asleep ; ) I also enjoyed the massage even if the pressure was to hard sometimes. Don't expect well educated physiotherapy but a good getaway of the stressful and loud city. Cons: The receptionist was also very friendly but can not calculate and wanted to charge us 40' dong more then needed.Not the cleanest location!The prices are really reasonable and we also met vietnamese people inside.However we would go again...

Had an excellent massage, while supporting the visually impaired!. Midori Spa is the place to go, if you're after a place to get a massage or something else spa-ish :) I got myself a full body Vietnamese massage, by masseur Mr Ha. He asked me up front what kind of pressure I preferred. The massage really impressed me!! These people really know what they are doing, I could tell my masseur was well-trained. The prices are also one of the cheapest in Hanoi, but way better than others. And ofcourse the best thing is that profits go to the visually impaired!

Important to have such places!. I've just had a very good feet treatment with hot wax and my feet feel really smooth now. Mr Uan took time to massage my feet and also asked me various times whether the pressure was right. I was in one room with a friend who had the same treatment and also another guy who had a body massage, but was separated from us by a curtain. We where asked beforehands if it was alright that another customer was treated in the same room. I think it's really important to have places alike, that offer visually impaired people good working opportunites, which is probably quite rare in Vietnam.

Such a great organization. . I had a lovely Swedish massage from a young woman named Ms Lan, who was visually impaired. After spending the day walking around in this bustling city it's nice to come back and get a massage. I looked around at other spas but they were very expensive. The spa prices at midori spa are fair and reasonable. Upon walking to the salon through a motorbike car park it does look abit dodgy however once you go upstairs it's completely professional, clean and air conditioned. I visited another spa in Hanoi earlier in the week, and felt very pressured to tip at the end of my massage, however midori did not make me feel this way. Of course I tipped the girl anyway but at my free will. This is a great organization and i wish I found it earlier in my stay in Hanoi.

Super Massage with great social meaning!. I just enjoyed a wonderful massage at Midori Spa. After having spent a day in the totally chaotic City of Hanoi, you can't do anything better than going to a spa. There are plenty of spas in Hanoi, so I was really happy to find this nice address. Service, atmosphere ans the massage were excellent, especially the young lady who made the massage, Ms Lan, was really attentive and professional! Another thing I want to say: not only the price was really fair, they didn't force me to tip at all... ( of course the young lady got a tip, but I did it volantarily and with great pleasure.) that's really rare in Vietnam!! I really appreciated the behaviour of all people working there!

Fantastic Massage. I just had a fantastic 90 min shiatsu massage from a lovely young man who was visually impaired. This is the second time I have visited this spa in the past week and both times I have received great service. Spa is clean and the staff are friendly.Highly recommend!

Good massage. Found this site during our visit. Not blind but more visually impaired masseurs. We were very satisfied with the 90min massage. We tried the mixed massage (can't remember what it's named) and was so refreshed. We would have gone back if it's not our list day. Will certainly come again on my next hanoi visit.

So so.... This spa support the blind and visually impair , that's why I like the idea to do something for a good cause.We spent at Midori spa 2 hours and 45mn for a therapy package with my husband , the spa is a narrow place with an entrance view of a motorbike parking, not really relaxing as a first impression .There is only one visually impair person and her name is Huê,to make the massage ,which was very good, but the other therapist girl whom provide the massage to me was very talkative ... Asking all the time about my life ... Not really professional , and massage average... Overall, I think the owner of this spa use some poor blind persons to advertise his spa as a charity place to hook up foreigner customers . Expensive for what it is ... Not worth at all.

Excellent masssge. Just flew in from Ireland, very jetlagged. Had a great massage from Thuoc, highly recommend a visit. Also had a wonderful facial. Feel a 109% better. Lovely staff, Great start to the holiday

Best massage in Hanoi!. I had a great 60min Shiatsu massage from Lan - a great person and one of the visually impaired therapists. The cost was 280k only and it helps to create more jobs for these therapists with the 'seeing hands'. Go there - I bet you will love it.

Excellent spa in the middle of Hanoi Old Town. Make time to visit!. Today I had a 60 minute Thai massage and 75 minute foot spa (massage and scrub) with my masseur Lan, who's visually impaired. He was just wonderful. After three weeks travelling around Vietnam my massage and foot spa were just perfect. Relaxing, friendly and very welcoming. I'd definitely recommend it to others, particularly as its also a social enterprise and provides training and employment opportunities to blind Vietnamese.
Amazing massage!. I had an 75 min. massage at Midori Spa. It was a great experience and a wonderful massage. I really recommend this spa!
Amazing experience . This was amazing. Wonderful staff and excellent massage. They served tea and water. Over all a good experience. I recommend this to others.

Treat your body and support the enabling of others.. Midori Spa supports the ability of the visually impaired, but I don't recommend coming here just for charity. I booked a Therapy Spa Package 2 hrs 45 mins as standard (20 min Steam bath/ Sauna (which was lovely and lemongrass scented although not entirely sure I needed it with the amount I have sweated in Hanoi!), 60 min Thai massage with oil (although as I like a strong massage I had it without oil and upgraded to 90 mins), a sea salt body scrub and facial) for 900,000 vnd before upgrade. I booked the day before and was welcomed with tea, and the same friendly welcome was there today. A secure box is make available for you, massage was firm and very professionally carried out by one of the "visually impaired" not that that made any difference. Scrub and facial were assisted/ carried out by a seeing therapist (Mido Spa assisted?) and my skin feels smooth with the usual facial heat treatment to open pores and "vacuuming" to remove all dirt. Great value, great service, and also was offered noodle soup (chicken or beef) as a bonus.

Awesome Foot Massage. Happened to walk by this place the other night in Hanoi and stopped in for a 30 minute foot massage. Days of walking & touring had left me with tired, achy feet and the massage was heaven. The man who massaged my feet did a fantastic job. He even massaged my neck and shoulders at the end. I went back the next day and had another good foot massage. Not as amazing as the first but still very good plus they gave me a discount off their already low prices for returning. I highly recommend this spot. It's not luxurious but it is clean and calm and very affordable. Wish i could go there every day.

Well worth finding!. This was a nice experience for a massage. The massage therapists who are visually impaired are really good in what they do and the service provided by the staff who guided us with regards to our preference is also worth mentioning. The spa itself is located in a busy backpackers street and slightly hidden from anything else in the same street. But well worth the find :)Two thumbs up!

Best place. We wanted to have a good massage in Hanoi, and after reading many reviews we chose Midori Spa and i'm sure we made the best choice. No chating in between the masseuze, not asking for tip at the end (though they deserve a good one). They've got a large list of massage, we opted for the Midori massage which included diferent kinds of massage. The two masseuze made a really strong massage, getting on the stretcher to use their weight, and it was a full body massage. Moreover, it's a charity that gives a good oportunity to visually impaired people, and they know really good how to use their hands and elbows, real professionals. The prices are absolutely a good oportunity. We just regreted trying it the last day, because we would have repeated for sure. Give it a try and let them relax you,you're in good hands!
Best massage in Hanoi!. Simply the best massage! I've been there 3 times and will continue to go back until I leave. Very friendly and experienced staff. Must visit!

Fantastic massage, great price and extremely friendly staff!. Stayed in Hanoi for 4 days and went to get two massages here! Great experience, definitely the best massage ive gotten in asia so far! A must if you're in Hanoi

Wonderful massage at a fraction of the UK price . Decided to go here after reading up online about the visually impaired staff and decided to go for a massage after a busy week in crazy Hanoi. Myself and parter went for the Swedish massage together for an hour and was so relaxing an about £8. Couldn't fault it at all. Must go if you need to chill in Hanoi

Relaxing and wonderful. Very sore neck and shoulders from carrying my pack around - noticed this place from just beside my hostel and decided to give it a go. Wonderful experience, staff were lovely and attentive. Locked away my belongings and gave me the key to the locker. Clean and peaceful. Will be returning tomorrow, too.

Wonderful Massage!. We went here on our last day in Hanoi having been to another spa earlier. I wish we had found it earlier in our stay. It was absolutely wonderful and very reasonably priced. I am a therapist and always enjoy getting treatments myself. This was up there with the best. They even came and collected us from our hotel which was great because I am not entirely sure we would have found it otherwise. I thoroughly recommend this spa.
Good experience. The staff was very friendly and the clinic was clean. I got the 60 minutes swedish massage and it was very good! I will definitely recommend this clinic - I will come back.
Very good. The massage was very good, the clinique was clean and everybody was very friendly. Good value for the money, we will definitly come back!
