So on my recent holiday in Vietnam, I was certainly seeking out places to get a foot massage every few days.Hanoi was our last stop on a 3 week adventure through Vietnam and I was fortunate enough to notice Marguerite Spa on the afternoon that we arrived back from Halong Bay. We stayed at the La Siesta Hotel & Spa (and I also had a nice massage there before I found Marguerite) and this place was just on the corner up from our hotel. From the outside it looked like an inviting oasis in the hustle and bustle that is the Old Quarter and that is what drew me inside.How lucky I was to have stumbled on this place - they had only been opened a week and from the minute I walked through the door I couldn't have asked for a friendlier welcome. I was seated with a cool drink while they prepared the room and turned on the a/c and then I was transported by what is probably one of the best foot massages I have had in all my travels, not just in Vietnam (honestly). My masseuse was male and he was awesome - the exact right amount of pressure (I like a hard massage) and he regularly checked that I was okay (I was more than okay - I was floating). It was total bliss - and then he did my head/face ... wow. Just wow!After the massage I was again given a seat with a cool drink and had a bit of a chat with the owners about how new the place was and how much I enjoyed my massage. They even sent me off with a little gift, which just makes my memory of the place even nicer. And then there was the price - amazing value for money - and much much cheaper that the spa at La Siesta.Coming from a massage-lover I seriously highly recommend Marguerite Spa - and when I return to Hanoi (and I will return) I shall seek them out again. My only disappointment was that I left the next day and couldn't fit in another treatment with them - next time I shall book a few treatments. I wish them all the very best luck in their new venture - they are fabulous. Go here!

Excellent Massage!!!. We were in much need of a massage after a 3 day trek in Sapa and it was the most relaxing massage I've ever experienced. The masseuse was well trained in Thai massage and knew exactly where all my trouble spots were. Staff are very friendly and professional. The prices are also cheap and affordable. Interior is clean and modern as it's fairly new. We left feeling refreshed and energised. Highly recommended!!

Most Relaxing Massagw Ever. After trekking Sa pa, Hanoi Marguerite Spa was the perfect place to relax and get the best massage in my life. No doubt more expensive than some other massages in town the masseur really knew what he was doing and the environment was very tranquil. Would definitely recommend this oasis in the heart of the Old Quarter.

Great new spa. Attractive design, friendly staff and central location. Visiting it on the occasion of opening, I got 15% discount of the bill but I like this one because of it professional service. Highly recommend!

Excellent massage!. The spa itself is very nice, really friendly staff. You are welcomed with a glass of water and are offered some fruit and candy. The masseuse was a really tiny girl, but she was really strong. And off course, when she's standing on your back with her full weight, you're gratefull she's so small. Wonderfull massage, exactly what I needed after travelling almost 24h from Belgium to Vietnam.Price was also good, 500k dong for 75minutes (i had a discount voucher of 15% via a travel agency)

Stumbled into heaven!. We were on our way to another spa when we stumbled across this one instead. It was so inviting and clean and the staff were so friendly that we couldn't go past it. They have everything on the menu you could want from a spa from massages, to pedicures to facials. Very reasonable prices as well. It's only just opened they told us, so we even got a discount. Although they were all so professional and welcoming you wouldn't know it was a new business. I think it will soon reach #1 on trip advisor.

Very Relaxing!. Stopped by today for a relaxing massage. Was actually eating lunch next door at the Newday Restaurant and they recommended the spa across the street, however we saw this one on the way so checked it out. It is fairly new, so very clean. They greeted us with very warm and friendly smiles and helped us choose the best service. The man who gave me the massage was very well trained in Thai Massage. He was 100% professional for the entire time, was friendly and talked a little, however kept the atmosphere very tranquil and relaxing.... a great mix of both. Ended the massage with an amazing scalp massage that put me to sleep. The room that my massage took place in also had a shower to rinse off the oil. I was very relaxed for the rest of the day. The entire spa was EXTREMELY clean and sanitized!I would for sure recommend this place to anyone looking for a great massage in Hanoi!

Pamper yourself with a relaxing massage. We were in Hanoi and wanted to get massage for a relaxing moment and also because I had badly hurt my hip just before the trip and found it a little difficult to walk the city.You cannot walk in the Old Quarter without being offered -and sometimes pestered- by people offering you to get into a massage place.We were recommended the Hanoi Marguerite Spa by our hotel, the Milton Boutique Hotel and decided to trust them. They sent a complimentary (FREE OF CHARGE, for those readers whose first language is not English) taxi to pick us up from our hotel. So, it is better to book from your hotel to have everyrhing arranged for you.I believe the Spa has two separate places in the Old Quarter.We were greeted and offered a drink before getting on with the massage session. The place is spotless -actually it opened recently- and comfy.The staff is very helpful and genuinely kind.The massage was great and relieved a lot of stress and enabled me to walk more easily for our last day in Hanoi.We felt refreshed and energized and left happy.I would sincerely most definitely recommend Hanoi Marguerite Spa, for a relaxing moment.Please, leave a tip to the massage young ladies to show your appreciation, although you do not have to. They work hard for your enjoyment and deserve all we can give back. So, if you can leave a small tip, kindly do. If you cannot, that is OK too, nobody asked for anything other than the rates clearly displayed on their advertising literature.
